Title: Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
We are a dynamic group of young minded professionals with ambitious goals. All together we are a marketing and advertising firm that specializes in Non-profit organizations, and value our clients. Very similar to a sports minded athlete, we are competitive to drive each other, our values are leadership, integrity, teamwork, discipline, and winning mentality.Our opportunity is a hands-on training program for all people and backgrounds. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionJob Summary:Marketing / Trade Show Coordinator to oversee the company's trade show presence and support various marketing initiatives such as targeted emails, creation of marketing collateral and ads, social media management, graphic design, and content marketing. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with the ability to work independently with moderate direction and effectively across other functions of the company. Applicants should be organized, resourceful, detail oriented and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously.Essential Job Functions And Responsibilities Include The Following  Support the research, planning and coordination for 20+ domestic and international trade shows annually Create, proofread, and edit copy for various marketing collateral including sales flyers, brochures, and catalogs Design, edit, and deliver print & digital assets including, but not limited to, sales flyers, catalogs, product brochures, social media imagery, website imagery, paid media campaign visuals, product mockups, etc. Develop, create and post engaging marketing campaign content on social media platforms (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.) and Google Display Network to increase brand visibility and website & social media traffic Assist with updates to company website, including new product additions, information, etc.
Knowledge & Skills  Energetic self-starter with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and complete simultaneous projects with minimal supervision Graphic design experience with a demonstrated ability in the creative development of marketing collateral Persistence, willingness, and aptitude to learn our products and market Superior verbal, written, and face-to-face communication skills
Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field Minimum of 2 years of Marketing experience required Strong MS Office Skills required (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite required (Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator) Video editing experience with Adobe Premier preferred, but not required Photography experience preferred, but not required Outstanding copywriting and proofreading skills required
We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
**This is an ONSITE only position** About usiOBX is a Premier Stem Cell and Bio-Restorative Orthopedic, Sports Medicine and Spine Care Center, located in Charlotte. NC. We make it a point to stay ahead of the curve, utilizing cutting-edge technology in our state-of-the-art facility.PPC and Marketing Specialist Job DescriptionOur Center is currently seeking a PPC (Pay Per Click) and Marketing Specialist to plan and run our PPC campaigns. You will be also required to track and manage our paid search budgets. As a PPC (Pay Per Click) and Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible to do search engine marketing (SEM) including search engine optimization (SEO) for our clients. For this position, you should be extremely good with numbers and have great analytical skills. Your main objective should be to ensure that our PPC ads and promotion endeavors have the most astounding return on investment (ROI.)ResponsibilitiesAs a PPC & Marketing Specialist, you'll work and will be involved in: Creating and planning a variety of PPC campaigns across a range of digital channelsOverseeing existing campaigns and making recommendations on how to optimize themAnalyze trends and making data-driven decisionsWriting engaging copy for advertisingProofreadingMaking creative suggestions for advertising templatesMarketing strategiesRelationship building and business developmentProducing detailed analysis and reports of campaignsPresenting data and reportsPlan budget and monitor bids to increase better ROI.Stay up to date with PPC (Pay per click) advertising and SEM (Search Engine Marketing) trends.Discover approaches and ways to decrease the risk of click fraud.Track KPIs to evaluate performance and pinpoint issues.Deliver reports for administration and management.Manage ad accounts on multiple platforms like Google Ads, Bing, etc.
Skills Excellent understanding of how PPC fits in to the wider area of digital marketingKnowledge of Microsoft Excel and data manipulationExcellent ability to think creativelyExcellent attention to detailStrategic thinking and development of innovative marketing strategiesCreative writing skillsAbility to present information quickly, effectively, and efficientlyStrong relationship-building skillsExcellent communication skillsSuperior experience using tools such as Google AdWords.Understanding of HTML and XML will be an added benefit.Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.Outstanding analytical, interpersonal and organizational skills.Excellent problem solving and networking skills.Strong work ethics.
Education & Experience BA/BS degree in Marketing, Digital Media or a related field.Proven 5+ years of experience as a PPC Manager or Marketing Specialist. (required)Professional certification in Google Ads will be preferred.Exceptional knowledge of SEO and advanced digital marketing skills.Outstanding knowledge of analytics tools, e.g. Google Analytics, Tableau, WebTrends, etc.

Title: Sales And Marketing Representative
JobDescription: Sales and Marketing Representative – Medical devicesAbout the companyHedgefog Research Inc. (HFR) is a fast-growing R&D/Manufacturing company located in the Los Angeles Metropolitan area (San Pedro, CA) with a focus on development of unique medical devices and software products for eyecare. Now, after concluding several years of R&D on an innovative product line and establishing a “Made in the USA” manufacturing capability, we are turning our attention to the next page of the company’s story. HFR is looking for a talented and passionate leader, who will promote the company’s growth by shaping and implementing a robust marketing and sales strategy. Key responsibilities -         Develop a deep understanding of the company products and the competing product landscape -         Generate leads, deliver sales pitches, and close sales deals-         Perform customer training -         Generate engagement with existing and future customers -         Identify and develop government leads and opportunities-         Manage a monthly product newsletter-         Engage eyecare providers by organizing and promoting regular webinars-         Represent company products at conferences and trade shows-         Build a stellar KOL team-         Work with the Management to plan, set, and meet sales goalsRequirements-         Bachelor’s degree in a discipline related to life sciences or business development preferred. A combination of professional certification combined with extensive ophthalmic experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.-         3+ years of healthcare sales experience (eye health industry preferred) is required, along with a documented track record of success (attainment of goals, awards, formal recognition) in those roles-         Excellent organizational and time management skills-         Ability to communicate effectively in both verbal and written form-         Mastery of Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.-         Ability to plan and organize webinars using Zoom and/or Microsoft Teams. -         Candidates should be physically able to perform all job duties which necessitates: driving in a geographically large territory for long periods of time each work day; lifting product shipping boxes; frequent travel by airplane and car, usually within the US (but, occasionally, international); remaining in standing position for prolonged periods of time when giving presentations or hosting business events; and performing other job-related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.-         Valid driver’s license along with a clean driving record. What we offerThis position provides a unique opportunity to participate in developing and growing our company’s emerging sales and marketing strategy. The new Sales and Marketing Representative will join a small, tightly knit team of engineers and scientists and will be expected to function well in a rapidly growing manufacturing company with heavy R&D emphasis. At HFR, we pride ourselves on offering our team members a work environment that is highly professional, informal, and fun at the same time. The new employee will discover an intellectually stimulating job that offers daily challenges and enables the individual to seek and find solutions while avoiding excessive bureaucracy overhead of larger corporations. As part of the job package, we also offer:-         Sales commission (negotiable)-         Retirement plan with employer matching-         Paid Personal Time Off-         Paid holidays-         Flexible medical benefits (i.e., you pick your insurance, we pay for it)-         Travel reimbursement-         Work from home/Telework opportunityThe range of starting annual base pay before commission for this role is $55,000 to $85,000. Sales commission is negotiable.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: Marketing CoordinatorRADIAN RESEARCH, INC.  Join a world leader in energy measurement and start your ownership journey today! Radian Research is a 100% employee-owned innovative technology company with an engaging and participative work environment. We provide Electric Meter Testing Instruments, Systems, Software and Services to Electric Utility Companies, Electric Meter Manufacturers and National Metrology Institutes for Engineering, Laboratory, Shop and Site applications. Radian provides both portable and primary energy reference standards unequaled in accuracy, stability, and reliability. The focus of Radian is our customer, and the heart of Radian is our team.  Position OverviewLeads marketing and cross functional teams to plan, coordinate and execute marketing strategies, campaigns and events to promote the RADIAN Brand and Offering. Reports to the Director of Marketing and is based at RADIAN headquarters in Lafayette, IN. Remote candidates will be considered depending on the suitability and strength of their other qualifications.  Key Responsibilities Event Planning and Execution·      Plan, coordinate, and execute marketing events, including trade shows, conferences, and promotional campaigns.·      Manage event logistics, including event registration, venue selection for RADIAN events,vendor management, budgeting, and scheduling.·      Coordinate with internal teams and external partners to ensure successful event execution.·      Monitor event success metrics, collect feedback, and make recommendations for futureimprovements. Website Management·      Continuously refine and update the company website to reflect RADIAN’s branding,product information, and marketing campaigns.·      Collaborate with the web designer to implement website enhancements and optimizethe user experience.·      Monitor website analytics and report metrics to establish a cadence for siteoptimization. Strategic Marketing Campaigns·      Develop and execute strategic marketing campaigns to target specific audiences andachieve business objectives.·      Work closely with content creators to craft compelling marketing messages and ensureconsistency across various channels, including print, display, website, and social media.·      Monitor campaign performance, analyze metrics, and make data-driven suggestions toleverage the website. Sales Team Enablement and Support·      Provide sales teams with effective, branded, and consistent marketing tools, collateral,and support materials to support their sales efforts.·      Collaborate with sales leaders to develop sales enablement resources, includingpresentations, product guides, and competitive analyses.·      Conduct training sessions to educate sales teams on new marketing initiatives andensure alignment with brand messaging. Content Creation and Dissemination·      Create clear, concise, and engaging marketing content for all communication platforms.·      Expand and improve visual marketing content, including images, videos, andinfographics.·      Leverage social media, email marketing, and other channels to communicate marketingmessages and engage with the target audiences. Social Media Strategy·      Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy that will enhance RADIAN’s online presence and engage with current and potential customers.·      Analyze social media metrics and adjust strategies accordingly. Team Leadership and Collaboration·      Inspire and lead the marketing team and key supporting teams to execute marketingplans successfully.·      Foster a collaborative environment and maintain strong relationships withcross-functional teams.·      Demonstrate energy, enthusiasm, and drive to motivate team members and achievemutual success. Teammate Engagement·      Build rapport with all RADIAN teammates, fostering cooperation and collaboration tosuccessfully execute projects effectively.·      Inspire loyalty and demonstrate respect to promote a positive and inclusive workenvironment. EDUCATION·      Four Year Bachelor of Science or Art Degree·      Professional Certifications applicable to Marketing     EXPERIENCE ·      Minimum of THREE, ideally FIVE or more years working in marketing capacities·      Electric Utility Industry Focus preferred ·      Manufacturing organization background preferred  DESIRED Expertise·      PROVEN Brand Marketing Acumen ·      Effective Market and Customer Facing Copywriting and Editing·      Event planning and coordination·      Leading cross-functional teams·      Creating and executing marketing plans·      Managing the production and publication of marketing-related content, including website development, print collateral, newsletters, and email campaigns·      Managing all aspects of professional photo and video creation including planning, production and deployment ·      Establishing processes and procedures for copywriting, design, and social media content to exhibit cohesive brand messaging·      Facilitation of Sales Enablement Activities that INSPIRE Sales Engagement ·      Website and Digital Marketing Tools, Techniques and Strategies·      Competitive Analysis from a Marketing Perspective  ESSENTIAL Skills and Attributes: ·      Precise, concise and effective verbal and written communication·      Building strong relationships and rapport with ALL Teammates ·      Strong ORGANIZATION and ATTENTION to DETAIL·      Positive Energy, Optimism and Enthusiasm ·      Integrity, Candor, Respect and Loyalty·      Gratitude and Appreciation – towards TEAM and CUSTOMERS·       Excellence – DESIRE to be the BEST you can be!!·       BE Genuine, Sincere and Humble·       Competitive HUNGER – DESIRE to be the LEADER in our designated market!   Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Fashion Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:

Through smart and connected 3D printers, polymer materials, a software ecosystem, and parts on demand, Stratasys solutions deliver competitive advantages at every stage in the product value chain. The world’s leading organizations turn to Stratasys to transform product design, bring agility to manufacturing and supply chains, and improve patient care.Position OverviewWe are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team. You will play a crucial role in defining the product strategy and market positioning, promoting our brand, increasing visibility and awareness while driving customer engagement. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
DescriptionRobert Half Marketing & Creative is looking for a Marketing Coordinator for one of our top clients in Charlotte, NC. This position is 100% remote contract to hire opportunity! Responsibilities Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and implement marketing strategies and campaignsConduct market research and analyze industry trends to identify new opportunities for brand growthCoordinate and execute digital marketing initiatives, including social media campaigns, email marketing, and content creationMonitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, making recommendations for optimization and improvementAssist in the creation and editing of marketing collateral, such as brochures, presentations, and promotional materialsSupport the planning and execution of events, trade shows, and conferencesMaintain and update the company's website and other digital platforms with fresh and engaging contentConduct competitor analysis and monitor industry trends to identify areas for competitive advantageAssist with the development and execution of marketing plans, budgets, and timelinesCollaborate with cross-functional teams, such as sales and product development, to ensure alignment and consistency in messaging
RequirementsRequirements  Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related fieldProven experience (1-2 years) working in marketing or a similar roleStrong understanding of digital marketing strategies and tacticsProficient in using social media platforms, content management systems, and email marketing toolsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsCreative thinking and problem-solving abilitiesStrong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environmentProficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and marketing software/toolsKnowledge of SEO principles and best practices is a plusFamiliarity with graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) is a plusAbility to adapt to changing priorities and tight deadlines
Innovation starts with people.®Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. Title: Marketing Specialist
Company: The Jefferson County & Port Townsend Leader
JobDescription: You love making people happy, and you know how to do that. You are driven to deliver on commission-based sales, connect with a small community of 10,000 people, and enjoy face-to-face marketing. With a base wage of $17 hourly, you can earn up to 10% on existing client sales, and up to 20% on new client sales. We expect our sales members to easily bring home between $60-70K annually.ResponsibilitiesJoin us in becoming part of history in the making while working at a family-owned newspaper located in the oldest two-story sandstone building in Washington State. Four day work week, 401K, dental and health insurance, gym membership, vacation time, and the opportunity to live in one of the most sought-after areas of the Pacific Northwest. Some remote work ok, but position will require a presence in Port Townsend or a neighboring town.QualificationsPrevious experience in sales, particularly in print media.

Title: Marketing Assistant / Brand Ambassador
JobDescription:
Marketing Assistant / Brand AmbassadorPhiladelphia, PA (19123)Entry-Level / On-Site / Full-TimeThe Marketing Assistants at Omnia are at the forefront of what we do by bringing our marketing ideas and strategies to life. As part of our marketing team, you will learn how to plan, coordinate, and execute promotional marketing campaigns across Philadelphia.We're currently working with several great charities and non-profit organizations, so if you're looking for meaningful work with training, advancement, and travel opportunities, this could be a good fit for you!You'll be learning and developing transferable business skills like: General marketing, sales, and customer service techniquesPlanning, coordinating, organization, and time management skillsCommunication, public speaking, and how to read body languageActive listening, objection handling, and negotiation skillsGoal setting, strategic planning, and leadership
Some of your initial duties will include: Working as a small group to plan for the event and coordinate travel plansSetting up branded marketing displays and distributing marketing materialsEngaging in meaningful conversations with local consumers about the brandQualifying people to determine if they're able to participate in the current offerAnswering general questions and overcoming common objections when appropriateCollecting payment details and general information from interested contributorsRehashing important information to leave all customers with a feeling of satisfaction
Marketing Assistant Key Requirements: 18+ years of age and able to work in the USAAble to start work within 2 weeks' timeLocal to Greater Philidelphia / willing to commute
Additional Recommendations: A marketing degree or general understanding of marketing practicesExperience working in a customer-facing role is beneficialConfidence in your communication skills/presentation skillsA positive mindset, willingness to learn, and the desire to grow
What we offer: Ongoing training, mentoring, and coaching from industry expertsProfessional and personal growth with advancement opportunitiesA fun, friendly work environment with a strong company cultureCompetitive pay with bonuses and other incentives (paid weekly)Opportunities to travel along the East Coast and beyondTickets to sporting events or concerts, fine dining experiences, team events, and more!
To Apply:Send us a copy of your resume today and we’ll be in touch soon! Please note, we’re evaluating applicants on a first come first serve basis and looking to move forward with the next steps within a week of application submission.
Skills: Communication, Event Marketing, Marketing, Networking, Presentation Skills, Public Speaking, Relationship Building, Sales and Marketing, Social Media, Sports

Title: Product Marketing Manager II
JobDescription:
Overview Why GM Financial? GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America and the Asia Pacific region. Through our long-standing relationships with auto dealers, we offer attractive retail financing and lease programs to meet the needs of each customer. We also offer commercial lending products to dealers to help them finance and grow their businesses.At GM Financial, our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes new ideas, fosters integrity and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.Our Purpose: We pioneer the innovations that move and connect people to what mattersResponsibilitiesAbout the role: The Product Marketing Manager II will lead and implement marketing strategies to drive awareness, engagement and affinity with B2C customers. This team member will help develop and drive go-to-market strategies for a variety of initiatives that support business goals. You will define and develop campaigns driven by research and analytics. You will assist in identifying customer needs, wants and expectations, to inform personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations and meet business objectives. You're a collaborator who builds strong partnerships across the GM Enterprise to deliver consistent business value to GM, GM adjacencies, the brands, and GMF. You will work closely with key business stakeholders, creative teams, UX designers, marketers, analytics teams and operations leaders. You will be knowledgeable about GM Financial' s key digital channels and will be recognized as a fierce advocate for putting the customer at the center of everything we do.QualificationsWhat makes you a dream candidate?   Excellent prioritization, time management, organization, and follow-up skills; with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Ability to dive into performance measurements with teams to help optimize and find key insights into performance.  Ability to synthesize analytic results into relevant and strategic recommendations.  Ability to understand and explain complex issues and clearly identify and communicate the situation at a high level.  Excellent oral/written communication skills.  Ability to create and manage a roadmap of campaign features and enhancements.  Self-driven leader who can take initiative and carry projects from start to finish.  Execute high profile marketing initiatives that align with the business needs and create an exceptional customer experience.  Work with cross-functional teams to ensure on-time delivery of campaigns and initiatives.  Manage customer communications for every touchpoint along the journey, ensuring that communications align with marketing plans and our business goals.  Work directly with the product managers and marketing team members to plan and implement goals, strategies, and campaigns around our products and other consumer touchpoints.  Establish and nurture relationships with key stakeholders and other influencers who contribute to the definition and ongoing support of B2C marketing strategies through stewardship, influence, motivation and change leadership.  Influence high-level prioritization of marketing initiatives, aligning experiences across channels and touchpoints to ensure the best business results.  Participate in the planning of B2C marketing strategies by combining customer needs and insights with quantifiable business cases to establish programs that are built on consensus and buy-in from senior leadership.  Measure, assess and report on the effectiveness of campaigns and the various tactics and collateral assets.  Understand and evangelize the vision, strategic priorities and goals of the organization, translating them into a roadmap of features and enhancements that provide remarkable customer experiences. 
Experience  Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent work experience required  3-5 years as a product marketer, marketing or similar role 
What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and nine company holidays.Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas, fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibilityWork Life Balance: Flexible hybrid work environment, 2-days a week in office

Title: Position Title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator
JobDescription: Position SummaryThe Marketing and Communications Coordinator is responsible for coordinating and executing specific tasks associated with the implementation of marketing plans and communications activities. The coordinator will also be responsible for implementing programs to maintain/enhance social media presence and to sustain the NPMA brand image across all materials and events. Reports directly to the Vice President of Marketing and Communications.Responsibilities·      Works closely with the Vice President, Marketing and Communications on implementing NPMA’s overall communications plan.·      Develop, write, and produce communication vehicles directed to members including weekly ePestWorld newsletter.·      Work with marketing team to develop and implement a social media strategy, and consistently analyze metrics and trends. Craft social posts and moderate all social channels.·      Maintain industry events calendar including NPMA events, State Association events, and events from affiliate organizations.·      Regularly monitor and update content on main NPMA website, microsites, and state association websites.·      Execute marketing plans for State Association meetings and webinars, including but not limited to electronic promotions, development of printed programs, PowerPoint presentations, and social media.·      Develop and distribute monthly newsletters for managed State Associations.·      Perform general administrative duties, including serving as member of back up team for answering telephones, database entry, etc.·      Attend NPMA and other events, working in a multitude of areas to support onsite experience.·      Other duties as required.Qualifications/SkillsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.·      Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications or related discipline desired·      2-3 years experience in marketing, communication, program/product marketing, and/or member communications preferred·      Must be able to work on project teams and share accountability/reward for achieving broader goal·      Must possess strong initiative and be results-oriented·      Requires excellent written and oral communication and time management skills·      Requires expert-level knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (i.e. Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) ·      Requires advanced knowledge of social media applications·      Previous experience working with a website CMS preferredNPMA’s shared core values describe our essence and guide our actions. Our values are part of our DNA. They guide the way we work with our members, partners and with each other. Through integrity, passion, life balance, teamwork and collaboration, all while having fun, we will continue to create a vibrant culture where ideas can blossom, people can thrive and success can flourish.

Title: Marketing Coordinator Amazon Seller & Vendor Central
JobDescription: XR Brands in Orange County, a leading sexual wellness and adult toy company, is seeking an entry-level eCommerce Amazon Marketing Coordinator to help grow our Amazon accounts on Seller and Vendor Central across the US, Canada, and international markets. This position will promote our brands and products on Amazon by using ‘Enhanced Branded Content’, A+ pages, and brand stores. Duties also include adding new items, optimizing listing bullet points, improving product description and keyword SEO, and overseeing and reporting fraudulent items.The candidate will track progress and analyze the results of promotions, advertisements, SEO, and pay-per-click campaigns for the management team. This position will also be cross-trained with other aspects within our marketing team that include, but are not limited to, Amazon chargeback maintenance, product information generation, promotion coordination, and other miscellaneous duties.Why Work Here?- Casual ‘family style’ work environment, with competitive wages and a strong benefits package- Successful, growing company with a 23+ year history, that provides a secure environment for you to thrive- The opportunity to exercise, develop, and expand your knowledge base and skillsThe position is full-time, Monday through Friday, and located in our office in Huntington Beach, California. Salary is commensurate with experience.Responsibilities:- Develop an Amazon marketing strategy to help drive traffic and sales for existing and new products- Continually optimize the existing brand stores, product pages, and A+ content to drive traffic and sales for existing and new products- Collaborate with team members to develop messaging and brand assets compliant with brand guidelines and Amazon standards- Improve and refresh content for existing products by optimizing listings with new bullet points, descriptions, keywords, titles, and images- Work closely with internal departments – sales, design, marketing, purchasing, customer service- Analyze and report performance metrics and marketing performance to allocate time toward best-performing itemsRequired:- Knowledge of Amazon Marketplaces: managing and updating product catalog, performing data analysis- Proven e-commerce marketing success track record- Basic HTML- Strong communication skills, both oral and written- Strong analytical and quantitative skills; able to make data-based decisions- Must be comfortable viewing adult imagery and videos daily, with the ability to hold, describe, and professionally discuss adult productsPreferred:- Knowledge in Amazon Seller &Vendor Central: managing and updating product catalog, performing data analysis, expanding marketing skills- Experience with Helium10 or similar software- Knowledge of Amazon Brand Registry- 2+ years of related experience preferredEducation:Unlike many companies, advanced education is not a requirement. We believe that the best individuals come with varied backgrounds and experiences, valued work ethic, problem-solving skills, intellectual curiosity, and a positive attitude more than a specific degree.XR Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
KORE Power, Inc. (KORE) is headquartered in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho, with operations in Waterbury, Vermont, and Buckeye, Arizona. KORE is the leading U.S.-based developer of battery cell technology for the clean energy industry. With clients in energy storage, e-mobility, utility, industrial and mission-critical markets, KORE Power provides the backbone for decarbonization across the globe. As the first U.S.-based, American-owned, and fully integrated provider of cells, batteries, and solutions, KORE is uniquely positioned to serve these markets. Through the construction and operations of its large-scale battery cell manufacturing facility in the U.S., KORE is positioned to operate at 12 GWh per year capacity. The facility (the “KOREPlex”) will operate with net-zero carbon emissions through strategic partnerships and solar and storage co-generation.KORE Power’s differentiated approach provides customers with direct access, unparalleled service, superior technology, and Tier 1 product availability. Focused on building sustainable communities, clean energy jobs, and green economic expansion, KORE Power is proud to offer a functional solution to real-world problems and fulfill market demand to deliver a zero-carbon future. The KOREPlex is expected to come to Buckeye, Arizona, and be the anchor to the development of the Sustainable Valley by the end of 2024. For more information, visit www.korepower.com.Position Overview:KORE Power is currently seeking a Marketing Coordinator. This role will assist the Marketing Manager to deliver the KORE Power message and brand throughout traditional and new media outlets. The candidate will have exceptional communication and writing skills and be comfortable with multi-tasking and meeting deadlines. This position reports to the Marketing Manager.Duties and Responsibilities:  Maintain promotional materials inventory, maintain databases and prepare marketing reports Coordinate marketing material requirements with Marketing Manager and all relative partiesSupport marketing staff by providing sales data, market trends, forecasts, account analyses and new product development Assist Marketing Manager in the target delimitation for products, brands and services Research, analyze and summarize marketing trends, study competitors market behavior and strategies, keep up to date on industry activities and trendsCoordinate, edit and optimize any material concerning advertising, branding and marketingCoordinate, edit, and optimize photo, video, and other media for marketing purposesReview each project to guarantee it complies with the product’s informationAssist Marketing Manager in the development and execution of all marketing strategies, including paid advertising, organic content, and social media strategyAssist the Marketing Manager in the development of lead generation and demand generation strategiesCompiling and analyzing data in order to accurately report impact and outcomes of marketing activities Observe competitors marketing campaigns and their impact, keep up to date with marketing trendsMaintain promotional materials database and schedule for updates
Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in English, Public Relations, Communications or Marketing1 to 5 years of experience in Marketing, preferably in a B2B role and/or in the clean energy sectorWorking experience managing and executing organic content strategyWorking experience with PPC and paid social media strategyWorking experience with Adobe Creative Cloud Software, including Illustrator and InDesignWorking experience with LinkedIn's Marketing SolutionsKnowledge of or working experience with Google marketing and analytics tools, including Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio (formerly known as Google Data Studio)Knowledge or working experience with social listening and research platforms, including ZoomInfo and MeltwaterAbility to work independently and with teamsMust be highly organized and detail orientedSuperior communication skills; both verbal and writtenAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth and ever-changing environment
 Work Environment:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. The job requires excellent vision (close, distance, color, peripheral, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus) and coordination.KORE Power is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, citizenship, sex (including gender identity, gender expression and pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, military or veteran status, political preference, marital status, mental or physical disability including medical condition), genetic information or other status protected by law. If you require an accommodation in order to apply to this position, please contact your local recruiting representative at careers@korepower.com

Title: Associate Marketing Manager - NPD
JobDescription:
As a member of the New Platform Development team, the Associate Marketing Manager, NPD, will drive the divisions' growth objectives by contributing to opportunity identification, consumer and customer insights, financial profiles and business cases, idea creation and validation, product development, product buy-in and budget management.Remote work option on Mondays and FridaysCompressed work week option: 1/2 day FridaysYour Story.As a member of the New Platform Development team, you will drive the divisions' growth objectives by contributing to opportunity identification, consumer and customer insights, financial profiles and business cases, idea creation and validation, product development, product buy-in and budget management.Your Passion. Our Culture.At Sargento, you work for a company you believe in, with a family of people who believe in you. Our culture stems from a simple premise: Hire good people and treat them like family. At Sargento, you can make decisions based on how they affect people as well as the long-term health of our company. You will be encouraged to make a meaningful difference in the community, in the company and in your career. With diverse experiences and tools to learn and develop, you can transform your aspirations into reality. If you’re ready for the right place to belong and grow your career, you can find it here.What You Do.Opportunity Identification Contributes to assessing the landscape to identify new product growth opportunities, including industry analyses, marketplace trend identification, category/competition assessment, supplier assessment, customer/channel opportunities and company strengthsDemonstrates understanding of competition and market dynamics by pulling Nielsen/IRI data information and presenting conclusions
Consumer & Customer Insights Contributes to identifying and prioritizing actionable insights by partnering with Insights, IMC and SalesAssists with crafting insights based on unmet needs, jobs to be done, ratings and reviews, search patterns and market dynamics
Idea Creation & Validation Assists in the creation of new product ideas, including ideation, seedling development, clear and compelling product positioning, product packaging and artwork, pricing and sizing, concept writing and concept testingAssists with clear, concise, and inspiring product rendering briefs to bring new product ideas to life
Financial Profiles & Business Cases Assists with the development of financial profiles of new products and business cases outlining financial attractiveness and market potential
Product Development Assists with large new platform development projects and/or drives smaller projects from idea to executionWorks with cross-functional team (Project Management, R&D, Finance, Operations, Sales and Core Marketing) to build the total new product offering, go-to-market strategy and business proposition
Product Buy-in Assists in the buy-in of new products, including key presentations, Sales selling materials, cross-functional alignment, production readiness and Core Marketing handover
Budget Management Sets up Purchase Orders in a timely fashionTracks spending to ensure programs come in on budget; identify over/under spendsForms good relationships with Finance and Accounts Payables
Your Education And Experience Ideally 3+ years of Marketing/NPD experience in Top-Tier CPG, Food or Cheese/DairyBA/BS required; MBA strongly preferredBranded Core Mktg experience requiredNPD experience strongly preferred – consumer insights, ideation, product development, project managementCross-functional leadership experience preferred
Benefits That Set Us Apart.  Comprehensive medical including Fertility, Adoption benefits, Dental, and Vision InsuranceFlexible Work Week Hybrid work schedule – Onsite Tuesday – Thursday with the option to work remotely Monday and FridayCompressed work week – Option of ½ day Friday
Onsite Health & Wellness Center: includes a nurse practitioner, licensed physical therapist, dietitian, personal trainer, and health coach, care coordinator and work-life mentorEmployer 401K contribution in the top 1% of the nationRelocation AssistanceTuition AssistanceAccess to Employee Store
Our Story.With over 2,400 employees and net sales of $1.8 billion, Sargento Foods is a family-owned company that has been a leader in cheese for more than 65 years. We created the world’s first, successful pre-packaged sliced and shredded natural cheeses. Sargento is based in Plymouth, Wisconsin, where we manufacture and market shredded, sliced and snack natural cheese products, as well as ingredients and sauces. Sargento is known for the exceptional quality of our products and for product design, packaging and merchandising innovations that have transformed our industry.To learn more about our culture and values, please visit our website at https://careers.sargento.com/us/en.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

JobDescription: It is the mission and intent of this position that the incumbent will keep the guest's perspective in mind at all times and carry out the mission of the Marketing Department. Title: Staff Accountant - Sports Marketing Firm
JobDescription:
A sports marketing agencyis seeking a high-energy accountant, who is looking for a career instead of a job, to join one of the most dynamic and exciting accounting teams in the city.Job DescriptionThe Staff Accountant position will work closely with our Senior Account, Accounts Payable and ReceivableManagers on a regular basis and report directly to our Controller while focusing on timely quarterly and year-end financial reporting.Roles and Responsibilities Perform timely account reconciliation and general ledger reviews
Monthly bank reconciliations
Work regularly with Accounts Payable Manager and assist in the payable process
Work regularly with Accounts Receivable Manager and assist in the receivable process
Work closely with Controller to prepare Quarterly and Yr-End Workpapers on a timely basis
Maintain, understand and when necessary develop new policies and procedures related to the employee reimbursement process. Working with corporate credit cards, receipt submission, and basic travel & entertainment rules and regulations
Maintain financial reports, records and general ledger account backup and support
Ad-hoc projects as needed throughout the year – examples: corporate risk & company insurance premiums, state taxes, office space/lease projects, setting up and implanting vendor programs for travel, closing budgets with Budget Managers, creating agenda for our Budget Manager Meetings, etc…
Minimum Qualifications 4 year-degree in Accounting/Business or related field
0-5 years experience
Proficient in MS Office, particularly Excel
Attention to detail while maintaining the ability to multitask
Strong organization skills, problem resolution, critical thinking, and communication skills
Independent self-starter, but also a team player
Benefits Competitive benefits package, including 401k, health insurance, flexible spending accounts, and bonus program
Work-Life Balance, no crazy tax seasons or long hours and half-day Friday in the summer
Greatenergetic workforce, new office build-out and work environment
Primarily work from Atlanta Office but will have options to occasionally work from home as needed.
Optional travel to our events – Masters (Augusta, GA), College Slam Dunk and 3 Point Contest (city and week of Final Four), High School All-American Game (Orlando, FL) among many others.

Title: Sales And Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Synture.com is seeking a motivated and self-starting Sales Agent to join our dynamic team. We are a leading marketing agency in Texas, specialized in providing precision targeting and authentic engagement solutions to businesses through geofencing, local influencer marketing, and user-generated content. If you're a hardworking individual who is eager to make a significant impact in empowering local businesses, we'd love to hear from you.Key Responsibilities: Drive sales and revenue growth by reaching out to potential clients and promoting Synture's unique offerings.Understand client needs and tailor marketing campaigns to meet those needs, providing top-notch customer service along the way.Build and maintain strong relationships with customers to establish a long-term clientele.Engage with local influencers to promote clients' brands, harnessing the power of community engagement.Manage various projects concurrently, ensuring every campaign is executed successfully and on time.Leverage understanding of geofencing and influencer marketing strategies to create compelling value propositions.

Rewards: Opportunity to work in an innovative, dynamic, and high-growth industry.Ability to drive your income with a competitive commission structure.Compensation includes a base option with pay per call.Opportunities for personal and professional growth within the company.
At Synture, we believe in driving real results and unveiling a new level of customer connection. If you are ambitious, goal-oriented, and have a passion for sales and marketing, we would love to receive your application.

Title: Growth Marketing and Paid Media Expert with Direct-to-Consumer Experience in CPG Industry
JobDescription: We are seeking a dynamic Growth Marketing and Paid Media Expert with hands-on experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry. Our luxury fragrance brand is expanding rapidly, and we need a talented individual to spearhead our growth initiatives. You will be responsible for driving customer acquisition, engagement, and retention, managing paid media channels, and playing a crucial role in our ongoing success.Responsibilities: 1. Develop, implement, and optimize multi-channel growth strategies aimed at driving customer acquisition, engagement, and retention. 2. Manage all aspects of paid media channels, including strategy, execution, and optimization for platforms like Google AdWords, Meta Ads,TikTok Business, email, SMS and more. 3. Leverage data to understand our customer’s journey, providing actionable insights to improve marketing effectiveness and paid media ROI. 4. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to align on growth strategy, product enhancements, and customer experience initiatives. 5. Implement A/B testing to optimize conversion rates across all channels, including earned and paid media. 6. Track, analyze, and report on key metrics to assess overall performance and efficiency, particularly within paid media channels. 7. Utilize your technical acumen to develop technical solutions that will automate and improve our growth marketing operations.Requirements: 1. Proven experience as a Growth Marketing Expert with a specific focus on managing paid media channels, with at least 3 years in the CPG industry. 2. Direct experience with DTC marketing strategies and paid media. 3. Proficiency in analytics tools and the ability to turn data into actionable insights. 4. Exceptional problem-solving skills with a focus on innovation. 5. Experience with SEO, SEM, email marketing, social media marketing, content marketing, and paid media. 6. Familiarity with marketing automation tools and platforms for managing paid media. 7. Strong technical acumen to develop automated solutions. 8. Excellent communication skills to effectively share insights and recommendations with the team. 9. A bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.We welcome all candidates who are passionate about leveraging data-driven strategies to drive business growth. As our brand is focused on delivering exquisite fragrances to our customers, we value innovation, creativity, and dedication.Please apply with your CV, a cover letter detailing your growth marketing and paid media experience, and any relevant project references or case studies.
Skills: Bulk SMS, Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), Google Ads, Mobile Marketing, Paid Media Advertising, Paid Media Strategy, Paid Social Media Advertising, Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Tiktok Marketing

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Company OverviewVoted #1 EHR by PC Mag, WRS Health delivers a fully integrated cloud based EMR and practice management solutions to its clients. We bring solutions to physicians by providing constant enhancement of our products and services including EHR, practice management, marketing, patient coordination and billing.Job Purpose and RoleWe are seeking a highly skilled and results-oriented Digital Marketing Specialist with expertise in retargeting strategies to join our dynamic marketing team. As a Digital Marketing Specialist with a focus on retargeting, you will play a critical role in driving conversions and maximizing ROI by implementing and optimizing retargeting campaigns across various digital channels. The ideal candidate is a data-driven marketer with a deep understanding of retargeting techniques, analytics, and a proven track record of achieving campaign objectives.Job Duties and Responsibilities Execute comprehensive retargeting strategies to re-engage website visitors and previous customers across digital channels, including display ads, social media platforms, email marketing, and search engine marketing.Collaborate with the marketing team to define retargeting goals, target audience segments, and key performance indicators (KPIs) aligned with overall marketing objectives.Set up retargeting pixels and tracking mechanisms to collect data on user behavior and website interactions for effective campaign targeting and segmentation.Continuously monitor retargeting campaign performance, analyze data, and identify opportunities for optimization and improvement.Optimize retargeting campaigns by adjusting bidding strategies, creative variations, ad placements, and audience targeting based on performance insights.Use A/B testing methodologies to assess ad creatives, messaging, landing pages, and other campaign elements to drive optimal results.Collaborate with the creative team to develop compelling ad creatives and personalized messaging tailored to specific audience segments.Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to retargeting and digital advertising.Work closely with analytics teams to generate regular reports on campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, or a related field.3-5 years of experience as a Digital Marketing Specialist with a strong focus on retargeting campaigns.In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with retargeting platforms and tools, such as Google Ads Remarketing, Facebook Pixel, AdRoll, Criteo, or similar platforms.Proficiency in digital advertising platforms, including Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, LinkedIn Ads, or other relevant platforms.Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and optimize campaigns based on key performance indicators (KPIs).Solid understanding of audience segmentation, targeting, and personalization strategies for effective retargeting campaigns.Experience with A/B testing methodologies and optimization techniques to drive campaign performance.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling ad copy and collaborate with cross-functional teams.Results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving campaign objectives and maximizing ROI.Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Certifications in digital marketing and advertising platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Facebook Blueprint) are a plus.
Location: Goshen, NYHours: Available during standard US business hours (9am-5pm EST or 8:30am-4:30pm EST)
Skills: A/B Testing, Campaigns, Digital Marketing, Facebook Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads, Key Performance Indicators, LinkedIn Advertising, Optimization Techniques, Remarketing

Title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator (ON-SITE)
JobDescription:
Full Job Description – Sales & Marketing CoordinatorASTOUND is a global creative experience design company that specializes in the design and execution of memorable experiences for companies to share with their customers. ASTOUND is a multi-faceted business whose services include architectural fabrication, brand strategy and development, retail design and store rollouts, digital engagements, trade show booths, branded events, and immersive environments.ASTOUND’s offices span North America, with fabrication facilities that exceed 600,000 square feet. Key office locations include Las Vegas, Portland, and Toronto. ASTOUND’s projects span over 40 countries and their clients are some of the most well-recognized brands across multiple industry sectors.The Sales and Marketing Coordinator plays a vital role in supporting the sales team by providing essential resources and assistance. This includes preparing pitch materials, conducting Salesforce data entry, and gathering background information on clients and events they are hosting or attending. The Sales and Marketing Admin serves as a key point of communication between the sales team and internal departments such as design, estimating, and operations, ensuring that client deadlines are met and projects progress smoothly. The Sales Coordinator reports to the Sales Operations Manager and works with the marketing department as it relates to supporting the sales team.Sales & Marketing Coordinator Responsibilities  Coordinate sales team by managing schedules, filing important documents and communicating relevant information  Creation and distribution of presentations and supporting documents to help the sales team generate business leads  Ensure the adequacy of sales-related equipment or materials  Help organize and maintain digital assets  Work with and hire photographers and videographers as needed for events  Help organize and maintain the company library of digital platforms and passwords  Respond to complaints from customers and give after-sales support when requested  Monitor the team’s progress, identify shortcomings, and propose improvements  Assist in the preparation and organizing of promotional material or events  Attend essential sales training meetings and develop an understanding of all the company's services and products  Establish active communication and engagement with client partnership team members to ensure that projects and workflows are processed promptly  Handle basic Salesforce administrative functions including reports and dashboards, workflows, and other routine tasks.  Completes ongoing extracurricular research, training, and other activities to keep apprised of the latest industry trends and best practices.  Communicate effectively with sales managers and their clients to maintain existing relationships while helping to create and build new client relationships.  Provide sales and administrative support through various duties such as making calls to vendors, managing calendars, scheduling site visits, etc.  Support the sales team in attaining sales targets  Prepare monthly, weekly, or daily sales analysis as instructed  Input new sales inquiries into Salesforce and update program files in the database as needed  Coordinate and respond to all requests for internal meetings  Assist in the implementation of sales strategy as prepared by the Client Partnership team  Create proposals and contracts that accurately reflect the services requested. This includes: word processing, creative writing, costing, and research  Inspire your team and influence them to perform at their best each and every day; this will ultimately determine the success of the Client Partnerships (Sales) organization.  Maintain a positive mindset, encourage teamwork, and act as an impeccable brand ambassador for ASTOUND  Willingness to travel within North America and overseas  Other Duties as assigned including support of the marketing team for sales-related matters 
Desired Education, Experience, & Qualifications  Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in sales and marketing support or administrative functions.  Excellent persuasive communication skills  Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data entry and documentation.  Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.  Analytical mindset with the ability to gather and interpret data to drive decision-making.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and self-motivated approach.  Should exert sound judgment, and discretion to preserve confidentiality of sensitive information.  Good liaison with all other department members  Flexible to work during non-business hours  Able to operate in different work conditions such as on-site, off-site  Can work well in a fast-paced environment  General troubleshooting capabilities are a must. We use many systems on a daily basis  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
Benefits And CompensationThe compensation package will be commensurate with experience. Our employees are entitled to a standard set of benefits, including health and dental insurance and 401(k) with company match.  Excellent Medical Insurance  Excellent Dental Insurance  Excellent Vision Insurance  Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay  401K matching program after 60 days of employment  100% Company Life and Short-Term Disability Coverage  Employee Referral Program 
DIVERSITY COMMITMENT At ASTOUND, our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is helping us to create not only a great place to work but also an environment where our employees, customers, and the communities we operate exist in a safe, productive, and enriching environment for everyone. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.
Skills: Administration, Communication, Organization Skills, Presentations, Sales Analysis, Sales Strategy, Sales Trainings, Sales and Marketing, Salesforce.com, Sensitive Information

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionExperience Level: 3-5+ years within Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) industryApproximate Salary Range: $60,000 - $70,000Position Summary: As a Marketing Coordinator at ENGEO you will collaborate with teammates in all aspects of the organization to pursue new business and develop current practices. You will lead a variety of internal and external marketing initiatives, provide key input on marketing content, and communicate highly technical concepts. You will set and maintain high standards of quality work, while inspiring our team and marketing efforts. At ENGEO, you will see your hard work make a direct impact on our growth and success!Primary Responsibilities  Help implement an innovative marketing vision and strategy that advances ENGEOs services and capabilities.  Collaborate with the Business Development (BD) team, engineering staff and Human Resources to expand brand awareness and recognition through direct marketing campaigns, social media, capability statements, and other marketing materials.  Regularly update and maintain ENGEOs website and social media accounts.  Explore and track the efficacy of branding strategies for ENGEO services, regional, and new markets.  Draft and create original content, such as articles and newsletters.  Develop written content for qualification statements that represent ENGEOs services.  Support presentations through graphics and formatting according to the ENGEO brand.  Maintain and regularly update marketing files and databases.  Assist with client event coordination and represent ENGEO, as needed.  Set expectations and maintain high standards of quality work - demand excellence and encourage creativity.  Support BD team with marketing material for Request for Proposals (RFP), Request for Qualifications (RFQ), and Request for Information (RFIs), as needed.  Perform other duties, as requested.
Required Experience Our Ideal Candidate   Innovative with a can-do attitude and all-hands-on-deck mentality  Has basic knowledge and understanding of A/E/C services  Able to work both collaboratively and independently  Knowledge of marketing tools and social media platforms (Hootsuite, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.)  Excellent organization and ability to multitask  Talent for storytelling and creative writing 
Required Qualifications  Experience Level: 3-5 years within the marketing sector  Education Level: Bachelors degree in a relevant field (Marketing, Communications, etc.)  Software: Proficiency using Microsoft Suite, WordPress, Hootsuite, Constant Contact (or other email distribution apps), and social media platforms  General understanding of the engineering, construction, and consulting industry (geotechnical, environmental, and water resources)  Outstanding communication (verbal and written) 
BenefitsBenefits:We Provide a Comprehensive Benefit Package For Individuals And Families, IncludingOur most important asset is our employees. The health and well-being of our employees and their families are our top priority.  Vacation Sick Leave Personal Leave Medical Leave Dental Vision Life Insurance Short and Long Term Disability Insurance  Flexible Spending Account for Medical and Dependent Care Expenses 401(k) and Roth 401(k) Retirement Plan Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) Wellness Plan  Health Club Membership Reimbursement College Savings Plan (Section 529) Incentives for attaining professional registration
Who We AreENGEO strives to create a positive, family-oriented, and innovative environment, where employees are engaged and excellence-driven. As an ENGEO team member, you will have access to mentorships, international opportunities, fun social events, and generous benefit packages. Here, you’ll receive exposure to a wide variety of projects, help to serve those around you, and drive business success.Click HERE to learn why we are consistently ranked in Great Place to Work’s Best Workplaces!What We DoFounded in 1971, ENGEO is an employee-owned firm of approximately 350 geotechnical and civil engineers, geologists, hydrologists, water resources engineers, environmental scientists, and construction-phase field representatives. ENGEO serves a diverse range of clients and projects and has offices located throughout California, Nevada, New Zealand, and Australia.We appreciate your interest in ENGEO.Keyword: Marketing Coordinator

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
At Northrim Bank, our vision is to be Alaska’s premier bank and employer of choice. We are looking for professional and knowledgeable employees who take pride in their work. We believe in providing value for our customers and communities.Employee Benefits Medical, Dental and Vision insurance, including FSA (Flex Spending Account)Paid Time Off to include select paid holidaysRetirement Benefits with generous 401K match
Some Other Favorite Employee Benefits IncludePaid Parental Leave, Education Assistance, Employee Assistance Program, Employee Wellness Program and much more! Pay is depending on experience, minimum is  $56,870.85/annually, $2,187.34/bi-weeklyPosition SummaryThe Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for executing the Marketing Department’s strategies that support the Bank’s growth goals and sales activities in the Bank’s digital channels. The position proactively creates digital assets and content for multi-faceted product and service campaigns and sales promotions through the use of digital channels that include Pinpoint marketing, email service providers, video platforms and social media. The Digital Marketing Specialist reports to the Marketing & Sales Manager and assists with customer acquisition programs and affiliate advertising. This position is responsible for content on Bank’s websites and communicates regularly with third party website and email platform vendors, and manages aspects of the Northrim product information network which includes online customer product touch points. This position serves as an active member of product launches working closely with other departments within the bank.The following duties are intended to provide a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities and ARE NOT intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional duties.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Email Marketing Platform: Responsible for outbound e-mail marketing platform as an electronic marketing communication channel. Manage various email campaigns, including template designs, calls-to-action, and content to be used in email communications. Develop schedule of campaigns that mirrors the initiatives of the bank. Manages the ongoing use of this digital marketing tool by analyzing results using industry benchmarks and past results and implementing optimizations as needed. Social Media: Manages consistent social media strategy and elevate the bank’s brand across a variety of social channels by maintaining a social media calendar, creating content, analyzing results, and recommending when to purchase social media advertising. Regularly shares feedback and insights gained from social media monitoring with team to help improve communication and marketing strategies. Pinpoint Marketing Platform: Responsible for the management of Pinpoint marketing messaging and asset creation, the bank’s always-on, omni-channel digital marketing system to identify customer segments and needs and recommend appropriate products and services. Utilize available reporting for continuous refinements.Product Information Network: Support the Bank’s information efforts by creating complementary digital channel strategies to support new product, customer acquisition or other bank-wide initiatives. Manage delivery for all digital screen touch points, including developing creative. Write and post internal communications through NBi (bank intranet) and maintain an editorial calendar that supports the bank’s communication goals. Work with IT, Human Resources and other departments in the bank to enhance and manage Bank’s use of video as a form of communication and facilitate additional bank training digital channels. Lead the creation and implementation of new content, features and functionality on the Bank’s websites.Website: Be the administrator for the Bank’s websites to include managing the website service providers and coordinating with Compliance, IT and other departments to ensure an effective and accurate online customer interface. Monitor and report on website usage and identify opportunities to improve web traffic and drive usage of the online channel. Manage Bank’s website content management system.Events: Supports employee and customer events. Attend community marketing events as bank representative to gain insights and make valuable connections. Attendance: Maintain regular and predictable attendance.Administrative: Serve as back up for the customer comment center for routing customer comments. Responsible for managing other administrative functions, as assigned. Complete online, written and in-person compliance training within established timeframes.Other duties as assigned.
QualificationsEducation Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field is required. Related experience may be substituted for education requirement.
Experience Five years of related work experience in marketing.Experience in the financial services industry desirable.One year ofwebsite experience. Experience working under pressure and with tight deadlines is important. Attention to detail and organization is critical. Related military education/experience may be used as a substitute for education or work experience.
Licenses & Certifications  Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation. 
Knowledge & Communication Skills Have excellent business writing and interpersonal skills.Ability to interpret and analyze data and present it in a way that can be easily understood by bank management.Abilityto read, write and verbally communicate in the English language and in an effective manner with customers, staff, management, and third party vendors. Ability to interact and communicate professionally with people at all levels in a manner all will understand.Must understand and have the ability to implement applicable compliance requirements.
Analytical & Decision Making Skills A good problem solver and have the ability to understand complex instructions high-level direction. Detail oriented with the ability to proof read documents for accuracy and managing project logistics. Ability to analyze data and make recommendations based on findings. Complete work and manage priorities under stressful conditions and tight deadlines. Must be able to work independently with limited supervision and general instructions, as well as possessing the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and manage complex projects. Independent critical thinking is necessary.
Computer/Software/Other Equipment Skills Highly proficient knowledge of MS Office Suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Ability to operate standard office equipment such as PC, printer, fax/copier, and telephone. Knowledge of online communities, including blogs, social networks, virtual worlds, mobile and other emerging digital marketing trends (Examples include but are not limited to Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, Google+, Instagram and Pinterest). Knowledge of web content management systems such as Drupal or WordPress. Knowledge of web design and HTML is required.Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management systems. Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop.Video editing/directing experience a plus.
Working Conditions  The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Work is performed in a professional office environment.

Title: Communications and Marketing Assistant 1

Must be able to prioritize and multitask despite frequent interruptions and deadline pressure; exercise independent judgment when creating content for website, events, and seminars; interact effectively with a diverse group of students, faculty, and staff; collaborate as part of a team; maintain confidentiality; interpret, communicate, and apply policies/procedures; anticipate needs; and execute and follow up on tasks. PREFERRED : bachelor’s degree; proficiency with Adobe Acrobat, Adobe Creative Cloud applications, and web publishing; and MIT or other academic administration experience. Title: Product Sales and Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Pay rate range - $45/hr. to $48/hr. on W2Hybrid (Tues-Thurs in office)Candidate can sit in Plano office or Atlanta office.Job DescriptionTop 3 Skill Sets Product management, sales, marketingEducation Requirement Bachelor's Degree in business, marketing, sales, product management, or relatedYears of experience 2 or morePosition SummaryThe primary purpose of this role is to collaborate cross-functionally to drive sales and awareness for the category across multiple sales channels.The selected candidate will work directly with leadership, internal sales channels and marketing teams to provide guidance to achieve all applicable targets and KPIs.This candidate will meet with leadership and stakeholders in person as needed.This candidate will report directly to the Sr. Manager for Certified Re-Newed Category Management.Role and ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities And Duties  Regularly meet with various marketing teams and stakeholders to ensure on-going support and awareness of CRN products Monitor, analyze and report marketing tactics and support to ensure optimal ROIs for marketing activities Support CRN operations, finance and account teams with forecasting, ensuring all demand is accurately loaded into our demand planning system and submit monthly forecasts in a timely manner. Ensure strong communications between CRN operations teams and account teams regarding demand and delivery timelines. Oversee the customer experience journey on digital and partner with appropriate CX and e-commerce teams to ensure proper flow, assets, pricing, etc. Review and analyze e-commerce sales reports to make recommendations on adjustments, if needed. Monitor various e-commerce platforms for CRN sales compliance Collaborate with CRN leadership, operations, marketing and sustainability teams in effectively telling our sustainability story as well as measuring and monitoring associated KPIs Assist CRN sales leadership in ensuring avoidance of price collisions across channels by maintaining accurate pricing reports Coordinate communications, sales promotion development, and training as required to stimulate and facilitate the sale of Samsung CRN products. Foster strong working relationships with key channel sales teams, marketing and product teams Collaborate with business analyst to review historical sales performance, forecast future performance and make recommendations based on data Maintain CRN product roadmap and sales decks Help monitor forecasts-to-actuals sales performance and work back with leadership to optimize program Coordinate with sales management to develop sales and marketing plans Provide support and guidance to account teams as needed
Background/Experience Required  Minimum Bachelor's degree in related discipline 2 or more years of relative experience in the Consumer Electronics or mobile products Experience in working with cross-functional teams across divisions (Sales, Operations, Marketing, Product) Demonstrate competency in both oral and written communication modes for internal personnel at mid-to-senior levels Strong working knowledge in all levels of account management, product management, sales and e-commerce Proficient in MS Office Good presentation skills Strong product knowledge Ability to adapt quickly and successfully manage multiple critical tasks at once Strong attention to detail Clear & decisive decision making Ability to interact with all levels of both the customer and Samsung environment.

Title: Marketing Support Specialist II
JobDescription:
The Marketing Support Specialist II (Marketing Coordinator) is responsible for coordinating the production and implementation of marketing plans/campaigns for the assigned location. Works with Marketing Supervisor/Marketing and Senior Field Marketing Manager to ensure marketing efforts align with both corporate and location goals.This person will report to the Cox Manheim location Monday through Friday:13813 St Charles Rock Road, Bridgeton MO 63044What You'll Do  At the direction of the Marketing Supervisor/Manager, execute marketing campaigns to address auction and client needs, ensuring Manheim brand alignment and accuracy  Plans and executes marketing tactics within the location including print, displays, and signage  Assists in managing auction social media sites to drive awareness to auction sales and events and creatively engage both current and prospective clients  Contribute ideas and insights in the development of a year-long event sale calendar  Track results of all marketing campaigns and make adjustments to future campaigns based on results  Utilize Cox Manheim tools to execute marketing plans including graphic design requests, existing editable templates and company intranet site  Execute necessary sale day preparations/responsibilities as directed by leadership including but not limited to client engagement, promotion/incentive execution, giveaway tracking, etc.  Travel as required by corporate marketing and auction leadership  Assist with and travel to additional auction location(s) to help with marketing efforts (when needed)  Perform other duties as assigned by auction leadership and corporate marketing

 Join the Cox family of businesses and make your mark today! About Cox AutomotiveAt Cox Automotive, people of every background are driven by their passion for mobility, innovation and community.
