Title: Marketing Associate  - Immediate Start
JobDescription:
Marketing Associate Are you a college/university graduate who is looking to get their foot in the door?Do you like the idea of an intense, fun and creative environment where you're challenged to produce your best every day? Or maybe you have experience and are looking for a career change? *If you answered yes to each of these questions, then read on*What do we do at Omnia?Omnia is an engagement marketing agency that directly encourages customers to participate in the evolution of a brand. Through one on one interactions we create positive experienceslinked to customers' attitudes, moods and behaviours. This allows customers to createconnections with brands, reinforcing the offer of a product, and establishing relationships with the brand.Marketing Associate Role:The Marketing Associates at Omnia are at the forefront of what we do. Our marketing team is responsible for bringing our marketing strategy to life. We provide promotional marketing strategy and implementation to major clients in several different industries. You will learn how to differentiate between different client demands and work with a wide range of audiences. You will gain cross-functional skills such as: Planning, organizing and setting priorities for different audiencesCommunication, presentation and public speakingObjection handling and negotiation skillsPitching customers and collecting information
As an entry level team member within the company your initial duties will include: General sales and marketing support to various departments within the companyLearning how to organize a variety of marketing events Working on improving marketing and sales strategies for our clients Helping to organize, and with more experience run training sessions for more junior members of the team Learn how to assess ROI for each of our campaigns 
Marketing Associate Key Requirements Ability to start work in 2-4 weeksAbility to work in the USA without visa sponsorshipFriendly outgoing personalityMarketing degree or experience in a hands on role is beneficial but not requiredPresentation skills; public speakingDesire to make an impact and build value from day one
What we offer: Fun, friendly environment with a strong company cultureFull training with a dedicated mentorCompetitive pay with opportunities to get on a promotional track within 6-12 monthsSocial perks such as invites to sporting events, fine dining experiences, concerts, team events and more
To Apply:Drop a copy of your resume today and we’ll be in touch soon! Please note, we’re evaluating applicants on a first come first serve basis and looking to move forward with the next steps within a week of application submission.
Skills: Communication, Event Marketing, Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Negotiation, Presentation Skills, Press Releases, Public Speaking, Sales, Sales and Marketing

Title: Entry-Level Marketing & PR Assistant
JobDescription:
Marketing & PR Assistant (Entry-Level / Full-Time/ On-Site)Freehold, NJAre you up for a new challenge and looking for any or all of the following… An entry-level marketing or sales position?Ongoing training, support, and career coaching?A welcoming environment with like-minded people?Flexible hours in a performance-driven environment?Structured progression based on results, not seniority?More control over your career stability, safety, and/or security?Travel opportunities and other bonuses, rewards, and incentives?
If so, we would love to speak with you about our entry-level marketing & PR positions, our company culture, our plans for the future, and where you could potentially fit in with us!About The Role: Each morning you’ll be learning and practicing different sales and marketing techniques before heading to an event location to represent a specific brand or cause for the day. You will be working as part of a team engaging with local consumers, distributing marketing materials, and closing sales when the product and timing are right.Some specific responsibilities will include: Setting up branded displays and distributing branded marketing materialsApproaching customers to break the ice and engage in conversationQualifying potential customers before presenting a product or serviceListening to customers’ wants, needs, and concerns to determine a solutionConducting market research and collecting valuable feedback from consumersClosing a handful of sales and processing digital sales transactionsPerforming other general sales and marketing tasks as needed
Training & Support: We provide ongoing sales training plus on-site sales support and guidance because individual results lead to overall results and we want to see everyone achieving their desired outcomes!Career Advancement: As we grow our team and host more events, we’ll be looking for people to build and develop sales teams and manage event locations, so there may be opportunities for you to progress into other areas within your first year.Hours & Pay: We’re primarily interested in people with full-time availability, but will consider part-time hours as long as you can work 20+ hours per week over 3-4 days Monday-Saturday. Salary is paid on a weekly basis and includes base pay, commissions, and bonuses.We also offer a range of additional benefits including: Cash BonusesTravel IncentivesMentorship programTeam sporting eventsWeekly team outingsAnd more!
Requirements: No specific work experience nor degree is required, but you’ll need to be 18+ years of age and eligible to work in the USA to be considered. Sales, customer service, retail sales, hospitality, food service, or similar experience can be helpful since you’ll be working in a fast-paced environment and speaking directly with customers.For Consideration: Please send your resume or candidate profile using the online application process. We’re actively reviewing applications as they come in, so please make sure your contact details are up-to-date and that you’re keeping an eye on your phone and email account in case we reach out to you. We look forward to speaking with you!
Skills: Communication, Customer Service, Customer Support, English, Leadership, Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Retail Sales, Sales, Social Media

Title: Alumni Relations Assistant, Engagement Marketing and Communications
JobDescription:
Job SummaryAlumni Affairs and Development (AA&D)Alumni Affairs and Development is a dedicated team supporting Harvard’s advancement activity through front-line fundraising, alumni and volunteer engagement, technology, prospect management and research, business process, events, communications, and many other areas.Our goal is to create an environment of respect that leverages the many talents, perspectives, and experiences of our employees; to deliver the strongest possible results by incorporating diverse perspectives into our daily work; and to make AA&D a great place to work for everyone. We strive to live our values of respect, inclusion, trust, collaboration, continuous improvement and innovation; and open communication and effective information sharing in our daily interactions and our work.AA&D is comprised of the University Development Office (UDO), Faculty of Arts and Sciences (FAS) Development, AA&D Resources, the Harvard Alumni Association (HAA), and the Office of the Vice President (OVP).Harvard Alumni AssociationThe Harvard Alumni Association (HAA) is the University-wide alumni association for Harvard University. It is also the home to the Harvard College and Radcliffe College alumni/ae association and the staff that support them. In its University-wide capacity, the HAA serves alumni of all eleven schools at Harvard in a manner supportive of and complementary to the work of the individual school alumni offices. Harvard University alumni span the globe at nearly 400,000 strong – more than 327,000 are in the USA, with 204 international countries represented.This Alumni Relations Assistant role provides supports work across Harvard Alumni Association’s (HAA) Engagement Marketing and Communications (EMC) team. Key aspects of the position include supporting the work of the Marketing Strategist in the creation of email newsletters; providing support and back-up coverage for the Digital Content Strategist’s work managing the HAA’s four social media channels, including social posting, scheduling, and some content creation; and provides primary administration support to all members of the EMC team, especially the Senior Director and Senior Associate Director.Position Description In support of the Marketing Strategist, plays a key role in curating content and events from across Harvard for the EMC team’s weekly and monthly newsletters;Regularly monitors four HAA social media networks, which includes tracking replies, retweets, and communicating regularly with the Digital Content Strategist about any issues or flags that arise. This position also manages responding to direct messages across a variety of social networks to ensure alumni outreach receives a timely response;Provides writing support for Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Facebook content;Provides back-up social media coverage at key HAA and Harvard events in support of the Digital Content Strategist;Performs archival and other research to support the marketing efforts of the EMC team; Provides support to the entire EMC team on a variety of projects, including maintaining and updating marketing calendars, submitting project requests through Workfront; managing and maintaining list pulls and marketing reports; and other duties as assigned across a wide variety of work;Provides regular administrative support to the Senior Director and Senior Associate Director;Manages the EMC team’s proofreading queue;Makes updates and build pages on alumni.harvard.edu on an as needed basis;Verifies and approves requests to access the alumni LinkedIn Group;Manages vendor who provides captioning for all HAA video content and regularly manages YouTube uploads of videos to the HAA YouTube channel;Provides back-up support for HAA phone line as needed;Manages and regularly updates the EMC team’s section on the Alumni Affairs and Development intranet (“The Source);Other duties as assigned.
Basic Qualifications At least 1 year of related experience in marketing/communications. Education beyond high school may count towards experience. Experience with Microsoft Office (i.e. - PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) required;Evening and weekend work required at least once or twice monthly throughout the academic year that will require an on-site presence in Cambridge; this role is also required to be on-site covering Harvard Class Day, Commencement, Reunions, and Harvard Alumni Day events in Cambridge office for most days from the last full week of May through the first Saturday in June. Provides social media coverage at events that may occur outside of standard office hours.
Additional Qualifications And Skills BA/BS from accredited institution preferred;Excellent written communication skills;Experience with social media preferred;Strong organizational skills and attention to detail; ability to manage multiple competing priorities at once;Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively;Team-oriented mindset, demonstrated interest and openness to collaborating closely with team members from across the EMC team and HAA broadly;Must have cultural sensitivity and awareness of diversity issues regarding the internal and external Harvard community;Strong customer service skills and an interest in helping and supporting others;Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with an ability to be flexible and nimble and quickly adapt to new directions and approaches under deadline pressure;Possess a learning mindset with an interest in staying up to date on marketing best practices;Level of comfort working in Excel is helpful. 
Additional Information This position requires a 3 month orientation and review period.Please include a cover letter with your application.
Why AA&D?We are a dedicated team of 400 alumni affairs and development professionals supporting Harvard’s advancement activity through roles that include front-line fundraising, alumni and volunteer engagement, technology, events, communications, prospect management and research, business process, talent management and many other areas.Harvard’s Alumni Affairs and Development team inspires and galvanizes alumni, friends, and members of the University community to support Harvard through philanthropy, governance, and active engagement. AA&D believes a workplace that reflects the diversity of our society and our ever-evolving University constituency makes us a stronger and more effective organization. Our goal is to create an environment of respect that values the many talents, perspectives, and experiences of our community, to deliver the strongest possible results by incorporating diverse perspectives into our daily work, and to make AA&D a great place to work for everyone. AA&D strives to live our values of respect, inclusion, trust, collaboration, innovation and sharing of information in our daily interactions and our work.To learn more about our Alumni Affairs and Development team, please visit our website at https://alumni.harvard.edu/careers .To learn more about how Harvard supports diversity and inclusion throughout the University please visit the Office for Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging at https://dib.harvard.edu/ .Accommodations: Harvard University welcomes individuals with disabilities to apply for positions and participate in its programs and activities. If you would like to request accommodations or have questions about the physical access provided, please let your recruiter know.COVID-19 Vaccination InformationThe health of our workforce is a priority for Harvard University. With that in mind, we strongly encourage all employees to be up to date on CDC-recommended vaccines.BenefitsWe invite you to visit Harvard’s Total Rewards website to learn more about our outstanding benefits package, which may include: Paid Time Off: 3-4 weeks of accrued vacation time per year (3 weeks for support staff and 4 weeks for administrative/professional staff), 12 accrued sick days per year, 12.5 holidays plus a Winter Recess in December/January, 3 personal days per year (prorated based on date of hire), and up to 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents who are primary care givers.Health and Welfare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits, disability and life insurance programs, along with voluntary benefits. Most coverage begins as of your start date. Work/Life and Wellness: Child and elder/adult care resources including on campus childcare centers, Employee Assistance Program, and wellness programs related to stress management, nutrition, meditation, and more.Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive program including $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and reduced tuition through other participating Harvard graduate schools.Tuition Reimbursement: Program that provides 75% to 90% reimbursement up to $5,250 per calendar year for eligible courses taken at other accredited institutions. Professional Development: Programs and classes at little or no cost, including through the Harvard Center for Workplace Development and LinkedIn Learning.Commuting and Transportation: Various commuter options handled through the Parking Office, including discounted parking, half-priced public transportation passes and pre-tax transit passes, biking benefits, and more. Harvard Facilities Access, Discounts and Perks: Access to Harvard athletic and fitness facilities, libraries, campus events, credit union, and more, as well as discounts to various types of services (legal, financial, etc.) and cultural and leisure activities throughout metro-Boston.

We strive to create a community that draws upon the widest possible pool of talent to unify excellence and diversity while fully embracing individuals from varied backgrounds, cultures, races, identities, life experiences, perspectives, beliefs, and values.EEO StatementWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Coactive makes it easy to search, filter, and analyze visual content. Increasingly image and video data captures the content we watch, the products we buy, and the work we do, and already represents 80% of internet traffic. But rather than being an asset, visual content is often a tax or even a liability because it is so hard to work with and understand. Coactive solves this by bringing structure to unstructured data. Rather than spending months (or years) building complex infrastructure, data teams can unlock the value of their visual data in minutes to power use cases such as content understanding and moderation, search, and analytics.Coactive was founded by experts who shaped the fields of high-performance deep learning and data-centric AI. We have the scars from building and working with the first generation of modern machine learning systems at Google, Meta (formerly Facebook), Pinterest, eBay, Lyft, and other leading organizations. Through our decades of experience, we have developed a playbook to democratize the toughest parts of machine learning systems; no PhD required.The product marketing manager (PMM) is the Coactive leader accountable for overall marketing strategy. This person will build content, and execute go-to-market and ongoing programs to build market awareness, while clearly communicating Coactive's value proposition and differentiation to drive highly qualified prospects that lead to customer growth. The product marketing manager will help position Coactive as the leader in the market; one that firms will have confidence to do business with to support their critical objectives. This will be achieved by building a clear corporate identity, developing polished and effective content, and promoting customer successes and thought leadership. To be effective, the PMM will seek to understand the competitive landscape, the needs of the target market, and tailor messaging to differentiate our offerings. In creating marketing programs, the PMM must take an analytical approach to optimize the investment of time and money into programs.In Coactive's fast-paced startup environment, your responsibility will span from strategic and tactical on a day-to-day basis - from working with cross-functional leadership, responding to marketing opportunities, and interacting with prospects and customers, to selecting and managing PR and content development partners to help execute the marketing strategy.What you'll do:Marketing Strategy & Program Execution Design multi-channel marketing strategy that positions Coactive most effectively to the target market, building awareness, driving new sales leads, and supporting closing deals. Execute a mix of go-to-market and ongoing marketing programs supporting the strategy. Solicit feedback on strategy and programs with internal stakeholders and external experts to improve plan, gain buy-in and alignment to program goals. Gain media and event placement for Coactive leadership and Coactive customersDevelop and implement SEO and paid search strategies as appropriate, including test and learn for effectiveness to drive both organic search rankings and assess the ROI on paid search investments. Develop and manage relationships with PR and marketing agencies, web development resources to execute timely marketing programs with high quality, fresh content. 
Brand Identity Develop/evolve brand identity, standards; ensure adoption across organization and collateral. Provide ongoing review, guidance, and assistance on content visual appearance and effectiveness of market facing materials. 
Content and Collateral Deeply understand customer businesses & customer problems in target vertical; including stakeholders with roles in the awareness/discovery, evaluation, selection, and procurement phases to optimize collateral and messaging in support of the sales cycle. Establish a foundational product messaging framework, using value messaging or similar methodologies, that effectively communicates the value proposition and differentiation. Design and deliver multi-channel collateral for prospects, analysts and influencers, and investors, including: sales presentations, product data sheets, web content, white papers, blogs, newsletters, podcasts, and social media, and demo storyboards. Develop content, scripts, and talking points for Coactive speaking engagements. Develop a sustainable content production process and resourcing. Devise programs to develop, test, and iterate content with external stakeholders. 
Measurements & Continuous Improvement Participate in sales engagements to gain first-hand feedback regarding effectiveness of content. Design and implement measurements for the effectiveness of the marketing strategy. Understanding of sources of all leads; look for patterns for successful channels for future marketing. 
What we look for:Education: Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, or related field. A degree in computer science, engineering, or related discipline is also ideal, with requisite marketing experience. MBA is highly desirable. 
Experience: 6+ years of B2B technology product marketing experience in start-up environments, with a proven track record of developing and executing effective marketing programs in software platform companies. Experience briefing media, analysts, and like stakeholders. Familiarity with AI/ML market space and tooling is desirable. 
Skills: Ability to build strong relationships with PR firms, analyst community, media, and other influencers. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, and ability to work well in a team environment. Strong sense of visual design and presentation. Exceptional business writing and presentation skills; with proven ability to effectively communicate complex information simply. Excellent project management skills and attention to detail. Strong analytic and strategic thinking skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapid growth environment. 
What you can expect from us:The estimated annual base salary for this position is between $110,000-150,000.*  100% medical, dental & vision coverage for youMedical, dental & vision partially covered for your dependents401KUnlimited PTOAn allowance to set up workstations however you wantA supportive environment. We build products, but we develop people. Social events ranging from happy hours and hiking to board game nights and games of Mario Kart.

Title: Marketing Account Coordinator
JobDescription:
Account CoordinatorInsight Marketing Design is looking for a multi-tasking, detail-oriented team player to manage projects and project execution. If you’re an energetic self-starter who can prioritize and manage multiple projects, we’d like you on our team. You’ll have the opportunity to guide projects through the agency, from hearing client requests to delivering completed projects. Our ideal candidate will have prior experience working in marketing or managing client relationships. Must be organized and able to manage time effectively.What We DoInsight Marketing Design is a full-service advertising and marketing agency – which means we provide a full gamut of services. Branding, design, video production, web development, research, strategy, digital and social – yeah, we have a lot of hats and we wear them often. Check out our Facebook page for a taste of our company culture (spoiler alert: cats, holiday festivities, and BEER). PS: We’re cool with wine coolers and pop if those are more your thing!What You’ll DoThe Account Coordinator is responsible for keeping the train on the track and moving forward. They assist the Account Executive with day-to-day account management (phone calls, email, handling mail/packages, managing deadlines and budgets), gaining access to assets needed, coordinating and scheduling tasks, and documenting details related to all client projects. They work with both the client-facing side of our business as well as with our creatives to ensure projects are on time and on budget. The Account Coordinator also assists with monthly billing and reconciliation of all projects for assigned clients. Our clients cover a wide range of industries – we’re always learning about new services, products and companies. NO same ol’ same ol’ here. The Account Coordinator position is a vital role, and when mastered, has a direct career path towards becoming an Account Executive.RequirementsAn Associate degree from an accredited college or university with course work in business or marketing subjects. Prior experience in account management or marketing experience is a plus. The ideal candidate must be meticulously organized and detail oriented.Learn more about the role here: https://insightmarketingdesign.com/careers/account-coordinator/Our commitment to you: Health, vision, dental insuranceCompany-matched retirement contributionFlexibility for family / personal obligationsWork from home WednesdaysHoliday / PTO / Sick leaveBusiness casual environmentSummer hours: knock off a little early on Fridays
This is a full-time salaried position that reports to the VP of Account Services. Candidate is expected to work at our Sioux Falls, SD office. Pay depending on experience. Direct candidate applications only, please (no recruiters). Insight is located in Sioux Falls, a growing city in the eastern side of South Dakota, which is consistently ranked in various lifestyle reviews as a top city for young professionals, top small city for business, top 100 places to live, and most affordable US cities. We offer a competitive benefits package and are an equal opportunity employer.Interested applicants, please send your resume to careers@insightmarketingdesign.com.More information about our company can be found at https://insightmarketingdesign.comGet to know the mantras we live by and what makes our team tickCreativity is what we are all about. In every shape, form and size. There’s always a creative solution to any challenge and we’re always up for a good challenge. We love what we do, and better yet, we enjoy the people we work with and for! That’s not to say all of this happens just willy-nilly. We have a guiding set of shared values – what our company stands for. Delivering shared successIf our clients are successful, then we are successful. We work each day with mutual respect to bring trust, value, and reliability to our clients.Sweat the small stuffWe are inspired by our world, working with creative collaboration.Quality is a must, and we never settle for mediocrity.Don’t wish for it, work for itWe face challenges with enthusiasm and live every day with intention. Every tomorrow is an opportunity for a better yesterday.We are WEWe are the sum of each of us together. We work as a team, complimenting each other’s strengths, pulling each other forward. Find your YOUOur life experiences and identities outside the office walls have a profound impact on the work we do. Dance in the rain. Climb the mountain. Participate in life.
Skills: Advertising, Attention to Detail, Easily Adaptable, Marketing, Marketing Agencies, Multiple Project Coordination, Multitasking, Time Management

JobDescription:

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Snap One is a leading manufacturer and distributor of control, A/V, surveillance, networking, power, and infrastructure equipment for residential and commercial professionals.  We believe that life’s better when everything works together. And the same can be said about the collaborative work we do.  Join our award-winning team in our continuous quest to deliver the most brilliant, personalized smart living and smart business experiences to people around the world. The Product Marketing Manager will report to the SVP Product Marketing and will be primarily responsible for architecting go-to-market product messages and campaigns. This position is instrumental in telling product stories based on product strategies, competitive landscape, and customer knowledge. The Product Marketing Manager will work collaboratively in a matrixed environment, driving the development and execution of activities with cross-functional teams to successfully align with company objectives and desired outcomes. Intellectual curiosity, accountability, attention to detail, creative problem solving, and business acumen are key attributes to be successful in this position. Job Location:  Specific Responsibilities Partner with and guide the product organization in understanding assigned products, how they are unique, and the value they provide to customersCraft clearly articulated, unique selling propositions and product messages that drive demand Quarterback the creation of campaigns end-to-end, with knowledge of audience, brand, thought leadership, targeting and segmentation strategies, campaign analysis, messaging, positioning, creative, content mapping/development management, and the marketing mix across the buyer’s journeyBe an evangelist in both internal and external audiences to drive ongoing demand generationTrack performance and report regularly on performance to plan, adjust campaigns when growth targets are not meeting expectationsBuild strategic marketing partnerships internally and externally, to influence, motivate, and move the campaigns function forwardManage expectations clearly when plans need to shift or be managed differently using data driven decisions and a mix of emotional intelligence
  Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business technology or relevant field of study6+ years’ proven success in developing and executing product go to market campaigns4+ years’ experience with B2B marketing campaignsDemonstrated ability to formulate financial/operating plans and drive actual results of business to meet planProven ability to meet tight deadlines, to be a problem solver and to juggle numerous projects simultaneouslyVersed in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and project tracking tools such as Trello, Wrike, Jira, etc.
Preferred Qualifications Advanced business degreePrevious experience marketing AV/Electrical products
Snap One is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Marketing Demand Generation Specialist
JobDescription: Internship or Part-Time Marketing Demand Generation Specialist: Job Description: We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Internship or Part-Time Marketing Demand Generation Specialist. In this role, you will be responsible for executing personalized InMail and email cadences to generate qualified leads and support our marketing efforts. Your primary focus will be to drive survey responses and engage potential customers, ultimately contributing to the growth and success of our organization. Responsibilities: - Create and execute personalized InMail and email cadences to targeted individuals and companies. - Conduct thorough research on target prospects to understand their needs and preferences. - Craft compelling and customized messaging, leveraging strong writing skills, to drive survey responses and generate qualified leads. - Implement effective strategies to maximize email and InMail open rates and response rates. - Collaborate with the marketing team to align messaging and content with overall marketing campaigns. - Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, making data-driven decisions to optimize results. - Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all outreach activities and lead generation activities. - Stay informed about industry trends and best practices related to demand generation and lead generation techniques. - Leverage expertise in social media platforms, particularly LinkedIn, to enhance marketing efforts. - Demonstrate a strong writing background to personalize outreach messages effectively. - Possess good knowledge of marketing and technology to effectively communicate product value. - Pay close attention to detail and demonstrate a commitment to delivering high-quality work. - Quickly learn about our products to effectively promote and generate interest among potential customers.  Requirements: - Prior experience in demand generation, lead generation, or email marketing is preferred. - Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to customize messages for different audiences. - Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. - Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work. - Basic understanding of marketing principles and strategies. - Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. - Familiarity with survey tools (e.g., SurveyMonkey) is a plus. - A passion for marketing, data analysis, and driving results. - Expertise in LinkedIn and social media platforms. - Strong writing skills for personalized outreach. - Good knowledge of marketing and technology. - Detail-oriented approach to work. This is a part-time position, offering $15 per hour. As a Marketing Demand Generation Specialist, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our lead generation efforts and contribute to the overall success of our organization.  If you are a motivated, detail-oriented individual with strong writing and marketing skills, great research abilities, and the ability to quickly learn about products, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and interest in the position.

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: Job Purpose The Digital Marketing Coordinator facilitates the curation, production, execution and measurement of content for external audiences, which includes social media, emails, web content and other channels for the California Dental Association and its affiliate companies. Activities include coordinating content calendars and creative assets, optimizing content for each channel, timely publishing/posting, monitoring performance and being responsive to results/feedback. Consistently contributes to the planning, development and implementation of coordinated informational and promotional communications.Essential Competencies:• Critical Thinking Skills (Decision Making): Deciding with intention, reflection and reason; clarifying purpose, evaluating alternatives and analyzing risks.• Communication Skills (Approachability): Being consistently approachable, open to feedback direct and truthful; building trust and authentic professional relationships.• Relationship Skills (Collaboration): Participating as an active, contributive and supportive member of a team to achieve shared goals; listening, sharing and trusting.• Adaptation Skills (Flexibility & Innovation): Appropriately adapting behavior to changing conditions; modifying approach to succeed with new situations and timelines. Using creativity, ingenuity and insights to tackle issues; proactively addressing problems and seeking fresh solutions.Essential Functions• Maintain, communicate with and grow our social platform communities by managing content scheduling, publishing/posting and monitoring/moderation of Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn and other platforms; keeping up to date with best practices, changes and opportunities.• Proactively research new and engaging digital connection opportunities/channels, sharing enthusiasm for digital marketing and communication, curiosity about CDA's audiences and understanding of organizational goals and objectives.• Work collaboratively with the integrated marketing team in leveraging new and existing content for social, email and web to drive engagement.• Apply SEO skills and best practices to digital content, researching keywords and optimizing findability• Support paid media and ad buying initiatives.• Develop a strong understanding of end-to-end user journeys for key initiatives/activities.• Coordinate and facilitate email and landing page testing, review and sending, applying best practices.• Measure and report back on post/campaign/channel performance; seek opportunities to improve processes, grow relevance and reach.• Work closely with design, digital experience and content team members to develop messaging, graphics and other digital assets.• Collaborate with marketing managers to understand the perspectives and priorities of business partners.• Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to support the organization’s initiatives.Nonessential Functions• Perform other content team duties as assigned.Required Education, Licenses & Experience• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications or related field, or equivalent experience.• Minimum three years of digital content experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.• Professional experience with the administration of social media channels.• Understanding of fundamental social findability, SEO strategies and analytics.• Diplomacy and tact while interacting with all levels within and outside of the organization, including staff, volunteer leadership, members and the public.• Professional and empathetic interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.• Self-motivated, proactive approach to work, managing time effectively and prioritizing projects to meet competing deadlines and the pace of digital channels.• Computer skill fluency, including ability to use Windows/Microsoft Office software, social media platforms and project planning tools.Preferred Education, Licenses & Experience• Knowledge of the current social media and digital content climate.• Experience working in a nonprofit, not-for-profit or association environment.• Experience with reporting tools such as Google Analytics and social tools such as HubSpot.• Experience working with a content management system or digital content platform.Working Conditions  Occasionally (1-33%) Frequently (34-66%) Constantly (67-100%)• Frequently maintains a stationary position.• Occasional overnight travel for organizational events.• Comfortable in a matrix organization.• Remote or hybrid working arrangement.Salary Range: $46,900 - $57,500 a year

Title: Event Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Event Marketing AssistantWe’re growing our events team and looking for 3-4 additional Event Marketing Assistants for our upcoming summer events. You’ll be promoting brands across Orange County at pop-up events, in-store promotions, trade shows, shopping malls, product launches, themed events and more. This is a great position for graduates, career changers or anyone with an interest in marketing and the ability to relate to different people. We can offer short-term seasonal work for people wanting to learn new skills and earn good money and we can offer long-term work with continuous learning, growth potential and travel opportunities for people looking for something more permanent!Responsibilities: An Event Marketing Assistant’s primary purpose is to help a brand increase its market share. You’ll be capturing customers’ attention, qualifying them, and engaging with them in meaningful conversations. These positive interactions will help the brand improve brand awareness, enhance its reputation, and acquire new customers. You’ll need to be 18+ years of age for this particular role because of the outbound nature and digital transactions. You’ll also need to be eligible to work in the US (we cannot provide sponsorship). A solid work ethic and desire to exceed are important because your earnings are based on performance. For Consideration: Please send your resume through the online application process. We’re looking to grow our team ASAP, so you might hear back from us the same day you apply! Title: Creative Marketing Coordinator

Title: Marketing Campaign Representative
JobDescription: Marketing Campaign Representative About Us:NLC Academy is not like any ordinary marketing agency. It's a community of people who are ready to work and give real value to our clients, community, and industry. Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Zilliant powers intelligent B2B commerce with our industry-leading price optimization and sales guidance software. Our data science, cloud-native software, and passion for customer success deliver the highest ROI, fastest time to value, and highest customer satisfaction.  If you’re ready to make an impact at a growing company that values the time, input, and effort of each of its employees, we’re eager to connect with you!Zilliant is looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our team. The Product Marketing Manager is responsible for establishing, leading, and executing product marketing and the go-to-market programs, working in close collaboration with the Product Management, Marketing and Sales teams.What You’ll Do: Implement go-to-market strategies for Zilliant's B2B commercial channels.Execute key product launches and quarterly releases using the go-to-market (GTM) launch process in collaboration with product management, marketing, and the go-to-market cross-functional core team.Support comprehensive marketing opportunity assessments by utilizing internal and external data sources to identify and capitalize on market trends and customer needs.Utilize data-driven insights to develop key product messaging and positioning for use in customer marketing campaigns and field marketing to drive measurable demand and adoption.Support the management and insights of competitive intelligence and Zilliant’s win and loss analysis program to gather strategic market insights and drive data-informed decisions for future product enhancements and competitive positioning.Coordinate, and support marketing campaigns and corresponding content focused on building pipeline for Zilliant solutions.Increase the awareness of Zilliant solutions and how they can benefit prospective customers and customers.Drive continuous optimization of Zilliant key product lines through analysis of product performance and end-user satisfaction.Support the end-to-end customer journey by driving optimization and utilization of Zilliant product lines based on data-driven insights.
Who You Are: An experienced Product Marketer with a strong understanding of market dynamics, customer needs, and the ability leverage data-driven insights to execute effective go-to-market strategies.An exceptional communicator, both written and verbal, who can effectively convey complex ideas and information to diverse audiences. 
What You’ll Need: 3-5 years of product marketing experience in a B2B SaaS environmentStrong organizational skills and the ability to work across functionsStrong written, presentation and PowerPoint skills; high level of business acumenKnowledge of Pricing and/or Sales Optimization software preferred
What You’ll Enjoy: Full benefits package including medical, dental, and 401k plans with a company matchGenerous Paid Time Off (PTO) policy to ensure a solid work/life balanceMonthly Zilliant Zen Days to rest and rechargeComprehensive parental leave to provide time to bond with new family membersVolunteer Time Off (VTO) policy to give back and contribute to your local communityRemote or Hybrid work schedule, depending on team and personal preferencesThe financial and strategic backing of Madison Dearborn Partners (MDP)

Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
JobDescription:
OverviewVEIC is a sustainable energy company on a mission to generate the energy solutions the world needs. For over 30 years VEIC has been working with governments, utilities, foundations, and businesses across North America to develop and deploy clean energy services that provide immediate and lasting change. With expertise in energy efficiency, building decarbonization, transportation electrification, and new approaches for a clean and flexible grid, VEIC brings innovative solutions to the market. VEIC is nationally recognized for developing pilots and programs that optimize energy use, reduce energy burdens for low-income customers, and advance new technologies. In addition to our full-service consulting business (Energy Services), VEIC administers three large-scale sustainable energy programs: Efficiency Vermont, Efficiency Smart, and the DC Sustainable Energy Utility (DCSEU). As VEIC’s Marketing Analytics Manager, you will play a vital role in our growth by creating data stories that make an impact. Overseeing our digital performance, your work will involve managing data collection, analysis, and optimization to discover new insights for innovative marketing strategies across all our brands. You will be responsible for brainstorming new ideas, preparing reports and dashboards, analyzing trends, and suggesting ways to enhance marketing strategies and tactics. Your contribution will be crucial in strengthening marketing decision-making through the creation of advanced analytics implementation, data segmentation, and identification of complex data patterns and trends.We are committed to building an inclusive work community that represents a vibrant diversity of background, experience, perspective, and thought. Climate change impacts all of us; however, we are impacted differently based on our identities and experiences. We all deserve a place at the table to make decisions about our collective future – we hope you’ll consider joining us as we work towards our vision for a healthy planet, thriving people, and energy justice.Qualified candidates located in the states where VEIC conducts business will also be considered: CA, CT, DC, DE, HI, MA, MD, ME, MI, MT, NJ, NY, PA, OH, RI, VA, VT, and WI. Candidates across all markers of identity (age, race, gender, ability, communication style, etc.) are highly encouraged to apply.Responsibilities  Monitor, analyze, and present website analytics data to uncover trends and evaluate the effectiveness of individual pages.  Generate dashboards and deliver insightful reports and recommendations to stakeholders across all organizational levels, turning technical findings into digestible insights and actions.  Advise brand teams on the structure and use of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Google Search Console accounts; work with brand teams to set up new accounts as needed.  Support brand teams in capturing robust Google Analytics data to optimize marketing and website performance.  Support brand teams with SEO responsibilities, including competitor keyword analysis and optimizing digital elements.  Consult with brand teams on managing title tags, meta descriptions, sitelinks and rich snippets.  Consult with brand teams on visually representing data in Annual and Quarterly Reports.  Update Google My Business listings (and map listings in Google, Bing, and Apple Maps) as needed.  Partner closely with third-party digital marketing service vendors.  Facilitate discussions with brand teams and external partners on integrations with Google Ads accounts.  Create annual, monthly, and campaign-level reports focusing on performance and trends.  Perform custom analysis & ad hoc queries to answer business questions and help inform strategic direction.  Proactively seek latest information and maintain a current and thorough understanding of digital marketing best practices, including industry trends, metrics, and competitive activities.  Other duties as assigned. 
Qualifications  A strong personal commitment to the mission, vision, goals, and values of VEIC.  Bachelor’s degree in a related field and a minimum of 2-5 years of experience in digital marketing or an equivalent combination of education and experience that has provided you with comparable knowledge and skills.  Comprehensive knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console  Ability to produce accurate analysis and practical suggestions in a timely fashion  Thorough knowledge of SEO and content analysis  Strong ability to identify and resolve problems creatively  Demonstrated project management skills and experience, including planning, facilitation, vendor management, communications, and the ability to develop and attain goals effectively.  Demonstrated ability to partner with technical experts and support the needs of internal clients, partners, and vendors on time.  Strong time management and prioritization skills, as well as the ability to identify and implement the best allocation of resources to ensure the successful completion of projects.  Strong interpersonal, communication (written and oral), organization, and planning skills.  Experience with Cookie consent  Knowledge of PowerBI integration with marketing analytics data is preferred but not required.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
This position is responsible for the development and execution of marketing plans to reach targets from brand awareness to product promotion. This includes being a competent professional able to grasp consumer behavior trends and generate creative ideas and should also be well-versed in specialized marketing concepts, principles and tactics. The goal is to deliver effective marketing programs that will help our reputation and growth. This is a unique role that works across multiple PlayCore brands and requires a high level of organization.Essential Duties And Responsibilities  Manage PPC/Google AdWords campaigns. Provide regular reports on metrics.  Manage and coordinate blogs. Write blog posts and project manage staff-written blogs, including arranging for appropriate images or other supporting materials.  Responsible for social media postings on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and other social media channels. Provide regular reports on social and online communications metrics and measurement. Suggest ways to increase effectiveness of online vehicles and follow through on initiatives.  Design and manage email marketing programs.  Coordinate, manage, and implement photo and video shoots. Edit photos and videos as-needed.  Prepare and/or work with Graphic Designer to update product literature, price lists, flyers, guides, advertising, catalogs, etc.  Maintain the websites, keeping them up to date to ensure timeliness and accuracy of content. Make SEO improvements as needed. Assist Marketing Director and Graphic Designer in site development and management issues.  Report preparation, including trend analysis.  Trade show support Facilitate and manage staff and logistics of large-scale trade shows and localized events. Work in tandem with the Marketing Director to effectively plan and execute these events and meet marketing goals.  Responsible for booth reservation, design, signage, layout, materials, furnishings, collateral, promotions, etc. Manage and schedule company representatives and outreach sessions.  Prepare, ship, and track all materials/displays and provide trouble-shooting assistance  Track show success and lead generation  Staff exhibit booth 
 Work with other staff on sales and marketing projects as may arise  Support the sales team with mailings, email distribution and other duties  And other responsibilities and duties as may be required from time to time and as the business changes  Other duties may be assigned by Manager or Supervisor. 
Competencies (check all that apply)☒ Analytical Decision-Making☐ Financial Management☒ Communication☐ Managing Others☒ Learning & Development☐ EEO Accountability☒ Planning & Organizing☒ Results Orientation☒ Professionalism & Integrity☒ Teamwork & Relationship-Building☒ Risk-Taking/Creative ThinkingEducation And/or Experience  BSc/BA in marketing, communications or equivalent  Proven experience as marketing specialist or similar role 
TravelThis position requires some travel, up to 25%.Computer Skills  Demonstrated proficiency with MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access  Solid computer skills, including MS Office, marketing software (Adobe Creative Suite & CRM) and applications (Web analytics, Google Ads etc.) 
Other Requirements  Thorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO/Social media etc.) and market research methods  Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and tools  Experience managing multiple social media accounts simultaneously  Knowledge of HTML, CSS and web development tools (e.g. Shopify or similar) desired  Intermediate-level graphic design skills using the Adobe Suite (Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop)  Well-organized and detail oriented  Exceptional communication and writing skills  Commercial awareness partnered with a creative mind  Experience with HubSpot (or similar marketing automation software) 
Dero/Everlast a PlayCore Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Tech Elevator, Inbound Marketing Specialist (Remote, US)
JobDescription:
About Tech ElevatorMeet the Tech Elevator TeamRead About Student OutcomesMeet StrideSuccess StoriesResponsibility and Inclusion
Tech Elevator is an intensive in-person and online education provider helping individuals and companies acquire in-demand technology skills for the modern workforce. Through our full-time and part-time coding bootcamps and company partnerships, we teach students and employees from diverse backgrounds to become software developers—while also helping them to build career-readiness skills and connections through our nationally recognized Pathway Program™.At Tech Elevator, our mission is to elevate people, companies, and communities and, since 2015, we’ve been transforming lives through technology education. In 2020, we were listed as the 16th fastest-growing education company in the US, and we’ve consistently led our industry in performance outcomes. We are also proud to be listed among Purpose Jobs 2022 Best Places to Work in Midwest Tech.For us, it’s not just work; every team member contributes to a life-changing program. We work hard to help our students uncover the best version of themselves while working for a brand that empowers every employee to continually evolve and grow.About the Role:The Inbound Marketing Specialist will appreciate the opportunity to offer creative input and take ownership of the Tech Elevator brand voice across all social channels. S/he will work closely with key stakeholders in marketing to also take the lead on manual and auto-email marketing campaigns and performance.Essential Functions:  Refine, curate, and publish from all social channels to reflect an inclusive, sophisticated brand voice and to grow our social community. Draft and deploy email marketing campaigns, from newsletters to announcements to special lead generation initiatives. Engage with key stakeholders to develop blog/email/social content, and drive brand awareness. Analyze and report on data from performance metrics to drive decision-making across all channels of responsibility. Effectively manage up and support on marketing projects where needed.

An understanding of owned and earned media, and a passion for building brand buzz on social media.

Title: Adjunct Instructor Sport Management & Marketing
JobDescription:
Conveniently located in Morris County with easy access to Routes 287, 280, 80, 10, 24, and the Convent Station train station, Saint Elizabeth University which was established in 1899 by the Sisters of Charity of Saint Elizabeth resides on 150 acres of picturesque rolling hills and lush woodlands. The University offers a quality education in the Catholic tradition with a firm foundation in the liberal arts and serves a diverse population, including the needs of women, students of color, those who lack adequate financial resources, and those who would benefit from a nurturing, supportive collegiate environment.Diversity And Inclusion StatementFounded by the Sisters of Charity in 1899, Saint Elizabeth University (SEU) is a community of learning in the Catholic liberal arts tradition for students of diverse ages, backgrounds, and cultures. SEU is devoted to providing educational and career training opportunities to traditionally underserved communities and is characterized by small class sizes and a highly communal student-centered culture emphasizing individualized attention.SEU is a federally designated Minority-Serving and Hispanic-Serving Institution. Our traditional undergraduate population is 38 percent Black and our total enrollment is 30 percent Hispanic, while 47 percent of our students are first-generation college students. In addition, 76 percent of our first-time freshmen are low-income students eligible for federal Pell funding; many come to us with unique challenges related to their financial, social, academic, mental and physical health.Saint Elizabeth University seeks to foster and maintain a diverse campus community through inclusive excellence and equal opportunity. SEU has long preserved its legacy of providing quality education and access for underserved populations, particularly in fields and career paths traditionally beyond the reach of marginalized and often disenfranchised communities. In our traditional co-educational undergraduate enrollment today, women outnumber men two-to-one. SEU has a long legacy of educating women who thrive in STEM and healthcare professions and continues to produce diverse women and men as leaders equipped with a deeper appreciation of inclusion in its various forms. We strive to ensure that all graduates realize their potential through hard work and an exceptional education that is unimpeded by irrational self-doubt or societal biases.Essential Duties And Responsibilities  Adjunct Professor - Sport Management & Marketing Program  Teach one or more Bachelor’s level (undergraduate) courses  Course instruction to include use of online course management system (Moodle)  Courses in Sport Management & Marketing may include Sport Sales & Promotion and Sport Event Planning & Facilities Management 
Qualifications  Master's Degree in Sport Management.  Excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills.  Previous college teaching experience preferred 
EEO/AA StatementSaint Elizabeth University aspires to create a community based on the collaboration, innovation, creativity and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas - an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspective, backgrounds and experiences flourish. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all individuals feel and experience an environment where they are welcome, safe, secure, and heard. As such All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law. Any information provided will be used only in the compliance of data for EEO/Affirmative Action reporting. Completion of this data is voluntary and will not affect your opportunity for employment and/or terms or conditions of employment.
Skills: Athletics, Coaching, Fitness, Interpersonal Skills, Moodle, Sports, Sports Coaching, Sports Management, Teaching

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Houston, TX

Our company’s success has come from the hard work and effort put in by our team. Our team is service focused, continuously making self-improvements, seeing obstacles as opportunities to innovate, and all about making things happen for the team. We are currently seeking a Marketing Coordinator who is passionate about collaborating with others, and confident they can accomplish anything. This is a potential growth position for the right driven person. We are a blank slate; we are looking for someone to come in and help us paint a beautiful picture. Analyze and improve Web Site SEO process for optimum efficiency, search results, and capacity. Provide sales staff with campaign objectives, timelines, and deliverables, as well as directions for use or promotion. Manage partnerships with external vendors to ensure high-quality and timely marketing campaign implementation, as well as to maintain competitiveness. Oversee logistics, manage registrations, communicate with vendors, create itineraries, and order marketing collateral independently for marketing and community events. 
Key Responsibilities: Prepare reports by gathering, evaluating, and summarizing data to understand market trends, customer behavior, and the competitive environmentBy gathering and analyzing sales predictions, creating objectives, planning and organizing promotional presentations, and updating calendars, assist the Sales and Marketing Manager in reviewing and establishing the market plan and strategy. Provide sales staff with campaign objectives, timelines, and deliverables, as well as directions for use or promotionProduce drone coverage for marketing advantagesDesign Videos for web siteDesign Animated sales tools for web site, social media etc. Produce training videos and plant process videosProduce Customer Referrals using videos and other meansCreate Marketing Presentations and AdvertisementsCreating social media content & company blog postsAdditional tasks as needed to assist with marketing efforts
Requirements: 1-3 years of marketing experienceStrong organizational and project management skills, as well as meticulous attention to detail, are required. A bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, communications, or a closely related subject is required. Outstanding copywriting and proofreading skills, as well as excellent written and vocal communication skillsStrong understanding of different marketing platforms, channels, and best practices, such as social, digital, and email marketingMust be a self-starter who can move projects forward on their own, prioritize activities, and meet deadlines. To analyze analytics and develop reports, you’ll need excellent analytical skills. A high amount of imagination is required. Some travel will be required. 
Core values: Responsiveness: Our people are always trying to make our customers’ lives easier. We communicate and respond quickly to both our external and internal customers. Teamwork: We know that a good team is always better than any individual. We hold each other accountable, and we expect others to hold us accountable. Open and honest communication is key. Self-Motivated: Our people are self-motivated. They are not satisfied with the status quo and don’t need other people to push them. They give a 100% effort because they are proud of their work, not because their boss tells them to. “Get It Done” Attitude: We have a “Get It Done” attitude. We don’t use obstacles or setbacks as an excuse. We always take responsibility and get the job done…no matter what. Problem Solvers: We’re always thinking outside the box and love dealing with new and challenging situations. “I can’t figure it out” isn’t said around here.
Skills: Advertising, Attention to Detail, Copywriting, Itineraries, Market Analysis, Marketing Campaigns, Marketing Presentations, Proofreading, Social Media Content Creation, Training Videos

Title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator
JobDescription: In-person roleReports to the Director of Development and CommunicationsOur client is a dynamic and growing organization looking for a Marketing and Communications Coordinator. They are a college preparatory school that helps children from low-income families. Through their programs, they help develop transformative leaders who will not only succeed in college but also make a difference in the world. If you would like to make a difference in the community and in the lives of children, this job is for you. They offer an excellent benefits package.Job SummaryThe Marketing and Communications Coordinator is responsible for the coordination and implementation of communications efforts across a broad spectrum of workflows and platforms. S/he will be responsible for supporting the Admissions, College Counseling, Academics, Student Life, Athletics and Alumni Relations teams’ marketing and communications strategies and needs. The Marketing and Communications Coordinator is responsible for developing and executing integrated communications and marketing strategies involving content design and creation, social media, email marketing, website and other digital presence, photography and video, traditional media pitching and more.Primary Duties and Responsibilities include:Communications and Marketing• Work closely with the Director of Recruitment and Enrollment and the admissions department to create and execute a strong marketing plan for recruitment and enrollment. • Assist the Academic, Student Life, Athletics, Alumni Relations and College Counseling teams to support their marketing/communications needs. This includes designing print and digital materials, social media content creation and posting, and coming up with creative ways to share news internally and externally.• Monitoring and developing a consistent brand identity and guidelines for all visuals.• Write/edit/pitch press releases and manage relationships with media outlets as it relates to athletics, college counseling, and academics. This includes creating school fact sheets, promoting opportunities and sporting events..• Support the school’s online website content as it relates to service lines and ensure that new information is posted regularly.• Attend Takes photographs/video at events for marketing and communication materials as it coordinates with service lines.

Title: Entry Level Marketing
JobDescription:
ROLA Marketing is a marketing and sales firm based in San Diego. We are composed of highly professional and hardworking individuals. We are seeking an individual to join our team to acquire skills on the job and apply your learning knowledge to the role. We are looking to hire immediately for this on-site role. Title: Junior Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
ROLA Marketing is a local sales firm headquartered in San Diego. We are looking to hire immediately for this on-site role. As a Junior Marketing Assistant, you will be a key point of contact for our clients and their customers. With recent demand from our clients, we are looking to fully cross train the right individual for a managerial role.Responsibilities: Open communication with clients and customers in a retail settingAttendance to company meetings, in person and virtuallyImplementing marketing strategies to drive sales leadsBeing knowledgeable on all client products and servicesProvide sales assistance and generate leadsProvide brand promotion and awareness for our clients

Title: Marketing & Paid Media Coordinator
JobDescription:
OverviewHere at Discount Tire, we celebrate the spirit of our people with extraordinary pride and enthusiasm. Our business has been growing for more than 60 years and now is the best time in our history to join us. We are opening more locations every year and we are always looking for qualified individuals to join us in our growth. We are a company that promotes from within, both in our retail and corporate operations.Under direct supervision, the Marketing & Paid Media Coordinator provides support to the financial operations and activities within the Paid Media department. This role involves assisting with budget management, invoice processing, and administrative tasks and works closely and collaborates with the Paid Media team and other stakeholders to ensure accurate and efficient financial processes within the Paid Media department.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Facilitates and handles paid media invoicing - receives invoices; uploads into media buying software; ensures all invoices are received; troubleshoots missing invoices; audits invoices; and submits invoices for payment.Assist in managing and tracking media budgets.Support the financial analysis of media campaigns, providing insights on performance metrics, costs, and return on investment (ROI).Collaborate with media planners and buyers to gather financial data and provide support in preparing media plans and campaigns.Maintains media buy comparison reports.Assist in the preparation of financial reports and presentations for internal stakeholders.Maintain accurate financial records and documentation for media-related transactions.Assist with the coordination and management of media vendor contracts, including negotiating financial terms and tracking contractual obligations.Provide administrative support to the media finance team, such as scheduling meetings, organizing documents, and maintaining files.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth financial processes and effective communication.Answers and screens incoming calls, emails and mail from advertising sales representatives.Support the management of the show-car program, including but not limited to planning, logistics and scheduling. Establishes positive interactions with media representatives; serves as the first point of contactCoordinates order approval process with outside vendors and media buyersAttend internal meetings and communicates pertinent information and details to the paid media team. Stays current on the latest industry technologies, trends and strategiesCompletes work in a timely and accurate manner while providing exceptional customer serviceOther duties as assigned
Qualifications: Some experience in a financial or accounting role, preferably within a media or advertising environment, is desirable.Familiarity with media planning, buying, and campaign performance metrics is a plus.Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and financial calculations.Effective organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.Good analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a logical and methodical approach to financial tasks.Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with cross functional teams, partners, sponsors, and vendors is required.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and establish positive working relationships with stakeholders.The ability to work efficiently and accurately under pressure, meet deadlines, present a professional demeanor and work well independently is essential.Customer service skills including the ability to manage and respond to different customer situations while maintaining a positive and friendly attitude is essential.In addition, organizational and problem-solving skills, a can-do attitude, and the ability to adjust to changing requirements are essential.Maintaining confidentiality, treating others with respect and upholding Company values are key attributes.Strong integrity and commitment to maintaining the confidentiality of financial information.Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and financial tools.
Education Requirements: This position requires a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Business, or a related field.Discount Tire provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Junior Marketing Consultant / Entry Level Marketing
JobDescription: With years of experience in the communication field, Prompt Innovations has created relationship-based methods focused on our innovative marketing outreach techniques. There is no secret to our success. We simply build genuine, respectful, and transparent relationships with our clients and exceed their expectations. Our mission is to teach all our Junior Marketing Consultants practical communication skills to create a more authentic consumer experience, resulting in an increased brand reputation for our expanding clientele.Our company was built on the philosophy of leading by example, encouraging competition, and maintaining a respectful work environment. As a Junior Marketing Consultant, you will communicate with top sales and marketing executives to take our client's brands to new heights.
