Title: Marketing, Event & Community Coordinator
JobDescription:
Our goal is to be the best retailer in USA in the eyes of our customers, associates, and business partners.  We would love to have you join the Scheels team! OverviewThe Event and Community Coordinator will act as the lead liaison between Scheels and our customers, vendors and the community by providing superior service in all relations affiliated. The associate will professionally represent Scheels by working with an Assistant Store Leader and the Store Leader to create event and outreach strategies that align with the store goals.What It Takes To Be a Scheels Expert Customer Service   Genuinely and consistently treat co-workers, customers and business partners like they are the most important person including eye contact, a smile and a genuine “Thank you” 
 Culture   Approach daily tasks, projects and follow-up communication with energy and sense of urgency  Cultivate a deep desire to become a knowledge expert in their role with the ability to apply their knowledge and experience with great impact  Show respect and appreciation for others and Scheels  Arrive to work and meetings 10 minutes early 
Team Mentality  Genuine interest and action in helping others before yourself, regardless of recognition or reward 
 Teach-ability   Consistent eagerness to listen, learn, apply knowledge and accept critical feedback  Ability to adapt to a changing work environment  Ability to apply concepts of basic math, grammar, punctuation and spelling 
 Dress Code   Meets Scheels dress and grooming expectations in support of professional, clean and welcoming environment for customers, co-workers and business partners 
 Efficiency   Demonstrate pride and ownership of their work while meeting expected deadlines 
The Essentials   Create an annual strategy of events that promote and align with the store’s goals and creates customer and store interaction  Execute first class events to drive sales, traffic, and community good-will 
 Coordinates schedules, organize materials, review transportation itineraries and book venues and services  Determine and direct events, including:  Budget  Advertising  Staff needs 
 Coordinates registration and payment procedures, promotional advertising and mailings and corporate sponsorship activities  Provide project status updates to store leader and leadership team  Manage public relations between Scheels and our customers, sponsors and within our community Manage, Communicate, and Execute community outreach and donations per Scheels guidelines Understand the SCHEELS brand and event marketing strategies  Welcome, greet and address customers in friendly and courteous manner while providing prompt and outstanding services  Exercise judgment and tact and be able to effectively work with all levels within the organization while working on projects  Demonstrate strong oral/written communication skills, organization, attention to detail, problem solving and presentation skills, to communicate effectively  Leadership and management experience along with a strong knowledge of Scheels’ polices and applicable laws  Be professional in appearance and attitude, contribute to a positive team atmosphere and treat others with respect and consideration while following Scheels’ policies and procedures  Ability to work assigned schedule which may include varied hours, evenings, weekends, and holidays.  Some travel, including overnight stays  Must possess a valid driver’s license 
Expert ExperienceIdeal candidate will have a High School diploma, or General Education Degree (GED), one to two years of experience in marketing with demonstrated successes; or equivalent combination of education and experience.ScheduleMust be flexible to work assigned schedule between 8 am and 9 pm, Monday through Saturday; 10 am and 6 pm Sunday. Schedule may include varied hours, evenings, weekends and holidays; must be available minimum of 2 weekends a month. Average hours per week are 40 hours.Assigned schedule is typically between 8a.m. and 5p.m., Monday through Friday with event weekends as needed.BenefitsScheels offers a complete benefits package to include:  Employee Stock Ownership Program  Associate Discount  Health & Dental Insurance  Short Term & Long Term Disability Insurance  All State Accident Insurance  Employee Assistance Program  Paid Time Off  Holiday Pay  401(K)/Roth(K)  Maternity/Paternity Leave  Life Insurance  Vision Insurance  Bereavement 
 Equal Employment Opportunity Scheels is an equal employment opportunity employer providing equal employment opportunities to individuals regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Scheels will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals when appropriate.

Title: Direct Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
DescriptionReports To: Director of Direct MarketingDepartment: Direct MarketingWork Location: Hybrid (WFH & DC Headquarters)Job Type: Full-Time / Salary ExemptSupervisory Responsibilities: NoPosition Summary: We are seeking a creative, talented, and self-motivated individual interested in advancing the DCCC’s mission and helping to maximize its capacity to fundraise through direct mail, telemarketing, and SMS communications for the 2024 cycle. This individual will assist in the day-to-day operations of the direct marketing and grassroots fundraising department. The ideal candidate will have an interest in growing as a fundraiser, be detail oriented, and have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects.This position is part of a collective bargaining unit.Responsibilities Include Responsible for tracking and assisting with daily direct marketing deliverables.Reviews art, copy, and costs for all fundraising material.Responds to donor inquiries via phone, email, and mail.Processes and tracks all department invoices.Keeps record of all fundraising pieces, moving deliverables, and important communications.Works with outside vendors, other DCCC departments, and external partners as needed.Provides administrative support to the Direct Marketing team including meeting coordination, note taking, and meeting follow-up.Assists with pulling lists for both online and offline fundraising as neededAssists with sorting through in house mail and upkeep of donor databaseOther duties as needed.
Requirements Commitment to the election of Democrats in the U.S. House of Representatives;Previous experience in a political, agency or non-profit setting preferred;Excellent writing and proofreading skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel;Strong time management, planning, troubleshooting, organization, and communications skills;Comfort talking to donors over the phone and email with customer service or donor outreach experience preferred;Must be detail-oriented, able to prioritize and manage multiple projects, and work both independently and with other partners in accomplishing goals;Proactively fosters an inclusive atmosphere and commitment to diversity, equity and inclusionAbility to demonstrate multicultural competence – the awareness, knowledge and skills needed to work with others who are culturally different from self in meaningful, relevant and productive waysPersonal and professional commitment to promoting and investing in cross-cultural skills and awareness related to individuals from broad backgrounds, races, ethnicities, religions, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and disability.Proven interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills with the ability to build relationships with staff at all levels 
Why You Should Work Here We recognize and reward hard workA high-quality benefit package for all eligible employees that includes:More than 25 days of paid time off (which includes federal holidays, time off around the holidays, vacation, and sick days) Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance where 100% of the monthly premium is paid for by DCCC for employees, families, and dependents/partners.Accidental Death and Dismemberment (AD&D) and Life insurance provided to all DCCC employees, paid for fully by DCCC.Up to 6% retirement employer match contribution Monthly mobile phone stipend Monthly metro benefits (for employees located in the DC region only)Gym Access (for employees located in the DC region only)Opportunity to contribute at a growing, dynamic national political committee working to sustain the Democratic congressional majority to advocate on issues America care about most. Learn, develop, and hone professional skills related to running and operating multi-dimensional political campaigns and the operating systems that support the campaigns. Experience working with the largest Democratic battlefield, containing numerous highly competitive campaigns in diverse districts across the nation.Opportunities to expand your network and engage with policy makers, political candidates, Democratic Party leaders and a diverse team of professionals and colleagues. Gain experience in cross-team interaction and exposure to other functions and departments within the DCCC. Equity and inclusion are actively integrated into decisions made at Senior Team and Department levels regarding hiring, contracting, and political strategyProfessional Development programming dedicated to personal and professional growth beyond the 2024 election cycle)
About The DCCCThe Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee (DCCC) is the official national Democratic campaign committee charged with electing Democrats to the U. S. House of Representatives. The DCCC recruits Democratic candidates and supports Democratic campaigns – both challengers and Democratic incumbent Members – with a variety of services including field operations, fundraising support, communications assistance, digital strategy, research support and management consulting. In addition, the DCCC’s Independent Expenditure supports these campaigns with television, radio, digital, and other voter contact efforts. The DCCC is supported by the contributions of individuals and organizations, along with Democratic Members, from throughout the country. We look for talented and hard-working professionals who are committed to electing Democrats and protecting the House majority.Equal Opportunity/Diversity PolicyDCCC prohibits discrimination of employment, promotion, compensation, terms, conditions, or privileges of employment on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, sex (including marital and parental status), religion, age, disability, actual or perceived gender identity or expression, weight, personal appearance, family responsibilities, genetic information, economic status, genetic information, veteran’s status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. DCCC is an equal opportunity employer and will comply with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination in employmentDCCC’s equal opportunity policy covers all programs, services, policies, and procedures of DCCC, including opportunity for employment and treatment as a DCCC employee, as well as opportunities for vendors to contract with DCCC. DCCC is committed to building a staff that reflects the diverse communities that make up our country and the Democratic Party. Working towards the goal of a diverse DCCC, our policy extends to both staff and vendors.Diversity Mission StatementThe diversity mission of DCCC is for DCCC to reflect the diversity of the country, which strengthens the core mission of electing House Democrats. To that end, DCCC strives to create an inclusive environment that cultivates and supports diversity at every organizational level, including its staff, candidates, and contractors.

Title: Marketing Liaison
JobDescription:
Position SummaryThe purpose of this position is to act as a representative between the Company and referral sources, promoting effective communication and program adaptation to meet the needs of the community. The Marketing Liaison educates referral sources and the community about the Company and its services. This position functions as the Company's representative for community events, health fairs and recruitment activities.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: To perform this job, an individual must perform each essential function satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation.  Responsible for a designated geographical territory and maintaining accounts within that territory Achievement of an established individual monthly sales quota for which all Marketing Liaisons will be held responsible Work closely with Company staff to help coordinate needed services for clients Attract and maintain business relationships in the health care industry Coordinate and participate in community events, i.e. recruitment functions, career days, etc. when needed Establish and maintain positive relationships with referral sources Work closely with assigned offices to achieve proposed company census and revenue objectives Visit and establish effective rapport with physicians, office staff, discharge planners and other referral sources Participate in external marketing including building relationships with referral sources Support marketing functions sponsored by the communities to engage in community networking, conducting physician visits and meeting with discharge planners Complete an on-site visit to the referring facility to review the physician orders, assess the patient's clinical needs and obtain clinical information once the referral is obtained as requested Maintain monthly budget for assigned service area Attend required meetings and in-services as requested Abide by all policies and procedures set forth by state and federal regulations Abide by all policies and procedures set forth by the Company Ensure protection of confidential information that is stored, handled, or maintained by following Company policies and procedures related to confidentiality and/or HIPAA regulations Other duties as assigned
Required Skills  Superior customer/sales service and knowledge Strong communication skills both written and verbal which includes active listening Works requires advance knowledge of the homecare industry, and other State/Federal regulatory changes
Required Work Experience  Minimum of one (1) year in Sales and Marketing preferably in healthcare
Licensing/Certification/Education Requirements  High School graduate Associate degree in Business or Health related field required; bachelor’s degree preferred
Other Requirements  Position may require unscheduled overtime, week-end work Must be willing and able to work flexible hours Travel required Must have reliable transportation Current State Drivers’ License Current Auto Liability Insurance according to Company Policy
Required Computer Software/Equipment Used  Advanced Microsoft Suite skills Demonstrate proficiency with EMR Software Applications Demonstrate knowledge and ability to use multiple computer programs Demonstrate proficiency with HRIS System Standard Office Equipment Computer
Physical Requirements  Frequent lifting of objects up to 30 pounds Subject to standing, walking, sitting, bending, reaching, kneeling, pushing and pulling Work is typically performed in a standard office environment The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Required Safety Expectations  Working safely and follow safety rules Report unsafe working conditions and behaviors Take reasonable and prudent actions to prevent others from engaging in unsafe practices
Supervisory Responsibilities  Does not have direct supervisory responsibilities Occasionally needs manager’s direction due to extraordinary circumstances
CompetenciesAnalytical Thinking: Able to gather and analyze data and reach appropriate conclusion; Solves problems in a timely manner.Customer Service: Possesses good interpersonal skills while dealing with emotional or difficult situations; Responds promptly to customer’s needs.Accountability: Accepts responsibility for own decisions, actions and results; Able to maintain dependable behavior in times of crisis or complexity.Attendance: Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered; Arrives at meetings on time. Returns from lunch and breaks appropriately.Communication: Speaks and writes clearly and persuasively; Listens and gets clarification.Ethical Behavior: Upholds organizational values and abides by state and federal regulations; Maintains confidentiality of HIPAA information; Treats others with respect.Initiative: Seeks increased responsibility; sets self-improvement goals linked to the organizational goals.Job and Industry Knowledge: Demonstrates knowledge of the position and industry; Seeks additional information.Productivity and Quality of Work: Maintains high level of performance while demonstrating commitment to accuracy and thoroughness.Teamwork: Displays ease working with others; Contributes ideas and skills to team; Puts success of team above own interests.I have reviewed and discussed the job description and I understand my job duties and responsibilities prior to signing this form. I certify that I can perform the essential functions and attest that I have the qualifications as outlined.I further understand that future performance evaluations and merit increases to my pay are based on my ability to perform the duties and responsibilities outlined in the job description to the satisfaction of my immediate supervisor. I also have been explained my position on the company organizational chart and know who my immediate supervisor is.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of incumbents of this position.

Representatives meet with new and existing customers on behalf of our client to build and maintain relationships and increase sales. Title: Marketing Manager (Pharmceutical)
JobDescription:
Position SummaryThe individual in this position is responsible for the strategic and tactical planning, organization, implementation and management of marketing activities to the Pharmaceutical Marketplace and in addition will provide leadership to increase all of product line(s) market share in THE COMPANY's territory. This individual must be able to discern US market trends and guide THE COMPANY in this direction. Incumbent will be a team player with energy to lead the tactical marketing efforts of THE COMPANY by building strong relationships and cooperation with other departments within THE COMPANY (USA), other subsidiaries, 3 rd party partners, collaborators and especially the field Sales team. There will be some corporate selling involved, which includes but is not limited to, travel with the general sales force. There may be other related duties the company from time to time.The position is to provide leadership and direction to strategic and tactical marketing of THE COMPANY. This person becomes part of the Senior Level Marketing Team and work together to increase the overall business of THE COMPANY. The candidate will evaluate and determine future market and technological trends to increase the company products market share. The Marketing Manager will coordinate with other departments and outside parties to ensure organized marketing activities utilizing all resources to produce business growth. Sales and Marketing Alignment is a major initiative.This document attempts to communicate the traditional, physical and environment demands associated with this position. The company will consider reasonable accommodation including changing the way the job is traditionally performed whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity.Job Functions Include, But Are Not Limited To  Develop short and long term marketing strategy for each Product line for the company Market in THE COMPANY's territory. (Monthly) Together with executive management, set targeted number of athe company products to be synchronized with sales revenue target for each half of a fiscal year. (Semi Annually) Monitor and implement mid. and short term strategies and tactics to attain the targeted number of the sales forecast. (Weekly) Create marketing plan and budget together with the other Marketing Managers and product managers to implement and developed long and mid. term strategies. (Quarterly) Manage various marketing campaigns aimed toward customers in the athe company market segment. This includes but not limited to email campaigns, lead nurturing campaigns, customer retention campaigns etc.. The use of CRM and Marketing Automation software as tools will be implemented.(Daily) To obtain and report metrics around various marketing campaigns. To inquire and determine why we are winning and losing sales opportunities. To evaluate new products for market fit and develop strategy to introduce them. This will be divided into projects to be performed locally within the USA and to be performed globally. (Monthly) To be an expert in understanding of market wants, needs and desires applicable to current and future trends within the industry and to communicate those needs to Corporate Headquarters. The use of various survey tools, customer observations and trade reports should be implemented. (Daily) Visit regional offices or distributors to evaluate their performance and to find what countermeasure is required to improve their performance of sales. (Quarterly) To contribute to exhibitions with tactics aimed toward the company market segment and in some cases to act as the lead Marketing Manager coordinating activities for the exhibition. This requires working with all the product managers and sales. (Monthly) To analyze THE COMPANY's performance and competition, to analysis the business environment, to identify new market entrants for determining the effects on long-term strategy. (Monthly) To advise regarding market trend, competitive situation and marketing and support issues which will contribute to the company. (Monthly)  Coordinate relationship with other companies to improve THE COMPANY's business situation by global approach. (Quarterly)  The company in developing and maintaining relationship with third party partners and collaborators to improve at company Markets business. (Monthly)  Plan, coordinate and present technical marketing presentations at conferences, trade shows and at selected corporate, government and academic institutions. (Weekly)  Foster and track Collaborations with Key Opinion Leaders as it relates to a tactical business plan. (Weekly)  Work closely with Marketing Communications Department to plan, implement, and maintain a regular productions schedule of printed application notes, newsletter articles and other related technical marketing documents. (Daily)  Create and implement training programs aimed towards increasing our sales and technical staff in understanding the company market space. Alignment between sales and marketing requires that we deliver the same message to our customers. (Monthly) 
  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:Incumbent must have a Bachelor's degree in Science or business, while an advanced degree is highly preferred. Position requires at least eight (8) years prior successful history in management of sales and/or product marketing in analytical instrument business. Attention to detail and strong customer service skills are required along with a dependable work ethic.Supervisory ResponsibilitiesAlthough this position has no direct reports it is expected that they are a role model of upper management. That is this person should garner the respect of all employees and external contacts. Personal integrity, work ethic and motivational energy are characteristics of the type of leader we expect. This is a senior level position and lack of personnel to manage is a reflection of the freedom this position requires to act freely without the additional burned to manage. Resource groups are available to be consulted as needed including Marketing Communications, Documentation, R&D, Safety and Training, and Business development. KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS: CASUAL WORKING THOROUGH Japanese CultureForeign Language Chemistry/PhysicsNegotiationsWriting SkillsProductsOrganizationAdministrative Procedures Market KnowledgeLeadership SkillsOrganizational SkillsSales SkillsMicrosoft Dynamics CRMComputers/SoftwareProduct KnowledgeProduct ManagementApplications

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Description Location:  Depending on location and proximity to a pulse point (Elevance Health Major Office), will determine hybrid schedule with the highest in-office commitment being 4-10 days in an office per month.The  Product Marketing Manager  is responsible for developing business marketing strategies and ensuring alignment of marketing plans to business unit goals. This role will be part of the Carelon Insights product marketing team and will work closely with the Carelon Subrogation business and sales leaders.How You Will Make An ImpactPrimary duties may include, but are not limited to:  Builds strategic market product / marketing plans.  Serves as a single point of contact on marketing issues and resolution. Coordinates the development and review of communication materials with appropriate resources.  Leads development of marketing collateral to support marketing plans. Coordinates with business, sales, and other leaders to support plan creation.  Provides leadership and direction to marketing support and creative staff. 
Minimum Qualifications  Requires a BA/BS degree and a minimum of 5 years of related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. 
Preferred Skills, Capabilities, And Experiences  Managed care experience preferred.  Associates in this role are expected to have strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills, problem-solving skills, facilitation skills, and analytical skills.  Associates in this lead product marketing role are expected to: develop in-depth knowledge of assigned product(s), market and client needs, and competitive offerings; develop key messaging articulating product value propositions and key differentiators; and collaborate with clinical, product and sales leaders to execute marketing and thought leadership campaigns aimed at driving product sales. 
Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.Be part of an Extraordinary TeamElevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

Title: Email Marketing System Administrator- Part-Time
JobDescription:
Email Marketing System Admin-Part TimeAbout This RoleRemote, Temporary W2 role with a 6-month term. 10-15 hours per weekAs our Email System Administrator, you will serve on our Marketing team and will guide people on an educational journey through email. You will work closely with both the Marketing and Tech Ops teams to optimize email systems toward personalization. This includes working cross-functionally to ensure our email system takes full advantage of the rich data provided by our CMS, Salesforce. By doing this, you facilitate the email experience for more than half a million subscribers.In all your work, you will bring your skills and experience to help further our mission of helping people experience the Bible as a unified story that leads to Jesus.What You’ll Be Doing Own the creation and maintenance of existing dynamic lists and automations in our email instance, including adding, editing, and troubleshooting automations. Oversee the architecture of BibleProject’s email service provider (Pardot), including maintenance and improvement of the existing system.Serve as a key consultant for email strategy, including a close eye on email industry trends and an understanding of how individual email initiatives work toward user journeys.Act as the key email ambassador between the marketing team and IT, developing key conversations around how email best works with Salesforce. Help our team understand and navigate the integration between Pardot and Salesforce, including the coordination of work with external contractors toward the rollout of integrated campaigns between the two platforms.Evaluate, plan, and execute the successful transfer of BibleProject’s email system from Pardot to another third-party service, including the re-creation of existing dynamic lists, automations, and form handlers.
What We Are Looking For Proficient skills or experience working with a mass email marketing system, preferably Pardot. Proficient skills or experience using Salesforce, specifically the reporting feature to make the most of our email instance.Hands-on experience in troubleshooting and problem managementExcellent time management skills with experience working remotely
About BibleProjectPortland, Oregon, Founded in 2014BibleProject is a nonprofit, crowdfunded organization that produces 100% free Bible videos, podcasts, blogs, classes, and educational Bible resources. Our mission is to help people experience the Bible as a unified story that leads to Jesus.We are rapidly growing in the area of multimedia technology. What began with two animated videos now encompasses multiple platforms and products—including over 160 videos. Our website and app serve as connection hubs to our ever-growing library of resources. Classroom, our online learning platform, offers accessible, graduate-level Bible classes.These, and all of our supporting products, continue to be completely free to audiences around the world, thanks to the ongoing generosity of our patrons.Location: This role must be performed within the United States. Occasional travel to Portland, Oregon may be required.Beginning: August 2023Reporting to: Camden McAfee, Director of MarketingCompensation The hourly range for this role is $25-$35 based on relevant experience.  Competitive wage that scales with experience directly related to this role. Top tier in the non-profit market but will not match top Marketing companies.

BibleProject is an equal-opportunity employer

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
The primary focus of this position is to organize and execute the firm’s marketing strategy in support of the firm’s business development efforts. This role will focus on achieving the firm’s overall marketing objectives through direct support of the firm’s practice groups and attorneys. The Marketing Coordinator will help maintain and manage the firm’s brand, organize and execute client and firm events, maintain client contact information, and oversee vendors. Other daily tasks in addition to the main responsibilities below may be assigned as needed. The Marketing Coordinator is a member of the Marketing Committee and will report to the Executive Director.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Collaborate with firm management, Marketing Committee members, and attorneys to implement and execute the firm’s marketing strategy Review marketing updates, produce, and manage posts on the firm’s LinkedIn page Organize and assist with firm’s business development events or client events Support the firm’s efforts with alliance partners and other professional associations Create and manage databases of firm contacts, resources, and events Manage sponsorship requests, civic engagement, and related programs Coordinate client gifts & referrals Maintain firm website, including biographies and updates Track and report key metrics to management Manage vendor projects, invoices, and budget reporting
Requirements Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of two years of relevant experience in a law firm. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered.Strong software skills, including strong knowledge of Microsoft Office. Experience with Canva, LinkedIn. Asana, and Adobe is a plusExcellent writing and proofing skillsAbility to organize projects and execute in a timely fashionDetail-oriented and self-starterAbility to communicate with all levels of an organization
We offer a positive work environment with long-term employees who work well together and great benefits (including paid vacation and holidays, 401(k) and profit-sharing program, health/vision/dental insurance, and parking). The normal business hours are 8:30 to 5:30, Monday through Friday but may occasionally require more than 40 hours per week to perform the essential duties of the position.

Title: Product Marketing Manager (FT)
JobDescription:
We are seeking a talented and experienced Product Marketing Manager in the Education Technology (EdTech) Sector to join our dynamic marketing team. The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing effective marketing strategies to drive the success of our products. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with success in previous companies bringing a product line to market, a strong communicator, and a deep understanding of the product lifecycle. They will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, and marketing, to ensure our products' successful launch, promotion, and ongoing growth. This role requires reporting to our office in Los Alamitos, CA.Responsibilities Develop comprehensive product marketing strategies and plans to drive awareness, adoption, and revenue growth for our products.Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape to inform product positioning and messaging.Collaborate with the product management team to understand product features, benefits, and differentiation, and translate them into compelling value propositions for target audiences.Create and manage product launch plans, including the development of marketing collateral, sales enablement materials, and training programs to support successful product introductions.Collaborate with the marketing communications team to develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns across various channels (e.g., digital, social media, events, PR) to generate product awareness and demand.Develop and deliver product training and sales enablement materials to educate the sales team on product features, benefits, and competitive positioning.Monitor and analyze market trends, customer feedback, and competitive activity to identify opportunities for product enhancements or new product development.Conduct regular market and competitive analysis to assess market trends, pricing, and positioning, and provide recommendations for adjustments to maximize product performance.Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather customer insights, conduct user research, and leverage data to drive continuous improvement of product offerings.Collaborate with customer success teams to develop customer testimonials, case studies, and success stories that highlight the value and impact of our products.Support sales teams in key customer meetings, presentations, and trade shows as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio.
Requirements Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field.Proven experience in product marketing, preferably in the technology/software industry.Strong understanding of product management principles and the product lifecycle.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create compelling messaging and marketing materials.Demonstrated experience in developing and executing successful product marketing strategies and campaigns.Strong analytical skills with the ability to gather and interpret market research and data to drive strategic decision-making.Experience working cross-functionally with product management, sales, and marketing teams.Self-motivated and results-oriented, able to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Strong presentation and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to diverse audiences.Proficiency in market research and competitive analysis tools.Knowledge of digital marketing, social media, and content marketing strategies.Experience with Salesforce and marketing automation tools is a plus.
Base Salary Range: $100,000 - $150,000.Benefits PTOHealth/Dental/Vision401k and MatchHybrid Work SchedulePhone/Internet StipendMeal BenefitQuarterly Company Outings
We would love to hear from you if you are a creative and strategic thinker passionate about driving product success through effective marketing strategies. Join our team and play a key role in shaping the future of our products and delighting our customers. Apply today with your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this position.

Title: Email Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Reports to: CRM ManagerLocation: Delray Beach, FL HeadquartersCompany OverviewNow Optics is a leader in the eye care industry. Its retail brands, My Eyelab and Stanton Optical, are amongst the fastest-growing, full-service retail optical centers throughout the country. The company consistently ranks among the largest optical retailers in the country by Vision Monday. Now Optics continues to expand its retail footprint with 230+ corporate and franchise locations while delivering affordable eye care services and providing a fast and friendly customer experience. We believe in building a positive and cohesive culture where everyone is contributing towards a common goal and set of values.Vision: Modernizing the eye care experience for all people.Mission: Making eye care easy.Values: iCAREIntegrity: We see integrity as building a foundation of trust with our customers, employees and stakeholders by communicating honestly, ensuring consistency and delivering on our commitments.Collaboration: We see collaboration as combining the talents of a diverse group, offering proactive communication and being open-minded to new ideas.Accountability: We see accountability as taking initiative, delivering our best in all we do, accepting responsibility for our actions and taking ownership of results.Respect: We see respect as prioritizing human relationships, being present, connecting with transparency and empathy.Empowerment: We see empowerment as making purpose-driven decisions to support the company vision, showing appreciation for others, and taking care of the individuals we serve.Job Description And ProfileThe Email Marketing Specialist is passionate about building customer loyalty and retention through thoughtful 1:1 customer communication to increase engagement with our brands and reinforce our brand identity. The role is responsible for day-to-day email and sms implementation, understanding our customer database, developing and managing our Marketing Content Calendar, and creating customer journeys and segmentation strategies that drive customer lifetime value for all brands. The Email Marketing Specialist is analytical and comfortable working with IT, Digital, Operations and Creative to implement all email/sms campaigns, including automation, drip flow, reporting and proactively setting up A/B testing and applying learnings to future campaigns. Requires cross-functional collaboration and platform management. The role is a great opportunity to own a powerful tactic and see immediate results that contributes to the business in so many ways.Duties & Responsibilities Strategy: Leverages customer behavior, analytics and macro events to define customer segmentation and lifecycle opportunities across multiple touchpoints to optimize customer engagement, retention and lifetime value. Messaging: Writes creative briefs for the development of meaningful creative and messaging that drives action and reinforces our brand identity. Creates and manages the Marketing Content Calendar used across multiple touchpoints. Offer Strategy: Creates motivating and competitive offers based on contact strategy and touchpoint, works with cross functional teams for alignment, approval and implementation. Collaboration: Develops and executes email campaigns that can extend to other CRM touchpoints and landing experiences. Identifies new CRM opportunities and ways to engage new customers and win back lapsed customers. Email Acquisition: Assess email file and sources of growth to enhance capture rate and data integrity. Manage email opt-in/opt-out language and preferences. Works closely with Retail Ops. Project Management: Manages email implementation and coordinates with stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure data-driven marketing goals. Manages work flow and analyzes new vendors and marketing technologies that would help build needed capabilities and future roadmap. Test & Measure: A/B tests creative formats and offers for optimal performance and customer engagement by brand and customer type. Tracks and monitors results, continuously optimizing the strategy. Creates hold out groups to determine incrementality. Results: Develops and owns the email marketing dashboard. Monitors and analyzes performance to improve file growth, ROI, conversion rates, open rates, and customer KPIs. Develops needed executive level view of results and socializes performance of programs and adhoc requests. Leverages learnings to continue to evolve and optimize targeting and cross-sell/up-sell opportunities. Monitor the competitive landscape. Systems: Comfortable implementing email platforms and/or CRM infrastructure (systems, communications) with the intent of automating and personalizing campaigns and enhancing the customer database with preferences and data centralization. Works closely with IT & Ecomm. Growth: Supports the overall marketing team with special projects and testing efforts. 
Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree required 3+ years of experience driving email marketing strategy Experience building 1:1 customer communication & writing creative briefs Experience in multi-channel retail industry a plus Strong understanding of creative briefs and experience collaborating with the Creative Teams 
Skills & Requirements Excellent written and verbal communication skills Working understanding of email platforms is a plus Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills Demonstrated leadership, project management, & planning skills Ability to collaborate on projects cross-functionally Works well independently, is resourceful, and eager to learn Advance English Level is required 
Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time as needed.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Pay starts at $20 - $21/hour, with the opportunity to earn more based on experienceAt Country Meadows our Marketing Coordinator’s primary job duty is to successfully coordinate the marketing office and select marketing functions. The Marketing Coordinator supports marketers, family members, residents and prospective residents with assistance as needed with various tasks relating to marketing, transfers, admission and or discharge. Part-time 24 hours/week - position requires some flexibility to meet the needs of residents that may include an occasional weekend*
We’re Proud to Offer our Coworkers: Above standard industry wages, with the opportunity to earn more based on experiencePayActiv On-Demand Pay – Work today, get paid tomorrowPerformance-based bonuses for attendance, feedback, and more through our “Engage” coworker centered bonus programCareer Path growth opportunities – learn and earn additional bonuses from $750 - $2,000 (position specific)Double time holiday pay (including YOUR birthday)Generous paid time off with PTO rollover – unused days carry over to the next yearHighmark Blue Shield Healthcare Benefits, Highmark Vision and United Concordia Dental401 (k) with company matchEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Wellness reimbursement incentives
Ask your Employment Specialist during your interview for details on any of our coworker centered benefits and incentives.Marketing Coordinator Responsibilities: Assist the Marketing Directors with move in paper work and information needed for the resident files.Assist the Marketing Directors with recording information throughout each month to aid in the completion of the monthly marketing report.Assist with planning and executing special events.Typing and proofreading letters and email to families, prospects, doctors and other key referral sources.Input data on each new sale in the computer/CRM.Responsible for ordering office supplies and keeping the office organized.Updating and maintaining waiting list, resident information books and campus information books.Prepare packets of information for prospective residents and new residents.Copy, fax and mail as needed to residents, families, doctors, department heads, and home office.
Marketing Coordinator Requirements: Minimum high school diploma or GED.General computer experience with Microsoft Office.Must be flexible enough to adjust to the needs of the residents.Positive and friendly attitude.Excellent telephone etiquette.Able to multi-task in a fast paced and ever changing environment.Adaptable, flexible and focused to meet the needs of prospective residents and their families.Respects older persons and enjoys interacting with seniors.
About Country Meadows:We have over 2500 co-workers who are serving our residents with meaning, thriving with purpose and leading our company with innovation! We have been serving seniors for over 35 years, and we invite you to join our vision for making lives better.EOE

Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Are you passionate about marketing, full of creative ideas, and ready to make a meaningful impact? We're looking for a talented Marketing Assistant to join our vibrant team and help us shape the future of our brand. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy collaborating with a diverse team, and have a strong desire to learn and grow, this is the perfect opportunity for you!Your Role:As a Marketing Assistant, you will play a vital role in supporting our marketing team across a wide range of activities. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills and contribute to key marketing initiatives. Here's what you can expect:  Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, email, and traditional marketing. Assist in conducting market research and analysis to identify customer trends, competitor activities, and potential growth opportunities. Assist in organizing and coordinating events, including trade shows, conferences, and product launches. Monitor and report on the performance of marketing campaigns using analytics tools. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging marketing strategies.
Qualifications:  Strong passion for marketing and a desire to build a career in the field. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Solid understanding of marketing principles and best practices. Proficient in using social media platforms and basic knowledge of content management systems. Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively within a team.
Skills: Attention to Detail, Campaigns, Communication, Content Management, Management Systems, Market Research, Marketing Campaigns, Marketing Strategy, Oral Communication, Social Media

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: The Fairytale Brownies Marketing Coordinator assists with the management of a wide variety of marketing efforts that have a budget of approximately $2.5 million. Duties: Planning and Analysis·        Assist with the development of marketing campaigns that generate the majority of company revenue through digital and print efforts.·        Prepare a wide variety of reports including digital and print campaign results, merchandise sales reports, and email campaign results.·        Assist with the preparation of the Marketing budget in collaboration with Accounting Team. Print·        Manage all catalog production schedules for approximately 1.7 million catalogs mailed annually.·        Work with outside consultant and print vendor to implement catalog circulation plans.·        Schedule and assist with the coordination of bi-annual weeklong photo shoots.·        Assist with the development of catalog pagination based on sales reports and new product intros.·        Coordinate the writing and editing of catalog copy with Marketing Team Leader.·        manage catalog source codes, maintain version spreadsheets, and coordinate specialized gift list reorder mailings.·        Collaborate with IT to implement catalog circulation plans.·        Oversee production of all print ads as well as collateral print materials for order fulfillment.·        Creates bi-annual sales reports and records results in square inch analysis.·        Assist in managing relationships with all print vendors. Merchandising·        Assist with the company’s merchandising strategy including product and price assortment, and coordination of new and discontinued products.·        Prepare post-season product sales reports.·        Assist with merchandise forecasting for the holiday and spring seasons.·        Monitor peak-season inventory to implement promotions and cross-selling as necessary.·        Maintain website “Best-Sellers” page based on current occasions and inventory planning. Digital·        Assist with the maintenance of the company’s Amazon storefront.·        Assist with the management of pay-per-click advertising and coordination with PPC consultants. Other·        Coordinate writing and editing copy for all collateral marketing materials.·        Assist the Customer Service and Corporate Sales Teams by providing marketing collateral that adheres to brand standards.·        Contribute to maintaining a safe work environment at all times.·        Contribute to the team effort by assisting in other departments as needed.·        Perform the above duties to the best of one's ability and with the utmost integrity.Requirements: ·        Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in a marketing environment.·        Minimum of 2 years’ experience in project management.·        High level of attention to detail and accuracy.·        Ability to multi-task and prioritize projects based on established deadlines.·        Proficient in Microsoft Excel with ability to manipulate, import, and analyze data.·        Proficient with Microsoft Word and Outlook. ·        Proficient with project management software such as Asana.·        Excellent written and oral communication skills.·        Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.·        Flexibility and willingness to change and adapt as the situation demands.·        Flexible to work additional hours as needed.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
The ideal candidate will be responsible for growing revenue through digital media by designing and executing marketing campaigns. After campaigns have been launched, you will extract and analyze data across multiple channels. We are looking for a Digital Marketing Specialist to participate in our client's digital advertising campaigns. Your main responsibilities include monitoring online consumer behavior and working with the team to create campaigns to increase site traffic and sales. Our ideal candidate is able to proactively research market trends and create/optimize product campaigns. We would like a creative team player with a passion for digital marketing to become a pivotal part of our marketing team.This is a part-time role only hours as needed, possibility to turn into full-time. Must be located in Northern Indiana.  Responsibilities Research advertising trends and competitors’ pricing and productsExecute projects with the team to create contentContribute to the creation of creative marketing campaigns across social media, the company website, email and other platforms.Monitor project statusAssist in analyzing marketing data (campaign results, conversion rates, traffic etc.) to help shape future marketing strategiesCreate reports on the growth and analytics of campaignsWork with outside vendors to supplement the work as needed
Qualifications Proven experience as a digital marketing specialist or similar roleThorough understanding of marketing elements (including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO/Social media etc.) and market research methodsDemonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and toolsSolid computer skills, including MS Office, marketing software (Adobe Creative Suite and CRM) and applications (Web analytics, Google Adwords etc.)Knowledge of HTML, CSS and web development tools (e.g. Dreamweaver) desiredWell-organized and detail-orientedExceptional communication and writing skillsCommercial awareness partnered with a creative mind

Title: Brand Assistant (Marketing and Public Relations)
JobDescription:
Brand Assistant (Marketing and Public Relations)Now Hiring! Full-Time Hours / Entry-Level Position / Tampa, FLWe’re growing our marketing team and are interested in meeting with people who have confident communication skills, an understanding of consumer behavior, and/or the ability to inspire and influence others. You’ll fit in great with our existing team if you also have a positive attitude, a competitive nature, and a good sense of humor! maAs a Brand Assistant, you’ll be helping a specific brand enhance its reputation, improve brand awareness, and increase market share. You’ll receive ongoing training, so no specific experience is required, but you must be open-minded, coachable, and willing to expand your comfort zone!Primary Responsibilities: Learning about a brand and its ideal target marketRetaining and recalling product/service information Setting up branded displays in retail establishmentsAttracting attention and prequalifying customers Promoting a brand with integrity and enthusiasm Consolidating sales and completing transactionsCollecting consumer feedback and statisticsWorking as a team to evaluate each retail event
In addition to ongoing training and on-site support, we also provide: A welcoming, safe, and diverse work environment Product/service knowledge and marketing materialsResources for professional and personal developmentProgression opportunities for those who produce results Introductions to industry experts and networking contactsLocal, regional, and sometimes national travel opportunitiesOne-on-one time to discuss your progress and career ambitions
Compensation: Basic wage plus commission = $700-$1,000 (paid weekly)Primary requirements: Available to interview and start within 2 weeks’ time (on-site, in Tampa, FL)At least 18 years old and eligible to work in the USA (no sponsorship options)The ability to retain and recall a reasonable amount of product/service informationThe ability to stand/be on your feet for several hours at a time when at an event
Recommendations: The ability to work well in groups while also achieving individual goals (bonus points for leadership experience/abilities!)Confident communication skills and the ability to strike up conversations (Bilingual / Multilingual people are encouraged to apply!)Experience working with customers (ie: hospitality, retail sales, customer service, fundraising, volunteering, etc)Marketing/Communications/Business degrees (you’ll have a solid foundation and may learn and progress at an above-average pace) Experience playing team sports (former athletes tend to feel right at home and perform well in our industry!) 
All relevant experience and degrees will be taken into consideration, so don’t let a lack of experience hold you back! Apply today and you could be meeting with us to discuss opportunities sooner than you think!

Title: Marketing And Public Relations Assistant
JobDescription:
Marketing and Public Relations AssistantPhiladelphia, PA 19123*Investing time for freedom, rather than exchanging it for income. Today is your opportunity to build the tomorrow you want.*We're expanding our client reach this summer with additional locations, so we're eager to meet with people who have an interest in marketing and public relations along with a positive outlook, the desire to succeed, and the ability to work well as part of a team. Marketing Public Relations Assistant Day-to-Day Duties:Your main duties will revolve around promoting our client’s products and services in a fun and enthusiastic manner. This will take place at retail shopping malls, promotional events, trade shows, and other locations with heavy foot traffic. You will also be given the opportunity to be involved with the events team where you'll participate in the organization and setting up of the events. Your main duties will include: Communicating with local consumers to determine their familiarity with the client's brand Attracting customer's attention and enticing them to learn more about the current promotionsBuilding relationships and establishing rapport with customers to create interest and trustPromoting the features and benefits of any relevant products and services Answering general customer inquiries and addressing any concerns they have Completing a small number of sales transactions when the product/service and timing are rightCollecting statistics, feedback, customer data, and other relevant information to help the client improve Working as a team to brainstorm and collaborate in an effort to improve or enhance future events
Hours, Pay, and Benefits:We're looking for people who can work full-time hours throughout the summer or ongoing. We can be somewhat flexible with timings and are able to offer short-term or long-term contracts. All of our staff receive a basic wage plus additional bonuses, incentives, and commissions related to their performance. Average weekly earnings are $800-900 but this varies based on hours worked, results, and responsibilities. Omnia believes that rewarding our staff is very important because individual results lead to our overall success. In addition to the ongoing training and support we provide, we're also known to offer our team members tickets to sporting events, concerts, and other amazing activities!Growth and Advancement:We're passionate about professional and personal growth, so we offer daily product training workshops, motivational talks, networking opportunities, regional seminars, and more. As we grow our team and client portfolio we'll be looking to promote some people from within into leadership and management positions. Basic Requirements: Candidates must be able to work in the USA and be over the age of 18 Applicants have to be able to travel to our office location in downtown Philadelphia (19123)We're looking to get people started ASAP to keep up with client demand, so please only apply of you can start within 2 week's timeNo specific work experience is required, but it is beneficial if you've worked directly with customers or in a business environment No specific degree or educational qualifications are necessary, but all related education can assist you on your path to success! 
Apply online today for consideration! Our recruiters are typically in touch with successful candidates within 1-3 working days.

Title: Marketing and Communications Associate
JobDescription:
This role is key part of the Americas Commercial team who’s responsibility is to help empower commercial success of the Vivo Ventilation, Z Series Sleep and overall Breas branding activities in the region. Responsibilities include particpiation in the development and implementation of customer facing activities in the region.The purpose of the position is to work under the direction of the Director of Marketing – Americas to initiate, execute and evaluate marketing activities in the region plus provide marketing support to the direct sales teams in the US and distributors in Canada and LATAM. The role requires close collaboration with colleagues in the Americ and Sweden and aims to deliver a high service level to customers and sales teams. Evaluate outcomes and ROI.Support and coordinate with Sweden all local website initiatives in line with marketing activities, product launches and new technology and ensure that they are secure and technically up to date.Prepare and evaluate the effect of other marketing activitiesClose collaboration with the sales, customer service, technical service, quality/regulatory affairs and finance teamsAssist in other sales or operations related projectsMaintain efficient workflow processes within the US team and manage sales collateral in an efficient wayStay up to date on rules and regulations for promotion of medical devices to various customer segments (both professionals and consumers) in the territory where Breas is active.Maintain compliance to rules and regulations for promotion of medical devices.Manages all sales and marketing collateralSupports and manages local price files and quotation calculatorsSupports and manages US Commercial Sharepoint filesMaintain a high service level towards all direct and indirect sales and marketing partnersRepresent Breas towards customers and suppliersIssue requests for proposalsMake the necessary agreements for customer activities and marketing material within agreed budgetsInitiate marketing materials and make them available to relevant partiesManages local budgets related to all marketing and communication spend for websites, tradeshows and congresses and printed marketing collateral
Qualifications / Requirements  A bachelor’s degree in marketing, Graphic design or other relevant discipline Excellent skills with graphic design software (eg Adobe InDesign) WordPress skills to execute website updates Experience from medical devices and preferably also consumer marketing Fluent in English
Characteristics  Strong customer orientation Clear thinker, able to work in structured way Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver results according to agreed timelines Strong team player Creative mindset generating ideas for marketing activities and for removing obstacles in project execution.
Location near Lansing, MI is a plus.Less than 10% travel. Office is located in Massachusetts, but residence in MA is not a requirement.

Title: Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
The Marketing Representative will create and distribute positive branding messages and collateral for the company’s products. You will help us create a strong brand presence with innovative promotional offerings, online and offline marketing campaigns, and marketing events. You will collaborate with the sales team to ensure that your marketing efforts support their sales efforts. Finally, your analytical skills will assist you as your monitor and report on the success of your marketing efforts. Responsibilities Collaborates with sales and product teams to develop branding messages.Identifies target customers and markets. Collects and compiles customer feedback in an easily reviewed and understood format for review by company management and leadership.Collects and maintains sales records required to track, review, and modify performance of marketing initiatives.Forecasts and analyzes sales trends, marketing strategies, and product performance; prepares and presents reports summarizing information; makes recommendations based on analysis.Develops and distributes materials related to sales, training, and marketing.Develops and maintains positive relationships with existing and potential clients. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent customer service skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field required. Experience using WordPress, Canva, and Adobe Creative Suite preferred.2-5 years of related experience in business, promotional sales, customer service, or related field preferred.
Skills: Analytical Skills, Communication, Customer Service, Digital Marketing, Event Marketing, Events, Marketing, Marketing Campaigns, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Written Communication

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
DescriptionRobert Half is seeking a knowledgeable and experienced Digital Marketing Specialist. The client is looking for someone who can efficiently maneuver the ins and outs of marketing strategy, analysis and campaign execution while keeping tight control of the bottom line.Essential to the job are both a customer-first mindset and experience improving online customer experiences, implementing marketing technology solutions, and following inbound marketing practices. If you're detail-oriented and have strong decision-making and interpersonal skills, we want to hear from you!In this position, you will be responsible for the strategic planning and implementation of all digital initiatives that support the sales strategy and marketing plans for our client. With support from the Marketing Manager, you will oversee the company's brand image and voice through the development of strategies and content across the digital landscape of owned sites, social media, partner platforms and paid media.What you get to do every day  Create strategies and tests to optimize spend and performance of paid digital campaigns Enhance job knowledge by taking advantage of educational opportunities and reading trade publications Collaborate with technology and creative vendor partners in order to meet expectations on budget, deadlines and brand compliance Share thought leadership and identify trends and insights with executive leadership Maintain project status and timeline for digital projects, communicating updates regularly Develop and execute digital marketing initiatives to meet objectives in customer acquisition, growth and retention, and reactivation Improve user experience by supporting updates of the online customer portal Establish and support the social media presence of the company Build content that will be engaging for the company's partners and customers Monitor digital marketing campaign performance through reports Enhance the company's website by creating landing pages, blog posts and SEO Support other project tasks related to print, direct mail and data management as needed

Title: Email Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Job Title: Email Marketing SpecialistDepartment: Consumer MarketingHours Available:M-F 8:30am-5:30pmWhy Work @ BEDGEAR?At BEDGEAR You Can Expect To Find Successful Teammates Who Exemplify Our Core Values Of BeingIf you’re looking for a career and not just a job, BEDGEAR provides a work environment that accelerates growth for all its team members. Keeping up with the everyday challenges of a fast-growing consumer goods company demands a team of all-in players, who are focused on continuous improvement, collaboration, leadership, and have a growth-mindset. If you want to elevate yourself personally and professionally, surrounding yourself with others that share the same values, beliefs, and behaviors will provide the support and extra push to reach new heights and smash new goals.HUNGRY - HUMBLE - CURIOUS - CLEVER - COMMITTED - HUMANITARIANAbout The PositionYou will develop and execute marketing strategies and campaigns across multiple channels including email, mobile push, on-device, web, and more. You will be focused on setting up the email marketing strategy, cadence, personalization and dynamic content approach, customer experience flow, A/B testing, creative development, channel delivery and campaign integration. You will also be responsible for results learning- and strategy optimization recommendations. You will have a strong foundation in CRM marketing, a customer focused approach, and most importantly, a strong can-do attitude that makes you comfortable working in an environment that is fast paced, dynamic, and encourages autonomy. Ideal candidate will possess advanced knowledge of Klaviyo, and be responsible to create, test, execute and analyze workflows, nurture customers, improve retention, increase e-commerce sales, and generate future leads.Essential Functions (include But Not Limited To) Create and manage email marketing calendarResponsible for generating strategies to increase our CRM database; enhance our email list and targeting with rich segmentation dataCreate and test audience segments, lists and workflowsAssist in growth and optimization of current email and SMS programsCollaborate with creative to develop best-in-class flows and email campaigns, inclusive of promotions, seasonal campaigns, and new product releases that are aligned with overall marketing campaign calendar Conduct market research and competitive analysis as part of campaign planning processGenerate briefs for the production of creative and copy assets for emails
Direct responsibility for execution of email operations including coding and scheduling of emailsActively conducts tests on lifecycle flows and journeys, reviews performance to identify optimizations, and iterates. Partner with cross-functional teams (merchandising, content, creative) to provide strategic recommendations from internal learnings, external best practices and data
Support B2b organization with the deployment of retail marketing emailsMonitor deliverabilityCreate and maintain reports to track campaign performanceClerical and administrative duties related to essentials functions of jobAssists with other duties and projects as requested by management
Qualifications/Requirements Must be 21 years of age or olderHS Diploma or GED and College degreeMust be legally authorized to work in the United States and have IDs needed to verifyEnglish proficient (reading, writing, speaking/listening, comprehension)Proficiency with Klaviyo; CRM knowledge and integrations with marketing automation toolsExperience with E-commerce platforms, Magento a plusComputer literacy with Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook proficiency
Education/Experience/License Requirements Bachelor's degree in marketing (or related field) preferred though relevant work experience is acceptable5+ years Digital Marketing3+ years hands on Email Marketing and AutomationKnowledge of Google AnalyticsAbility to multi-task and prioritize competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
BEDGEAR® is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that participates in the E-Verify program!About BEDGEAR® PERFORMANCE®Launched in 2009, BEDGEAR® is the brand of Performance® that provides innovative bedding by focusing on an active lifestyle and well-being. BEDGEAR’s sleep solutions are engineered with Performance fabrics that are temperature neutral and instant cooling and maximizes airflow to allow the body to naturally regulate its temperature. With a core belief of One Size Does Not Fit All™, BEDGEAR has redefined the way people view sleep by developing interactive in-store experiences and breathable bedding products that are personally fit to a consumer based on specific factors, including body type, sleep position and temperature. BEDGEAR is dedicated to integrating environmental responsibility into product development to ensure less returned goods are being sent to landfills. BEDGEAR is essential to the rest and recovery routines of professional athletes and active people who need to maximize their sleep. A proud manufacturer in the USA, BEDGEAR offers mattresses, pillows, sheets, blankets, pet beds as well as travel, kids and baby products that often feature removable and washable covers to maintain a clean and healthy sleep environment. BEDGEAR is represented in more than 4,000 retail stores across the globe and has earned more than 220 U.S. and worldwide patents, trademark registrations and pending applications. Sleep Fuels Everything®!Learn more at www.bedgear.com.

Title: Marketing Coordinator/Content Specialist
JobDescription:
Investors Heritage, headquartered in Frankfort, Kentucky is the largest national life insurance company domiciled in Kentucky. We have been nationally recognized as one of the fastest growing life insurance companies in the United States and are looking for high-quality candidates to join our team to help support this growth.The RoleWe are looking for a savvy Marketing Coordinator/Content Specialist to guide and develop the content creation process for our brand. To ensure success as a content specialist, you should show a keen eye for detail and be highly creative. Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
DIGITAL MARKETING COORDINATOR (HYBRID) (Hybrid) Mechanicsburg, PADuck Donuts is seeking a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join the company’s marketing team. This is a hybrid position with in-office expectation 1-2 days a week with flexibility. Supporting national and local initiatives across multiple platforms, this position will be responsible for digital marketing execution while representing the brand voice/personality in support of the company’s 120+ franchised locations. The Digital Marketing Coordinator will manage and execute the integrated digital marketing plan, working to drive sales, traffic and local brand awareness for the Duck Donuts brand and local shops. Headquartered in Mechanicsburg, Pennsylvania, the company prides itself on sprinkling happiness to its guests through its unique in-store experience, exceptional guest service and iconic warm, delicious and made-to-order donuts. As one of the fastest-growing donut franchise companies, Duck Donuts has more than 120 locally owned and operated shops across 24 states and internationally. Key Responsibilities Executes the digital marketing communication plan for the company including but not limited to: email marketing, push notifications, loyalty marketing, listings, online ordering, delivery service providers, website updates, etc.Working closely with the creative and branding teams, develop digital campaign briefs and create and own detailed project plans for seasonal launches, new initiatives, campaigns, etc.Own the new shop opening checklist, working with operations and on-boarding teams to ensure all digital platforms and trainings are in place for new shops.Own the Digital Marketing Dashboard, updating this report weekly with key metrics to demonstrate the success and ROI of the digital marketing effort.Work with agency partners to manage key aspects of day-to-day business.
