Title: Data Entry Specialist (Sales and Marketing Support)
JobDescription:
Own the Role: SP6 is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Administrative Assistant to support our sales and marketing teams. In this role, you will be working cross-functionally to consolidate existing lists of current and potential client information into a single master list. Additionally, you will conduct research utilizing ZoomInfo or LinkedIn Sales Navigator to ensure accurate and complete data. **This is a hybrid opportunity with 2 days/week in office**How You’ll Drive Success:  Consolidate multiple Excel lists from various sources into a single master list ensuring data accuracy and consistency. Review and verify data entries for completeness, correctness, and adherence to established standards. Conduct research within customer records and other sources to gather missing or incomplete data, utilizing tools such as ZoomInfo or LinkedIn Sales NavigatorEnter and update customer information, such as contact details, purchasing history, and preferences into the master list. Maintain data integrity by identifying and resolving discrepancies or inconsistencies. Assist sales and marketing teams by generating reports and providing data analysis when necessary.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective communication and coordination of data-related tasks.Assist leadership with projects on an ad-hoc basis.
To Be Successful: Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry. Familiarity with data management and quality control practices.Excellent research and analytical skills. Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines. Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with different teams.
 Experience in a sales or marketing environment. Familiarity with CRM systems (SalesForce) and Sales Engagement Platforms preferred.Exposure to HubSpot preferred. Knowledge of data cleansing and deduplication techniques. Understanding of sales and marketing principles and terminology.
About SP6: SP6 is a niche technology firm advising organizations on how to best leverage the combination of big data analytics and automation across distinct (3) practice areas: Cybersecurity Operations and Cyber Risk Management (including automated security compliance and security maturity assessments).Fraud detection and preventionIT and DevOps Observability and Site Reliability
Each of these distinct domains is supported by SP6 team members with subject matter expertise in their respective disciplines.SP6 provides Professional Services as well as ongoing Co-Managed Services in each of these solution areas. We also assist organizations in their evaluation and acquisition of appropriate technology tools and solutions. SP6 operates across North America and Europe.Why SP6? Recognized as one of North America’s top professional service partners.The chance to be part of a winning team and a premier Splunk partner.Competitive salary and OTE.100% employer-paid health insurance (Gold-rated plan).401(k) with company match.30 days of annual paid time off (4 weeks Paid Time Off + Holidays)Significant Training and Development and Certification attainment.Opportunity for long-term career advancement.Your contributions are felt and recognized by our growing company.Grown over 100% in the last 2 years.
Skills: Attention to Detail, Communication, Cyber Risk Management, Data Cleaning, Data Entry, Data Integrity, Deduplication, Maturity Assessments, Online Data Entry, Sales and Marketing

Title: E-Commerce Marketing Associate (Analytical) (Hybrid Remote)
JobDescription:
Job Description Reli. is a rapidly growing eCommerce company selling on Amazon (www.amazon.com/reli), Walmart, Shopify (ShopReli.com), and eBay seeing 100% year over year growth. We currently service 5,000+ orders daily across our eCommerce marketplaces, with over 1,000,000+ unique customers such as Marvel, Dominos, and Lululemon.We pride ourselves in our strong, upbeat work culture and dynamic start up feel. We are looking for new team members that are enthusiastic and willing to learn and grow within the company.As an E-Commerce Marketing Associate, you would be part of the “Product Team” and directly contribute to all aspects of new eCommerce product launches - from performing product research to taking product photos and more.This is a starting position with very high potential for advancement and career growth! Upon completion of one year at Reli, a high performing Marketing Associate can expect to see advancement to our Marketing Associate level 2 position which starts at 30/hr.Check us out on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/shopreliReli. is headquartered at 12641 166th Street, Cerritos, CA. Creative/Design Copywriting for Product Pages (product page title, bullet points, enhanced content, etc)Product Page Listing Setup & Updating on Amazon, Shopify, Walmart.com, and other marketplacesProduct Page Photography capturing creative and market focused photosGenerate written design requests for product page images, creative box artwork, and other marketing materials to provide to our third party design service for executionAssist with design queue management & coordinate with designers for photo editing/design finalizationIdentifying & supporting marketing efforts to drive marketplace growth and/or optimization through A/B Testing, Price Optimization, & moreExperience with performing product research, analysis, pricing

Preferred Qualifications: Experience with eCommerce product page creation (images, copy, etc.)Marketing Perspective - Understanding what types of product images are attractive to the customer for driving conversionStrong Attention to Detail - Understanding the importance of following detailed SOPs and being able to document and communicate properly; ability to translate large amounts of detailed information into specific takeawaysOpen-minded - Ability to be open-minded about findings and willingness to adjust accordingly, willingness to learn and being open to feedbackCreative thinking - Ability to try alternative approaches that with help see a problem / analysis from different perspectives (product-focused with consumer mindset)Experience with performing product research, analysis, pricingAnalytical ability - Ability to propose data-driven product specs/price, etc.; Ability to gather & evaluate/analyze research in order to make informed decisions and conclusions based on quantitative analysis, making judgments about the value of information and understanding its components; considers different points of views and understands how information connects.Willingness to ask questions / intellectual curiosity - Asks questions to find out all the needed details to move forward / complete task; being curious to understand the context of the process or ask questions if not clear; determined to understand the findings to communicate to the teamPhotography experience

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: Position Title: Marketing CoordinatorDate: July 11, 2023FLSA Status: Non-Exempt Reports To: Marketing ManagerThis role is initially in-office. Once up to speed, the Marketing Coordinator may be allowed to work hybrid with work from the PSA Westminster office 3 days a week and work from home 2 days a week. However, the current hybrid model may not continue indefinitely. Job SummaryProfessional Security Alliance, Inc. dba PSA, The PSA Network, and Edge located in Westminster, Colorado, is the world's largest systems integrator consortium. This Marketing Coordinator position will be responsible for supporting day-to-day marketing operations for promotions, public relations, and events for PSA and Edge. This position requires the ability to work cross-functionally with other departments and a strong desire to work in a fast-paced environment. We are seeking a candidate with proven success in deploying strategic plans leading to high engagement rates. This position reports to the Marketing Manager. Starting at $23.68 per hour. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive compensation package which includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K, flex spending and PTO to full-time employees. For those working out of our corporate headquarters, we have a business casual working environment. Essential Duties and Responsibilities·        Support day-to-day marketing operations for promotions, public relations, and events·        Monitor and track trade journals and online publications for coverage about The PSA Network and Edge, its members and key technology partners·        Collect and assemble digital marketing metrics for PSA and Edge brands·        Assist in content updates for PSA and Edge websites·        Support social media strategy, campaigns, content creation and implementation·        Manage day-to-day moderation for PSA and Edge social media ·        Responsible for designing and sending select e-mails for PSA and Edge·        Support onboarding processes for new PSA and Edge members and technology partners·        Manage and maintain PSA and Edge email lists and contact database while generating growth ·        Assist with executing PSA and Edge event communications supporting the director of events and events coordinator ·        Support internal communications campaigns and employee intranet·        Other duties as assigned. Employees are required to follow all job-related directives and perform other tasks as requested by their supervisor Travel·        Minimal travel to select events / meetings per year Minimum Qualifications·        Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, public relations or related field, or equivalent years of related work experience·        Three years progressive experience in marketing is preferred·        Exceptional marketing generalist with the ability to execute and deliver creative initiatives·        Skillset in Adobe Creative Suite (including Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), Constant Contact, Klaviyo or other marketing automation tool, and Microsoft Office suite required·        Basic knowledge of WordPress, HTML and video production·        Adept at anticipating, assessing and translating company needs into actionable tactics·        Excellent grasp of new and emerging marketing practices and approaches and ability to find unique and distinctive ways to leverage them in marketing programs·        Proficient use of marketing analytic tools to measure impact of marketing initiatives Personal Characteristics ·        Ability to manage multiple priorities at one time·        Quickly evaluate proposals and determine the best course of action·        General understanding of marketing concepts, techniques and strategies·        Superior organization, project management and execution skills·        Superior writing skills and the ability to proofread and edit to identify errors in content, spelling and grammar·        Ability to speak professionally and effectively with customers and employees of the organization·        Positive demeanor and ability to work in fast-paced environment·        Enjoys working in a team environment but comfortable working independently·        Ability to have fun and be creative...the sky’s the limit! Physical RequirementsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Additional InformationThis job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee filling this position. Title: Associate Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionAssociate Marketing ManagerMinneapolis-St. Paul-Bloomington, MinnesotaDescription(Overview)At Schwan’s Company, the opportunities are real, and the sky is the limit; this isn’t just a job, it’s a seat at the table. Around here, every job matters, every voice counts, and every person contributes in a big way. As part of our front lines, we look to you to execute business, build relationships, and take pride in your work because at Schwan’s, you lead the way and we value what you bring. Our passion is our food. Our secret is our people.Schwan’s Company, a U.S. affiliate of the global lifestyle company, CJ CheilJedang Corporation, is a leading U.S. manufacturer and marketer of quality foods offered through retail-grocery and food-service channels. Our many popular brands include Red Baron®, Tony’s®, Big Daddy’s®, Villa Prima™ and Freschetta® pizza; Mrs. Smith’s® and Edwards® desserts; and Pagoda® and Bibigo Asian-style snacks. Schwan’s is a place for people with an appetite for more. To learn about joining a team where you can belong, contribute, and thrive, visit www.schwanscompany.comGENERAL PURPOSEWe are searching for an Associate Marketing Manager to join the Consumer Brands marketing team. We’re looking for someone who has a passion for building brands, for work that is both analytical and creative, for collaboratively leading and working with cross-functional team members and agency partners, and who can be a driving force to help our brands win with our consumers and customers. In this role, you will work on a brand that has high growth goals and high internal visibility.ResponsibilitiesStrategic Brand Management Contribute to the development of the brand’s annual operating plan and long-term strategic growth plans through analysis of consumer trends, competitive intelligence, syndicated consumption data, and secondary researchMonitor brand performance and overall business health against our internal and external KPIs/goals; be the subject matter expert of your brand/portfolio line’s volume, profit, and share performanceAnalyze external consumption and internal P&L data; creates and presents brand performance reporting decks to senior leadership through monthly business performance reviewsProvide on-going analytical insights into consumption trends, demand planning, budgeting, and brand profitability in collaboration with key cross-functional partners; assists in volume forecasting and planning
Brand Building Be the voice of our consumer and the champion of our brand; ensure brand consistency and standards across all products, packaging, marketing communications, and initiatives Collaborate with brand team and agency partners on the creation and execution of integrated, omni-channel marketing plans based on our consumer target and brand goalsDevelop and maintain internal and external brand materials, including presentation decks, in customer-facing marketing materials and/or communications on the strategy, insights, and purpose of our brand and product portfolio
Innovation Support the commercialization of new products in collaboration with cross-functional partners; can include innovation, renovation, and line extensionsBrand lead for new item commercialization; can include writing business cases, volume forecasting, concept refinement, consumer research, packaging design work, go-to-market support plans, sales material creation, and post-launch performance analysisLead the creation of marketing plans for new item launches in collaboration with agency partners and the Senior Marketing ManagerIdentify global insights, market trends, competitive activity and whitespace opportunities to contribute to our brand’s innovation roadmap in support of our strategic growth plans
QualificationsEducation: MBA required; will consider part-time MBA students close to graduationKnowledge, Skills & Abilities Understanding of marketing strategic frameworksExperience performing business analysis and synthesizing multiple sources of data into actionable insights and strategic implicationsExperience leading cross-functional teams through complex projectsConsumer-first mindsetPassion and accountability to drive growthIntellectually curious and passionate “self-starter”Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skillsAbility to work collaboratively, lead, and influence cross-functional teams, all levels of management, and external agency partners to deliver resultsPersonal initiative and willingness to deal with ambiguity in a rapidly evolving environmentThorough understanding of general business principles, including effective analytical skillsProject management skills including strong attention to detail
The employing subsidiaries of Schwan's Company are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, age, race, color, religion, gender, vet status, national origin or other protected class.Job Type: Full-time Business Unit: Req #: 23-3163

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: ABOUT THE JOB The Digital Marketing Coordinator works directly with the Director of Programs and Events. The ideal candidate will be responsible for coordinating all aspects of Project Unity marketing initiatives, web site and social media. Candidate must have experience in marketing, graphic design, website design, and social media platforms. Candidate should have graphics design skills with working knowledge with Adobe Creative Cloud – Illustrator, Photoshop, Spark, Premiere Rush, InDesign, Canva and other graphic platforms. Candidate should have experience with email marketing platforms such as MailChimp. Candidate must have experience in Wordpess and web design. Ideal candidate will need to have a professional demeanor, be detail oriented, have proof reading skills, a self-starter, proactive thinker, social media savvy, creative and an out of the box thinker, a team player, a strong communicator both written and oral, and a willing attitude to work extra to get special projects done.Responsibilities•      Market and publicize the work of Project Unity through social media, on-line ads, newsletters and event email campaigns•      Complete copywriting duties including proofing reading and editing content (e.g., for social media posts, comments, digital graphics, digital ads, etc.) •      Create and manage email and newsletter campaigns, event flyers, e-blasts and online community calendars•      Create graphic design elements to supplement any external facing or production-related materials•      Work with on-line ad companies to run ad campaigns; manage relationships with companies•      Manage social media accounts and content on all platforms; make recommendations and implement plans to optimize social presence across all platforms•      Create and maintain content calendars for all social media platforms, email marketing, and other digital marketing channels•      Respond to comments, questions, compliments, and complaints on social media•      Direct any actions or requests from social media to appropriate Project Unity contact•      Manage website (Wordpress site), update page content for programs, event calendar, back-end web site management such as downloading sign up lists, reports, data tracking, and other needs as necessary•      Assist with managing subscriber distribution lists in MailChimp•      Collaborate with external graphic design teams and media organizations to develop elements for digital marketing campaigns•      Manage data analysis and complete monthly reporting using web analytics tools, such as Google Analytics•      Attend on-site programs and events for live social posting; assist with on-site programs and events, as needed•      Perform other marketing/media/graphic duties and needs as requiredQualifications•      3+ years of work experience in Digital Marketing, Web Design, Graphic Design and Social Media management•      Proficient knowledge of social media applications including LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube•      Working knowledge of digital/on-line reputation management and social media presence•      Proficient skills in Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, other graphic design software, and email marketing applications such as MailChimp •      Proficient use of Wordpress for web design•      Above average knowledge of Frame i.o, DropBox, Eventbrite and Microsoft Office Programs•      Experience working with vendors and external resource organizations•      Excellent verbal, written communications and grammatical skills•      Ability to work independently and process information quickly•      Proactive thinker on tasks and plans for back-up/work-around situations •      Works well in a fast-paced environment •      Manages time efficiently and prioritizes tasks to achieve results •      Responds well under pressure to short deadlines and impromptu tasks •      Possesses sound judgement and exhibits a tactful demeanor in difficult situations •      Exhibits professionalism and strong business acumen •      Sincere interest in race relations, diversity, equity & inclusion, law enforcement relations and community building EDUCATION  • Bachelor degree in marketing, communications   EMPLOYMENT DETAILS •      Contract basis•      Up to 40 hours/week •      Non-benefited•      Mileage benefits•      Mobile device stipend•      Virtual and in-person office work environmentPlease apply immediately if you have a background in marketing/digital marketing and are interested in learning more about this opportunity! Submit your cover letter and resume at careers@projectunity.net.

Title: DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST
JobDescription:
Division: Blue Water DevelopmentLocation: W.Ocean City, MDWorkplace: On-Site with Hybrid OpportunityEmployment type: Full timeTravel %: up to 10%Salary range: $40,000 -$50,000Bonus eligible: Non EligibleBlue Water is privately held and family-owned by father and son Jack and Todd Burbage.Founded in 2002, Blue Water invests, develops, and manages RV resorts, campgrounds, hotels, and attractions. Blue Water's integrated marketing, revenue management, and operations approach has quickly established itself as a hospitality industry leader. With dozens of resort-area properties in East Coast states from Maine to Florida and new additions out west in Texas, Montana, and Oregon, the Blue Water family is committed to creating elite assets, delivering exceptional guest experiences, and enhancing the communities we serve.INTRODUCTION TO ROLE We are seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating and executing successful email marketing campaigns, implementing email automation, managing social media ads, and providing insightful reports.Who We Are Looking ForIf you are a creative and analytical thinker with a passion for email and social media marketing and a desire to join a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.What You Will Work OnReasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform and assign the essential functions outlined below. Design, create and execute email marketing campaigns that align with company goals and initiatives.Support the development of email automation journeys for various customer lifecycle segments, including welcome series, abandoned cart reminders, post-purchase follow-ups, and win-back campaigns.Use data and analytics to optimize email campaigns, including A/B testing, personalization, and segmentation.Create email content, including subject lines, copy, graphics, and calls-to-action (CTAs) that is engaging, on brand and ADA compliant.Segment and maintain email lists to optimize targeting and engagement ratesMonitor and manage email deliverability rates, ensuring emails reach inboxes and are not marked as spam.Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy to increase brand awareness, drive engagement, and generate leads.Collaborate with internal teams to ensure consistent branding and messaging across all campaigns.Ability to create a variety of content formats, including email campaigns and social media graphics.Analyze campaign performance data and provide actionable insights to improve future campaigns.Stay up to date on email and social marketing industry best practices, trends, and regulations.
Who You Will Work WithDigital Marketing Specialist reports to the Production Manager.What You Bring Bachelor’s degree and/or certifications in marketing, communications, or a related field At least 2-3 years of experience in email marketing.Strong writing and editing skills with attention to detail and accuracy.Strong understanding of content marketing best practices, including SEO, social media, and email marketing.Ability to analyze data and provide actionable insightsExperience with email marketing platforms such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud, HubSpot, Meta Business Suite, etc.Experience with WordPress, social media platforms and Google Analytics is a plus.Experience creating compelling visuals and graphics using Adobe Suite or Canva.Familiarity with email marketing regulations such as CAN-SPAM and GDPR.Experience building out email automation and drip campaignsExperience with HTML and CSS is a plus.Excellent project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Physical RequirementsThis is a largely sedentary role; however, some frequent sitting or standing is required. The ability to read and interpret writing in color is required. Must use dexterity to operate computers and related tools. Some travel is required!Blue Water is raising the standard of excellence and innovation in real estate development and hospitality with every entity brought on board.Blue Water Development Corporation is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and is committed to making employment decisions based on merit. We are committed to complying with all Federal, State, and local laws providing for equal employment opportunities and all laws related to terms and conditions of employment.

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
DescriptionWe are seeking an outgoing, creative, and customer service-oriented Marketing Specialist to join our awesome team here at Fairlawn! The ideal candidate will embody Fairlawn’s core values: Be Kind, Own It, Be Flexible, and Always Improve.The Marketing Specialist is an important role within the Marketing & Sales Organization and will be based out of our corporate office in Champaign, IL. The role will be accountable for top-of-the-funnel marketing and sales initiatives and create an impactful digital presence to increase brand awareness. This includes ownership of marketing efforts through social media postings, website oversight, paid advertising, internal communications, and creative content. Additional accountabilities will include ad hoc property leasing support, vendor administration, training, and reputation management. The Marketing Specialist will report to our Director of Marketing & Sales.What will you do?   Exemplify the core values of Be Kind, Be Flexible, Own It and Always Improve Collaborate with the property management team to deploy a targeted and effective marketing strategy through compelling content, imagery and messaging that conveys the property brand and sales position. This includes acquiring expertise in the sales process and property operations, complying with Fair Housing, ensuring accuracy and relevance, and delivering a polished product Create organic and paid social media posts for channels that strategically increase brand awareness and drive qualified traffic to properties. This includes gathering content at the properties on an ad hoc basis and taking ownership of the creative content and its final results Be a champion in marketing evaluation and strategy across social media, websites, and paid listings by consistently providing recommendations and identifying areas for improvement in lead generation. This involves compiling data, analyzing key performance indicators, and making guided adjustments based on findings to optimize leasing and marketing efforts Work with vendors on administration for signage, graphic design, promotional materials, and other special projects. Strong project management skills are essential, particularly when it comes to meeting deadlines Stay current with the latest marketing and real estate industry trends, best practices, and competitive environment Support reputation management at the company and property levels by offering oversight, responses, and solutions for improved ratings. Additionally, provide ad hoc pieces of training on great customer service Develop and assess internal communications collaboratively, encouraging feedback Actively engage and interact with individuals while attending and supporting corporate and social events Provide a great customer experience through outstanding internal and external service Learn and ensure compliance with all Fair Housing Laws including local, state, and federal housing regulations (We provide training) Pivot, roll up your sleeves and jump in where needed!
Why should you work here?  Competitive Pay and Incentives. We are ready to invest in you! Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance - Starting First Day of Employment - to access care for positive health outcomes and your overall wellbeing Employee sponsored benefits including Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Critical Illness, Accident, Flexible Spending, and H.S.A. Accounts to avoid costly medical expenses due to gaps and ensure that all your medical needs are met 401(k) Retirement Plan with Match to invest in your future wealth and retirement Paid Vacation, Sick Leave, and Holiday Pay to help you reset and come back rejuvenated and refreshed Monthly company events to promote team cohesion Wellness Days to focus on being your best self. We want you to have time to disconnect and recharge in a way that works for you The opportunity to work for a growing organization where you are valued and can have a direct impact Quarterly off-site meetings with your manager to celebrate wins, issue solve and ensure you are set up for success. Plus, the process is rewarding, and the results are great for your career
RequirementsWho you are – We’d love to hear from you if you:   Have a Bachelor’s Degree with a concentration in Marketing, Sales, Advertising, or similar Have at least 3 years of property management, hotel management or sales experience, with at least 1 within marketing, sales or leasing Can present your marketing portfolio during later-round interviews Have the ability to work closely with the property teams, different departments, and the community Are proficient with relevant technology (e.g. Microsoft Office, AppFolio, Outlook, Adobe Illustrator, Basecamp, Asana, Monday) and can easily adapt to changing technology Are proficient with social platforms (e.g. LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Tik Tok, Pinterest, Twitter, Later, Hootsuite , Sprout) Outstanding writing, editing, and proofreading skills with strong self-editing skills and a sense of voice and tone so that first drafts meet a high standard with minimal to no edits needed Can give and receive real-time feedback with a positive mindset Have an ability to work against deadlines and multi-task with changing priorities Can work independently and also work closely with other team members Embody our core values: Be Kind, Be Flexible, Own It and Always Improve
Some Additional Things You Will Need  Valid driver’s license and dependable vehicle. Limited in-town usage of personal vehicle for errands, any out-of-County personal mileage reimbursed at the Federal rate Availability to work longer hours and weekends during peak times including onboarding new properties, summer turnover and special events Ability to travel and work from multiple locations Must be able to complete the physical functions of the position including, but not limited to: ability to walk properties and complete physical inspections
Fairlawn Real Estate is a fast-growing real estate firm managing approximately 5,000 units throughout Central Illinois and Indianapolis. Our company uses the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS) to run and help grow our business – the tools from EOS contribute to finding the right people and putting them in the right roles, effectively solving issues as they arise and building a culture of accountability. In short it gets everyone on the same page and working toward the same goals. If you have an ownership mindset and take pride in all the details, joining our team may be perfect for you!IND789

Title: Product Marketing Manager - 23223
JobDescription:
DescriptionProduct Marketing ManagerWhy YOU want this positionEnverus is the leading energy SaaS company delivering highly technical insights and predictive/prescriptive analytics that empower customers to make decisions that increase profit. Enverus’ innovative technologies drive production and investment strategies, enable best practices for energy and commodity trading and risk management, and reduce costs through automated processes across critical business functions. Enverus is a strategic partner to more than 6,000 customers in 50 countries.We are currently seeking a Product Marketing Manager who loves creating thought-provoking content, understands the importance of building an effective buyer’s journey and can quickly grasp technical concepts and distill them into compelling value messages for customers. If your heart skips a beat when you get to learn about new technology solutions, you’ll fit right in here! This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in the world’s most dynamic and fastest-growing sector. You should enjoy working in a fast-paced, innovative environment. We need marketing leaders that can solve problems and think on their feet. You should be comfortable navigating ambiguity and taking ownership of improvement. If you like working in an environment where each day is filled with new projects and opportunities, this is the place for you.Performance Objectives - What You’ll Do  Bring your segment’s value props to life through engaging storytelling and messaging across the diverse marketing and sales channels that make up the Enverus customer journey. Own the go-to-market messaging, segmentation and positioning strategy for new product launches and feature updates. Act as the subject matter expert on current industry challenges, solution messaging, personas, and collateral, ensuring consistent messaging across marketing channels. Create and update sales enablement materials and content, including solution overviews, product videos, sales decks, white papers, e-books, blogs, customer case studies, competitive research, sales playbooks, and solution spec sheets. Partner with the demand generation marketing team to create a content roadmap that aligns with quarterly and yearly revenue goals and supports every stage of the buyer’s journey. Partner with the Product team to craft effective messaging that integrates our broad product portfolio into a cohesive and compelling solution. Partner with our Sales Go-To-Market team to ensure the Sales team is enabled to communicate business value and value propositions in the most effective way possible. Take a metrics-driven approach to inform messaging and content success, and address opportunities for improvement. 
Competitive Candidate Profile - What You Need To Succeed  3-5 years experience in product marketing or equivalent practical experience highly desired.  Excellent storytelling, messaging and writing skills. Ability to effectively communicate and build relationships with sales, product and marketing. Proven understanding of the demand engine and how to activate content throughout various channels to achieve GTM goals. Able to provide writing samples. Empathy for prospects and customers; an advocate for their needs and challenges as different elements of the marketing plan are designed and launched. A background in ERP SaaS, technology or energy business preferred; basic knowledge of supply chain/accounting processes a plus. An ability to navigate ambiguity, identify gaps and take ownership over improvement. Embody our core value of ONE TEAM through a proven record of collaboration and building strong partnerships; must maintain relationships across the organization to act as an educator, collaborator, and trusted partner.

Title: Marketing Account Manager
JobDescription:
Company DescriptionDaxko powers health & wellness throughout the world. Every day our team members focus their passion and expertise in helping health & wellness facilities operate efficiently and engage their members.Whether a neighborhood yoga studio, a national franchise with locations in every city, a YMCA or JCC--and every type of organization in between--we build solutions that make every aspect of running and being a member of a health and wellness organization easier and delightful.Job DescriptionWe are on the hunt for a skilled and experienced Marketing Account Manager who excels in website development to join our dynamic digital group. In this role, you'll play a key part in making sure our client's projects succeed from start to finish. You'll be a master at moving smoothly through the fast, thrilling world of website development and digital marketing, with a special focus on the fitness industry. As the digital world keeps changing, you need to stay on top of new trends and use this deep knowledge to help our clients.To succeed in this role, project management skills are crucial. The right candidate will go beyond expectations in leading website development, attention to detail, and solving challenges.Qualifications Highly effective website project management and organization skills, specifically exceptional time management, and analytical skills, specifically for creative projectsProficiency in marketing systems and reporting, including marketing automation, testing, and CRM tools. Knowledge of paid marketing, organic SEO, and technical SEO best practices in order to accomplish clients’ digital marketing and business objectives. Demonstrated ability to identify complex problems and information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions Ability to handle stressful situations or dissatisfied customersExcellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think on your feet during client presentations or internal meetings. Confidently train and teach others how to use WordPress, Google Analytics, and other Marketing toolsConfidently lead external (client) and internal meetings in person and virtuallyBachelor’s degree OR equivalent relevant agency experience, with a strong preference for continuous learning in the digital space. Working knowledge of WordPress and API plug-ins, Google Analytics, and Microsoft Office SuiteExperienced in project management, website UX/UI design, and content managementExperienced in Technical SEO during website development
In your day-to-day you will: Lead WordPress projects from initiation to completion, ensuring timely delivery and client satisfaction. Coordinate with internal and external teams of designers, developers, and other stakeholders to execute the project effectively. Effectively nurture and build client rapport, serving as a consultant to all assigned customers that provides direction towards client goalsUtilize your expertise in website design and development, to collaborate with teams to create visually appealing, user-friendly, and mobile-responsive websites that align with clients' branding and marketing goals. Coordinate with any project leads, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Content, and Analytics teams to ensure successful project management Identify upsell & cross-sell opportunities for additional services and offerings to maximize revenue. Address client concerns, resolve issues, and provide customer service to drive customer delight and increased retentionMonitor time tracking and Statement of Work (SOW) balances. Work with partner firms to deliver on client contracts and facilitate communication. Title: Junior Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Company DescriptionAs a leading healthcare education organization, Unitek Learning’s family of schools helps thousands of students launch and accelerate their careers every year. As a rapidly growing and highly successful company, Unitek is also a great place to pursue a rewarding and challenging career. We offer a competitive salary, generous benefits, unlimited growth potential, and a collegiate work environment.Job DescriptionWe are looking for a Junior Marketing Coordinator to join our team.This role will play an integral part in the development and execution of marketing strategies while emphasizing the project management of partner and interdepartmental projects. Working closely with Partners, Admissions, Business Development, and Academics, this role will be instrumental in helping us meet and exceed our organizational goals in marketing. Collaborate with Admissions, Business Development, and Academic teams to formulate and execute compelling marketing strategies that align with our institutional goals and effectively showcase our healthcare programs. Coordinate all marketing projects for partners, ensuring timely execution and delivery of marketing campaigns, initiatives, and collateral materials. Coordinate integrated marketing initiatives for enhancing college visibility, attracting prospective students, managing collaborations with partners, and executing special events.  Disseminate compelling marketing content, encompassing digital ads, brochures, and email campaigns. Assist in carrying out comprehensive market research to uncover potential marketing opportunities and strategize media engagement. Assist in carrying out all promotional efforts across relevant channels, guaranteeing uniformity with Unitek and associated brands. Design and orchestrate all internal communication protocols to encourage efficient cross-departmental cooperation. Advocate and augment the visibility of Unitek Learning brands across all marketing channels and materials. Assist in carrying out project schedules, outcomes, and resources, promoting productivity and responsibility. Arrange events, business meetings, and B2B trade exhibitions, integrating them into overarching marketing strategies. Scrutinize market trends and propose modifications to marketing and business expansion strategies based on insights gathered. Other duties as assigned. 
Pay Starting at $19/hrQualifications Associate’s degree in marketing, Communications, or a related field is preferred but not required. 1+ years’ of Customer Service experience. 1+ years’ experience Sales/Marketing preferred. Experience with any of the following project management tools often used for marketing: Trello, Asana, Smartsheet, Slack, Basecamp, Monday.com, Microsoft Teams, or Wrike is preferred. Proficiency in using social media platforms and tools for business. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Project Management experience preferred. Self-starter with a keen eye for detail and the ability to work independently. 
Additional InformationWe Offer: Medical, Dental and Vision starting the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment2 Weeks’ starting Vacation per year. Increasing based on years of service with company12 paid Holidays and 2 Floating Holiday401K with a Company MatchCompany Paid Life Insurance at 1x’s your annual salaryLeadership development and training for career advancementTuition assistance and Forgiveness for you and your family up to 100% depending on program

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
JobDescription:
Incubeta is growing! We currently have an opening for a Marketing Data Scientist.  Reporting directly to the VP, Adtech & Analytics, this role is responsible for understanding, designing and deploying data science projects for the purpose of enhancing and improving digital marketing activities. In order to successfully perform this role, you will need to be able to work with large and messy datasets of structured and unstructured data, build and implement models and algorithms, and design and run experiments to optimise media and customer experience. You are expected to have a relentless curiosity about various business problems and a passion for inventing data-based solutions to those challenges.As a Marketing Data Scientist you will be required to: Design, build, and implement predictive models and algorithms to improve and optimise media performance, customer experiences, revenue generation, and other business outcomes.Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and innovative prototypes to enable self-service frameworks.Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to internal and external technical and non-technical stakeholders.Document projects in a manner that ensures specific processes can be replicated and scaled across the organization.Collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders in an agile and dynamic environment.
KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCERequired Skills And ExperienceAs a Marketing Data Scientist, you are required to build bespoke data science solutions based on opportunities identified by you, the Analytics and Tech team or the Media team. The production process will include: Advising the team/s on the requirements to perform the project successfully after initial exploration of the dataWorking with the client’s/ Incubeta’s analytics, data, tech and BI teams to get the requirements in placeCreation of the data pipeline into BigQueryResearch and architecture of existing and potential solutions Adaption of solutions into a unique Incubeta templateThe automation of script triggering through Google Cloud Presenting any findings as well as training to team members and clients who will use the tool/ model
In order to successfully perform this role, you will need the following hard and soft skills:Hard Skills Expert SQL Expert Python Expert in RBigQueryGoogle Cloud Platform certified (Advantageous)Data ModellingProbability and StatisticsPrescriptive, predictive and statistical modelling Machine Learning ExpertPresentation Skills Knowledge of Key Metrics and Dimensions for GMP Platforms (DV360, CM360, SA360), Google Ads and Facebook (Advantageous)Knowledge of Digital Media Strategy (Advantageous)
Soft Skills Excellent problem-solving abilities.Ability to think and act independently as well as collaboratively.Relentless enthusiasm and highly reliable.Ownership driven, pro-active to self-learn and make progress..Confidently deal with enquiries around analytics from and establish influential relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.An excellent communicator and be able to present ideas, verbally and in writing (to internal stakeholders).Strong technical communicator - able to turn complex technical concepts into simple and easy to understand concepts for both internal teams and clients.Exceptional attention to detail and pride in any work produced.Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic, pro-learning environment on multiple priorities simultaneously. Strong ability to prioritize and manage own time as well as assisting teams where needed.Excellent problem solving skills.Display honesty and integrity at all times.Accountable for your actions even when making mistakes.Organised and detail oriented.Be approachable and open to constructive feedback.Display a hunger for knowledge and a willingness to learn for any situation.
Tasks And ResponsibilitiesYour tasks and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Own ideation and implementation of solutions and feature sets for customers and work collaboratively within the Data and Tech team to create and deliver.Identify and prioritize new solutions based on customer feedback and industry needs.Build ways to analyze and understand consumer engagement and product performance through modelling and data visualization.Formulating, suggesting, and managing data-driven projects which are geared at furthering our clients' business and marketing interests.Selecting and employing advanced statistical procedures to drive and obtain actionable insights.Cross-validating models to ensure their generalizability.Producing and disseminating non-technical close-out reports that detail the successes and limitations of each project.Suggesting ways in which insights obtained might be used to inform business and digital marketing strategies.Staying informed about developments in Data Science and adjacent fields to ensure that outputs are always relevant.
Required Certifications At least an honours-level degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.SQL BigQueryGoogle Cloud Platform PythonRMinimum 5 years of professional experience in a data science role, developing and deploying machine learning techniques.
Skills: Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science, Data Visualization, Google Ads, Google BigQuery, Key Metrics, Problem Solving, Statistical Modeling, Statistics

Title: Partnership Marketing Associate (23-24 Season)
JobDescription:
Position OverviewThe Chicago Bulls are seeking a highly motivated, organized and committed individual to fill the position of Partnership Marketing Associate for the upcomig season. As an Associate, you will have the opportunity to learn about partner service, activation, and retention, and participate in the planning and execution of partner agreements and events. We are seeking an organized and driven individual who is passionate about sponsorship, client service, and following current industry trends.This position will start in September 2023 and continue until the conclusion of the 23-24 season.ResponsibilitiesIn this role, you will learn hands-on the many facets of Partnership Marketing by fulfilling the following activities: Assist and report day-to-day to the Partnership Marketing Senior Account Executive and collaborate with Partnership Marketing team on partnership fulfillment and department processesSupport game day activity including department ticket distribution, gameday credentials and passes, and parking requestsCoordinate department merchandise and gifting inventory and shippingTrack partner touchpoints and marketing activities and events in CRMOrganize activation photos and data for recaps throughout the seasonLead digital advertising trafficking processMaintain Department storage areas
Additional ResponsibilitiesThe Partnership Marketing Associate will also assist the department with: Partner hospitality experiences including Chalk Talks, Court of Dreams, events and appearancesOff-site B2B, Community, and Marketing EventsPartnership Strategy & Insights projects and requestsFulfillment of in-game activations and digital promotionsCreative and design projects and requests (brainstorms, invitations, recaps, proposals)Client-facing and inter-department planning and status meetings
QualificationsThis person should be an organized, efficient, collaborative self-starter with the following: Bachelor’s degreeBackground and/or interest in sales, marketing, communication, entertainment or sportsCreativity, curiosity, and positive energyStrong operational efficiency, and proficiency in Microsoft Office suiteStrong work ethic with attention to detail, time management, and follow-throughExcellence in verbal and written communicationFlexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays as neededValid driver’s license
We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. Title: Integrated Marketing Associate (23-24 Season)
JobDescription:
Position OverviewThe Chicago Bulls are building a future-looking marketing capability that applies a combination of data, technology and creativity to drive fan development and support organizational growth. The marketing group is made up of four capabilities - Integrated Marketing, Digital Marketing, Product and Brand & Fan Development.We are seeking a dedicated and creative Integrated Marketing Associate to join our team for the upcoming 2023-24 season. You will primarily be responsible for carrying out our integrated marketing initiatives. This will include responsibilities such as supporting grassroots initiatives handling creative assets, developing planning documents and more. In addition, you will provide daily backing to the larger Marketing department specifically the Brand & Fan Development team and collaborate with creative teams across the organization.This position will start in September 2023 and continue until the conclusion of the 23-24 season.Key ResponsibilitiesYou will be part of a successful team while gaining relevant, hands-on, experience. More specifically, your responsibilities will range across the following: Participate in the development of effective copy, creative and roll out of key initiatives and tentpole moments for the team and league.Assist with coordination and activation of grassroots events including but not limited to, youth camps, retail events, fundraisers, watch parties and fan fests. Interface directly with fans to ensure a legendary experience.Support game day activations including the Bulls Kid Zone, retail marketing programs and perform quality checks for in arena signage.Lead the development and execution of broadcast inventory including drops, commercials, and content. Work directly with broadcast affiliates.Manage creative requests and trafficking of all internal and external integrated marketing assets.Support rollout of email and communication assets around key moments of the season.Order and maintain department inventory of event giveaways, signage, collateral, and fulfillment of all contest prizing.Develop and build creative deck materials, planning documents and aid in research projects.Work with vendors and finance to improve and project budgets.
Qualifications Bachelor’s degree with a concentration (in Marketing or Business is preferred).Previous internship experience, although not required, is strongly preferred.Meticulous attention to detail, including excellent copy editing and proofreading skills.Ability to prioritize and multi-task while meeting strict deadlines.Ability to work quickly in a dynamic, collaborative environment.Ability to follow project work plans and a budget.Strong social skills that reflect exclusive examples of integrity, preparation, collaboration, service and creativity.Strong communication and presentation skills (both written and verbal).Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Excellent teammate, with positive energy, who has a desire to learn.Have reliable means of transportation and can work nights and weekends.This role requires flexible work hours and will include time outside of normal office hours during the business week, including weekends and holidays. .
We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

JobDescription:
The role of the Direct Marketing Associate is to evolve new client relationships and to be an advocate for our client's product offerings and potentials in their industries.We are looking for outgoing, driven individuals to join our team as Direct Marketing Associates. Title: Communications & Marketing Specialist
JobDescription: Dept Number/Name: 0-6419-000 / Public Health Interdisciplinary Research & EducationCollege Division: USF Health- College of Public HealthSalary Plan: Staff- Grant Funded (Time-Limited)This is a hybrid schedule with at least 2 days required at the Tampa office.Job Code/Title: 3732 / Communications & Marketing SpecialistHiring Salary/Salary Range: $34,500 - $43,000 annualPosition Number: 00043280ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:The Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Consultation Program is a Center with the College of Public Health (COPH) and is funded through a Federal Grant. The goal of the Center for the Occupational Health Planning & Education (COHPE) is to provide workplace safety and health through education and consultation. The position reports to the Communications & Marketing Officer.POSITION SUMMARY:The Communications and Marketing Specialist develops and coordinates a wide variety of programs and activities designed to promote the USF 21D OSHA Consultation Program. The position serves as a media contact for the program, coordinates special events and develops/edits marketing and promotional materials such as brochures, flyers, online and multimedia content for use in print publications, websites and various multimedia formats. The specialist is a professional contributor providing specialized expertise in marketing, communication and public relations in the state of Florida for the small business community.RESPONSIBILITIES:Design, develop, write, edit, publish, maintain, coordinate and oversee the Consultation Marketing Plan that is incorporated into the Consultation Annual Project Plan (CAPP) goals each fiscal year to meet the grant requirements. Analyze the effectiveness of the marketing strategies/performance data and report on how they impact the activities within the Consultation Program to upper management.Develop program-wide marketing plans that include creating print and electronic communications content to be used by the Consultation Program for dissemination to clients and small-business marketplace statewide. Research materials, both online and off-line, to learn how best to target employers and write articles for publications and dissemination to meet the CAPP Operational Description Activity Outcomes.Create, develop and coordinate publications such as newsletters, brochures, flyers, press releases, photographs, videos and web-based marketing material to promote the consultation services to major stakeholders and potential clients. Oversee logistical activities i.e. location, registration, facilities, meals, lodging, audiovisual equipment, transportation and tours in promoting the USF Consultation services during special safety and health events, marketing conferences to include the Safety and Health Achievement Recognition Program (SHARP) and display booths at national and local trade shows.Coordinate and conduct statewide webinars with small businesses with a focus on the emphasis industries outlines by OSHA on an annual basis. Create and distribute the monthly Consultation Program E-newsletter to Florida's small businesses and draft the content of the Annual Onsite Magazine and the Consultation Annual Project Plan Report (CAPR) for approval.Provide statistical information to the Program Manager in preparation of the quarterly State and the annual OSHA Consultation Program reports relating to the progress of the marketing activities towards the annual goal of the Program.Maintain and organize contact databases or registries for various programs such as the SHARP and Sunshine State Award Programs. Assists with the Consultation website design and collaborate on the maintenance of the web pages including postings, messages, news releases, photos, templates, and other information and make corrections as needed. Serve as the Public Information contact for the Consultation Program.Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned to support the mission and function of the OSHA Consultation Program.POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:MINIMUM:This position requires a High School diploma and 5 years of related experience, OR a Bachelor's degree and 1 year of directly related experience. Appropriate college coursework may substitute at an equivalent rate for the required experience.PREFERRED:Previous experience in a higher education environment and working with Florida's small business community.Graphic design skills and proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud, i.e., Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.SPECIAL SKILLS/TRAINING:Knowledge of safety and health procedures, Code Federal Regulation - CFR 1908, Consultation Policies and Procedures Manual (CPPM), and OSHA Regulations. Proficient with Basic HTML, WordPress and All Microsoft Office Programs, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe lnDesign, Adobe Photoshop, conference planning, newsletter development experience.Information for Applicants This position is subject to a Level 1 criminal background check.Job Opening Number: 34029Original Posting Date: 05/03/2023Posting End Date: 08/06/2023How to Claim Veteran's Preference:This position allows eligible veterans and their spouses to claim Veterans’ Preference pursuant to Florida Statute 295.Applicants claiming preference are responsible for providing required documentation AT THE TIME OF SUBMITTING APPLICATION; such documentation is required for eligibility determination.Supporting documentation, in addition to the DD214, may be required based on eligibility criteria. If you are submitting a DD 214, please ensure the social security number and date of birth is redacted/removed.For information on obtaining a DD 214 visit http://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records/ or call 1-866-272-6272.How To ApplyClick on the Apply Now button. When applying to an opening you will have the opportunity to upload a cover letter and resume.Apply online by completing the required information and attaching your cover letter and resume. Please include your experience as it relates to the qualifications stated above. YOUR COVER LETTER AND RESUME, PLUS ANY OTHER REQUESTED MATERIAL, MUST BE IN ONE ATTACHMENT. Only online applications are accepted for this position.Click here for additional tutorial information.Equal Employment Opportunity USF is an equal opportunity, equal access academic institution that embraces diversity in the workplace.The University of South Florida does not discriminate on the basis of sex and prohibits sexual harassment. Any person may report sex discrimination, including sexual harassment (whether or not the person reporting is the person alleged to be the victim of conduct that could constitute sex discrimination or sexual harassment), in person, by mail, by telephone, or by electronic mail, using the contact information listed for the Title IX Coordinator. Reports may be made at any time either online or directly to the University's Title IX Coordinator.Work Location Campus map and location overview:USF - HealthUSF - Tampa CampusAbout USFThe University of South Florida is a high-impact global research university dedicated to student success. Over the past 10 years, no other public university in the country has risen faster in U.S. News and World Report's national university rankings than USF. Serving more than 50,000 students on campuses in Tampa, St. Petersburg and Sarasota-Manatee, USF is designated as a Preeminent State Research University by the Florida Board of Governors, placing it in the most elite category among the state's 12 public universities. USF is a member of the American Athletic Conference.Working at USFWith more than 16,000 employees at USF, the University of South Florida is one of the largest employers in the Tampa Bay region. At USF you will find opportunities to excel in a rich academic environment that fosters the development and advancement of our employees. We believe in creating a talented, engaged and driven workforce through on-going development and career opportunities. We also offer a first class benefit package that includes medical, dental and life insurance plans, retirement plan options, tuition program and generous leave programs and more.To learn more about working at USF please visit: Work Here. Title: Specialist, Marketing Automation
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionPosition:Specialist, Marketing AutomationDepartment:MarketingReporting To:Director, MarketingOur PurposeWe are building a championship organization that serves our fans, community and business partners through world class sports and entertainment. We believe that Winning Matters, our Fans come first, with risk comes reward, great teams can achieve unimaginable results, honoring the Pacific Northwest is our duty and driving the business is our responsibility.Since the team was awarded in 2018 through to our first puck drop in 2021, the Kraken brand has become one of the most recognized and beloved in the NHL. Playing at Climate Pledge Arena, the most sustainable arena in the world, we want to provide a memorable experience every night and make fans for life. Our joint foundation, One Roof Foundation aims to advance equity and sustainability by increasing opportunities to thrive for our most vulnerable young people and communities.Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion In HiringThe Seattle Kraken aspire to write a new playbook in sports and entertainment that includes everyone. In alignment with this vision, if you don’t meet every job requirement listed—or if you haven’t played ice hockey before or are still learning about the sport—we still encourage you to apply. We understand you may bring other relevant experiences and expertise to help us become the highest performance organization we can be. One of our core values is ‘Make Us Better’ and we recognize diversity, equity and inclusion as a critical business strategy.If you’d like to request an accommodation in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing: hr@seattlekrakenhockey.com .Position SummaryThe Kraken are seeking an experienced Marketing Automation Specialist to oversee the day-to-day operations of our email, text, and mobile notification marketing strategies.They will work alongside the Marketing, Communications and Brand teams to execute Kraken messaging and marketing campaigns that support the goals of the Kraken organization. This person will have a strong foundation in email design, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system oversight and email automation.This person will be tasked with the creation and delivery of Kraken messages that are fan-enhancing, ensuring a healthy and engaged database. The key areas of focus include Kraken digital communication such as newsletters, game day communications and corporate partnership fulfillment.The ideal candidate will carry out best practices ensuring continual enhancement of digital marketing efforts. The successful candidate will need to be a mission-driven, dynamic, high energy and highly productive professional with reliable judgment and instincts.Essential Duties & Responsibilities Responsible for direct marketing program(s) such as email, text, and mobile notifications.Development and execution, including segmentation, testing, and deployment of Kraken digital communications such as newsletters, game day communications and corporate partnership fulfillment.Liaise with the creative team, project stakeholders, and partners to ensure that all campaign assets are available and ready for deployment on time.Hockey content liaison with Kraken social, web, and app teams.Analyze and report on campaign performance. Monitor key metrics such as open rates, click-through rates, and conversion rates. Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to improve future campaigns.Work closely with Kraken automation and data agencies to integrate best practices.Identify A/B testing opportunities, analyze campaign performance and leverage test findings to maximize results for future campaigns.Work closely with business intelligence team to identify target audiences, help grow email database and design custom messaging across channels.Other duties as assigned.
Required Experience & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).Experience in email design and automation, preferably in the sports or entertainment industry.Strong knowledge of email marketing best practices, including segmentation, personalization, and A/B testing.Knowledge of database management concepts and best practices.Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an expert ability to present and communicate new ideas and concepts.Extremely organized and detail oriented, resourceful, quick learner and able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.A high degree of personal integrity and consistently put the interests of the organization first.Must be a fierce communicator and cross-organizational collaborator.
Preferred Experience & Qualifications Previous experience with Eloqua or similar marketing automation platforms.Familiarity with HTML/CSS for email template customization.Someone who is a problem solver and takes initiative on projects.
Total Rewards Package  Compensation: In accordance with Washington’s Equal Pay and Opportunity Act, the starting salary range for this position is $65,500 - $70k. The full rage for this role is $65.5-$75k. Actual base pay will depend on employee’s experience and other job-related factors permitted by law.Bonus eligibilityMonthly cell phone stipend

  Benefits & Perks: Company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance, including premiums for eligible dependents enrolled in the plansCompany-paid life insurance and short & long term disability insuranceCompany-paid employee assistance program and Headspace subscriptionFlexible spending accounts and voluntary accident, critical illness, and hospital indemnity insurance availableCompany-paid Orca card401k (pre-tax and Roth) with Company match up to 4%10 vacation days, 3 personal holidays, and accrued sick timeMinimum 11 paid holidays per yearPaid parental leaveKraken ticket stipend and employee only pre-sale opportunities to non-Kraken eventsDiscounts at the Kraken Team Stores, Kraken Community Iceplex, 32 Bar & Grill, and other partnersCompany-wide recognition platformCorporate office located at the Kraken Community Iceplex in Northgate; within walking distance of the Northgate Light Rail Station and Northgate Transit Center; free parking

Working Conditions Minimal Travel (<10% travel): May be required to travel. Trips may require air travel and/or overnight stay away from home for one or more nights.Must be able to work a flexible schedule inclusive of weekends, nights and holidays requiredFrequent bending, lifting 15-20 pounds, sitting, exposure to multiple external elements, extensive walking through the building including inclines and stairs.
Seattle Hockey Partners, LLC and Seattle Arena Company, LLC are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We do not discriminate on basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.
Skills: A/B Testing, Communication, Data Analytics, Direct Marketing, Eloqua, Hockey, Key Metrics, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Automation, Marketing Campaigns

Title: Marketing/ Graphic Designer ( Illustration + Motion Graphics)- Freelance [Remote]
JobDescription:
ABOUT US:Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process. JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Full day overlap)HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $45 – $75/hrESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short termBraintrust Job ID: 7127
THE OPPORTUNITYRequirementsSkills and experience our team needs: You’ve shipped several real-life products—and seen to their growth. This usually means you’ve had at least 1-3 years of experience.You’re in the pursuit of mastering your design craft and consider yourself well on your way towards the top of your game.You’re comfortable jumping into an unfamiliar space with our clients and navigating uncertainty (and a little chaos).You’re committed to goals, sometimes determined by yourself and often determined by others, and flexible on tactics.You enjoy being the voice of the people who use what they build.You have experience working directly with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to ship working software.You can rapidly build user flows and wireframes in your design tool of choice.You’re comfortable with lean, agile environments.You have an aptitude for training and mentoring other designers.You’re an artist at heart and showcase your work outside of your portfolio. 
 What you’ll be working onOur client was born out of a desire to help innovators and disruptors harness the full power of custom software development. They’re always searching for people who care passionately about their craft, embrace the humility of consulting, and consider themselves evangelists for software best practices.They’re dedicated to growth through discipline, collaboration, and mentorship. The goal is to find progressive ways to build software as small teams of passionate craftspeople. They help our clients—from brand new start-ups to enterprise-level organizations—implement their own diverse culture and software development mastery.Here’s who our client is looking for:Our client is searching for a Marketing Designer with at least 1-3 years of experience. In this role, you will partner with our clients to help them with design best practices by leading by example and being hands-on with their product.If you were part of our team, here are some things you would have done last week: Facilitated working sessions, user interviews, and recommended next steps based on what you learned.Worked closely with Product Management, Engineering, and other stakeholders to meld customer desires with business needs.Designed user journeys, personas, experiments, and any other things necessary to best serve our clients’ goals.Used collaborative technologies like Figma and Miro to visualize ideas and create beautiful, functional interfaces.Created designs, prototypes to communicate your ideas.Had candid conversations with our clients about how decisions impact the people using what they build and the business itself.Crafted beautiful and thoughtful interfaces for our clients.Utilized both data and your intuition to help us be better informed in our decisions.Been agile and struck a balance between evolving product requirements and consistent delivery. They learn from our clients and want to adapt as quickly as possible.Modeled our values of pursuing mastery, humanity, and courage.This list isn’t exhaustive. They want you to feel empowered to contribute to efforts outside of your discipline, including driving your own pursuit of learning new skills and techniques. They believe they make the best decisions when different perspectives enter the mix. That includes yours. 
Skills and experience our team needs: You’ve shipped several real-life products—and seen to their growth. This usually means you’ve had at least 1-3 years of experience.You’re in the pursuit of mastering your design craft and consider yourself well on your way towards the top of your game.You’re comfortable jumping into an unfamiliar space with our clients and navigating uncertainty (and a little chaos).You’re committed to goals, sometimes determined by yourself and often determined by others, and flexible on tactics.You enjoy being the voice of the people who use what they build.You have experience working directly with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to ship working software.You can rapidly build user flows and wireframes in your design tool of choice.You’re comfortable with lean, agile environments.You have an aptitude for training and mentoring other designers.You’re an artist at heart. 
Apply Now!C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
