Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Are you looking for a new best friend, card-game companion, or gardening guru? Then consider working with one of our light, bright, and beautiful Assisted Living and Memory Care communities - where our residents are #1 and our team members shine!Marketing AssistantFrontier Management is seeking an outstanding Marketing Assistant to join The Preserve at Woodland Hills Assisted Living & Memory Care community located in Woodland Hills, California. Demonstrated success as a leader in similar settings is required of the Marketing Assistant.Position qualifies for a Performance Based Bonus Program! See below for more detail.Frontier Management's portfolio of communities spans throughout the United States with each community sharing a commitment to superior service and quality lifestyle for our residents within their own unique setting. Frontier's mission is to provide an enriched and meaningful experience for our residents, team members, and community partners. If you are as committed and passionate about serving the needs of our senior residents as we are, we encourage you to apply and experience the Frontier Difference.The Marketing Assistant is responsible for coordinating all on-site sales and move-in efforts under the direction of the Marketing Director. The position will be a crucial resource for successfully supporting seniors and families who are seeking our services as well as ensuring a smooth move-in process. The Marketing Assistant must possess a high level of customer service, self-motivation, and a compassion for Seniors.Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Conducts initial and/or follow up contact with prospective residents and family members, to include phone calls, walk-ins, and requests for information received through the mail or web-based. Assembles all appropriate collateral material for mass mailings, individual correspondence, information packets, floor plans, etc. Follows up on requests for information from current prospects and disseminates information approved by the Executive Director. Maintains database in Lead Tracking (ALF) Nurtures relationships with new and existing prospects to provide a continuation of referrals and to sell the services provided by, including but not limited to Independent Living, Assisted Living and Memory Care senior living. Implements marketing strategies as instructed by the Executive Director and Marketing Director. Assists with the implementation of the marketing plan, which includes participation (as needed) through all phases of the marketing process, special events, promotional strategies, community relationships, presentations, etc. Participates in all areas of marketing activities that are needed to achieve goals set by the Executive Director. Handles mailing of letters, forms and collateral materials, as appropriate in response to the needs of prospective residents and their families. Maintains database of contacts and referral sources in sales software. Completes required forms and follows all procedures deemed necessary to keep database current. Answers phone inquiries. Responds in writing and by e-mail as necessary. Attends and participates in appropriate in-service and department meetings. Generates correspondence as necessary with prospects, and their families, as required to maintain and nurture relationships. Performs clerical duties and assignments deemed appropriate by the Executive Director, including assisting with the completion of required resident documents prior to move in. 
Other Requirements: High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s degree in Marketing preferred. Two years of Senior Living experience preferred. Must possess excellent leadership and communication skills, be creative, fun loving and have a caring disposition towards the elderly. The Marketing Assistant must also have a current driver’s license Typing and marketing skills and have a neat, professional, courteous manner and appearance. Ability to pass drug screen and Criminal background check. Willing to work shift assigned, weekends, and holidays. Ability to work independently with minimum supervision; problem solving, conflict management, budgeting. 
The Marketing Assistant qualifies for a Performance-Based Bonus Program! Frontier Management, LLC has an established Performance Based Bonus program for our community’s Marketing Assistant that incentivizes diligent efforts and outcomes, which positively impact the Company and its future, by striving to control costs, maintain high levels of resident satisfaction and reaching high census targets.Frontier Management offers a competitive salary and a work environment that encourages initiative and fosters respect. Frontier Management, LLC offers medical, dental, vision, life/AD&D, Flexible Spending Account, Short Term Disability, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance. We also offer a 401(k) plan with a competitive Match program. To discover more about the Frontier Management team, please visit our site at www.frontiermgmt.comEqual Opportunity Employer/ Drug-Free Workplace

Title: Marketing Consultant Professional - I
JobDescription:
Individual will help support digital experiences across Telecommunication Groups wireless and wireline portfolios related to a website redesign project. This individual will help create visitor web experiences that tie seamlessly with media, demand gen and social campaigns, and drive quality visitor traffic and conversions. The marketing consultant will interface with key contacts across the business such as integrated marketing, creative, product marketing, and ecommerce, providing web expertise and guidance related to user flow and optimizations. Focuses on SEO, conversion optimization, streamlining our story/messaging, and implementing logical and concise navigation. Manages breadth of digital experience initiatives, requiring digital strategy development and execution, project management of content delivery, content authoring, and quality control. Proven experience in implementing and delivering value through digital content. Knowledge of creative and technical development processes involved in producing web content. Strong experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) or another CMS SEO knowledge and experience Project management, prioritization and proofreading skills High energy, self-motivated individual with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work independently. Outstanding problem solving skills.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
DescriptionCREA, LLC is a full-service low-income housing tax credit (LIHTC) syndicator forming long-term relationships with investors and developers that cultivate success and improve lives. With over 20 years in affordable housing, CREA has raised $9.88 billion - resulting in the formation of over 77,000 homes within 849 communities across the country. Thanks to the contribution of over 160 employees, CREA continues to look for talented and passionate individuals who are excited about opportunities to grow with the company. We are currently looking to add talent for the position of Digital Design Specialist / Digital Content Specialist to join the team.Physical Presence: In-Office | Tue – Thu; Flexible | Mon & FriLocation: Indianapolis, IndianaReports to: VP, Marketing Communications ManagerPosition SummaryReporting to the VP, Marketing Communications Manager, this position is responsible for implementing and administering various marketing functions in a creative entrepreneurial environment. Day-to-day activities will involve coordinating various aspects of internal and external digital marketing communication projects, producing video content, creating and maintaining website and social media content, designing collateral materials, as well as generating and editing news stories and press releases.Primary Responsibilities Contributes to the overall internal and external marketing strategies, including marketing plans, presentation decks, graphic design, videography creation and support, production of newsletters and other promotional materials (electronic & otherwise)Assists with media relations – predominantly writing & distribution of news contentContributes to the content and maintenance of company website(s) & social media platforms to ensure accurate information is posted and/or removed in a timely manner Assists in overseeing of the workflow of various marketing projects from concept to completionAssists in the follow-through of ongoing business development and creative projectsCoordinates and provides content and production timelines for digital media
Additional Responsibilities Include Supporting digital and creative marketing efforts for CREA FoundationAssists in supporting event marketing needs, specifically annual investor and company-wide meetings, as well as conferences and eventsMaintains and organizes files and records, including but not limited to project requests, ads, brand and photo libraries, logos, graphicsAbility to work within tight deadlines and manage multiple tasks/projects with various timelinesPerforms other duties as assigned and driven by business needs
RequirementsAn associate degree in marketing, graphic design, communications, or a related field is required. Bachelor's degree preferred. 2-3 years of professional experience in a similar role with an applicable skillset is preferred. Must be proficient with Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Adobe InDesign and/or Illustrator, Premier, Photoshop, and Microsoft Office Suite. The ideal candidate should be highly motivated, demonstrate great initiative, and exhibit dependability, attention to detail, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team. This role necessitates strong prioritization, organizational, and task management skills to meet deadlines. Sound project management abilities are highly desired. Up to 10% travel is required. The candidate must possess and be able to demonstrate effectiveness in each of the Core Competencies.Core Competencies Excellent oral and written communication skillsExtensive creative and project management skillsCommunicates ideas and concepts visually through artistic measures, creative messaging, and computer technologyAbility to effectively manage and administer sensitive and confidential informationInitiative and ability to work with little guidance & supervisionDemonstrates ability to meet deadlines
Skills: Ad Serving, Digital Marketing, Digital Marketing Communications, Digital Media, Marketing Communications, Media Relations, Press Releases, Product Marketing, Social Media Content Creation, Video Production

Title: Coordinator, Events & Marketing
JobDescription:
Job TitleCoordinator, Events & MarketingReports ToVice President, Strategic RelationsDepartmentStrategic RelationsFLSA StatusNon-ExemptSalary Range40 hours/week. $23/hour - $25/hourSummaryThe Los Angeles County Economic Development Corporation (LAEDC) seeks an Events & Marketing Coordinator to join a high-performing strategic relations team to assist with planning and executing regular in-person events and supporting our marketing/communications team. This position will report to the Vice President, Strategic Relations, and ensure productive relationships with members, event sponsors, and support with marketing & communications. The coordinator will work closely with the Director of Strategic Relations and the Director of Marketing & Communications and have regular and frequent check-ins. This role supports the LAEDC's mission to create a stronger regional economy that provides a high quality of living and prosperity for all.LAEDC's Culture Of InclusionLAEDC is committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and connectedness. Understanding that we, like the population we serve, come from all walks of life and are a stronger organization because of it, the LAEDC is committed to a culture that values and prioritizes diversity and free expression within its team. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that stays true both to our roots here in Los Angeles County and to our mission by ensuring that anyone, regardless of one's background, origin, orientation, or station in life, and other characteristics that make our employees unique, can find a home at the LAEDC with our team.DutiesMARKETING & COMMUNICATIONS  Create and schedule event lead-up marketing and day-of materials for audiences, including email correspondence, social media posts, slide decks, etc.Coordinate and implement ongoing communication strategies. Write informative, engaging, and persuasive copy and visuals.Work with team to develop speaker slides and proofread of all marketing materials for events and programs.Assist with post-event marketing and content creation.Produce digital marketing content, including executing campaigns, message development, analyzing metrics, and identifying trends. 
EVENTS Coordination, preparation, and effective implementation of LAEDC events, including summits, receptions, speaker series and fundraising events. Provide on-site support during events, including registration and check-in, set-up and break-down.Assist in managing event logistics for both online and large-scale in-person events, including working with vendors, venues, catering, guest registration, and other related needs.Assist with research of services provided and related and pricing of venues and vendors.Participate in all planning, pre-event, and post-event meetings.Assist with coordination and collection of items for silent auctions and/or raffles at events.Willingness to learn CRM software to track event attendance.Other duties as assigned.
CompetencyTo perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:Achievement Focus - Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Recognizes and acts on opportunities; Sets and achieves challenging goals; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goalsCommunications - Exhibits good listening and comprehension; Expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; Keeps others adequately informed; Selects and uses appropriate communication methodsJob Knowledge - Competent in required job skills and knowledge; Displays understanding of how job relates to others; Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
The Objective of this RoleElectrical Equipment Company is currently looking for a Market Coordinator to create distinctive and exciting marketing campaigns to promote our prestigious product lines. This position is responsible for contributing to and executing EECO's B2B field marketing plans to industrial customers and support electrical products and services for manufacturers to increase direct customer engagement through precise target marketing while expand the current client audience.Area Of Responsibilities Nurture the development of print & digital channels, increasing contact acquisition rate.Coordinate marketing automation campaigns and analytics to create measurable results and real time insight.Designing marketing materials for email, social media, podcast, video, and print campaigns, and other content generation as necessary, filtering vendor messaging to fit EECO's specific audiences.Present your concepts, develop and document the designs for print and digital distributionBe accountable to the team and schedule while upholding the highest design standards

Education And Experience A relevant diploma in related field.1-3+ years of print & digital design experienceExperience with planning, documentation and management of marketing collateral and print campaigns for various project types
Who We Are And Why We Are SuccessfulThe Electrical Equipment Company (EECO) is not your average industrial full-line electrical distributor. Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription: Marketing Specialist PHP AGENCY INC.PHP Agency Inc., PHP
Date:
is seeking a Marketing Specialist to join our Dallas-based HQ teamPHP is a life insurance field marketing organization, founded in 2009. Our CEO is entrepreneur Patrick Bet David. PHP provides a part-time or full- time opportunities to individuals pursuing careers as life insurance agent. The ideal individual will have the ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, with strong written and verbal communication, administrative, and organizational skills, and the ability to maintain a realistic balance among multiple priorities. Strong prioritization, organization, and project management skills
Ability to travel as necessary.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Title: Part-Time Event Marketing Operations Staff
JobDescription:
Company DescriptionThe New York Red Bulls are one of 29 teams in Major League Soccer (MLS). RBNY, one of the ten charter clubs of MLS, have competed in the league since its founding in 1996. The Red Bulls play home matches at Red Bull Arena (RBA) in Harrison, New Jersey. The three-time MLS Supporters' Shield Winners are owned by the Austrian beverage company Red Bull for which the team is named. The New York Red Bulls offer one of the nation's premier youth soccer development programs, from local soccer partnerships across New York and New Jersey to Regional Development Schools and the Red Bulls Academy teams.You will report to the Field Marketing and Events Manager. This role works directly with our Marketing and Operations teams during the set-up and breakdown of all match day BULLevard activations and Special Events. Marketing Event Operations Staff are directly involved with the preparation and maintenance of all BULLevard materials, also known as marketing activations. You will be well-versed in the building portion of each activation, understanding what is needed from these activations to successfully run properly.As a part-time employee of the Company, you will not be eligible for Company-sponsored benefits or paid vacation. ResponsibilitiesJob Description  Help with the set-up and breakdown of infrastructure and branding for the BULLevard and other activations around Red Bull Arena on matchdays.  Serve as liaison between marketing and Red Bull Arena from a marketing and operations standpoint.  Assist Operations and Special Events teams in the set-up of activations requested.  Monitor usage of activations to ensure it is used properly or in need of adjustments. 
Because of the cyclical nature of the entertainment industry, you may be asked to work varying schedules to reflect our needs (includes nights and weekends).QualificationsCareers in sport management, operations and special events interest youYou can lift up to 40lbs and are comfortable being physically active for extended periods of timeAvailable on nights and weekendsAdditional InformationRed Bull New York is an equal opportunity employer and we will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or any other classification protected by law.

Title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionThe primary purpose of this position is to provide marketing-related support to the company’s Marketing Department. Other duties include developing, implementing and maintaining digital content across multiple channels. To include expanding traditional services which better support and exceed the Credit Union’s strategic initiatives and goals. Assists with day-to-day operations to include but not limited to: coordination of marketing materials and sales tools to support the execution of the online marketing plan, social media outreach and internal and external corporate event planning, graphic design production, assisting with direct mail efforts, writing correspondence, presentation preparation and research, as well as helping with general office needs. It will also support departmental events during and after normal working hours; and performing other duties as assigned.Responsibilities Include Assists the administrators of the Credit Union’s digital marketing channels and online initiatives.Assists in the production and execution of email campaigns including promotions and member onboarding activities, credit union publications and collateral materials.Assists with the social media and website presence including schedule, content, design, production and execution of content/posts.Responsible for scheduling, tracking and reporting of all emails and surveys.Assists with member relations on social media sites. Researches complaints with product owners and crafts responses to members’ online posts.Assists in the planning and execution of the company’s annual meeting.Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or assigned.

Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related field is preferred. 1 – 3 years’ experience in marketing or digital marketing field.Demonstrated proficiency and knowledge in Microsoft Office programs, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint (required). Experience using graphics programs such as, Adobe Creative Suite, SharePoint, HTML coding, CMS WordPress; Marketing automation / emailing software Survey Monkey/Mail Chimp in digital marketing campaigns is preferred.
Following an employment introductory period, this position may be eligible for BayPort’s hybrid work model. BayPort values a culture that is highly collaborative, and we have found that a hybrid work model helps employees gain the best of both worlds – collaborating in-person in the office and working from home when needed to achieve focused deliverables. Title: Sales And Marketing Representative
JobDescription: Job DescriptionSales and Marketing RepresentativeRumsey Construction & Restoration (RCR) is an industry leader in Columbia, SC, Charleston, SC, Charlotte, NC, and Augusta, GA. RCR is a local, independently owned, and operated restoration, reconstruction, and remodeling company that specializes in disaster response, fire, water, smoke, and storm damage. We provide our services to residential and commercial property owners working with insurance-based claims and repairs related to the loss.Our Core Values: Teamwork, Resolute, Adaptable, Innovative, No Task Beneath Us Mission: At Rumsey Construction and Restoration, our business philosophy is simple: go the extra mile – every time, for every client. We want to build lasting relationships with our customers. Every time we work with someone, we believe it is our responsibility to give them an outstanding experience – quality craftsmanship, attention to detail, superior customer service, and practical solutions that are suited to their needs and budgets.Overview:Our Sales and Marketing Representatives are dedicated to our referral sources, customers, and clients as RCR returns compromised properties to its pre-loss condition. A Sales and Marketing Representative is responsible for generating new business opportunities and closing incoming leads. These responsibilities include inside and outside sales, attending and hosting networking events, lead generation, and participation in trade associations. In this position, your goal is to increase RCR brand awareness with traditional and strategic campaign strategies from existing referral sources and grow our overall referral base by consistently bringing in new referral relationships. The ideal candidate will exhibit high standards, excellent communication skills, and have an ability to take initiative, and prioritize daily tasks. A strong ability to take charge and meet tight deadlines will ensure your success in this multifaceted role.Responsibilities and Duties:●      Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone and email.●      Answer, screen, and transfer phone calls or take messages.●      Always provide the highest level of internal and external customer service. ●      Maintain and expand existing business relationships to increase lead generation and average job size. ●      Locate, present to, and sell restoration services and partnership opportunities to new prospects.●      Identify and research new customers to develop business partnerships through a variety of techniques including daily office visits, new introductions to generated leads, owners meeting coordination, networking and attending local organizations.●      Must be able to converse and build relationships with insurance adjusters and agents, property managers, real estate agents and internal staff.●      Develop lasting relationships with key referral sources to acquire jobs.●      Deliver gifts/food for referral sources within set budget.●      Work with internal staff to stay informed on all referral source’s jobs.●      Document and track leads and business development activities in company CRM●      Data entry into RCR’s programs●      Identify and attend key events and association meetings to cultivate new referrals sources.●      Retain involvement in targeted associations and verticals.●      Attend conferences and continued education courses.●      Participate in and represent in tradeshows and other promotional events. ●      Plan and organize marketing functions; including golf tournaments, charitable events, and other networking and social activities, many of which is after normal business hours. ●      Work with the Chief Marketing Officer to align strategies aimed at increasing market share & reaching new clientele.●      Become and remain proficient on our services and the associated terminology. ●      Manage multiple duties and priorities simultaneously.Qualifications and Skills:●      Minimum HSD/GED required.●      Construction or restoration experience a plus●      Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace●      Track record of long-term employment●      Two or more years outside B2B sales experience a plus●      Willingness to travel●      Must be available to manage client calls and emergency leads on an intake call rotation.●      Experience with database management●      Excellent organizational skills, data entry skills with a high degree of accuracy, and strong attention to detail●      Optimism and patience when providing customer service.●      Ability to maintain strong client relationships and develop industry partnerships.●      Strong communication skills between team and with customers and with potential referral sources is essential. ●      Self-motivated, ambitious, detail and goal oriented, outgoing, team-oriented and a self-starter●      Strong persuasive prospecting skills●      Capable of working in a fast-paced, team-oriented office environment●      Understanding the importance of following procedures and staying within company guidelines

Title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
We are looking for a smart, hungry individual to drive our growth marketing function. You will have a unique opportunity to work cross-functionally and use quantitative insights to drive better decision-making across the whole organization.As our Social Media Specialist, reporting to our VP of Sales & Marketing, you will be responsible for developing the digital and physical performance strategy to help achieve our ambitious goals, testing aggressively to find the best ways to deliver growth and awareness to support our sales team. Ideally, you are passionate, detail-oriented, an excellent communicator, independent thinker, and incredibly innovative.This role is for out of the box thinkers, as we are a new concept within the multifamily industry.To perform the job successfully, duties and responsibilities include the following, other duties may be assigned: Primary focus is to develop and grow LinkedIn, Instagram and other platforms as identified. Focus within these platforms will be on presence, brand awareness, connections, and engagement by driving both organic and paid social campaigns.Support our outside sales teams’ activities (conventions, trade shows and other events) through promotion on social media platforms.Understand marketing “strategies” to develop tailored messages, concepts stories and campaigns.Collaborate with members of our sales, operations, and consulting teams to develop messages relevant to B2B audiences - current accounts and potential new business.Work with our external multimedia designer to develop relevant visual content and assets that engage our current audience and garner new connections and business leads.Develop and execute campaigns and promotions.Create copy and details to tell a consistent click-through story.Plan and organize LinkedIn and other platforms social calendar as well as complimentary content for Sales Team to access and use on brand-associated personal profilesDevelop a plan that engages all Brand stakeholders to be involved in the Brand’s online presence.Educate and Engage with Sales Team through concise and informative bi-weekly emails of relevant tips on how to use as a sales tool to find leads and grow their own business and territory accounts.Derive innovative ideas or concepts from sales, operations or consultants into the calendar, schedule, and strategy. Monitor competitive brands’ pages and other public marketing to actively listen and evaluate their focus and message to remain competitive within the industry. Manage Clozzits YouTube channel by working with Multimedia designer and/or sales to upload all new video content, developing ideas and optimizing video titles and descriptions to optimize SEO.Develop LinkedIn Events strategy and act as organizer who will create the event, decide topic covered, invite guest attendance, speakers, and promotion. Look for speaking opportunities within industry specific events, manage application process and act as point for all coordination efforts. Manage and optimize social media spend to not exceed monthly budget (TBD).Respond to all social media comments within 24 hours of post – with a goal of reducing this time to under 12 hours.Manage social media channel password security. Regularly update passwords and evaluate associate ownership monthly, or more as needed, to maintain brand social media security.With social media operating beyond standard business hours, it may be necessary to monitor and address social media needs during nights, weekends, and holidays a needed.Coordinate analytic reporting: collect digital and social Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) on a weekly basis to measure success of campaigns and strategies; Review results with President and VP of Sales & Marketing to make recommendations for modifications and improvement.Improve engagement through surveys, focus groups, A/B testing and user acceptance testing as applicable.Monitor trends in social media channels, tools, and metrics and appropriately apply that knowledge to increase social media effectiveness.Plan and conduct market research, with a focus on the business to business to consumer landscape, to identify opportunities for increased sales.Audit and report on competitors’ social media efforts.Collaborate with industry partners in cross promotional opportunities.
QualificationsThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Passion and understanding of marketingBachelor’s degree or minimum of three (3) years of LinkedIn and social media related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Active working knowledge of social media platforms LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and other tools such as Adobe Illustrator, Canva, and Hootsuite.Preferred minimum of (2) years of Multifamily experience in a creative marketing role on either supplier or management co/owner side.Intermediate level of experience in Microsoft Applications including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Explorer, and Photoshop preferred.Fluent knowledge of the fundamentals of B2B and/or B2B2C sales and marketing strategies.Understanding of social media and online best practices; including trends.Experience with Google Analytics, and social media analytics.Understanding of HTML and content management systems.Ability to work independently and in a team environment to collaborate with others to gather promotional content to get the job done.A keen understanding of the sales arena, and an understanding of successful implementation of social commerce is preferred.Proficient written and verbal communication skills including proofreading, editing and grammar are essential. Presentation skills preferred.Must possess problem-solving and multi-tasking abilities, attention to detail, organizational skills, and time management.Continued desire to stay abreast of developments in current social media and internet platforms and technologies.Creative thinking and collaborative work style, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities.

JobDescription:
Title: Technical and Marketing Coordinator Location: New York, New YorkWho We AreVoted one of the Nation's Best and Brightest Companies to Work for, Kuraray America, Inc. (KAI) is a global leader in specialty chemical, fiber, and resin production. With top-of-the-line research and production facilities and a vast network of supply from around the world, Kuraray leads the industry in specialty dental, fiber, resin, and elastomer products. (ex: dental assisting, dental hygiene or dental lab)Good written and communication skills; Detail-oriented and good time management skills; Computer skills which include Excel; Microsoft Word and PowerPoint

We also provide an Educational Reimbursement Plan, helping our employees fulfill their career goals, as well as a competitive 401(k).Please apply online at: http://www.kuraray.us.com/careers/Kuraray America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer AA M/F/disability/protected veteran statusNo third party candidates accepted.

Title: Marketing Director
JobDescription:
Are you looking for a new best friend, card-game companion, or gardening guru? Then consider working with one of our light, bright, and beautiful Assisted Living and Memory Care communities - where our residents are #1 and our team members shine!Marketing DirectorFrontier Management is seeking an outstanding Marketing Director to join The Auberge at Onion Creek community located in Austin, Texas. Demonstrated success as a leader in similar settings is required of the Marketing Director.Position qualifies for a Performance Based Bonus Program! See below for more detail.Frontier Management's portfolio of communities spans throughout the United States with each community sharing a commitment to superior service and quality lifestyle for our residents within their own unique setting. Frontier's mission is to provide an enriched and meaningful experience for our residents, team members, and community partners. If you are as committed and passionate about serving the needs of our senior residents as we are, we encourage you to apply and experience the Frontier Difference.The Marketing Director is responsible for achieving high occupancy via direct sales interaction with prospective residents, their families, and professional referral resources. Additional responsibilities include outreach efforts with various medical professionals and organizations that have the ability/need to directly refer prospects to quality Senior Living options as well as full management of the community's CRM database. The Marketing Director is also responsible for the development of community events that are innovative and engage the consumer in a relevant and purposeful manner creating organic exposure to our Senior Living services.Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Performs facility marketing and sales activities including community events, prospective resident generation, tours, prospective resident follow-up and direct sales Grow your community’s social media presence by ensuring high-quality pictures and engaging stories are posted at least three times a week. Build your community’s digital reputation by requesting positive online reviews from resident families, vendors, and community partners. Monitors sales and other key metrics to ensure maximum results that assist in the complete fill up of the facility With general guidance and input from the management team, develops and implements an annual Marketing Action Plan, reviewed quarterly, for the community Performs community relation functions and participates in local community activities for the facility with particular attention to clergy, medical, legal, financial and business entities who would have influence with the senior market Maintains appropriate contact and develops a strong working relationship with local associations and community organizations that serve and support seniors Prepares and delivers presentations promoting the community as needed Ensures company profitability by meeting all facility activity and marketing budgets and census guidelines as set by the corporation Develops and implements purposeful, relevant and innovative in-house events and functions that will generate new traffic to the community Conducts in-depth interviews with prospective residents and other necessary parties to determine qualifications for residence into the community Conduct in-depth competition studies to determine strengths/weaknesses, census levels, rental rates, the range of services, department leaders, advertising/promotions, menu/food service, activities, amenities, etc. Manages inventory and distribution of all collateral marketing materials including handouts, postcards, brochures, etc. Identifies overall trends in the marketplace that would indicate adjustments to be made in the overall marketing strategy for the community or in individual instances Performs additional job duties as assigned 
Other Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing preferred 3+ years of outside sale experience. Senior Living sales experience a plus Excellent presentation skills and comfortable presenting to both small and large groups Strong communication skills, verbal and written; English language skills adequate to allow communication with residents and staff, and to understand written and verbal instructions Must be proficient in MS Office Suite, with an emphasis in Excel and Outlook Ability to network and develop strong working relationships Compassion and caring disposition for senior adults Must hold a valid driver’s license Willing to work shift assigned, weekends, and holidays 
The Marketing Director qualifies for a Performance-Based Bonus Program! Frontier Management, LLC has an established Performance Based Bonus program for our community’s Marketing Director that incentivizes diligent efforts and outcomes, which positively impact the Company and its future, by striving to control costs, maintain high levels of resident satisfaction and reaching high census targets.Frontier Management offers a competitive salary and a work environment that encourages initiative and fosters respect. Frontier Management, LLC offers medical, dental, vision, life/AD&D, Flexible Spending Account, Short Term Disability, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, and Hospital Indemnity Insurance. We also offer a 401(k) plan with a competitive Match program. To discover more about the Frontier Management team, please visit our site at www.frontiermgmt.comEqual Opportunity Employer/ Drug-Free Workplace

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
The Paper Store is committed to being the premiere destination for all of our customer’s gift-giving needs. Our mission is to share our passion for The Paper Store with each customer, during each visit, by going above and beyond their expectations for both selection and service. As the Digital Marketing Specialist, you will work as part of our broader Marketing team to develop and manage digital, email and SMS campaigns efficiently, measure performance and aim to drive online and in-store traffic and sales while promoting overall brand goals. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated, proactive, and creative individual with a solid analytics background. Strong organization and time-management skills are a must.The Digital Marketing Specialist reports directly to the Digital Marketing Manager.Competencies Accountability: Demonstrates a sense of corporate responsibility. Takes personal ownership and responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work. Ensures that actions are consistent with words.Communication: Communicates information with consistency and clarity; uses active listening to effectively understand and provide feedback. Adjusts communication style to suit the audience to promote engagement and increase understanding.Creativity and Initiative: Forward-thinking, recognizes opportunities and finds new ways of doing things and implements improvements whenever possible. Encourages creativity and innovation.Professionalism: Maintains a professional and positive manner even under changing or uncertain conditions. Works well with a wide range of individuals to provide support, encouragement and direction. Engages others to accomplish organizational and departmental goals. Is seen as a role model.Personal Development: Displays self-awareness, a high level of energy, persistence and a positive outlook. Continuously seeks ways to improve and learns from mistakes and constructive feedback.
Key Responsibilities Be a brand ambassador for The Paper Store Be a key stakeholder with Marketing, Buyers, Operations, and Design to brainstorm and execute top objectives for the omnichannel business with high visibility and impact. Showcase a variety of brand stories and seasonal commercial priorities as defined by the brand and eCommerce marketing teams. Pitch strategic planning decisions backed by data and creation of monthly digital cadence, translating business priorities to develop an email/SMS marketing calendar, including audience definition, scheduling frequency/recommendations, and test plans that maximize business results.Create designer work orders and collaborate in creative brief sessions to convey creative direction and ensure brand-appropriate outcome in consumer-facing asset. Work in the CDP editor to ensure email/SMS best practices are observed.End-to-End development and deployment of email and SMS marketing programs directly within the platform, creation of lead focused email and SMS offers, A/B testing, social media amplification, campaign reporting, marketing calendar management, and project management. Create weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reporting that clearly communicates results & insights to identify opportunities to increase channel revenue.Continuously identify opportunities for efficacy and conduct research on best practices and benchmarks to drive best in class email, SMS, and store marketing. Support full-funnel on behavior-based triggers, promotional, informative, acquisition, retention, remarketing, and prospecting efforts to enhance the consumer journey and drive customer lifetime value and brand affinity. Implement personalization strategies on digital marketing campaigns to increase performance in key KPIs for email, SMS, and other digital campaigns. Responsible for ongoing management of inbox placement and development of strategies to ensure optimal deliverability.Communicates trends internally and externally to digital marketing teams and internal marketing teams on key objectives as well as any marketing strategic changes.Maintain email/SMS campaigns and templates within the CDP and be responsible for organizing the assets for email/SMS-related images, icons, and other features within the CMS. Performs other duties as required/assigned by Manager.
Job Requirements Bachelor’s Degree2+ years of related experience in digital marketingExperience working within marketing automation platforms or content management systemsCommunicate effectively regarding current project status, issues, concerns, etc. Effective verbal and written communication on all levels both internally and externally. Thorough understanding of email marketing principles and best practicesSelf-motivated, analytical, quick learner, organized, detail oriented, multi-taskerPrioritizes workload and meets deadlines for a variety of marketing “deliverables”. Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Detail oriented, self-starter, curious and innovative mindset with the ability to react quickly to changing priorities without full guidance.Thrives in a fast-paced environment and is good at dealing with ambiguity.Data-driven, analytical, and solution oriented.Ability to work 3+ days/week at the Corporate Office in Acton, MAProfessional presentation in attire, demeanor, and appearance
The Paper Store is an equal-opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability, age, veteran status, or any other classification protected by state, local or federal law.We are looking to hire a full-time Digital Marketing Specialist at the Corporate Office in Acton, MA!

Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Do you welcome a challenge and thrive in a fast-paced environment, with projects that vary from day to day? Is thinking outside-of-the-box is your MO to get people’s attention and you love collaborating within a team. Audi and Porsche Beaverton are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Marketing Assistant. As a key member of our marketing department, you will provide crucial support in executing marketing campaigns, managing digital platforms, developing sales strategies, and conducting market research. Your strong organizational skills, creativity, and ability to multitask will contribute to the success of our marketing initiatives and help us achieve our business goals. If your working style is “go-getter” and you have the experience to back it up, then you could be the Marketing Assistant we’re looking for!Responsibilities  Assist in the development and implementation of marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, print, social media, and email marketing.  Coordinate and manage content creation, including writing, editing, and proofreading marketing materials such as blog posts, social media posts, newsletters, and advertisements.  Conduct market research to identify target audiences, industry trends, and competitor activities.  Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and provide recommendations for improvement.  Support the maintenance and update of company websites, ensuring accurate and engaging content.  Manage social media accounts, including content scheduling, community engagement, and monitoring online conversations.  Assist in the creation and distribution of marketing collateral, such as brochures, flyers, and promotional materials.  Support the planning and execution of events, trade shows, and other marketing initiatives.  Collaborate with internal teams, including sales and HR, to ensure brand consistency and effective communication.  Monitor and respond to customer inquiries and feedback received through various channels.  Stay updated on marketing industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.  Assist with administrative tasks, preparing reports, and maintaining marketing databases. 
Requirements  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred.  Proven experience as a marketing assistant or in a similar role is advantageous.  Strong written and verbal communication skills.  Proficient in using marketing software and tools, including social media management platforms, email marketing platforms, and analytics tools.  Knowledge of digital marketing channels and strategies, including social media, content marketing, and SEO.  Familiarity with graphic design software, such as Adobe Creative Suite, is a plus.  Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.  Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.  Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite.  Positive attitude, adaptability, and eagerness to learn and grow in a dynamic marketing environment. 
We Offer The Following Benefits  Competitive pay plan  Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance  Life insurance  PTO after 90 days of employment  Paid Holidays  Career advancement opportunities  Paid training programs  Employee discount programs  401K

All employment is contingent on successful completion of drug and background screening. We participate in E-Verify.

Title: Team Coordinator, Finance and Marketing
JobDescription:
Nursa is a healthcare platform that directly addresses the severe staffing challenges confronting the U.S. healthcare system by connecting qualified registered nurses (RNs), licensed practical nurses (LPNs), and certified nursing assistants (CNAs) seeking flexible work with facilities in need of help. Founded in 2019, we are a rapidly expanding venture backed startup whose mission is to put a nurse at the bedside of every patient in need. With your help, we will be able to enrich the lives of nurses and be a valued partner in delivering effective, compassionate patient care in every market we serve.Role overview:At Nursa, we thrive when our people thrive. We’re seeking a Team Coordinator to be the supportive force that empowers our Finance and Marketing Organizations.. This team coordinator will support with scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, and taking minutes. They will also be responsible for tracking team progress on projects, coordinating cross-team initiatives, and managing travel and logistics. The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem solver, have excellent communication skills and a meticulous attention to detail, and be incredibly organized. They will have previous experience supporting an executive leader with a large and growing team.Responsibilities: Manage complex calendars - including the scheduling of internal and external meetings Be an active contributor to team meetings, taking notes and tracking action itemsDevelop and maintain strong relationships with team members; provide support and guidance as neededBe a cultural champion for the teamOrganize in-person and virtual team gatheringsCoordinate travel arrangements; draft detailed travel itineraries and provide remote assistance with logistics, travel and food arrangements where neededManage expense reports, including ensuring the timely review and submission of expenses
Qualifications: 2 years experience in administrative role reporting directly to upper managementSuperb written and verbal communication skillsMeticulous attention to detailAn expert planner & organizer with strong time-management skills and the ability to organize and coordinate multiple projects at onceProficiency in Google Suite and other office productivity tools (e.g. Asana, JIRA, or similar), with aptitude to learn new software and systemsSomeone who is willing to immerse themselves in the team; adaptable and enjoys a challenge
What you get in return: Opportunity to revolutionize healthcare industry and build both relationships and teams that make a tangible impact We empower team members to act intelligently and be owners, believing that execution is everything, and have designed a learning-focused environment where you get ongoing support and regular feedback to help you growAn opportunity to join an international team with a work culture that is based on trust, flexibility, and curiosityCompetitive salary and benefits
Closing:Nursa is an equal opportunity employer. We aim to build a workforce of individuals from different backgrounds, with different abilities, identities, and mindsets. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply!

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionGoodwill of Southwestern Pennsylvania and North Central West Virginia is a nonprofit organization that funds job training, education, and other community programs by selling donated clothing and household items in Goodwill stores and online. We offer life-changing work on a mission-minded team. We are 1,000 working as one and each of us is essential to helping our community thrive. For three years running, Goodwill has been named to Forbes’ list of America’s “Most Inspiring Companies”.We offer a wide range of career opportunities from entry level to management in retail, human services, and administrative fields. Learn more about working at Goodwill. You can help. We can show you how.Position SummaryThe Marketing Specialist supports Goodwill SWPA and NCWV by coordinating and implementing assigned marketing projects & brand standards. The marketing coordinator participates in creating mission & brand awareness through advertising and promotions for retail, human services, and talent acquisition.Duties Include But Are Not Limited To Work with relevant staff to plan and execute promotional calendar and advertising planCoordinate and execute events such as store openings and other events as assigned.Conduct audits at all facilities to ensure that Goodwill SWPA and NCWV locations meet the brand standards set by Goodwill’s Marketing Department with regards to signage and messaging.Design and produce marketing collateral including signage, posters, flyers, emails etc., in conjunction with outsourced graphic designer as needed.Coordinate all aspects of store events, including signing, advertising, direct mail, etc. and conduct pre- and post-opening store audits to ensure compliance with marketing and retail standards.Work with Marketing Manager and stakeholders to establish communication plans targeted at both internal and external audiences.
External Hiring Range: $41,745.60 up to $43,415.42/yearTravel: Occasional travel may be required to Goodwill sites in Southwestern Pennsylvania and North Central West Virginia.Schedule: Monday through Friday (8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.). Schedule can vary depending on department needs.Qualifications  High school diploma or equivalent AND 5 years of experience required. OR Associate’s degree AND 3 years of experience required. OR Bachelor’s degree AND 1 year of experience required. 
Preferred Education: marketing, communications, or related field.Required Experience: must be in graphic design, retail, or general marketing.Preferred Experience: Adobe Suite, Constant Contact, Microsoft Office Suite, and Customer Service.Required Clearances, Licenses, And Certifications Candidates are expected to provide current, valid clearances (Child Abuse, FBI Fingerprints, and PATCH) prior to first day of employment.

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Exciting Remote Product Marketing Manager Opportunity in Software! Would you like to work at an incredible company that is dedicated to deliver on our mission to DOUBLE our Company size and performance over the next three years? Hawk Ridge Systems, an industry leader and one of the top Worldwide Resellers for DS SOLIDWORKS, has been providing intelligent state-of-the art 3D solutions for superior product design, engineering, and manufacturing companies for 25+ years. At Hawk Ridge Systems, we’re not only dedicated to helping our customers grow, we are also committed to challenging ourselves to develop new skills and reach new heights while priding ourselves on providing many career development opportunities throughout our Company!Due to our incredible growth plans, Hawk Ridge Systems is looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our amazing Marketing team! As the Product Marketing Manager at Hawk Ridge Systems, you will be responsible for defining strategies to deliver both the critical thinking and tactical execution. You are energized as much by campaign launches as you are by the collaboration required to get there. You will serve as the connective tissue between product, marketing, sales, and strategy to be the catalyst that unlocks the potential for client, product and company success. Your due diligence includes a keen understanding of user needs, competitors and industry trends to inform the marketing roadmap, positioning and audience growth strategies. You will serve as the strategic voice guiding the development of compelling and differentiated messaging, value propositions and competitive positioning for your product and solution portfolio. Your project management skills are the key to success as you balance and prioritize overlapping projects. You are flexible and humble and can address any problem through resourcefulness, compassion and professionalism. This role reports to the Director, Product Marketing.Powerful people skills and content marketing expertise are core to the role. You will focus on narratives driven by market insights, competitive analysis, and strategic product direction. Day-to-day responsibilities include partnership management and execution, communication with cross functional teams to align on strategy, and tracking towards goals, as well as working with the creative, content, and performance marketing teams to execute your strategy. You will also own interpreting and distributing data for all your marketing-related activity. By doing so, you have a direct role in driving the success of our company's growth strategy.At Hawk Ridge Systems our culture is driven by our core values – Being People Centric, caring about our team members, customers, and our community; Driving Excellence for ourselves and our customers; and Staying Stragile by seizing opportunities and challenges and adapting quickly. If these values are engrained in your core and you aspire to work at a fun, empowering, and dynamic Company, this is a fantastic opportunity for you to make an impact!WHAT DO I NEED FOR SUCCESS IN THIS PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER ROLE? Bachelor’s degree OR equivalent combination of education and experience (see below for requirements):  If your Bachelor’s degree is in Marketing, you must have a minimum of 2 year of partner marketing experience If you do NOT have a degree in Marketing, you’ll need a minimum of 5 years of marketing experience, with at least 1 year of product marketing or business development experience
Content marketing planning experience Project management experience Autonomous, self-driven, detail-oriented, excellent communicator with outstanding time management and interpersonal skills (empathetic, team player, problem solver with excellent relationship building and sales skills) Preferred, but not required: experience or a strong affinity for working closely with Sales Teams 
MORE REASONS TO JOIN THE HAWK RIDGE SYSTEMS TEAM! Excellent Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, and Long-Term Disability Insurance Competitive Compensation Package 401(k) plan with Company Match Excellent Time-Off Benefits, including Vacation, Paid Sick time, Paid Parental Leave, and Paid Holidays (plus your birthday and community service days off!) Excellent Training, Onboarding, Mentoring, and Coaching Amazing growth opportunities provides unlimited opportunities for Career Development Work at a Fun, Successful, Growing Company with a Team-focused Culture Family Friendly work/life Integration: We give you the flexibility you need to succeed 
If you would love being surrounded by the best minds in the industry and want to help drive our company’s success while thriving & growing your career, apply for our Product Marketing Manager role today! Hawk Ridge Systems has determined that the new hire range for this role is between $61,200 and $71,298. Your base pay will be based on a number of factors, including knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Since we appreciate transparency, we are sharing that we expect to hire for this position up to mid-range (dependent on experience/location), which will allow you the opportunity to progress as you grow in your career. Additionally, since base pay is only one part of our total compensation and benefits package, we invite you to review all of the amazing benefits (above) that Hawk Ridge Systems offers, such as paid time off for your birthday, community service, paid parental leave, company match 401(k), etc.Hawk Ridge Systems is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. In accordance with anti-discrimination law, it is the purpose of this policy to effectuate these principles and mandates. Hawk Ridge Systems prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Hawk Ridge Systems conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.#LI Remote
Skills: Business Development, Communication, Competitive Analysis, Digital Marketing, Interpersonal Skills, Market Planning, Marketing Analytics, Positioning (Marketing), Product Marketing, Relationship Building

Title: Digital Marketing & Demand Generation
JobDescription:
We are the Commercial Intelligence industry leader and the first to do it! We help brands use data to drive business growth, and we do this using a combination of technology and expert guidance that helps companies make the best possible decisions. Our Commercial Decision Platform GPS-Enterprise is the machine that turns data into actionable insights and our ROI Genome is our proprietary intelligence layer comprised of 20+ years of Analysis, Insights, and Learning. We measure the impact of Product, Sales, Operations, Customer Data and outside factors such as competitors, economic changes, seasonality, consumer mobility, and more to deliver impact. Our customers drive business growth by leveraging our technology and expert analyst!We’re growing fast, with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Miami, Denver, Charlottesville, Dallas, Dublin, London, Paris, Hamburg, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore, and Shanghai.As a Digital Marketing & Demand Generation Manager at Analytic Partners, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our online presence, driving customer engagement, and generating high-quality MQLs. In partnership with the head of global demand generation, you will develop the digital marketing strategy and execute the plan. You will work closely with other members of the marketing team and cross-functionally, including product, marketing operations, creative, sales and customer engagement teams. A successful Digital Marketing Manager has a deep understanding of paid media channels, is creative and has excellent communication skills. You will understand the lead lifecycle and work to optimize the funnel from inquiry to MQL, SQL and to closed/won opportunities.What We Value In You You’ve got positive energy and you’re passionate about working with data. You’re optimistic about the future of using data to make informed business decisions. You’re never tired of learning and are always looking for ways to grow personally and professionallyYou thrive in collaborative work environments . You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other.You can pivot on the fly. Analytics is constantly changing, and we need to keep adapting and evolving that change too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you.You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Do you enjoy owning a problem and see it as an opportunity to innovate and challenge the status quo? We’re all about harnessing innovation and are constantly looking for ways to improve.You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.
What You’ll Be Doing Lead paid acquisition efforts that optimize and diversify our digital media program with budgets exceeding $1M; must have a strong pulse on evolving paid channels and algorithm changes. Extensive hands-on experience with a range of marketing and ABM tools, including: Google Ads, Google Analytics, LinkedIn, DemandBase, SFDC, and HubSpot, just to name a few.Manage budget and media planning, forecasting, testing and measurement plans, ongoing analysis and presentation of results and insights. Identify and implement strategies to save money on paid search (SEM) through effective SEO practices.Work with demand generation to develop and oversee strategies for landing page, ad copy and audience targeting. Collaborate with content creators and developers to optimize website content and structure for search engine visibility.Manage and maintain our social media profiles and public-facing assets, including the company website, LinkedIn, AngelList, Vimeo, Glassdoor, blog posts, etc.Work with the marketing team to create compelling marketing assets such as collateral, product demos, newsletters, distribution lists, etc.Leverage our CRM system as a more effective marketing channel to nurture leads, increase customer engagement, and drive conversions.Work with Marketing Operations and Finance teams to report out on key business metrics, manage growth spend and efficiencies. Collaborate with the sales team to align marketing efforts with the customer journey and optimize lead management processes. Manage external vendor relationships as needed.
What We Look For In You At least 4- 6 years experience in digital marketing in B2B enterprise SaaS or technology related industry Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, or a related field.Proven hands-on experience managing paid acquisition programs (SEO, SEM, SMO, PPC) and optimizing ad spend across channels.Track record for managing budgets and reporting on those budgets. Proficiency with analytics tools, such as Google Analytics (certified preferred), LinkedIn Campaign Manager and a strong understanding of conversion rate optimization methodologies.Familiarity with SEO best practices and tools.Proficient in managing social media platforms and leveraging them for brand promotion and lead generation.Experience collaborating with design resources on creative with a clear opinion on the best performing approach.Experience in developing digital marketing assets and managing a company's online presence. Knowledge of CRM systems and their application in marketing strategies.Flexible to work within a high growth team.
Our Company Values And CultureOur differentiator is – Our People! We hire the brightest talent and develop them into leaders. We foster a culture of PEOPLE, PASSION and GROWTH.People: We value our people, clients, and partnersPassion: We love what we doGrowth: Unlimited growth means unlimited potentialAP is a client-focused, team-oriented organization where innovation and results are rewarded, and individuals can chart the course of their own careers.As a woman-owned and led company, this has meant supporting a meritocracy where everyone has opportunities to achieve their best and ensure we foster an environment of diversity, equity, and inclusion. In practice this means we will not only work to recruit a diverse workforce, but also maximize the full potential of all of our people. You can read more about our commitment to DEI hereAdditionally, Analytic Partners participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Title: Marketing/Proposal Coordinator
JobDescription:

JMT, currently ranked #59 on Engineering News-Record’s list of the Top 500 Design Firms.For more than 50 years, JMT has worked with federal, state, and local agencies to provide professional infrastructure services that turn visions into realities for the betterment of our clients, communities, environment, and employee owners. JMT is committed to building long-lasting relationships with our clients and our internal teams.We are looking for a motivated Marketing/Pursuit Coordinator to join us in the Texas region.
