Title: Marketing Liaison
JobDescription:
Job Type: Full-timeBenefits Offered: HealthcareDentalVisionPTO
Your Job SummaryThe Marketing Liason will be responsible for building referral source relationships in a variety of settings, such as hospitals, clinics, and senior-service related organization within the community. To build and grow census and quality mix by developing the market, working with acute care and other referral sources and providing prospective residents and/or responsible parties with appropriate information and assistance to choosing the nursing center.Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, health care or related business field preferred. Minimum of 2 years direct sales experience targeted to physicians, hospital personnel and case managers preferred. Proven success in personally developing referrals for a medical product from health care target markets (physicians, hospitals and case managers). Evidence of a local referral network from which to develop referrals. Experience with local community groups preferred
Responsibilities  Expand community base and develop referral relationships with but not limited to: senior-service organizations, case managers/discharge planners from hospitals, rehabs and nursing homes, adult day care centers, geriatric physicians, assisted living, retirement communities, etc. Understand local industry trends to represent and differentiate the company and its services in the market. Takes an active role in developing the marketing plan and budget with VP of Business Development by assessing community needs, outlining marketing strategy/objectives, identifying major competitors and identifying specific marketing action items with measurable goals. Develop relationships with a growing base of referral sources, leading to a consistent flow of quality referrals to the center. Majority of time (95%) allocated to external sales development. Effectively utilizes CMR Company tool to maintain accurate and up to date information on the CRM tools. Maintains a thorough knowledge of the center’s products, services, capabilities and physician relations. Takes active role in business meetings. Meets weekly with Administrator/department heads to discuss marketing opportunities, concerns and solutions. Meets regularly with nursing to discuss clinical service levels. Evaluates center physical environment through weekly rounds and discusses with Administrator. . Maintains awareness of admitting and attending physician’s opinions and challenges. Maintains an active involvement in the community organizations and associations. Evaluated on: Total Revenue is at/above budget, Quality Mix (Private, Medicare, Insurance) at/above budget, Total occupancy at/above budget, Medicare-Private conversions met objective, Sales calls met/exceeded goal. Maintains up-to-date customer profiles on existing referral sources. Conducts lead generating seminars which target potential quality inquiries. Schedules and leads effective presentations. Captures and follows up on seminar leads. Reviews discharges for possible re-admission and actively manages high potential prospects. Ensures admissions are qualified clinically and financially. Oversees the admission process and appropriate paperwork in partnership with Admissions Coordinator.
Austin Wellness and Rehabilitation Center provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Marketing & Communication Specialist II
JobDescription:
DescriptionIt is a very exciting time at our agency, some of the things you can look forward to as an employee with the Nebraska Department of Environment and Energy:  A new office building at Fallbrook with free parking, Flexible work schedules You will be doing work knowing you are making a difference for current and future generations.
Are you passionate about preserving, enhancing, and protecting Nebraska’s environment? If so, please consider a career with the State of Nebraska at the Department of Environment and Energy (NDEE). At NDEE, employees have the opportunity to work with a dynamic and supportive team of mission-focused individuals tasked with maintaining, restoring, and enhancing the quality of Nebraska’s air, land, water, and energy resources.The Nebraska Department of Environment and Energy has a full-time opportunity available in the Superfund/Voluntary Cleanup Program Section.What you will do!The successful candidate will be part of a team that creates communications content and coordinates department activities or functions that inform the public, news media, governmental/program officials, and state employees of issues and/or the agency’s objectives, policies, and/or programs; and coordinates public information operations for a multi-program agency with its other operations.What’s in it for you!Permanent Teammate BenefitsThe opportunity to work in a productive and creative environment where no two days are ever the same. We offer a competitive benefits package. 12 days of vacation during first year of service (accruals increase with years of service), 12 days of sick leave during first year of service (accruals increase with years of service), and 13 paid holidays per year.  Health Insurance Dental Insurance Vision Insurance WellNebraska Health Plan Direct Primary Care (DPC) Mail order Rx (3 month supply) and Specialty Pharmacy program Virtual Visits and FREE Nurse line 24 hours a day 7 days a week Employee Assistance Program Retirement/Investment Plan Early Retirement Insurance Program (55 and older) Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Health Savings Account Flexible Spending Accounts Life and AD&D Insurance Tuition Assistance* LinkedIn Learning Access to 16,000+ On-Demand Courses Direct Deposit of Payroll Nebraska State Employees Credit Union Deferred Compensation Plan Paid Holidays Vacation, Sick, Civil, and Injury Leave Military Training or Emergency Duty Leave Teammate Discount Program Charitable Giving through Payroll DeductionCoverage is effective the first of the month following 30 days of employment.
For a complete listing of job duties, requirements, and to apply, go to statejobs.nebraska.govLocation and address of position: 245 Fallbrook Blvd., Ste 100 – Lincoln, NEWork schedule: Monday – Friday – 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. Flexible schedule, remote work, and 10-hour workdays allowed after six-month probation and/or with management approval.Examples of Work  Plans and coordinates public and internal information functions and/or activities within the agency to meet project deadlines, facilitate co-action with other program activities, keep the agency staff informed, and ensure that agency public information priorities and goals are achieved.  Researches and determines the scope, nature, and target audience of agency public information functions and activities, to facilitate the development and implementation of an appropriate approach for disseminating public information.  Writes, designs, composes, edits, researches, compiles, and/or selects copy and layout for informational/administrative publications, audio-visual material, media releases, displays, exhibits, and/or speeches, to organize data so that it will reach and be understood by the target audience.  Arranges publication space or broadcast time and preparation of informational material to schedule and coordinate the development and dissemination of agency and program information to the public.  Presents and/or schedules presentations of public information to news media representatives, governmental/program officials, or interested citizen groups to release information, educate people, and elicit feedback on the agency mission and programs and to stimulate participation and support for agency goals and activities.  Assigns and reviews the public-information-related work of technical production and office support staff members to arrange for story subjects, facilitate completion of project assignments, and ensure accuracy and completeness of writing, typing, photography, and printing.  Develops and recommends policies and procedures to agency management to increase the impact and effectiveness of agency public information functions and activities.  Advises agency management on public relations to discuss potential and actual reaction to and impact of agency information releases and suggest alternative approaches for disseminating information.  Reviews legislation, rules, and policy and program statements to determine the impact on agency public information functions and assess comprehension by target audiences.  Confers with news media representatives to discuss agency public information needs, develop and maintain contacts, and facilitate the dissemination of agency and program information through the mass media.  Coordinates promotional materials for newspapers, radio, television, outdoor and business and industry to develop appropriate preparation and dissemination procedures and ensure that they are followed. 
Qualifications / RequirementsREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree in journalism, communications, marketing, public relations, advertising, graphic arts, digital media, videography, or related field and at least one year of experience in coordinating, planning, and managing public relations/publicity campaigns, mass media communication activities and/or public information programs. Required experience may substitute for the education on a year for year basis.PREFERRED: Experience with public relations and public information; experience with writing and editing; experience with website management; experience with communication on social media; experience with video production; experience with graphic design.OTHER: Valid driver’s license or ability to provide independent transportation, minimal travel requirement; ability to lift 25 pounds; regular and reliable attendance required.Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesKnowledge of: the principles and practices of journalism; the principles and practices of public relations; the techniques of layout design; the principles and practices of electronic and social media communication; the principles and practices of visual reproduction such as photography, graphics, or printing; graphic design software; the techniques of online layout; website design and maintenance; the principles and practices of video production with the ability to shoot, write and edit video content; the English language including spelling, punctuation, sentence structure, word usage and grammar; the techniques, formats, and styles of public information dissemination; agency operations, rules, policies, and objectives; agency program legislation and goals; statewide and local media sources and operations including appropriate contact persons, possible costs, and publication/broadcast deadlines; reference sources including agency reference material and external information sources; the inter-relationships of agency public information functions/activities and state/local program activities .Ability to: communicate effectively in individual or group settings with news media representatives, governmental or program officials, agency staff, and the public, at levels understandable to each audience; apply the principles and practices of public relations/journalism to operation of a public information function; skillfully operate audio and/or visual equipment; operate electronic hardware and software appropriate for online information development and delivery, including audio and visual formats; write/edit copy to fit assigned space in a layout; compare finished product with established standards and/or original to identify errors; evaluate the public information potential of written, illustrative, and related material for a specific project assignment; develop the information dissemination approach most likely to reach the target audience; assess the impact and effectiveness of specific public information materials or activities in meeting the interests of the public or media and the needs of the agency; develop and apply agency policies and procedures for the public information function; assign and review the work of others; plan and organize the operations of a public information function; coordinate the various aspects of design from layout to design to paste-up.

Title: Marketing & Communications VISTA (Lewisville,TX)
JobDescription:
The Texas Association of Charitable Clinics, (TXACC) founded in 2003 is a private, not for profit 501(c)3 membership association that supports Texas' free and charitable clinics. Through mentoring, the provision of resources and education and advocacy efforts, TXACC seeks to strengthen the charitable clinic network in Texas. The Texas Association of Charitable Clinics VISTA Program is looking to place individuals who are committed to national service and public health in the clinics throughout Texas that are dedicated to providing quality healthcare services to low-income individuals. Title: Marketing Automation Specialist
JobDescription:
Position : Marketing Automation Specialist, Web & Digital MarketingDepartment: Web & Digital MarketingReports to:  Senior Marketing Automation Manager Location : U.S. based Remote (see location requirements below)Who We AreCouncil on International Education and Exchange (CIEE) is a nonprofit study abroad and intercultural exchange organization that transforms lives and builds bridges between individuals and nations through study abroad and international exchange experiences that help people develop skills for living in a globally interdependent and culturally diverse world.Why Work With Us  You will change the world . CIEE builds bridges between different people, different countries, and different cultures. We help young people participate in high-quality international exchange and study abroad programs that bring the world together. We change lives, our alumni change the world. Be part of the change!  You will receive a competitive total rewards package (only applicable for U.S. employees). CIEE provides all employees with exceptional benefits offerings that increase total compensation by up to 25%. Our top-tier benefits include:  Paid time off and Parental leave  Gym Reimbursement Program  Employee Assistance Program  Short-term & Long-term Disability  6 floating Fridays (based on our eligibility rules)  CIEE Study Abroad and TEFL Program discounts  403(b) Retirement Plan with employer contribution  Insurance Coverage (life, travel, medical, dental, and vision)  Flexible Spending Accounts/Health Savings Accounts (medical and dependent)  Voluntary Benefits (identity theft protection, pet insurance, accident, and critical illness) 

 You will be part of a fast-paced, international, diverse, and collaborative team of professionals. CIEE operates the largest nonprofit network of study-abroad locations, with facilities and staff in 26 countries. Additionally, we help international participants from over 130 countries come to the USA each year. Committed to excellence and solving whatever problem the world throws at them, CIEE professionals work on international teams and are dedicated to advancing our 75-year-old mission to make the world a more peaceful place. 
Who You AreCIEE is seeking a Marketing Automation Specialist. This is a full-time, salaried non-exempt position responsible for assisting in the development and implementation of marketing automation strategies that provide operational structure and functionality for marketing activities including digital advertising, nurture and triggered email campaigns. Marketing Automation Specialist will work closely with the entire Web and Digital Marketing team and the business stakeholders, reporting to the Senior Marketing Automation Manager.What You’ll Do Providing marketing automation support and troubleshooting for the Web and Digital Marketing team within Marketo and SalesforceEngage in regular campaign and nurture operational, integrity analysis and reportingCollaborate with digital marketing and web producers, IT and business stakeholders in the planning, development and implementation of sophisticated nurture campaignsPerform regular data structure maintenance within Marketo to ensure system optimizationIdentify opportunities for marketing and sales outreach through regular data analysis and reviewDevelop understanding of CIEE business requirements, sales processes and KPI'sProvide documentation and reporting for marketing and sales activities via digital campaigns
What You’ll BringThe ideal candidate will possess: Bachelor's degree required, preferably in marketing, communications, or a related field.A minimum of one to three years of experience in marketing automation, or a related field.International travel and/or study abroad experience preferred, but not required.Marketing Activities knowledge including smart list functions and flow step capabilityDesign Studio knowledge of landing page, form, and email template maintenanceDatabase knowledge for leading historical research and troubleshootingUnderstanding of segmentation and dynamic content constructionUnderstanding of web parameter trackingUnderstanding of custom and standard objectsAbility to build lead lists and reports based on criteriaKnowledge of Marketo Sales Insight capabilities 1 of 2Ability to understand and navigate Salesforce setup controlsStrong proficiency in MS Office Visio, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint are required.Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.Ability to set priorities, multitask and pay strong attention to detail.Professional, creative, flexible, collaborative, and high energy. Readiness to grow and develop yourself, our client group, and our Company  Ability to embrace CIEE’s Core Values (Excellence, Integrity, Respect, Inclusion, and Problem-Solving) and culture 
Location Requirements:The position is available to candidates in the United States, except for candidates residing in: New York (State and City)Washington (State)ColoradoCaliforniaJersey City, NJ
Diversity MattersCIEE believes that diversity matters and that professionals with diverse backgrounds provide diverse approaches and ideas to solving problems and finding ways to advance our mission to bring the world together. Candidates from underrepresented groups with diverse backgrounds and experiences are strongly encouraged to apply.Due to federal regulations a background check will be conducted as a condition of employment.

Job DescriptionThe Communications and Marketing Associate helps develop and implements communications strategies, approved by the Dean and Pardee School leadership, which will facilitate the production of internal and external communications and publicity. Responsibilities include management of the School website and other electronic outlets, including social media; writing, reporting, and production of written and graphical content for all electronic and print mediums for internal and external distribution; media relationship management; event publicity; and implementation of School-wide communication strategies. The Specialist also advises Pardee faculty and staff on issues related to communication strategies and implementation. This position will be expected to seek out opportunities for publicity for the School and provide proposals on School Communications Strategy. This position reports to the Manager of Strategic Initiative & Special Projects.Content Production: Report and produce written and graphical content for all web and print outlets for internal and external distribution. Content includes written material for website and social media, graphics, email communications, newsletters, print media, such as newsletters, press releases, information about faculty accomplishments and research, etc. Regularly update materials. Manage web-based calendar listings of events, deadlines, etc. Develop assigned corporate level School publications and manage dissemination. This includes material produced directly by the Pardee School, or as requested by other BU units.Web Management: Manage School website and other electronic outlets, including social media accounts. Provide regular and timely updates to material and news content including writing news stories and developing accompanying graphics. Edit all material carefully for clarity and quality. Increase visibility and web traffic through basic SEO (search engine optimization) practices. Maintain stylistic consistency across various School-related websites and social media. Work closely with faculty and staff in the School and its units on developing material for the website including its news feed. Will work as primary liaison for relevant offices across the University including Interactive Design, on website issues. The incumbent for this position must be very savvy in the advantages of electronic media and social networking for the sake of creating and expanding good publicity for the Pardee SchoolMedia Management: Maintain contacts and relationships with local, national, and international media outlets, as well as internal media units. Develop and maintain relationships with media outlet to improve media coverage of School activities and activities of faculty, students, and units. Duties include generating leads, pitching stories, managing interviews, writing for websites, and providing information and background research.Advertising and Marketing: Work with Dean of Pardee School and others on developing and updating ongoing marketing strategy utilizing print, radio, online and social channels. Create original marketing content. Liaise with BU Marketing and Communications, as directed, for creation and preparation of placed ads. Research best practices and strategies for re-marketing and targeting specific audiences. This position will be expected to seek out opportunities for publicity and make proposals which will include logistics, pricing, and benefits.Communication Coordination: Ensure University policies and guidelines are followed School wide including in all units and centers affiliated with the Pardee School. Assist all units and Centers in the School in establishing brand integrity and quality control for all communication activities (print and electronic). Serve as lead for communication coordination with staff with communication responsibilities in the various units of the School and provide advice for focused and timely communication of their activities on website and social media. Maintain School-wide calendar of communication activities in coordination with other units and centers in the School. Work closely with special events and projects team and unit administrators to ensure consistency in communication activities.Event Publicity: Collaborate with event planning teams within the Dean's Office and administrators within School's units to implement effective and timely strategies to publicize events. Create print and web outreach materials to advertise, promote, and then report on events. Advise administrators on event communication management and ensure adherence to School and University communication styles and policies.Required Skills B.A./B.S. required, Master's preferred.Excellent writing skills; a writing sample is required for consideration.Graphic design and/or web design experience preferred with five to eight years of experience.
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military service, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, or because of marital, parental, or veteran status. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Title: Marketing Manager (Pharmceutical)
JobDescription:
POSITION SUMMARY:  The individual in this position is responsible for the strategic and tactical planning, organization, implementation and management of marketing activities to the Pharmaceutical Marketplace and in addition will provide leadership to increase all of product line(s) market share in THE COMPANY's territory. This individual must be able to discern US market trends and guide THE COMPANY in this direction. Incumbent will be a team player with energy to lead the tactical marketing efforts of THE COMPANY by building strong relationships and cooperation with other departments within THE COMPANY (USA), other subsidiaries, 3 rd party partners, collaborators and especially the field Sales team. There will be some corporate selling involved, which includes but is not limited to, travel with the general sales force.   There may be other   related duties the company from time to time.   The position is to provide leadership and   direction to strategic and tactical marketing of THE COMPANY. This person becomes part of the Senior Level Marketing Team and work together to increase the overall business of THE COMPANY. The candidate will  evaluate and determine future market and technological trends to increase the company   products   market share. The Marketing Manager will coordinate with  other departments and outside parties to ensure organized marketing activities utilizing all resources to produce business growth. Sales and Marketing Alignment is a major initiative.   This document attempts to communicate the traditional, physical and environment demands associated with this position. The company will consider reasonable accommodation including changing the way the job is traditionally performed whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity.   JOB FUNCTIONS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:   Develop short and long term marketing strategy for each Product line for the company Market in THE COMPANY's territory. (Monthly) Together with executive management, set targeted number of athe company products to be synchronized with sales revenue target for each half of a fiscal year. (Semi Annually) Monitor and implement mid. and short term strategies and tactics to attain the targeted number of the sales forecast. (Weekly) Create marketing plan and budget together with the other Marketing Managers and product managers to implement and developed long and mid. term strategies. (Quarterly) Manage various marketing campaigns aimed toward customers in the athe company market segment. This includes but not limited to email campaigns, lead nurturing campaigns, customer retention campaigns etc.. The use of CRM and Marketing Automation software as tools will be implemented.(Daily) To obtain and report metrics around various marketing campaigns. To inquire and determine why we are winning and losing sales opportunities. To evaluate new products for market fit and develop strategy to introduce them. This will be divided into projects to be performed locally within the USA and to be performed globally. (Monthly) To be an expert in understanding of market wants, needs and desires applicable to current and future trends within the industry and to communicate those needs to Corporate Headquarters. The use of various survey tools, customer observations and trade reports should be implemented. (Daily) Visit regional offices or distributors to evaluate their performance and to find what countermeasure is required to improve their performance of sales. (Quarterly) To contribute to exhibitions with tactics aimed toward the company market segment and in some cases to act as the lead Marketing Manager coordinating activities for the exhibition. This requires working with all the product managers and sales. (Monthly) To analyze THE COMPANY's performance and competition, to analysis the business environment, to identify new market entrants for determining the effects on long-term strategy. (Monthly) To advise regarding   market trend, competitive situation and   marketing and support issues   which will contribute to the company. (Monthly)  Coordinate relationship with other companies to improve THE COMPANY's business situation by global approach. (Quarterly)  The company in developing and maintaining relationship with third party partners and collaborators to improve at company Markets business. (Monthly)  Plan, coordinate and present technical marketing presentations at conferences, trade shows and at selected corporate, government and academic institutions. (Weekly)  Foster and track Collaborations with Key Opinion Leaders as it relates to a tactical business plan. (Weekly)  Work closely with Marketing Communications Department to plan, implement, and maintain a regular productions schedule of printed application notes, newsletter articles and other related technical marketing documents. (Daily)  Create and implement training programs aimed towards increasing our sales and technical staff in understanding the company market space. Alignment between sales and marketing requires that we deliver the same message to our customers. (Monthly) 
  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:  Incumbent must have a Bachelor's degree in Science   or business, while an advanced degree is highly preferred. Position requires at least eight (8) years prior successful history in management of sales and/or product marketing in analytical instrument business. Attention to detail and strong customer service skills are required along with a dependable work ethic.    SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Although this position has no direct reports it is expected that they are a role model of upper management. That is this person should garner the respect of all employees and external contacts. Personal integrity, work ethic and motivational energy are characteristics of the type of leader we expect. This is a senior level position and lack of personnel to manage is a reflection of the freedom this position requires to act freely without the additional burned to manage. Resource groups are available to be consulted as needed including Marketing Communications, Documentation, R&D, Safety and Training, and Business development.   KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS: CASUAL WORKING THOROUGH Japanese Culture Foreign Language Chemistry/Physics Negotiations Writing Skills Products Organization Administrative Procedures Market Knowledge Leadership Skills Organizational Skills Sales Skills Microsoft Dynamics CRM Computers/Software Product Knowledge Product Management Applications

Desired Skills and Experience
            PHARMACEUTICAL
Skills: Attention to Detail, Coordinating Activities, Exhibitions, Key Opinion Leaders, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Campaigns, Marketing Communications, Marketing Documents, Sales and Marketing, Strategic Marketing

Title: Communications & Marketing Staff - District 8
JobDescription:
About Our JobThe office of Councilmember-elect Shontel Lewis, who represents City Council District 8, is seeking a Communications and Marketing staff member who is a self-starter, and possesses excellent interpersonal communication, attention to detail, and exceptional writing skills. This individual has a dedicated work ethic and an inherent ability to maintain a professional, positive attitude in a fast-paced, changing work environment that includes reorganizing priorities to meet community and constituent needs.This is a full-time, at-will position.The position includes the core responsibilities of communications, event and project coordination, constituent services, and administrative duties. A Marketing and Communications staff member for City Council District 8 will be able to effectively time manage, prioritize, and lead in the below areas: Create, develops, and manage marketing content, which may include social and online media, print media, direct mail, newsletter, and other multimediaPrepare presentationsEvent planning, and attend community events; promote community engagementDevelop and implement communication and marketing campaignsPrepare and disseminates press releases/media advisories to local media, newsrooms, and public inquiriesManage and edit all photographs and video content for informational, creative, entertainment, advertising, and promotional purposesWrite, edit, and publish content for websites, videos, social media posts, and email campaignsManage search engine optimization of all social media content to increase visibility.Generate content that motivates, inspires, educates, and informs across a wide variety of digital platformsComplete other duties at the discretion of management
The budgeted compensation for this position is $56,000 - $63,000, annually.About YouCompensation will be commensurate with experience.Our ideal candidate is either familiar or has a desire to learn to navigate municipal government departments and agencies and is well-informed about the current political landscape in the District 8, Councilmember Lewis represents. This position requires a solid rapport with the district team and developing familiarity with constituents, community, and area stakeholders.Our ideal candidate will have: Strong organizational skills with managing deadlines and projectsExperience using one or more of the followingA graphic design platform (i.e., Adobe Creative Cloud, Canva)Email and marketing software platform (i.e., Mailchimp, Salesforce)Microsoft Office SuiteAbility to work flexible hours including weekend and after hours when needed
We realize your time is valuable, so please do not apply unless you have at least the following minimum qualifications: Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or a related fieldExperience: Minimum of one (1) year marketing and communications experienceEducation/Experience Equivalency: One (1) year of the appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for each required year of post-high school education. Additional appropriate education may be substituted for the minimum experience requirements
To be considered for this position, you must include the following on your job application (upload the attachment(s) to the Resume/CV section on the My Experience tab): Resume attachmentCover letter about your interest in this position, addressing the current political landscape in Denver and City Council District 9, or your interest in municipal government, that demonstrates your writing abilitiesWork samples you would like to share pertaining to Marketing and Communications (in a PDF format), or a weblink to your portfolio

Title: Local Store Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Since 1946, Milo's Hamburgers has been serving the Birmingham's BEST Burgers, that's over 50 years of commitment to Alabama and our Team Members.What’s our real secret sauce? Our people. We’re the ones who are always giving a little something extra, the ones who dare to do things a little differently. And the ones always striving to be warmer and more welcoming than expected.Why? Because to us, working at Milo’s is a lot more than just a job, it’s a chance to do something delicious.Milo’s is looking to hire an additional full-time Local Store Marketing Coordinator to help create community relationships with local businesses, schools, and non-profits. The initial responsibilities of the Local Store Marketing Coordinator will cover three to six of our 23 locations, but has the potential to grow after proven success. The LSM Coordinator will be heavily involved with planning, executing, and following thru on store specific promotions, events, and sponsorships to drive profitable sales and build brand recognition.While the majority of work will be in these three to six areas, the LSM coordinator will also get to experience other aspects of marketing, such as branding, advertising, media, product promotions, programming, and grand openings.If that sounds like something you would enjoy doing keep reading and submit your information! We would love to talk to you!You will: Manage local store marketing efforts from end-to-end, including project plan management, creative execution, scheduling, production, shipping/tracking, communication to the field, and assisting operations on local activation.  Establish strong relationships with Milo’s regional managers and general managers.  Research the local market to determine the competition, opportunities, trends, community involvement, media and public relations opportunities Reports all local media and PR opportunities and events to the Marketing Manager on a regular basis Assist operations in administering community events, improve the process and generate more engagement from the field Maintains and tracks promotional activity, social media engagement activities and events to build excitement for new products/locations/local events Tracks and manages a pre-determined budget for all markets; works with senior management to establish budget for large events and sponsorship Assists with overall department goal planning, strategy and strategic initiatives; plans, prepares and presents at required and regular scheduled meetings Keeps track of all local store marketing initiatives on a monthly basis and reports results
REQUIREMENTS: Has excellent interpersonal and written communication skillsTakes initiative with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage timeHighly organized and detail orientedAligns with the Company’s cultureAbility to recognize problems and problem solveAbility to set goals and convert plans into actionAbility to multi-taskStrong proficiency in Microsoft Suite – Excel, Word, Power PointBeginner to Intermediate graphic design experience
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s Degree in business or marketing related field1-2 years of marketing experience required
BENEFITS: Strong Growth OpportunityHealth Coverage (Medical Insurance – Blue Cross/Blue Shield)Dental & Vision CoverageLife InsuranceShort & Long Term Disability401K with Matching Contributions of 6%2 weeks Paid Vacation & Additional Personal DaysBonus PlanFlexible Schedule

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Els for Autism Foundation was established in 2009 by Liezl and Ernie Els. The Els' son, Ben, is impacted by autism spectrum disorder, which affects 1 in 36 children in the U.S. The Foundation offers innovative, evidence-based programs for families and individuals across the lifespan in six focus areas: Education, Research, Global Support, Recreation Services, Adult Services and Therapy Services. The Els for Autism Foundation serves families around the world and offers in-person programs and services at The Els Center of Excellence® in Jupiter, Florida.The Foundation impacts the lives of individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and their families daily. We influence and support autism acceptance and appreciation worldwide. Come join our innovative, dedicated, and passionate team in delivering and facilitating programs and services supporting individuals and families impacted by ASD across the globe.This position will support the development, events, and programs and services teams in their marketing efforts. Position is responsible for implementing brand and trademark guidelines, creating promotional materials, social media posts, website updates, newspaper campaigns, coordinating public relations activities, and as needed, supporting events.Collaborate with the events team to promote events; with the programs team to promote programs and services, and the development team in support of Foundation funding.Key Responsibilities Include Email marketing for newslettersGraphic design and layout for marketing campaigns as well as for internal and external communicationsImplement and execute the Foundation's social media strategyWork with the appropriate staff to develop content, navigation, and SEO/Analytics for website

Title: (Global Oil & Gas) Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. About the CompanyThis company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. Job Summary We are seeking a Marketing Specialist to join the ITHRA Communication & Partnerships Division of King Abdulaziz Center of World Culture (Ithra). Ithra is an all-purpose cultural destination, an environment for transformative experiences to unlock the power of potential through mastery in arts, science, literature and innovation. Marketing Specialist is a strategic role, you will be an integral part of development and execution of marketing plans to reach targets from brand awareness to product promotion. A marketing specialist should be a competent professional able to grasp consumer behavior trends and generate creative ideas. The candidate should also be well-versed in specialized marketing concepts, principles and tactics. Responsibilities:  Provide track and measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts and strategiesLead projects to develop marketing campaigns, brand collateral, and long-term strategiesOversee the work of external consultants, including web developers, videographers, and online platform vendorsManage brand resources and processes to enable consistent brand deliveryPerform extensive quantitative and qualitative market research to implement data-driven marketing campaignsWork closely with internal teams to develop content marketing and demand generation strategiesResponsible for the development and implementation of strategic and external events calendarWork with Marketing Coordinator to develop a centralized marketing calendar to include spotlight articles, social media, and email campaignsBrainstorm and develop ideas for creative marketing campaignsLiaise with external agencies to execute promotional events and campaignsAssist in outbound or inbound marketing activitiesCollaborate with marketing and other professionals to coordinate brand awareness and marketing effortsPlan and execute initiatives to reach the target audience through appropriate channelsAssist in analyzing marketing data to help shape future marketing strategies.
 Requirements:  Willing to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.Hold a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, or related field from a recognized and approved programHave a minimum of 15 years' experienceHave a minimum of 5 years' experience in a corporate marketing/advertising or similar environmentHave proven experience as a marketing specialist or similar roleHave a thorough understanding of marketing elements, including traditional and digital marketing such as SEO/social media, etc.Have a thorough understanding of market research methodsHave demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and tools.

Desired Skills and Experience
            Marketing,Advertising,Social Media

Title: Marketing Director
JobDescription:
Are you looking for a new best friend, card-game companion, or gardening guru? Then consider working with one of our light, bright, and beautiful Assisted Living and Memory Care communities - where our residents are #1 and our team members shine!Frontier Management is seeking an outstanding Marketing Director to join Table Rock Memory Care Community community located in Medford, Oregon. Demonstrated success as a leader in similar settings is required of the Marketing Director.Position qualifies for a Performance Based Bonus Program! See below for more detail.Frontier Management's portfolio of communities spans throughout the United States with each community sharing a commitment to superior service and quality lifestyle for our residents within their own unique setting. Frontier's mission is to provide an enriched and meaningful experience for our residents, team members, and community partners. If you are as committed and passionate about serving the needs of our senior residents as we are, we encourage you to apply and experience the Frontier Difference.The Marketing Director is responsible for achieving high occupancy via direct sales interaction with prospective residents, their families, and professional referral resources. Additional responsibilities include outreach efforts with various medical professionals and organizations that have the ability/need to directly refer prospects to quality Senior Living options as well as full management of the community's CRM database. The Marketing Director is also responsible for the development of community events that are innovative and engage the consumer in a relevant and purposeful manner creating organic exposure to our Senior Living services.Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Performs facility marketing and sales activities including community events, prospective resident generation, tours, prospective resident follow-up and direct sales Grow your community’s social media presence by ensuring high-quality pictures and engaging stories are posted at least three times a week. Build your community’s digital reputation by requesting positive online reviews from resident families, vendors, and community partners. Monitors sales and other key metrics to ensure maximum results that assist in the complete fill up of the facility With general guidance and input from the management team, develops and implements an annual Marketing Action Plan, reviewed quarterly, for the community Performs community relation functions and participates in local community activities for the facility with particular attention to clergy, medical, legal, financial and business entities who would have influence with the senior market Maintains appropriate contact and develops a strong working relationship with local associations and community organizations that serve and support seniors Prepares and delivers presentations promoting the community as needed Ensures company profitability by meeting all facility activity and marketing budgets and census guidelines as set by the corporation Develops and implements purposeful, relevant and innovative in-house events and functions that will generate new traffic to the community Conducts in-depth interviews with prospective residents and other necessary parties to determine qualifications for residence into the community Conduct in-depth competition studies to determine strengths/weaknesses, census levels, rental rates, the range of services, department leaders, advertising/promotions, menu/food service, activities, amenities, etc. Manages inventory and distribution of all collateral marketing materials including handouts, postcards, brochures, etc. Identifies overall trends in the marketplace that would indicate adjustments to be made in the overall marketing strategy for the community or in individual instances Performs additional job duties as assigned 
Other Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing preferred 3+ years of outside sale experience. Senior Living sales experience a plus Excellent presentation skills and comfortable presenting to both small and large groups Strong communication skills, verbal and written; English language skills adequate to allow communication with residents and staff, and to understand written and verbal instructions Must be proficient in MS Office Suite, with an emphasis in Excel and Outlook Ability to network and develop strong working relationships Compassion and caring disposition for senior adults Must hold a valid driver’s license Willing to work shift assigned, weekends, and holidays 
The Marketing Director qualifies for a Performance-Based Bonus Program! Frontier Management, LLC has an established Performance Based Bonus program for our community’s Marketing Director that incentivizes diligent efforts and outcomes, which positively impact the Company and its future, by striving to control costs, maintain high levels of resident satisfaction and reaching high census targets.Frontier Management offers a competitive salary and a work environment that encourages initiative and fosters respect. Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
Company: Girl Scouts of Kentucky's Wilderness Road
JobDescription:
Reports to: Brand and Communications DirectorSalary Range: $30,000-$33,000Location: Within Council JurisdictionEssential DutiesTo develop, plan and execute digital media strategies and interactions that promote an awareness of Girl Scouts within the community, support membership and fundraising goals, and effectively strengthen the GSKWR visibility. Defining topics, creating content (long form and short form), and publishing it throughout various digital and print media channels Assists in the development and implementation GSKWR digital media strategy (including Google Ads, YouTube, LinkedIn, Facebook/Instagram, and other third-party ad sources (such as editorial sites and event sponsorships) to build brand awareness and generate qualified leads.Measure the success of digital media campaigns based on departmental KPIs.Identify, negotiate, and manage strategic digital media placements for brand growth, lead generation programs and other promotional efforts based on department objectives.Stay up to date with the latest digital media best practices and technologies. Brainstorm and collaborate with internal teams on new ideas and tactics.Seek media opportunities to promote council-wide Girl Scout objectives (this includes but is not limited to program initiatives, supporting the recruitment of girls and volunteers, fund development initiatives) by establishing a presence in the community with key media sources (print, radio, TV, bloggers, etc.).Fields inquiries from news media from start to finish including providing facts, pitching media stories, securing girls and volunteers to be featured. Serves as official council spokesperson where appropriate.Manages daily social media interactions in collaboration with messaging from the Communications Department to ensure comments, posts and questions are addressed quickly and thoroughly.Interfaces with Girl Scouts of the USA and other councils on national and regional initiatives with a PR/Media component.Adapts and implements national initiatives locally within media market.Makes community presentations to key constituencies to positively influence public perception of Girl Scouts, as well as to membership to educate about communications initiatives.Supports efforts by the Development and Executive teams to foster connections with local government officials and like-minded organizations to enhance advocacy efforts on behalf of girl leadership.Assists with crisis communications development and implementation.Research and maintain a Community & Media Contacts Database.Creates content for and works with Communications in the planning and writing of articles for the council blog.Creates or collaborates on writing and production of content and/or editorial pieces featuring Girl Scouts.
Management/Administrative: Collaborate with Communications Director on development of comprehensive public relations and communications plan.Regularly gathers, evaluates, and reports on analytics through digital media engagement.Meets on a regular basis with various departments to evaluate promotional and digital media needs and implements plans as needed that support all council efforts.Solicit and manage speakers, emcees, and judges for Council events.Proof-reads Communications materials to ensure use of proper brand voice, spelling, and grammar.Performs other duties as assigned by the Communications Director.
Minimum Qualifications And RequirementsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in communications or public relations or an equivalent in professional experience.
Knowledge/Experience: Excellent working knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) with the ability to learn new software programs, data management systems and processes.Working knowledge of desktop publishing software including Adobe Creative Suite2 or equivalent.Working knowledge of additional software including Council software and Council Enterprise System preferred.Working knowledge of print and media relations.Ability to perform basic office skills including typing at least 60 WPM, composing/editing correspondence, recordkeeping, report preparation, records management, proficient use of business machines.Demonstrate knowledge of, or willingness to learn, Girl Scout program, principles, and standards.
Skills and Abilities: Work independently, plan, organize and manage multiple projects and deadlines in a timely order in a continually changing work environment.Ability to solve an extensive variety of CES or other data collection software technical problems quickly and completely.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to perform office skills to include recordkeeping, report preparation, records management, proficient use of business machines at a management level.High standards of personal accountability.Understand tracking performance.Ability to provide leadership and supervision to achieve Council goals.

Title: Surety Marketing Representative - Wisconsin
JobDescription:
DescriptionOld Republic Surety Company can proudly say that we attract and retain the best talent in the business. We write surety bonds through partner independent insurance agencies throughout the country. Our business is growing, which is creating numerous new employment opportunities.ORSC is seeking a Surety Marketing Representative to join our growing company in Wisconsin and Michigan. This position is primarily responsible for traveling the assigned territory and making effective marketing calls to agents in order to meet personal and company production goals. The ideal candidate may live anywhere within the assigned territory.This position requires a high degree of travel by use of company vehicle, airplane, etc. up to, and at times, exceeding 70% of the time. Other responsibilities include: Generate new business, within an assigned territory, by promoting Old Republic's products and services to prospective agencies.Vet and appoint new agencies. Once appointed, provide the agencies with an onboarding experience and training on the online processing of bond requests, renewals, and cancellations.Increase premium with existing agencies by building upon relationships and by educating the agencies on ways to refine the shared book of business. Coordinate management visits with key agencies.Collaborate with adjacent territories on the development of account-based Surety programs, ensuring consistent messaging is used.Keep management advised of market factors; e.g. trends in the local economy, rates & commissions, agency prospects, non-performing agencies, territory-specific bond needs, etc.Make budget recommendations to management; e.g. premium & loss projections, ways to reduce controllable expenses, assessments of the staff to agency ratio, etc.
This position requires a minimum of four years of related experience. Qualified candidates who live anywhere in the assigned territory are encouraged to apply. This position normally requires a high degree of travel by car, airplane, etc., up to 70% of the time, requiring one to continuously have a motor vehicle operator’s record that is considered satisfactory as defined by company and/or corporate procedures.Old Republic Surety Company offers numerous opportunities for our employees to grow and prosper. We have a culture of growth from within and we support our employees’ pursuits in advancing their careers. We offer this in an open-door, collaborative workplace that encourages and rewards both teamwork and individual contributions. We want bright, passionate individuals who share our values and quest for success. To learn more about our company culture and our outstanding benefits, please visit our website and watch this video.Interested? Click ‘apply’ and follow some very simple steps to get your resume in front of the Talent Acquisition Team.Old Republic Surety Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse workplace.

Title: Field Marketing Specialist - San Diego and Orange County, CA
JobDescription:
Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in the wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional craft brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft the world’s best beers. Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer… and never satisfied.Job SummaryFirestone Walker seeks a Field Marketing Specialist to join our dynamic Marketing team. The Field Marketing Specialist (FMS) oversees the execution of local marketing efforts and demand drivers across critical markets for Firestone Walker. The FMS drives events, sampling, and cultural relevance of Firestone Walker and its portfolio. This position works cross functionally with marketing and local sales teams to ensure that priorities set translate into brilliant execution within the market.Essential Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesSpecifically, the responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following activities: Plan, execute, and attend events at sponsored events, festivals, etc. to build brand awareness and drive salesWork with EMM and Brand Team to develop local buzz creator lists; A list of local culture leading partners in the beer and lifestyle space that can drive awareness, buzz and influence for our brands across your local territoryResponsible for hiring, training, discipline, promotion, status changes and terminations of Brand Ambassadors in respective regionSupport local sales and distributor teams across key selling tentpoles to ensure our brands are set up to take advantage of key selling holidaysLeverage brand infrastructure and vehicles to drive local sampling opportunities at key events and tent poles across your territoryWeekly reporting to EMM and local sales team that capture insights of local market, wins/losses and opportunities to further grow our brands in the local marketUphold marketing guidelines when working cross functionally with local sales teamRecruit and manage local brand ambassadors for on-site events and local market supportProperly use, clean, and maintain event equipmentBecome an expert for Key Firestone Walker brand pillarsManage assigned territories budget and related documentsAdditional duties as assigned
Required Qualifications Must be at least 21 years of ageBachelor’s Degree in marketing or a related field and at least two years of prior experience in completing the above (or similar) job duties; or equivalent combination of education and experiencePrevious experience in the alcohol industry (beer, wine, spirits)Cicerone Certified Beer Server certificateLEAD training for the State of CaliforniaValid Driver's LicenseMust be able to obtain California Responsible Beverage Service certification within 60 days of hireExceptional organizational and project management skills and the ability to work independently and as a team to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skillsExceptional networking/relationship building skillsEnthusiastic & engaging attitudeForward and proactive thinker, who seeks new opportunities and looks for creative solutions to problemsProficient in Microsoft Office suite of programsPassion for Firestone Walker, Cali Squeeze & 805 BrandsMust reside in designated territory
What Firestone Walker Offers  Competitive pay rate for an experienced individual with the right skillsAn excellent benefits package including: 100% paid premiums for employee including medical, dental, vision, & life insurance
Accrued PTO (rate of 13 days per year)Accrued Sick Leave (1 hour for every 30 hours worked) 401(k) retirement plan including company paid profit sharing & 4% matching9 paid holidays per year
Please submit your work experience when applying. Firestone Walker is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JobDescription:

Title: Lifecycle Marketing Specialist (Remote, US)
JobDescription:
We are seeking a Braze-savvy Lifecycle Marketing Specialist to join Koala Health’s growing marketing team. Working closely with both DTC and B2B teams, and reporting to the Director of Performance Marketing, your responsibilities will encompass the tactical aspects of our lifecycle marketing program inclusive of email and SMS.This role will play a big role in maximizing the effectiveness of our acquisition and retention focused lifecycle campaigns. This role will be contributing to customer acquisition, re-engaging lapsed customers by building out email and SMS campaigns within Braze. Prior experience building out campaigns in a customer engagement platform (Braze, Iterable, Bloomreach, Blueshift, etc.) will be a key qualification for this role.What You'll Do Contribute to strategic and tactical implementation for automated marketing in the B2B & DTC shopper/owner journey.Identify key customer segments and personalize content to enhance engagement across the entire customer lifecycle and journey.Manage day-to-day operations of cross-channel marketing campaigns, including email and SMS.Create and execute email marketing communications to drive customer acquisition and retention.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to gather business requirements, keep partners informed, and provide updates on project performance.Ensure accurate and up-to-date user data is leveraged effectively across CRM application.Conduct tests, iterate on marketing efforts, and share results.Determine KPIs through cross-enterprise collaboration, develop mechanisms to measure success of programs, and ensure alignment with business growth goals.Identify strategic opportunities to evolve and expand lifecycle strategy to drive increased customer love and Customer Lifetime Value (CLV); including ongoing competitor assessments, guiding customer research and benchmarking, and build potential campaign ideas to drive loyalty. Deeply understand the health and value of our customer segments, establishing priorities to increase revenue and performance with specific audiences through dedicated CRM engagement. 
What You'll Need 2-3 years of experience in lifecycle marketing, with minimum 1 year of direct experience in Braze, Iterable, Bloomreach, Blueshift or similar ESP. Experience in marketing automation; including email and SMS marketing.Understanding of user segmentation strategy to influence user behavior and lifetime value.Thrives in an environment where you’re building the plane while flying it. 
Why You'll Love Koala Health We know that not everyone will have all these skills on day one. We value a learning mindset and individuals who are invested in our mission.We are a remote-first company offering our employees the flexibility of working from home.We offer a competitive salary and a chance to own a part of the company in the form of equity.We cover medical, dental, and vision insurance with partial coverage for your partner and dependents.Other benefits include unlimited PTO, and a 401(k) retirement account.
Koala Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Marketing Project Coordinator
JobDescription:
JOB TITLE: Specialist Email Marketing US Target BR ***-*** 4 days in the office M-Thurs, Friday work remote 18 month contract Critical: sales force and marketing experience 2 + years experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud or equivalent enterprise email automation software. Some technical email knowledge such as basic HTML email code evaluation/troubleshooting, list management, segmentation, journey building, & automation are preferred. JOB PURPOSE  Manages distribution for all outbound email campaigns and text messages for the Independent Sales Force. Responsible for planning, targeting, scheduling, configuring, testing, executing, reporting and optimizing email and text campaigns. This position is very detail-oriented and requires independent judgment & decision making on an ongoing basis throughout each day by determining how any specific email should be set up and built, where to load data for deployment, etc. This role requires the ability to collaborate with key stakeholders within the organization and to think creatively, strategically, identify, and resolve problems.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  1. Manages all email marketing campaigns including calendar, list segmentation and validation, and email campaign set up, QA and deployment in Salesforce Markeing Cloud. Under the direction of the supervisor, helps develop strategy for email and text campaigns. Develops and executes outbound email campaigns and text messages in response to requests received from various internal departments and campaign planning team. Populates templates with creative assets, copy, and programming html code. Proofs and edits content as needed and routes the email for approval at all stakeholders. Works cross functionally to ensure email marketing campaign information is accurate. Works in partnership with internal team to optimize campaign deployment process. Adheres to tight deadlines and implements last-minute changes as needed. 60% 2. Works with IST Business Analyst to build Data Extensions for email templates. Executes email campaigns with a heavy emphasis on customer segmentation, testing protocol, and technical execution. 15% 3. Troubleshoot and works closely with IST on any Marketing Cloud issues. 5% 4. Serve as an email marketing and SMS subject matter expert and share best practices while working in partnership with internal team to optimize campaign deployment process. 10% 5. Gathers, organizes, and analyzes data from journeys and provides strategic direction for the planning of emails and text messages. 10% In addition to the above, incumbent is expected to meet the required competencies for this position as defined in the competency profile.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES  Education Bachelors degree or equivalent in journalism, English, communications or equivalent, plus Experience 2+ years of experience with web logistics, web publications and email campaigns, as well as professional writing, editing, online and publication communication experience. with Salesforce Marketing Cloud or equivalent enterprise email automation software. Some technical email knowledge such as basic HTML email code evaluation/troubleshooting, list management, segmentation, journey building, & automation are preferred. 1. Must have a strong proficiency in Salesforce Marketing Cloud or equivalent enterprise email and mobile automation software. Basic HTML knowledge, experience with list management, segmentation, journey building, automation, interactive forms and proficiency in Microsoft Excel strongly preferred. Experience with Google Analytics is beneficial. 2. Ability to manage multiple projects at once. 3. Knowledge of best practices for database and email marketing. 4. Excellent oral and written communications skills required to interface with the independent sales force, employees and executives to effectively plan, write, edit and obtain feedback regarding published information and potential topics. Diplomacy is required to advise internal clients and recommend best strategies for their communication needs. 5. Requires ability to stay abreast of changes to Company policies, programs, etc., and translate this knowledge into meaningful communication materials for the independent sales force. 6. Basic understanding of canned SPAM laws beneficial.  DIMENSIONS Non-Financial Scope: It is essential that e-mail campaigns go to the right group at the right time. Should an error occur, it could cause sales force confusion and/or affect sales, sales force morale, sales force trust or ultimately require a change in one of our product launches. An error also could affect results for month-end close. Reports to: Manager, Digital Communications & Web Content Jobs supervised: None Interacts with: Special Events, Sales Education, IST, E-Business, Consultant Marketing, The Mary Kay Foundation, Sales Force Recognition, Career Car Services, Sales Development, Product Marketing, etc.

Desired Skills and Experience

Title: Marketing Automation Specialist
JobDescription:
Vectra® is the leader in AI-driven threat detection and response for hybrid and multi-cloud enterprises.The Vectra Platform captures packets and logs across network, public cloud, SaaS, and identity by applying patented security-led AI to surface and prioritize threats for rapid threat response. Vectra's threat detections are powered by a deep understanding of attacker methods and problem-optimized AI algorithms. Alerts uncover attacker methods in action and are correlated across customer environments to expose real attacks. Organizations around the world rely on Vectra to see and stop threats before a breach occurs. For more information, visit www.vectra.ai.As a Marketing Automation Specialist, you will play a crucial role in supporting the marketing automation and email marketing efforts of the company. You will be responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and optimization of marketing automation campaigns and systems. This position requires a solid understanding of marketing principles, excellent analytical skills, creative problem solving, and proficiency in marketing automation tools and platforms. Reporting directly to the Head of Marketing Operations and Strategy, you will work closely with marketing leaders and the greater marketing team to execute automated marketing campaigns and drive lead generation and customer engagement.The ideal candidate will have at least 2-3 years of experience in marketing automation, with proficiency in Marketo and/or HubSpot, and a strong understanding of email marketing and nurture strategies. Experience with facilitating marketing automation platform integrations is a definite plus.Key Responsibilities: Design, implement, maintain, and optimize marketing automation campaigns. Configure workflows, email templates, landing pages, and lead scoring models, ensuring seamless campaign execution. Ensure timely delivery of campaigns and troubleshoot any issues that arise. Leverage your proficiency in email marketing to create and optimize email programs and database-wide nurture programs. Work with the marketing team to develop effective email templates, subject lines, and content that resonate with target audiences. Conduct A/B tests to improve email performance and deliverability. Collaborate with our BizOPS team to integrate marketing automation platforms with CRM systems, such as Salesforce. Work cross-functionally to ensure a seamless flow of data between platforms, enabling effective lead management, tracking, and reporting. Manage and maintain the marketing automation database, perform data segmentation, and implement data cleansing measures. Analyze campaign performance data, including open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and other relevant metrics. Provide actionable insights to optimize campaigns based on data-driven recommendations. Generate comprehensive reports on campaign performance and present key findings to stakeholders. Continuously monitor and optimize campaigns to enhance results and meet marketing goals. Keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in marketing automation. Stay informed about the latest updates and features of key marketing automation solutions. Share knowledge and insights with the team to drive innovation and maximize marketing effectiveness. 
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. At least 2-3 years of experience in marketing automation, preferably with expertise in Marketo and HubSpot. Strong understanding of email marketing strategies, including email design, content optimization, and deliverability best practices. Experience with integrating marketing automation platforms with CRM systems, such as Salesforce, is a plus. Proficiency in utilizing marketing automation tools, including Marketo and HubSpot, to execute campaigns and workflows. Strong analytical skills and the ability to derive insights from campaign performance data. Excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Proactive attitude, self-motivated, and willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and industry changes. 
Our competitive total rewards package includes cash compensation within the range provided below. Actual pay for this position may vary based on the hired candidate’s location, experience and relevant incumbent pay position. Vectra Total Rewards$76,000—$117,400 USDVectra provides a comprehensive total rewards package that supports the financial, physical, mental and overall health of our employees and their families. Compensation includes competitive base pay, incentive plan eligibility, and participation in the employee equity plan (stock options). Specific benefits offered varies by location, but commonly include health care insurance, income protection / life insurance, access to retirement savings plans, behavioral & emotional wellness services, generous time away from work, and a comprehensive employee recognition program.Vectra is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Email Marketing Quality Assurance Specialist
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionQuality Assurance Specialist (Email Marketing)We're in search of a dedicated Email Marketing Quality Assurance Specialist to join our client on a contract basis. This role is centered on assuring the quality and accuracy of email marketing deliverables, ensuring they align with expectations and marketing strategies. The specialist will need to work efficiently within tight deadlines, often turning around projects within a few hours.Responsibilities Conduct comprehensive Quality Assurance reviews on all email marketing deliverables including Email Templates and Campaigns. This includes ensuring consistency and alignment in branding, product presentation, copy, and targeted demographics. Proofread and edit email copies for grammar, spelling, and punctuation accuracy, ensuring the content is clear and adheres to the Campaign and Flow Briefs. Validate the integration of client-provided content and images within the email system, ensuring they match the client's original materials. Cross-check the recipient list before every email dispatch to ensure it corresponds with the client's specific audience. Regularly review Campaign and Flow Calendars and various strategic audits to maintain compliance with the overall email marketing strategy. Oversee the technical setup of Campaigns and Flows pre-launch, guaranteeing strategic alignment, deliverability, and target audience reach. Manage the scheduling and setup of Campaigns and Flows, working within the fast turnaround times typical of this role leveraging. Uphold all client-specific standards and requests in terms of quality and content Propose improvements to the email marketing processes and deliverables where necessary. 
Work ScheduleThis role will primarily involve an afternoon shift from 12 pm to 8 pm (Mountain Time), in accordance with the quick turnaround requirements of our email marketing operations.
