Title: Marketing Account Manager
JobDescription:
Marketing Account ManagerGraduates & Career-Changers WelcomeStep up and take on this unique and exciting role as your entry into the sales and marketing industry.We are looking to find an ambitious, talented, and self-motivated Entry Level Marketing Account Manager to join our diverse and expanding team. We don’t require any specificexperience or qualifications. However, it’s crucial that candidates possess: A positive and proactive attitudeExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsHigh levels of social and emotional intelligenceExcellent time managementAccountability
Marketing Account Manager TrainingSuccess as an Account Manager requires a full grasp of three areas. You’ll build experience and receive mentorship in three areas prior to spearheading a campaign:1. Campaign DevelopmentWe believe that the person running the campaign should have a working knowledge of what a successfully executed campaign looks like and the inner workings of delivering one. You’ll begin by shadowing the team to learn the ropes and pick up the theory and the psychology of our campaigns before then working alongside the team to gain practical, hands-on experience.2. People ManagementYou’ll learn how to manage and motivate different types of people, to create an environment where you can draw out the strengths of the group, and successfully manage different personality types. At this stage, we also cover; coaching and mentoring methods, team leadership, interviewing, public speaking, training methods and performance evaluations.3. Analytics AnalysisWe know data is king! We provide real-time analytics to clients highlighting the number of customer interactions and successful acquisitions. You’ll learn how to analyse data, how to spot trends and ensure KPIs are consistently met. You’ll learn how to ensure a campaign grows quickly and maintains optimum productivity levels.Marketing Account Manager Requirements First and foremost, you will also need to be okay with starting out in entry-level sales and marketing and earning your development opportunities based on individual merit.A thirst for knowledge and a desire to keep learning and developing.Resourceful and self-motivated with a solution-orientated attitude.Experience in a leadership role (work-related or through sports) would be advantageous but not required.Strong emotional and social intelligence.
Learn, grow, develop and challenge yourself alongside a driven, like-minded team.If you have read this far, you know what to do, apply now!How to Apply: Send your resume through the online process and provide a contact number and email address.Hiring Immediately.Please note: This position is based in Orlando, FL so please be sure that you can commute in on a daily basis. Applicants living outside the city may not be contacted.

Join our global team and build a career where memories start with you.We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applications will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to MyCareer@travelandleisure.com, including the title and location of the position for which you are applying.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: Marketing Coordinator Focus—creating and posting pre-themed (from provided existing daily theme calendar) social posts on CVB social accounts IG, FB, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube etc. Creating and posting 2 short-form videos a month (2 weeks) (again calendar theme is provided). Writing & posting 2 blogs per month (from provided themed calendar). Ability to create ads/designs in Adobe Suite. Research area calendar of events (hospitality partners, Dayton.com, Daytonlocal etc.) on a weekly basis to add events to the CVB’s website COE. Constant updating of sv CRM data-bases for restaurants, meeting venues, attractions, arts & culture, retail outlets, recreation, all media lists, administrative support, assist with special events and projects  JOB DESCRIPTION Position: Marketing CoordinatorDepartment: MarketingReports To: Director of Marketing & Strategic Partnerships  Position Description:The Marketing Coordinator will support the Dayton Convention & Visitors Bureau’s (CVB) Marketing Department; create and deploy directed and approved content across the Dayton CVB’s social media networks; provide marketing administrative support; compile website/social media data; update and maintain various databases. The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for completing the following projects and activities: Responsibilities:·      Based on planned social media calendars provided by Director of Marketing & Strategic Partnerships, the marketing coordinator will create and post content on the CVB’s social media platforms (currently Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Pinterest). Posts included are generally once a day on Facebook and Instagram, once a week on Pinterest and LinkedIn and YouTube and can be scheduled via Canva or within the separate social channel platforms.·      Create two short form videos per month (each formatted slightly differently for Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, possibly TikTok videos) per the management provided social media calendar for placement on social media and on CVB website.·      Write two blogs per month for placement on Dayton CVB website and social media posts based on management provided blog calendar for the month.·      Use the Dayton CVB’s social media presence to improve the organization’s public image, to grow outreach and increase engagement with our target audiences of meeting planners, leisure visitors and local audiences, to market and promote our community’s assets and partners, to drive website traffic, and to increase participation in special CVB or hospitality-related initiatives·      Research area calendar of events (hospitality partners, Dayton.com, Daytonlocal etc.) on a weekly basis to add events to the CVB’s website COE that also feeds into the Visit Dayton App·      Ability to create ads and designs (in Adobe Suite) for the CVB·      With direction from management, explore and help evaluate the potential ROI for adding TikTok to the Dayton CVB’s social media platforms·      Administrative support for Marketing Department including filing, copying, compiling reports etc.·      Assist in compiling monthly, quarterly and annual marketing data reports and marketing plan·      Create, maintain and perpetually update databases in excel and in the simpleview CRM for various categories including but not limited to: local media lists, meeting planner media regional and national lists, consumer/leisure regional and national media lists, Montgomery County attractions, Montgomery County restaurants, Montgomery County arts and culture, Montgomery County meeting venues, Montgomery County retail outlets, bloggers, travel writers, etc.·      Maintain press kits and fulfill press requests for information·      Assist with special events projects·      Assist with content creation and management including photos, video, website data and files·      Provide support for Visitor Information Specialist, as needed, in gathering information for calendar of events listings on website and Visit Dayton App·      May attend industry and community events as directed·      Other duties as assigned       Position Requirements :·      Bachelor’s degree in marketing-related discipline or two-year degree with proven workplace experience or equivalent experience·      Preference of two years of industry experience·      Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)·      Experience creating and editing short form video, utilizing tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Canva or similar software/apps·      Knowledge of Google Analytics and knowledge of Google Documents and basic understanding of SEO and content marketing·      Knowledge of website content management systems a plus·      Demonstrated knowledge and proficiency working with social media platforms (Meta-Facebook, Instagram; YouTube, Pinterest, LinkedIn, TikTok etc.) in a business environment, including their various features (reels, stories, photo posts, short-form video, live video etc.), scheduling posts, placing ads, and how to maximize social media reach and impact from a business perspective - for the Dayton CVB’s business accounts.·      Strong written and verbal communication skills·      Strong organizational skills·      Ability to function successfully in a fast-paced environment; often with several key deadlines·      Ability to accomplish goals both individually and as part of a team·      Knowledge and proficiency with Adobe SuitePosition Relationships:Industry Associations and Organizations:  Maintains memberships and actively participates in CVB meetings, and conferences or tradeshows related to position.Budget: Responsible for administering assigned portions of CVB marketing department budgetProjects: Responsible for complete planning, execution and follow-up of certain projects as assigned by the Director of Marketing & Strategic Partnerships and Digital Marketing & Communications Manager including but not limited to the timely completion of monthly, quarterly and annual marketing reports.Finance Department: Cooperate in following policies and procedures necessary in order to maintain sound fiscal controls including but not limited to the timely and accurate submission of expense reports.Other Characteristics:Other Relevant Aspects of Position: Position may require overtime and varied hours; ability to work occasional evenings and weekends is required. Ability to travel by air, drive a vehicle and maintain a valid driver’s license throughout employment. Must be a team player and self-motivated.

Title: Marketing Department Coordinator
JobDescription:
JOB DESCRIPTION Marketing Department Coordinator Provides a mix of general office and administrative support to the upstream marketing department. Must be a self-starter who is unafraid to ask questions and learn new processes.  Under minimal supervision, responsible for: Managing the payment process for all marketing expenses. Securing booth space for tradeshows in a timely manner; completing all related paperwork, engaging with booth captain to ensure logistics in place. Title: Marketing, Sales, and Event Coordinator
JobDescription:
Tunnel Vision Marketing is looking for a Sales Marketing Event Coordinator who will be responsible for the promotions linked to our client, their products, and services. Coordinators assist with any new customer acquisition and brand promotions associated with client accounts while interacting with new and potential consumers.Our success relies on our promote-from-within culture. All of our managers have also completed the program and are therefore able to understand everything from the entry-level up. This program is designed to prepare you for your ideal career in sales, business development, and customer service.Responsibilities: Strengthen our relationship with clients and company partnershipLearn and market your campaigns honestly and effectivelyWork with other members of our team on linked campaigns to ensure companywide successInteract with other members of our organization regularly to ensure personal and professional growthGenerate new sales
Benefits of working with us: Career advancement opportunitiesNationwide travel opportunitiesWeekly team nightsPaid training
This is a valuable opportunity for those who have experience in hospitality, team leadership, management, sales, entrepreneurship, and anybody with a competitive mindset.

Title: Marketing Copywriter
JobDescription:
Marketing Copywriter Job Description As a marketing content writer, your input will be key in shaping campaigns, creating website and landing page copy, designing calls to action, and bringing our client narratives to life. Using your experience and background, you’ll be able to expand your portfolio and skillset as you submerse yourself in an environment that thrives on our team’s and our clients’ growth.Company Culture at NSG At NSG, our culture and core mindsets are vital to ensure success. You will thrive with us if you embody the following: Deep interest and curiosity in marketing, your clients, their industries, and the work we do for them. Adding value to your peers and clients with every interaction.Collaborating with empathy when interacting with clients and peers because you know we all have common goals achieve together. You look to build a better future and you never do work just because that’s the way it has always been done – you bring new ideas to your team and manager. 
Marketing Content Writer Responsibilities:Because copy is vital to almost everything we do, we are seeking candidates that have proven experience in the following digital marketing copywriting areas: Create and edit website copy, ad copy, landing page copy, and copy for a variety of digital and print marketing assets, asking — and being able to answer — the following questions of every piece of copy: Is it on message? Is the piece communicating the right information to the right audience? Is it on brand? Is it in line with the client’s voice and messaging preferences? Is it technically clean? Does it meet internal and client standards for spelling, grammar, style, and SEO?Review for SEO best practices and keyword use to support SEO strategyDevelop, learn, and manage internal and client style and voiceCollaborate with other copy and messaging team members for a range of purposesCraft website and landing page copyDevelop social media copy for organic posts and paid advertisementsResearch relevant topics and generate original ideas for content marketing blogsIncorporate keywords into blogs designed to support an SEO strategyWrite newsletter, promotional, and drip campaign email copy, and script videosGenerate long-form copy for case studies and white papersWork collaboratively with creative teams to synthesize copy and design effortsUpdate existing marketing collateralProduce internal outlines and external presentations as neededEdit the writing of your colleagues and clientsConduct client interviews and create relevant content from those interviewsGather and leverage testimonialsContribute ideas during internal brainstorms
Working at National Strategic Group Salary:  We look at the overall value your skills can add to our clients and company. We don’t set hard numbers for positions – we evaluate each candidate to the work that compliments unique abilities and company needs. 
Benefits:  Competitive health benefits package including medical, dental, and vision401K Short term disability (including maternity leave)Life insurance Paid time offPaid holidaysFlexible work scheduleQuarterly goals and plans to support career growth 
Day-to-day: No weekends, late nights, or holidaysFlexible starting times each day Hybrid model with days in office and home each week Casual, supportive work environment Free coffee /snacks 
 Marketing Content Writer and Editor Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in English, Marketing, Communications, or a related field) or equivalent years of experienceAbility to break down complex strategies into small, manageable tasksCapacity to complete tasks quickly and accurately while handling interruptionsProven capability to work individually and as part of a teamDemonstrated propensity to receive feedback and incorporate it appropriatelyA genuine love for writing and storytellingStrong communication skillsDemonstrated ability to learn new concepts and technology quicklyFamiliarity with digital marketing preferred
Our team is filled with people that constantly go above and beyond so we can collectively impress our clients and constantly help them grow. We support each other—Our goal is to set each other up to succeed personally knowing that will ultimately improve our client relationships and company culture. If the freedom to research and grow and tackle professional challenges motivate you, then we’d love for you to apply. We want to learn more about you now!
Skills: Blogging, Business Administration, Content Marketing, Copywriting, Creative Writing, Digital Marketing, Marketing, Marketing Copy, Narrative, Writing

Title: Assistant, Marketing Project
JobDescription:
Summary: The Marketing Project Assistant assists the Senior Brand Manager in streamlining workflows, maintaining quality standards for marketing deliverables, and facilitating the timely execution of projects for the Missouri Botanical Garden, Sophia M. Sachs Butterfly House, and Shaw Nature Reserve.This task- and deadline-driven role involves crafting project schedules using project management software, tracking the workflow of content and design teams, assigning project-specific tasks, and keeping internal stakeholders and clients advised on project progress and status.This position is well-suited for project traffic coordinators or administrative professionals adept at balancing a diverse array of project types and timelines. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:   Manages project request intake from internal and external clients and assigning based on project priority and creative staff capacity.  Monitors project timelines and communicates project status to Marketing and Creative team, as well as internal clients and external partners. If needed, adjusts schedules and deadlines accordingly within project management software.  Coordinates payment and processes invoices for creative production and advertising.  Utilizes department’s project management software to enter project information and to track project’s job status.  Collaborates with Marketing and Creative teams to secure necessary assets and ensure brand consistency and integrity.  Maintains marketing calendar.  Works with vendors to ensure delivery of assets needed for these projects and timely invoicing.  Assists with audience and market research in order to identify industry trends.  Supports Marketing team by gathering information in order to obtain bids or proposals from potential vendors for various marketing needs.  Assists with deployment of marketing creative and messaging across digital channels (blog, email) as needed.  Meets expected attendance guidelines.  Follows and adheres to established policies and procedures, including but not limited to Employee Handbook, Garden Safety Guidelines and Department Policies.  Behaves and communicates in a manner that promotes and fosters a culture of teamwork and cooperation, within our division and throughout the Garden, with co-workers, supervisors/managers, volunteers, visitors, and employees.  Performs other duties as assigned. 
 Supervisory Responsibilities  : None Competencies:   Communication – Listens to others and asks questions for clarification; Writes clearly and presents information accurately; Speaks professionally and responds well to questions; Supports positive visitor relations.  Collaboration –Demonstrates teamwork and promotes respect in the workplace; Engages in problem solving and group initiatives; Cooperates in implementing procedures and process improvements; Strives for positive visitor experiences.  Accountability – Demonstrates commitment to responsibilities and adaptable to changes; effectively prioritizes, troubleshoots and takes appropriate actions; Follows policies and procedures, meets deadlines, quality, and safety standards; Strives to proactively, address visitor and internal colleagues’ concerns.  Problem Solving – Identifies and resolves problems; Includes supervisor before taking action as necessary; Recommends solutions, demonstrates creativity and resourcefulness; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment in decision-making process; Includes appropriate people in making decisions.  Stewardship – Promotes and adheres to sustainability, safety and security protocols; Fosters a culture of respect, diversity and inclusion; Demonstrates effective and prudent use of Garden resources; Maximizes contributions during work hours.  Leadership: Leadership competency incorporates a cluster of knowledge, skills and abilities required for management of people, budgets and assigned business functions/operations 
Qualifications:   1 -3 years of administrative or marketing experience or related field.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Ability to interpret and analyze data effectively identifying suitable vendors and evaluating bid or proposals.  Willingness to work collaboratively with internal team members and external organizations in order to assist with completing various projects.  The Garden is committed to the safety and wellbeing of our employees, volunteers and guests. All staff are strongly encouraged to receive COVID-19 vaccinations by hire date, and the Garden reserves the right to require future proof of current vaccination status, based on community health department guidelines. When international travel is necessary for Garden business, staff must be able to obtain visas, vaccinations and immunizations for all countries where travel is required. 
 Education:   Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Journalism, Public Relations, or related field required.  An equivalent combination of education, skills, and experience may be considered. 
 Other Skills and Abilities:  N/A Language Skills:  Ability to communicate effectively in English (oral/written). Mathematical Skills:   Proficient mathematical abilities required.  Ability to understand, analyze and create budgets. 
 Reasoning Ability:   Ability to exercise independent and sound judgment in the observation, analysis and resolution of issues. 
 Computer Skills:   Solid Internet research skills required.  Proficient experience in computer applications related to database management and design software including: Microsoft Office products, Adobe Creative Suite, HTML, web development applications and programs.  Experience with project management software (Monday.com, Asana, Lytho) preferred. 
 Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:  N/A Physical Demands:   Ability to utilize computer keyboard (typing).  Must be able to lift and carry 20 pounds.  Ability to push/pull supply cart.  May be required to perform tasks at varying heights (i.e., climb step stools, ladders, etc.).  Principally operates standard office equipment to include computers, copiers, files, fax machines. 
 Work Environment:   Indoor office setting, shared by multiple staff; noise level is usually moderate.  Ability to work outdoors in temperatures over 100°F as well as in inclement weather conditions as needed.  Standardbusiness casual attire required.  Some travel to off-site meetings may be required. 
 Contacts with Individuals/Organizations inside/outside the Garden:   Interacts with Garden employees, volunteers, and members on a daily basis  Vendors  Exhibitors  Professional organizations  Community agencies  External media contacts 
Apply Now

Title: Senior Director of Marketing
JobDescription:
Lead a team of 3-4 direct reports in a high-growth consumer goods organization.Reporting to the VP of Global marketing, you’ll drive growth through strategic planning across product launches, promotional programs, channel development, competitive analysis, and vendor management.What You’ll be Doing:You’ll be responsible for driving strategy and long-term planning across a portfolio of products working to increase market share, drive top-line revenue growth, and add shareholder value.Create comprehensive and innovative marketing plans across campaign planning, media planning, online direct marketing, trade programs, etc.You will be tasked with leading new product launches from conception though execution, understanding the competitive landscape, be aware of market shifts, and understand consumer behavior and its drivers.Manage, coach, and develop your direct reports along with developing and managing the marketing operating budget.What You’ll Need for Success: A minimum of 10 years of marketing experience from the consumer-packaged goods industry.Bachelors degree, MBA preferred.Experience brand building, leading multi-functional teams, managing multiple projects, and proven success in growing sales, market share, and profits.Ability to commute to the Van Nuys office 3 days per week.

            MARKETING

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We’re building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve.Job SummaryThe Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the development, coordination, execution and delivery of regulatory and customer communications across a variety of channels. The right candidate is a self-motivated, independent thinker with excellent organizational skills and be able to manage multiple priorities and tasks simultaneously.Responsibilities  Creates email campaigns for monthly newsletter, new and existing product offerings, digital support options and account-based changes.  Owns and drives copy requests and updates for new and existing email programs.  Writes and edits all forms of short and long copy and for all types of media including websites, collateral, mobile apps, SMS and email communications for our various customer types.  Develops and/or updates FAQ articles with subject matter experts that are clear, concise, convincing, and accurate both grammatically and materially.  Prepares bill statement messaging, banners and inserts and coordinates execution with internal and external teams.  Works with internal Creative Services team and agencies to update creative and content on channel lineup and rate cards.  Works with agency to develop educational monthly social content calendar. 
Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Management Information Systems, Journalism, Communications, or Computer Science preferred.  Minimum 3 years’ experience in marketing, or agency account/project management.  Exceptional project management skills with proven ability to perform simultaneous tasks at a high level of effectiveness under pressure in a fast-changing business environment.  Ability to monitor, interpret, and communicate metrics and performance.  Experience interfacing with creative agencies/vendors.  Strong cross-functional communication and teamwork skills. 
Altice USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.Altice USA, Inc. collects personal information about its applicants for employment that may include personal identifiers, professional or employment related information, photos, education information and/or protected classifications under federal and state law. This information is collected for employment purposes, including identification, work authorization, FCRA-compliant background screening, human resource administration and compliance with federal, state and local law.Pay is competitive and based on a number of job-related factors, including skills and experience. The starting pay rate/range at time of hire for this position in the posted location is $59,758.00 - $95,613.00 / year. The rate/range provided herein is the anticipated pay at the time of hire, and does not reflect future job opportunity.Applicants for employment with Altice will never be asked to provide money (even if reimbursable) as part of the job application or hiring process. Please review our Fraud FAQ for further details.
Skills: Campaigns, Communication, Customer Communication, Email Marketing, Free Thinking, Marketing, Organization Skills, Project Management, Social Media Marketing, Subject Matter Experts

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:

Title: Email Specialist (Digital Marketing)
JobDescription:
Who We’re Looking ForAre you a creative genius with a passion for digital design? Are you the perfect middle mix of right and left-brain thinking? Do you love being visionary as much and diving down deep into the how and why of an issue? Do you have a knack for knowing people – what makes them tick, what motivates them, and what they value? Do you consider brand-consistent design and utilizing negative space effectively to be a part of your personal mantra? If so, do your best work with Acme Tools as an Email Specialist on our innovative, fast-growing eCommerce team!About Acme ToolsAcme Tools was founded as Acme Electric Motor in 1948 and continues to be a family-owned operation with thirteen locations and over 550 team Acme members across North Dakota, Minnesota, and Iowa. In 1999, Tool Crib of the North, Acme’s catalog and internet division, was acquired by Amazon.com. After rebranding as Acme Tools, we are now one of the premier retailers of tools and equipment online within the United States. We pride ourselves on having a growing, innovative eCommerce department with a start-up like atmosphere, which will allow you to create and execute strategies with freedom and approach projects in creative ways.You’ll Enjoy Our  Work-Life Balance  Professional Development Training  Competitive Pay & Annual Performance-Based Increase Opportunities  Generous PTO plan that starts accruing on day 1!  Paid Holidays – we are closed the 6 major holidays of the year  Maternity Leave (partially paid through company paid short-term disability!)  Work environment where everyone strives to do their best work and can see their impact on the company  Community Involvement Opportunities  Generous Employee Discounts 
We Also Provide  Various Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans To Fit Any Lifestyle & Family  Supplemental Health Insurance Add-On Programs  Medical & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts  100% Company Paid Short- & Long-Term Disability Insurance  401(k) Program & Company Matching  100% Company Paid Life Insurance 
 What You’ll Take Ownership Of:  As an Email Specialist, you will play a crucial role in developing and executing our email marketing strategies to drive customer engagement, retention, and revenue growth. You will report directly to our Email and SMS Coordinator, and be responsible for creating and optimizing email campaigns, managing subscriber lists, analyzing performance metrics, and ensuring email deliverability and compliance. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to coordinate campaigns, segment audiences, and deliver personalized and targeted content to our customer base.  Develop and execute comprehensive email marketing campaigns, including promotional emails, newsletters, automated workflows, and lifecycle campaigns.  Collaborate with Buyers to define campaign objectives, target segments, and messaging strategies to maximize customer engagement, conversion rates, and revenue generation.  Create compelling email content, subject lines, and CTAs that align with brand guidelines and resonate with our target audience.  Manage subscriber lists and segmentation strategies to ensure the right messages are delivered to the right customers at the right time.  Conduct A/B tests and analyze email campaign performance metrics, such as open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and revenue attribution, to optimize campaigns and drive continuous improvement.  Monitor and maintain email deliverability, compliance, and best practices, including CAN-SPAM and GDPR regulations.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design, content, and development, to create visually appealing and mobile-responsive email templates and landing pages.  Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in email marketing to drive innovation and competitive advantage.  Rolling with the punches with any other email/sms/digital marketing task needed 
Need-To-Haves  Bachelor’s degree in Design, Communications, Marketing or related field OR equivalent working experience  Knowledge and experience designing across multiple digital media and platforms, preferably email & SMS channels  Understanding of branding, style guidelines and following style restrictions; clean design sense  Strong Technology & Adobe Creative Suite experience, including UX design skills  Exceptional attention to detail and analytical skills with the ability to not only use metrics to spot successes/improvements, but strategize how to capitalize on them  Ability to work with a high level of autonomy and take initiative  Excellent communication, planning, time management, and follow-through skills  Natural visual thinker ready to grow and take direction from creative leadership 
Love-To-Haves  3-5 years of experience in modern eCommerce digital marketing experience, especially related to email & SMS campaigns 
Physical Requirements  Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer 
Employment offers are contingent on drug-screen and background check. Relocation to Grand Forks, ND required. Acme Tools is an equal opportunity employer.Small Town Friendliness. Big City Amenities. Find out why living in Grand Forks is way cooler than you think at www.grandforksiscooler.com#AcmeToolsIsHiring

Title: Marketing Associate
JobDescription:

If you have questions while submitting an application, please review these frequently asked questions.Current Employees And StudentsIf you are currently employed or enrolled as a student at The Ohio State University, please log in to Workday to use the internal application process.In Order To Ensure Your Application Is Complete, You Must Complete The FollowingWelcome to The Ohio State University's career site. We invite you to apply to positions of interest. Ensure you have all necessary documents available when starting the application process. You can review the additional job description section on postings for documents that may be required.Prior to submitting your application, please review and update (if necessary) the information in your candidate profile as it will transfer to your application. 
Job TitleMarketing AssociateDepartmentArts and Sciences | Center for Career and Professional SuccessUnder the supervision of the Assistant Dean for the Center for Career & Professional Success, and with a dotted-line partnership with the College of Arts and Sciences Marketing and Communications team, ensures strategic alignment of marketing efforts between the College and Career Success. The Marketing Associate provides strategic leadership and creative talent to develop and implement all marketing concepts that promote Center services, events and brand to all constituents including students, alumni, industry, campus departments, faculty, and administrators. Uses creativity, organizational skills, and deep knowledge of the Center to create original content and design for all communications channels, such as our website, social media, e-newsletters, and annual reports. Working with appropriate software, the incumbent designs, produces and delivers digital and print campaigns or materials that result in increased student, industry, faculty, staff, and alumni participation across all services and programs produced by the Center. Manages the Center Marketing Internship Program, which includes the recruitment, training, supervision, and evaluation of graphic design, videographer, and marketing assistant interns. Actively manages student staff during revenue generating events, such as career fairs, to facilitate smooth operations and outstanding customer service. Coordinates with various campus stakeholders and external vendors to ensure accurate and timely content and delivery of projects within budget. Develops, proposes tracks and monitors overall marketing budget for the fiscal year. Train, support and educate Center full-time staff members on digital and new media trends, principles, and best practices. The Associate shall serve as onsite project manager for the institution and College based marketing/communications and technology areas, identifying opportunities for collaboration and joint marketing. Translates abstract data or information into dynamic promotional or presentation materials that engage a wide audience. The position includes weekend and evening work.Required: Bachelor’s degree in Communication, English, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, or an appropriate discipline in the Arts & Sciences; Minimum of two years of professional marketing and writing experience, with proven organizational skills, preferably in an institution of higher education or other non-profit organizations; Considerable experience in persuasive writing, and editing solicitation materials, articles, business letters, scrips and other communication materials; Demonstrated ability to speak and write persuasively; Writing and graphic design skills; Ability to prioritize workload with an emphasis in handling large volume projects.Desired: Extensive knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, CRM/Marketing automation tools and Google Analytics; Experience with Microsoft Office Suite and Web CMS systems such as Drupal or related software; Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or governing or advisory boards; Ability to advise and assist Directors in establishing marketing goals and associated results; Extensive experience in web and print publishing, graphic design and data management software and computer hardware options.Additional InformationThe pay range for this job profile is $49,800.00 - $66,400.00. The offer for this position will fall within this range based on internal equity, the unit's available budget, and the candidate's qualifications.Location:Denney Hall (0030)Position TypeRegularScheduled Hours40ShiftFirst ShiftFinal candidates are subject to successful completion of a background check. A drug screen or physical may be required during the post offer process.Thank you for your interest in positions at The Ohio State University and Wexner Medical Center. Title: Product Manager II, WATCHMAN Competitive Marketing
JobDescription:
Additional Locations: N/ADiversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High PerformanceAt Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.About The RoleThe Product Manager II, WATCHMAN Competitive Marketing role is responsible for working with WATCHMAN franchise teams to develop high impact marketing and business strategies related to competitive marketing. This individual contributor will be an expert on the points of view and process for understanding the marketplace, identifying market trends and growth opportunities, competitive behaviors, perceptions, and commercial tactic influences, and leveraging insights to guide business strategy and tactics. They will also manage key touchpoints with other geographies and ensure consistency in workstream across the globe where appropriate. They will also be a subject matter expert in all things WATCHMAN and competitive when working with customers. This role will work with cross-functional partners including WATCHMAN Marketing, Sales teams, Clinical, R&D, Finance, and Global partners.This position will be based out of our Maple Grove, MN location with a hybrid work mode.Your Responsibilities Will Include Expertise in competitive intelligence approaches, resources and best practices, creative analytics to synthesize insights, and developing actionable recommendationsDrive tracking process with the sales team to ensure competitive details are continuously updated and currentPartner with WATCHMAN and Cardiology Sales Teams to create and educate sales force on WATCHMAN competitive updates and relevant messaging.Conduct and/or direct external vendors in market and competitive research and analytics to answer senior management questions about the businessManage ongoing touchpoints with global partners to coordinate workstreams across geographies.Plan and host competitive intelligence calls with the field and provide monthly updates to senior leadershipWork in partnership with sales execution partners to ensure competitive field activities are well planned and executedParticipate in Strat Plan, AOP, and Forecast planning session partnering with finance on updates to competitive share projectionsAssist team to educate WATCHMAN implanters, referring physicians, and Coordinators about the key differences between WATCHMAN and the competition.Strong knowledge of clinical evidence and ability to message the data in a competitive LAAC environment to both internal and external stakeholdersSeasoned communicator and an ability to create effective materials for the sales team and customerEstablished analytical and quantitative skillsExperience defining and utilizing a broad range of secondary research, primary qualitative and primary quantitative research techniques to identify and address customer insights on clinical dataExcellent project management, defining and managing overall schedule for project and milestones (both owned & assigned to others); often serving as project lead coordinating activities between cross-functional teams
Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or Healthcare/Biomedical 3+ years of experience in consulting, market research, business strategy/analytics or product marketing experience in the healthcare field Experience communicating and relationship building with external customers and internal sales teams via in-person, phone, and virtual engagementsOutstanding interpersonal skills including developing relationships in all levels of the organization and indirectly influencing business objectives Up to 20% travel, domestic and international
Preferred Qualifications MBA or other advanced degreeFinancial/market analysis and/or previous competitive intelligence experience Sale and/or field experience
Requisition ID: 566146As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!
Skills: Analytics, Business Strategy, Communication, Coordinating Activities, Interpersonal Skills, Market Analysis, Market Research, Marketing Analytics, Product Marketing, Sales Execution

Title: Sales & Marketing Operations Coordinator
JobDescription:
Who We Are: We're builders, entrepreneurs, and problem-solvers who draw our inspiration from the incredible leaders we serve. Nearly 15 years ago, we set out to find a better way to help the country's leading startups navigate the financial hazards that follow their first institutional funding. Today, Propeller's 350+ full-time professionals on three continents are proud to be considered the premier finance and accounting partner to many of the most iconic emerging companies across the CPG, DTC, Technology, Crypto, and Professional Services industries. We are more than just an outsourced CFO and accounting provider; we are a growth partner for our clients. With a best-in-class technology platform, coupled with unparalleled data and workflow optimization tools, we give founders the visibility and confidence to make smarter decisions.Title: Sales & Marketing Operations CoordinatorReports To: Senior Vice President Sales & MarketingLocation: Remote (In person meetings as needed)Role overview: The Sales and Marketing Operations Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating and executing day-to-day sales and marketing activities, driving growth by assisting in lead generation and nurturing, data hygiene support, and various inbound/outbound activities. This role requires excellent communication, organizational and analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.Responsibilities:  Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to develop and execute campaigns that drive leads, pipeline and revenue. Coordinate and manage the sales and marketing automation systems, including the CRM system, marketing automation platform, and other relevant tools. Develop, document and optimize sales and marketing processes and workflows to improve overall efficiency and effectiveness. Analyze and report on sales and marketing KPIs, providing insights and recommendations for improvement. Manage the sales and marketing budget, tracking expenses and providing regular updates to management. Support the sales team with prospecting, lead generation, and pipeline management. Maintain and implement data hygiene best practices to improve data quality between our CRM, marketing, and sales platforms. Ensure data cleanliness from leads acquired from tradeshows and other sources. Coordinate and provide technical support for sales meetings, including preparation of presentation materials. Coordinate production and distribution of marketing collateral. Lead email marketing strategy including planning content calendar, content creation, and data analysis to generate top of funnel leadsCreate and maintain Integrated Marketing Plan for the year to align content, digital efforts, social media & events with each monthly campaign. Assist with writing and optimizing webpages and all content (whitepapers, one-pagers, case studies, and blogs) for SEO
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing, Business Administration or a related field. Familiarity with CRM tools: Salesforce, Pardot, Outreach, PandaDoc, Docusign, OutlookExperience with researching and sourcing new prospectsStrong analytical mindset utilizing tools such as Microsoft Excel and other BI toolsExcellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skillsA data-driven and process-oriented mindset
Compensation: $85,000-$100,000 plus benefits including 401k matchCurrent Benefits Offered: Generous Paid Time Off and Holiday pay, comprehensive health benefits plus dental, vision, short and long-term disability, and life insurance. HSA contribution, Paid Family Leave, 401k match and remote work.DEI Statement: At Propeller Industries, we encourage our employees and our clients to bring their true selves to the organization. We believe that a diverse team enables us to cultivate and improve upon our culture of inclusion and collaboration. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome the contributions that you can bring in terms of your education, opinions, culture, ethnicity, race, sex, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran's status, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and beliefs. However you identify and whatever your background, we encourage you to apply for this role if you share our passion for helping great entrepreneurs build great companies. We look forward to meeting you!

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription: Looking for marketing jobs? Agri-Cover, Inc., an aftermarket automotive manufacturer is looking for a full-time Marketing Coordinator position in Jamestown, ND. Agri-Cover, Inc., our success begins with you; join our innovative and growing company as a Marketing Coordinator today!SummaryBe part of our innovative team marketing ACI's products under the direction of the VP of Sales and Marketing. Provide project guidance and leadership support for team members with detailed information and follow-up to ensure quality work is being delivered.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesLead the social media team making daily posts, administer social media advertising continually evaluate the changing social media landscape.Bring new ideas for promotional items, advertising, and processes.Administer quarterly promotions, company apparel and business cards.Prepare and negotiate advertising and promotional contracts.Lead day-to-day tactical execution of graphic design, ad construction and application guides.Ensure deadlines are met in a fast-paced, tight-deadline environment.Understand company products and brands.Ensure consistent image throughout all marketing materials.Responsible for overseeing all in-house printing on large format digital printers.Write marketing copy.Execute part numbers for marketing items.Update and add products to electronic jobber.Communicate with data houses on displaying new or discontinued product data.Conducts market research.Enforce our MAP Program.Prepare and approve co-op spreadsheet and statements.Must be legally authorized to drive and able to properly operate a company pickup.Other duties may be assigned.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education and/or ExperienceBachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or Communications from a four-year college or university with a minimum of two years related experience; or a minimum of four years training in marketing, public relations, advertising or digital media. An equivalent combination of education and experience is also acceptable. Must possess professional written and verbal communication skills and a high level of attention to detail.Apply online at www.agricvoer.com/careers/.

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Full-time
JobDescription:
The Morton Arboretum is a world-renowned nonprofit with a unique opportunity for a creative self-starter with an interest in trees, nature, and conservation. We’re seeking someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has experience with email and marketing automation programs, creating content for emails and other marketing tactics, and developing multichannel promotional plans. You’ll be part of a talented Marketing and Communications team, working in a business casual office, with 1,700 acres of nature and beauty outside your office door.Position Summary: Provide support for The Morton Arboretum’s integrated marketing communications that attract and engage audiences and heighten brand awareness. Coordinate multichannel marketing plans and create brand-appropriate promotional copy for various marketing campaigns. Facilitate email marketing and paid social media advertising efforts.Essential Functions:  Coordinate promotional and integrated marketing plans for Arboretum exhibitions, events, and programs. Implement the Arboretum’s email marketing tactics, including content creation, layout development, list management, performance measurement, and fulfillment of cross-departmental email marketing needs. Write, edit, and proofread effective, branded marketing copy, incorporating key messages and strategies, for use in all communication channels. Partner with the Design team for campaign creative development. Use the project management system to track project planning, implementation, and results. Create and maintain updated project files. Facilitate the Arboretum’s paid social media advertising efforts in partnership with the Public Relations and Web teams. Research competitors and other market factors, and assist with audience research and data collection to measure the success of Arboretum marketing efforts. Coordinate promotional activities and provide marketing support to staff members who represent the Arboretum at community events. Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications: Associate’s degree required, Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred. 2+ years of relevant experience required, including marketing and advertising project management. Exceptional writing/editing/proofreading skills, and meticulous attention to detail. Ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple projects simultaneously required. Working knowledge of marketing tactics and how to use them effectively required. Demonstrated skills in logical thinking, reasoning, and problem-solving required. Advanced ability to create and update spreadsheets required. Must be proficient with email marketing tools (MailChimp, Act-On, or similar programs) and key social media platforms—familiarity with Google software, Microsoft Office, Basecamp, and Survey Monkey.Success Factors: Positive, collaborative attitude with the ability to work to deadline, often under pressure. Curiosity about new communication channels and opportunities, as well as the social trends that inform them. Ability to develop and foster positive relationships with interdepartmental partners. Emphasis on teamwork and supporting others. Confident, comfortable public demeanor with strong verbal skills. Detail-oriented, flexible, and self-directed. Ability to balance creative and strategic thinking, and sustain complex collaborations. Customer service oriented with the ability to relate effectively with persons internal and external to the Arboretum. Ability to embrace and align with the organization’s employee core values to be inclusive, take ownership, work together, keep learning, and make the Arboretum exceptional.Physical Demands and Work Environment: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.  Physical Demands: Requires some physical activity: it is necessary to operate a computer for prolonged periods on a daily basis, limited carrying and lifting (up to 25 lbs.), some local travel. Work Environment: Office environment. Work is performed primarily indoors, with some outdoors or offsite activity for public events. This position is designated as a hybrid-eligible position, allowing for some work to be performed off premise, during regular hours of work. Equipment: General office equipment, digital camera, tablets, scanner. Schedule: Position may require occasional weekend or evening hours.
For full consideration, please submit a resume and cover letter with your application.The Morton Arboretum is a champion for diversity, supporting a culture of inclusion that attracts, inspires, and engages people to achieve success. The Arboretum is committed to hire and develop employees based on job-related qualifications irrespective of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or veteran status. To increase diversity in professions related to the public garden realm, we encourage applications from underrepresented minorities, persons with disabilities, and veterans.The Morton Arboretum is dedicated to complying with our obligations as an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All applicants are guaranteed equal consideration for employment.
Skills: Advertising Project Management, Content Creation, Marketing Campaigns, Marketing Copy, Messaging, Paid Social Media, Paid Social Media Advertising, Performance Measurement, Public Relations, Social Media Advertising

Title: Field Sales Marketing Representative
JobDescription: FIELD SALES ROLE–Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI)About Us: TTI is a $13.2B company who grew over 33% during the pandemic of 2021. We are a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth.Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, HART®, Oreck ® and Vax®.TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you! During the pandemic alone, we brought on an additional 500 employees into our leadership development program to sustain our rapid growth! Duties and Responsibilities of our Entry Level Role:•Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products.•Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material.•Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities.•Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTI Management, and our retail partners.•Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition.•Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers.• Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. •Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data.Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.Education and Experience Requirements •Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. •Valid driver's license required.•Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. •Ability to work nights and weekends.•Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays.•Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills.
