Title: Field Sales and Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
About the jobAbout Us:TTI (Techtronic Industries) is a fast-paced, high energy, organization that rewards out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation allowing us to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you.In this position, you will drive sales of our premier product lines within one of our largest retailer partners. This position will allow you to enhance your selling, account management and communication skills while launching your career in a fast-paced and extremely rewarding company.TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care products. Our consumers range from professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair, and construction industries to homeowners & DIY enthusiasts. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence, and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provide TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth.Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance, and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Our brands include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hart ®, Homelite®, Oreck®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil® and Vax®.Duties and Responsibilities: Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products.Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities.Maintain regular contact with store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships.Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition.Participate in the Leadership Development Training Program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results.Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management, and customers.Professionally communicate with all peers, customers, and management.Plan and execute demo events, store walks, trade shows, etc.Develop primary knowledge of the marketplace (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data.Maintain store and product aesthetic through proper merchandising, positioning, and objective completion.Sell directly to our customers in the retail environment.
Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes, and quality.Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required.Must be at least 21 years of age or older.Must have a valid United States driver's license with at least one full year of driving experience.Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities.Ability to work nights and weekends.Ability to work in a retail environment full time.Eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship or restrictionsCapable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays.Applicant must be MS Office proficient.Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills.
TTI offers a competitive salary and a full-time benefits package which includes medical, dental, disability and life insurance. We also offer paid time off and paid holidays, tuition assistance, 401K matching program, company vehicle, smartphone, and a bonus program. Locations available Nationwide. To learn more about TTI, visit our website at www.ttirecruiting.com.

Title: Marketing Specialist, Membership Acquisition & Onboarding
JobDescription:
You are excited to play a crucial role in driving member growth and helping to ensure a seamless transition into our member community. You are committed to delivering exceptional customer experiences and fostering lasting partnerships. You will collaborate closely with various internal stakeholders, including marketing, sales, and customer success teams. You want to be part of a dynamic and innovative marketing team and have a direct impact on the growth of our organization.If this sounds like you, please read on!The Marketing Specialist, Member Acquisition and Onboarding will be expected to help execute a wide variety of marketing initiatives, including direct response acquisition and new member onboarding communications in all key segments. This entails coordination of key membership acquisition and onboarding campaigns, execution of internal marketing platforms for email and social, as well as supporting development and updating of key membership personas, managing digital/social strategies for both paid and organic media, internal communications, and more.This position will help execute a consistent brand voice and will support strategic initiatives to acquire and welcome new members into the Academy, including building lead generation initiatives, list purchases, nurture streams, etc. The ideal candidate is a motivated marketing professional with attention to detail. It is critical that the individual in this role can effectively manage high visibility projects, has a solid grasp on general marketing principles and tools, maintains the pulse of membership counts and budgets, and is a superb written and oral communicator. Critical analysis skills, experience with Microsoft excel, and other reporting software such as Power BI are a requirement. This person must have the ability to work with senior stakeholders, including the AAOS Membership Council that oversees the Membership department, collaborate with multiple departments within the organization, manage many projects simultaneously, and be able to organize and simplify information. This position will report to the Manager, Acquisition and Onboarding (Member Experience), and is part of the Marketing, Communications, and Membership Department.  Deploys marketing campaigns and owns their implementation from ideation to execution.  Experiments with a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels like content creation, content curation, pay per click campaigns, social media, lead generation campaigns.  Ensures continued A/B testing incurs on all marketing channels to boost conversion rates and improve open, click, click to open, and direct response rates where applicable.  Supports Manager, Acquisition and Onboarding, in work towards Academy solutions for tracking of conversion rates in all marketing and CMS platforms.  Executes the development and production of marketing material, from digital and print advertisements to hard copy brochures and telemarketing scripts.  Collaborates with Membership Operations team to create, target and execute appropriate campaigns for acquiring and onboarding members.  Creates and ensures consistent, effective messaging, and adapts messaging to reach multiple target audiences, presenting content in appealing, intuitive ways across various segments and demographics.  Builds and maintains monthly ROI reports to measure key metrics, success points, and areas of opportunity for both acquisition and onboarding campaigns.  Supports the entire membership application process, from start to finish, including aaos.org website pages, application system (MAAP), submission process, review, approval, and notification to members throughout the year.  Partners with Membership Marketing Engagement and Retention team to ensure seamless hand-off of members as they travel from acquisition to onboarding and engagement and renewal.  Measures and reports on the performance of marketing campaigns and assess against goals, including but not limited to deployment of member surveys and focus groups, google analytics, and campaign monitoring using PowerBI.  Analyzes consumer behavior and evaluates analytics to draw key conclusions and drive strategic recommendations for marketing campaign improvements, evaluation of member retention based on qualitative and quantitative measurable attributes.  Supports Manager, Membership in building reports, identifying key metrics and deliverables to both the Membership Council and the Board of Directors, where applicable.  Assists in annual updating of Membership Policy and Procedure document to ensure that all changes to operational requirements are captured and that Customer Service teams are trained and abreast of any modifications.  Builds strategic relationships and partners with agencies and vendors, where applicable.  Monitors the marketing budget on an on-going basis and allocates funds wisely.  Supports the strategy and execution of all acquisition and onboarding operations and communications for key audience personas.  Assists in the development of marketing materials, including email, postcards, telemarketing scripts, social media, web edits/updates, and promotional videos.  Leads strategy to identify and establish acquisition lists and lead generation funnels to acquire new members.  Supports the new member experience from key transition points, including transitions of key member groups (resident to fellowship, resident to candidate, fellowship to candidate, candidate to fellow, fellow to emeritus, etc.).  Supports and executes win back strategies for members who have dropped their membership (recent and long-term), including residents who do not respond to transition communications.  Assists with the preparation of ROI analysis, process improvements, and analytics for all marketing initiatives related to member acquisition and onboarding.  Collaborates with Customer Service and Membership Operations team in follow up for all tracking of applications, both board-approved, and non-board approved, including application fee collection, as well as support oversight for all resident dashboards and transition categories to ensure optimal experience and immediate onboarding of new and transitioning members.  Supports launch of new membership categories, once available, including but not limited to Medical Students, Affiliated Orthopaedic Surgeons, and Allied Health Orthopaedic Team Members. 
Exemplifies The Following Essential Values Of The Academy Teamwork: Effective collaboration and team-focus to solve complex problems and drive innovation. Empowerment: The authority, information, and skills to make decisions and drive results. Accountability: Ownership of process and results that drive decisions and ensure implementation. Mindset of Growth/Continuous Learning: Focused on and invested in self and staff development to become more adaptable, making the Academy more agile, innovative, and sustainable. 
TravelUp to 10 days per yearRequired Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree  Past work experience in direct response marketing with knowledge of digital marketing and content marketing  Experience with paid media, including Google and social media platforms, Google Analytics, and experience with SEO  Experience with marketing automation tools such as Marketo, Eloqua, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot  Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Photoshop, Illustrator, and/or Adobe Creative Suite 
Desired 3-5 years’ experience in Marketing, Communications/PR or Advertising, or Association Basic skill with HTML and/or web development software Bilingual in Spanish a plus but not required. 
If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following: Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter with salary expectations to be considered. 
Please NoteThis hybrid position is based in Rosemont, Illinois and is open to applicants who are able to  commute weekly  to this office.Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of work visas.JOB CODE: 1000055
Skills: Content Marketing, Digital Marketing, Direct Response Marketing, Key Metrics, Marketing Budget Management, Marketing Campaigns, Marketing Materials, Paid Media Advertising, Promotional Videos, Public Relations

Title: Marketing Data Engineer - Opry Entertainment
JobDescription: Manage data pipelines and architecture, including CRM and other databases, through data hygiene and creation of new data elements and calculated measures. Move, process, and monitor data systems.Create and manage cloud environments such as Big Query and Snowflake, including data pipelines, views, and integrations. Define and implement cloud-based infrastructure for data lakes, analytics and machine learning initiatives.Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management. Conduct data audits for quality, efficiency, and speed. Design and improve ETL processes for large complex data sets.Build analytics tools that utilize data pipelines to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics. Create and maintain data modeling for audience segmentation, product recommendation, predictive scoring, and customer affinities. Perform root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.Create and manage SQL code and Salesforce Marketing Cloud automations for campaign-specific needs, journey automations, CRM updates, and ingesting new data into CRM databases.Collaborate with analytics teams to define requirements, mine and analyze data, and integrate data from various sources.Participate in implementation of BI visualizations. Serve as the technical resource to identify input and output requirements for campaigns, projects, and other development needs.Create advanced analyses of customer and transactional data to create predictive and propensity models to inform segmentation and customer behavior studies. Conduct analysis to uncover insights about our products and users through cohort analysis, A/B tests, funnel analysis, user segmentation, etc.Evaluate marketing initiatives to determine profitability and success rate, then make recommendations and adjustments to improve performance or shifts in direction.Perform other duties as assigned.

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
Job Summary:We are looking for an experienced product marketer to drive product marketing strategy, messaging, positioning, and content generation across the buyer’s journey for Panzura. In this role, you will see the world from our customers' eyes and build compelling, strategic narratives to drive awareness and preference for Panzura. To be a successful candidate, you will have proven experience leading product marketing at a public cloud or SaaS company, or across early- and mid-stage businesses. You should have a track record of building compelling narratives and creative content that connects with customers across the buyer’s journey. You should be seasoned in positioning products in the market to drive instant clarity for buyers and sellers on the right product for the right use case. You should have a passion for technology, but proven ability to captivate new customers above the technical details. You'll work closely with senior leadership, product management, worldwide sales, and GTM (Go-to-Market) teams to get the right message out to the market and drive product launches.Responsibilities: Lead product marketing for Panzura and associated cloud data services with a focus on creating thought leadership and accelerating pipeline through impactful messaging, positioning, and storytelling.Create differentiated messaging and impactful content to drive demand.Influence industry analysts, press, and influencers including Gartner, IDC, and others.Own the marketing content strategy and development for Panzura for our website, buyer’s journey, press releases, briefings, sales plays, etc.Drive thought leadership that creates attention to Panzura POV for cloud operational experience and cloud-native data infrastructure.
Requirements: A Bachelor's Degree in Marketing or Engineering field.2-4 years marketing experience in a relevant industry, across product marketing, product management, or solutions marketing. Experience in marketing cloud-native or SaaS solutions preferred.Subject matter expertise in hybrid cloud, cloud services, data management, storage as a service, enterprise storage, and/or data protection strongly preferred.Demonstrated experience leading product launches, positioning products, and scaling businesses in competitive markets.The position is remote but may require some travels needed to collaborate with other team members, customers, and to participate in industry events.
About You:  Thinks strategically and executes on marketing strategies around Panzura Products/Cloud services/Solutions.Excellent written/oral communications, including presentation skills.Strong analytical skills.Excellent interpersonal skills.Creativity to break through the noise and earn attention.Excellent negotiating skills.Ability to interface effectively with all levels of management and functional disciplines.Strong influencing skills.
Panzura is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity to all employees and applicants and to prohibit any discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. Employees will be treated on the basis of their job-related qualifications, ability, and performance. It is also our policy that sexual harassment or any other kind of harassment including harassment based on sexual orientation will not be tolerated. The foundation of these policies is our commitment to treat everyone fairly and equally and to have a bias-free work environment.

Title: Marketing Associate Director - US CF
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionVertex is seeking a talented marketer to join our US Cystic Fibrosis Marketing team to support the launch of our next CF medicine. The Marketing Associate Director, US CF will lead the Health Care Professional Marketing for the Vanzacaftor team.For more information about Vertex’s CF program, visit https://www.vrtx.com/our-science/pipeline/. To learn more about working at Vertex and our commitment to a vibrant and inclusive culture, visit https://www.vrtx.com/working-here/inclusion-diversity-equity/.Job DescriptionThe Marketing Associate Director, US Cystic Fibrosis (CF) Marketing will be the Vanzacaftor Health Care Professional (HCP) Marketing lead and is responsible for the development of the US HCP brand strategy, and execution of the promotional marketing tactical plan to support the launch. The AD will be responsible for personal and non-personal channels. In this role, they will work cross-functionally to develop scenarios and tactical communication plans for HCPs to prepare for launch. This role will create launch scenario plans, consider customer perspectives on sweat chloride, and execute an unbranded campaign ahead of launch. Critical to the role is the ability to partner closely with the Vertex commercial promotional review committee (CRC) and regional and cross-functional colleagues to ensure tactics and plans are executable in the US.Key Responsibilities Partners with marketing and cross-functional partners to help shape the brand strategy, develop messaging, and support the launch of VanzacaftorLeads the development and implementation of strategic and tactical plansConducts US SwCl landscape assessment considering customers perspectives (HCP, Payer, Patient) and determines specific barriers / needs for different customer segmentsCollects key customer insights across HCPs stakeholders (through market research, analyzing digital tools and dashboards, etc.) and makes strategic recommendations to advance performance and launch goalsCollaborates with Sales Leadership, Brand teams and cross-functional partners (including promotional review committee) to ensure tactics and materials support the needs of the field team at launchCollaborates with Global Commercial Strategy team as well as US TRIKAFTA, KALYDECO, ORKAMBI, SYMDEKO brand teams to ensure approach is cohesive across brandsEvaluates ROI of HCP marketing tactics
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree8+ years of direct work experience in healthcare/pharmaceutical marketing, or equivalent combination of education and experience
Preferred Qualifications Strong team player with an ability to collaborate cross functionally and help partners accomplish shared objectivesAbility to simplify and innovate (push against the status quo)Ability to independently work and problem solveRemains calm, cool and collected in stressful situationsStrong organizational skillsAnalytical mindsetAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task and self-prioritize workloadProduct launch, and/or orphan/specialty/competitive market experience

Vertex is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job TypeFull-timeDescriptionPosition Overview:The marketing coordinator position provides transaction, marketing, and business development support to commercial real estate brokers in Tampa, FL. This role executes the corporate marketing strategy and initiatives locally while providing insight to the corporate marketing team on how these strategies are best refined for optimum local execution. In addition, this role is the on-site liaison for operations, research, IT, and accounting which are supported remotely. The overall goal of this position is to provide the best transaction, marketing, and business development, support in our industry while enhancing the SRS brand. The successful candidate in this position will play a critical role in the success of SRS’ industry-leading retail real estate brokers and the presence of the SRS brand in the local market. This role requires a can-do, customer-service-focused attitude and offers a well-rounded marketing position with opportunities for growing knowledge and experience in all facets of marketing, business development, and commercial real estate. This position is primarily supported by the corporate marketing team which provides access to the best marketing software, tools, and templates in the industry as well as ongoing training.Principal ResponsibilitiesTransaction, Marketing, & Business Development Support  Ensure all communications, presentations, and collateral enhance the SRS brand and are consistent with the brand guidelines and precedents set by the corporate marketing team. Create print and digital marketing packages, tour books, and presentations for property listings, growing retailer clients, and business development pitches. Create and deploy e-mail blasts for property listings, growing retailer clients, newsletters, and other announcements. Build and maintain property listings, client information and team member bios as needed on SRSRE.COM, CoStar, LoopNet, and potentially other third-party sites. Maintain, update, and segment contact databases, email distribution lists, and party invitation lists. Assist remote research analysts with market aerial map creation as well as demographic and traffic count research as needed. Prepare documents related to transactions, which may include letters of intent, commission agreements, contract forms, and reporting spreadsheets. Assist brokers in managing transaction activity related to leases, acquisitions, and dispositions. Utilize Apto (Salesforce-based business management software) to assist brokers in tracking the progress of their business development pursuits. Assist in aspects of computer usage related to marketing including e-mail signatures, styling documents according to SRS brand standards, and printing
Communications, Public Relations, Social Media and Events  Create transaction-related press releases and deploy to local media. Analyze results and work to strengthen relationships with local media outlets. Revise new hire and promotion press releases created by corporate marketing for local media distribution. Work with local team members to submit market/industry award applications for local office and brokers. Stay abreast of speaking opportunities to better position the local team as leaders in the industry. Assist in event planning for regional trade shows or nearby corporate events. Assist brokers with enhancing and maintaining their professional presence on LinkedIn. Manage local office social media accounts by maintaining brand standards, distributing relevant content regularly and increasing engagement and followers.
Requirements  Team player and customer-service-focused attitude Commercial real estate experience required Bachelor’s degree preferred (preferably in marketing, communications, advertising, or public relations) Strong attention to detail with excellent grammar Strong as organizational, project management and communication skills Must be willing and able to wear multiple hats, manage multiple projects, and prioritize tasks effectively to meet deadlines Intermediate to advanced Adobe InDesign and Photoshop skills are required; Adobe Illustrator is a plus Strong Microsoft Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, and Excel skills; Apto preferred as well E-mail marketing, public relations, social media, database management, and event coordination experience preferred We do not work with 3rd party recruiting agencies***
Skills: Award Applications, Communication, Digital Marketing, Email Distribution, Media Distribution, Newsletters, Presentations, Press Releases, Public Relations, Sales Presentations

Title: Marketing Assistant - Law Firm
JobDescription:
Are you a creative leader searching for the professional career challenge and reward of a lifetime right here in South Florida? A home where you can put your diverse skillset, ambition, and creative ideas to the test? An opportunity to immediately integrate into a tight-knit high-performing team with a welcoming invitation to make your impact from day one?Welcome to Rossen Law Firm, the biggest and fastest-growing criminal defense firm in Broward County! We are on the hunt for a high-caliber creative self-starter who lives, sleeps, and breathes a “digital first” approach to all things marketing and social media to join our firm as a Marketing Assistant.We strongly encourage digital marketing experts, content creators, social media enthusiasts, videographers, creatives from advertising agencies, community engagement specialists, or candidates who are currently handling creative or digital marketing efforts in-house for brands or companies to apply. We’re looking for a dynamic “brand storyteller” who is gifted in the written and spoken word and knows how to cultivate persuasive content with exceptional aesthetics to match.If you’re talented but bored or unchallenged, uninspired by your company or colleagues, or you’re simply ready for a new adventure – we want to hear from you. All inquiries will be held in strict confidentiality.Enticed? We know you are! Read on for more information on job requirements, who we are and what we’re looking for, salary and benefits, or simply apply now!Competitive Pay And Benefits Competitive salary to be negotiated commensurate with experience75% of health insurance “Gold Plan” paid by the firm7.5% of salary as a guaranteed 401K contribution regardless of employee contributionPaid Time Off accrued on a scheduleA great culture with a shared emphasis on continuous improvement. We are always adding new fringe benefits, programs, and events to improve our work/life balance!

Desired Skills and Experience
Qualifications
You care about people like we do – and we mean it! Watch this video to determine for yourself if our mission to help good people when bad things happen inspires you as much as it does us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nmRTXZN1FlcWe only want to hire this role once. We want you to genuinely desire a long-term home to which you’ll exclusively commit your time, skills, and talents to.You’ll need to be an outstanding manager of your time and projects. There is no room for interpersonal doubt or emotional reactions. You will always operate with logic and sensibility. You are tough, self-assured, and self-motivated.You extoll a “can-do” work ethic and willingness to “roll up your sleeves” to get the job done. This is not a passive job. You will have a workload of projects and tasks with milestones, deadlines, and end deliverables.You’ll need to exhibit a ruthless attention to detail. Be prompt, focused, and organized in all that you do. You’re a high-level strategic planner and executor. Mistakes are always OK – we take responsibility, learn from them, and never make them twice.You get excited about setting and working towards Big Hairy Goals (BHAGs) for brand growth, physical expansion, and market dominance in the legal services sector for criminal/DUI defense.
Responsibilities
Practical experience with social (paid and organic), with a demonstrative creative ability and a healthy obsession with innovation, best practices, and emerging industry trends in digital engagement more broadly.Experience in writing, producing, and managing engaging video and social content in collaboration with a team. Take the lead in creating and telling the stories that inspire our target market audience. Quickly respond to (or, even better, create!) opportunities to tell our brand’s story, and the triumphant stories of clients’ success, growth, and prosperity with our firm at their side. This will require you to get behind a camera and shoot content sometimes on a day’s notice or less.Create, manage, and enthusiastically execute a planned calendar of marketing events, partnerships, and activations throughout the year. Explore new partnerships and opportunities for community engagements. Lead the effort to make a remarkable first-impression impact on the people who may need criminal defense representation. We’re looking for an extrovert to get out there into the community and help our brand make a positive local impact!A willingness to be curious and fearlessly adopt out-of-the-box thinking for conjuring, developing, and pursuing new ideas that further the firm's goals and mission.Work alongside a creative owner-visionary with impeccable standards and integrity who loves marketing, business development, and coaching.An appreciation for healthy conflict and a propensity to cultivate solutions and compromise for a shared goal among a diverse pool of personalities and interests.A minimum of 2 years experience in creative marketing with a slant toward digital SEO, social media, videography, and content creation.
Skills: Communication, Copywriting, Creativity and Innovation, Email Marketing, Google Ads, Marketing Strategy, Public Relations, Research Skills, Social Media Marketing, Teamwork

JobDescription:

Health insurance with HSA and FSA options, Dental insurance, Vision insurance, Life/AD&D insurance, Short - Long- Term Disability coverage, 401(k), Paid Time off (PTO), Paid Holidays, Employee Referral Program, Employee and Family room rate discounts, great culture and leadership, growth opportunities, and more!In-House Marketing Desk AgentFull TimeBase + Commissions (Average $90-110,000/year)Open Availability Required (Monday-Sunday)Location: Summer Bay Orlando by Exploria ResortsJob SummaryThe In-House Marketing Desk Agent will work with speaking to and soliciting qualified In-House guests including owners, exchangers, and renters to attend our vacation ownership presentation or owner’s update presentation when they arrive at the resort. Title: Digital Content Marketing Coordinator - Consumer Marketing
JobDescription:
This is a unique entry-level opportunity within the Consumer Content team at Ameriprise Financial, working with colleagues across the firm to deliver compelling omnichannel content experiences to clients and prospects.As a Digital Content Marketing Coordinator, you will be responsible for ensuring content compliance across multiple channels and platforms including ameriprise.com, social media, native advertising and others. This includes managing content development, maintenance and updates, as needed. You will work within multiple content management systems as well as partner with the public sites agile team to maintain respective site standards, timelines and operational best practices. You will also optimize digital content, maintain content inventories and assist with reporting and dashboards. This position has a broad reach across the firm, working with multiple business partners, so strong relationship and communication skills are needed.This position reports to the Director, Content Marketing.Responsibilities Serve as primary point of intake and resource for ongoing content updates and maintenance in firm-owned digital assets.Update ameriprise.com web content in content management systems.Track, analyze and report on volume, frequency and trends in ongoing content requests. Contribute to team dashboard reporting and ad hoc reporting requests.Manage relationships with multiple business partners and provide guidance to on digital content requirements, trends and best practices.Work with subject matter experts across the company to make sure that content is representative of the company point of view.Maintain brand consistency across all channels and tactics.Help ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies and procedures.Other responsibilities, as assigned.
Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalentMinimum of 1-3 years of marketing and communications experience.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Detail oriented and self-motivated.Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and project collaboration.Experience handling content in digital channels (websites, social media).
Preferred Qualifications High degree of professionalism with ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment as well as desire to support and be an integral part of a team known for its high standards and reputation for creating extraordinary content.Familiarity with content management and project collaboration systems. (e.g., Jira, Smartsheet, Bloom reach etc.).Bachelor's degree in marketing, Business or a related field; or demonstrated experience in financial services industry or similarly regulated industry.Understanding of content success metrics and analysis.Familiarity with agile project management.Familiarity with wealth management and asset management, Ameriprise target audiences including affluent segments, and competitor activities.
About Our CompanyAt Ameriprise Financial, we're not just in the business of helping clients with their financial goals - we also help our advisors and employees reach their true potential by embracing an inclusive and collaborative culture. We celebrate the unique qualities and reward the contributions of our talented, passionate employees. If you're motivated and want to work for a strong, ethical company that cares about you and your community, take the next step with Ameriprise Financial.Ameriprise Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, gender identity, disability, veteran status, marital status, family status or any other basis prohibited by law.

Title: Marketing-Third Party Associate
JobDescription:
It’s our people that make Shoes For Crews special! We hire talented people who support our values and provide training and coaching to our crew to meet their career objectives. Our success comes from great team work and exceptional individual effort. We strive to reward collaboration and recognize accomplishments in an environment of mutual support and respect. It’s much more than a great place to work, it’s where our crew looks forward to Monday, not Friday.What You Will Love About US Great Company Culture-Awarded one of the TOP companies to work forCompetitive salaryGenerous Health Benefit Package (some at NO cost)Prepare for the future-401(k) (with 3% match)Paid vacation, holidays, and sick leaveHybrid and remote schedulesEmployee recognition platformEmployee discounts (Including a FREE pair of shoesWellness programRobust onboarding programQUPID CommitteeEngagement Committee
Our mission is to keep the workforce safe on the job with comfortable, quality protective footwear solutions—reducing accidents and saving money!Shoes For Crews, LLC (SFC) is a dynamic designer, manufacturer and business-to-business marketer of the most technologically advanced, top-rated slip-resistant footwear for the foodservice, hospitality, industrial, and healthcare workplaces. SFC protects over 3.5 million workers per year in over 120,000 workplaces from slip and fall accidents. For over 30 years, the Company has built its reputation through innovative product development technologies, proprietary manufacturing, and distinct niche marketingPosition Summary: Individual will be responsible for supporting Third Party Market team by helping drive processes, systems, and reporting that help to improve the overall effectiveness on Amazon and other third party markets. This is a cross-functional role that will work with work with Customer Success, Product, and Analytics to ensure key internal reporting is accurate and best practices are being set and followed. The third party associate will also help to ensure that the new acquisition third party markets are successfully onboarded.Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Pulling reports from Third Party PlatformsWeekly operational platform performance trackingUpload content and videos onto platformTake queries from our own Customer Service teamMonitor social channels for trending ideasSupport team with daily administrative tasksItem set up and maintenance for respective platformsCatalog monitoringOrder validation
Qualifications And Skills Required Strong planning and project delivery skillsExcellent organizational, communication teamwork and time management skillsAn adaptable and flexible individual who can execute plans and have a hands-on approach to workStrong understanding of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
Education Required Bachelors degree in Marketing or Business Administration preferred
This job description is not intended to be all–inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties without notice or a change in compensation to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.Shoes For Crews is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse and inclusive workforce. Title: Email Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Join a growing and dynamic team that is taking digital marketing and e-commerce to the next level! The Digital Marketing & Sales team is seeking an Email Marketing Specialist to be a key contributor to our department and company’s pillars through the development of messaging strategy, implementation and reporting of email campaigns.Core ResponsibilitiesStrategy & Implementation Create, build and execute end-to-end email marketing strategies that includes concepts, design, testing, optimizing, developing and scheduling emails within our CRM toolMaintain data hygiene and clean lists to maintain email deliverability reliability and reputationDevelop compelling copy that will drive customer engagement and aligns with company goals including revenue, branding and voiceAssist Marketing Operations Manager in growing our email subscription listsStay up-to-date with email marketing best practices and trends
CRM Tool Update and monitor email lists with the CRM tool and develop segments to target for campaignsMonitor the customer buying journey and build loyalty with new and current customersDevelop campaigns to create leads within the CRM tool
Processes and Analytics Develop and maintain process for utilizing lists within the CRM ToolCreate documentation on how to best implement email campaigns based on new product releases, backlist titles and market/industry trendsDevelop dashboards for email reporting within the CRM Tool to make data-driven decisions.Report on sales revenue generated from email marketing efforts and share insights into optimizing and growing our customer databaseEnsure compliance with email marketing privacy and regulations, such as CAN-SPAM and GDPR.
Who We Are Looking ForThis newly created position will require someone who is willing to dream, take risks, think creatively, collaborate, ask questions, and have a hunger to research and discover. They will be interested in what motivates people and will stay diligent at pursuing information. Finally, they will be able to respond well to pressure, meet deadlines, maintain accuracy, and focus on attention to detail!We are seeking a team player who has 3-5 years of experience in email marketing and using supporting technology (preferably HubSpot) and comes with a college degree in marketing/digital marketing, communications, or a related field.Qualifications And Other Skills HTML/CSS and Adobe Creative Suite experience is a plus.Experience with marketing automation tools and supporting technology stackExperience supporting omnichannel marketing campaigns using Inbound methodology to deliver a personalized and cohesive buying journeyKnowledge of a wide range of digital marketing techniques and concepts
Skills: CAN-SPAM, Campaigns, Digital Marketing, E-Commerce, Email Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Automation, Marketing Campaigns, Sales and Marketing, Test Automation Tools

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Hybrid
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionDanfoss is looking for a Digital Marketing Specialist to join our diverse team. If you enjoy the thrill of lead generation and nurturing, we need to talk. We are looking for a versatile digital marketing specialist who will be responsible for contributing to business objectives using all the tools in our digital marketing stack for our AC Drives division.Job ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities for this position include, but are not limited to, the following.  Digital lead generation and nurturing in a team environment  Website design and maintenance  Manage social media plan and meet growth KPIs  Internal and External communications  Marketing automation and email journey creation  Manage employee advocacy program  Brand management  Report on campaign data analytics provide recommendations based upon campaign performance  Write promotional content (landing pages, ads, social media posts, etc.)  Intranet and extranet site management  Support requests for assistance with content design and updates, video projects, and communications  10% travel. Mostly domestic. 
Background & SkillsAt Danfoss, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a broader perspective in decision-making. When you consider this job posting, do you feel like your profile is not a perfect match? Numerous studies have found that women and people of color are more likely to apply only when they meet all requirements listed in the job posting. Even if you do not check all the boxes, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are curious to find out how you can bring new insights to the role or to Danfoss as an organization.Required (basic) Qualifications.  B.A in Marketing or Communications, or 5 years related work experience. 
 Qualifications  Solid understanding of the B2B buyer journey, digital marketing ecosystem, and lead generation/nurturing  Experience supportingMarketing Automation, Social Media, CRM, SEO/SEM, Employee Advocacy, Website design/maintenance, graphic design, and video production  Experience with tools such asAdobe Creative Suite, Sprout Social, Bambu, Salesforce Marketing cloud, Google Analytics, etc.  Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to run multiple projects simultaneously, while meeting deadlines and budgets in a fast-paced, global/matrixed environment  Strong analytical and quantitative skills with a passion for driving results  Team player who is positive, enthusiastic, flexible, and takes initiative with a “can-do” attitude.  Strong writing/story telling skills  Highly motivated, resilient, and persistent in reaching objectives  Digital native, “Digital first mindset”  Attention to detail required 
Employee BenefitsWe are excited to offer you the following benefits with your employment  Bonus system  Paid vacation  Personal insurance  Communication package  Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups  State of the art virtual work environment  Employee Referral Program 
This list does not promise or guarantee any particular benefit or specific action. They may depend on country or contract specifics and are subject to change at any time without prior notice.Danfoss – Engineering TomorrowAt Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

Title: Marketing Executive
JobDescription:
We are searching for an ambitious marketing executive to spearhead our marketing campaigns. You will be required to coordinate with staff in other departments, ensuring that each endeavor runs smoothly from inception to delivery. To ensure success as a marketing executive, you should be attuned to attitudinal changes within each target audience. Ultimately, a top-notch marketing executive will conceptualize ways in which marketing activities can be harnessed to expand our own company's footprint.Responsibilities: Researching and brainstorming each stage of the project.Delegating assignments to members of the graphics and advertising departments, as needed.Supervising employees' work, providing direction and clarification, as needed.Ensuring adherence to clients' specifications.Coordinating efforts to ensure that campaigns are completed.Adhering to time and financial restrictions.Tracking changes in consumer engagement following the roll-out of each marketing campaign.Compiling reports detailing the effects exerted by each campaign, and sharing these with clients
Marketing Executive Requirements: Degree in marketing, sales, or similar.Prior experience as a marketing executive.Proficiency in Hootsuite.A thorough understanding of contemporary trends in consumerism.Excellent research and writing skills, particularly as these apply to marketing.Strong leadership, delegation, and capacity development skills.Highly organized and detail-oriented.Respect for people and ideas.
Join our team and make a significant impact on our brand's growth and success. Apply now to become our Marketing Executive and lead our marketing efforts to new horizons!

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription: Dept Number/Name: 0-4601-000 / Innovative EducationSalary Plan: AdministrativeJob Code/Title: 9587 / Marketing SpecialistHiring Salary/Salary Range: $55,000 - $65,000Position Number: 00053993Work Flexibility: This person will be part of a communications and marketing team that largely works M-F in-person on the Tampa campus but there will be opportunities for remote work on occasion provided goals are being consistently met and projects are completed in a timely fashion.ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:Innovative Education (InEd) meets the needs of learners at any time and any place through innovative distance learning, continuing education, degree completion, certificate, workforce development, lifelong learning, and pre-college programs. InEd contributes to student success by collaborating with faculty, teaching assistants and academic administrators to strengthen the quality and breadth of USF's educational offerings, and by providing a variety of academic services, including online teaching workshops, consultations, and instructional technology support. InEd aligns with the goals stated in the USF Strategic Plan, including the desire to increase enrollments, improve the university's degree completion rate, and develop and nurture public-private partnerships designed to generate new revenue and ensure institutional financial security. InEd is committed to contributing to student success, supporting teaching, generating new revenue, and establishing a reputation for innovation and quality that distinguishes USF from its competition.POSITION SUMMARY:This position exists to support communications and marketing efforts for USF Innovative Education. Functions include writing stories for the website, writing features for newsletters and external outreach, writing news releases for potential pitches. This person will work with academic units across USF to find subjects for stories, which will range from students to alumni to newsworthy program changes. This person will also work with teammates to write or edit website copy, bios, or content related to online programming where Innovative Education partners with other units. This person will also write content for email blasts related to Corporate Training and Professional Development programs. Future newsletters are envisioned for targeted audiences and this position will be responsible for the content, design and distribution.SPECIAL SKILLS/TRAINING:This position requires someone with training in oral and written communications, familiarity with AP Style, and the use of the tools such as a CMS, Constant Contact and Sprout.RESPONSIBILITIES:This position requires someone with training in oral and written communications, familiarity with AP Style, and the use of the tools such as a CMS, Constant Contact and Sprout.Work with teammates to write or edit website copy and content related to online programming where Innovative Education partners with other units. Maintain and/or collaborate on website maintenance, including posting stories, releases, photos and other content.Write content for email blasts related to Corporate Training and Professional Development programs.Future newsletters are envisioned for targeted audiences and this position will be responsible for the content, design and distribution, serving as writer and editor.Assist with social media posts and report metrics.Performs other duties as assignedPOSITION QUALIFICATIONS:MINIMUM:This position requires a bachelor's degree and 2 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.PREFERRED:This position requires a Bachelor's degree in mass communications, advertising, or marketing. This position requires a minimum of four years' experience in writing and communications team roles, preferably in higher education. The ideal candidate should be a strong journalistic writer who is well-versed in AP Style. The ideal candidate should demonstrate an understanding of a variety of writing styles, including feature stories, website copywriting, writing for social media, and bios.SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:Samples of work must be included, and a cover letter is strongly recommended.The ability to write for different media/purposes (web, social, news, content marketing, landing pages) and demonstrated ability to write for these varied audiences/purposes is preferred.Information for Applicants This position is subject to a Level 1 criminal background check.Job Opening Number: 34608Posting Date: 07/11/2023Posting End Date: 08/10/2023How To ApplyClick on the Apply Now button. When applying to an opening you will have the opportunity to upload a cover letter and resume.Apply online by completing the required information and attaching your cover letter and resume. Please include your experience as it relates to the qualifications stated above. YOUR COVER LETTER AND RESUME, PLUS ANY OTHER REQUESTED MATERIAL, MUST BE IN ONE ATTACHMENT. Only online applications are accepted for this position.Click here for additional tutorial information.Equal Employment Opportunity USF is an equal opportunity, equal access academic institution that embraces diversity in the workplace.The University of South Florida does not discriminate on the basis of sex and prohibits sexual harassment. Any person may report sex discrimination, including sexual harassment (whether or not the person reporting is the person alleged to be the victim of conduct that could constitute sex discrimination or sexual harassment), in person, by mail, by telephone, or by electronic mail, using the contact information listed for the Title IX Coordinator. Reports may be made at any time either online or directly to the University's Title IX Coordinator.Federal RightsApplicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA).Work Location Campus map and location overview: USF - Tampa CampusAbout USFThe University of South Florida is a high-impact global research university dedicated to student success. Over the past 10 years, no other public university in the country has risen faster in U.S. News and World Report's national university rankings than USF. Serving more than 50,000 students on campuses in Tampa, St. Petersburg and Sarasota-Manatee, USF is designated as a Preeminent State Research University by the Florida Board of Governors, placing it in the most elite category among the state's 12 public universities. USF is a member of the American Athletic Conference.Working at USFWith more than 16,000 employees at USF, the University of South Florida is one of the largest employers in the Tampa Bay region. At USF you will find opportunities to excel in a rich academic environment that fosters the development and advancement of our employees. We believe in creating a talented, engaged and driven workforce through on-going development and career opportunities. We also offer a first class benefit package that includes medical, dental and life insurance plans, retirement plan options, tuition program and generous leave programs and more.To learn more about working at USF please visit: Work Here. Learn Here. Grow Here.Connect with us:

Join our team and make a significant impact on our brand's growth and success. Apply now to become our Marketing Executive and lead our marketing efforts to new horizons!

Title: BCRI Branding & Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Founded in 1992, Baltimore Crisis Response, Inc. (BCRI) is a nonprofit behavioral health services organization based in Baltimore City. Primarily serving low-income communities in Baltimore and Maryland, BCRI provides call center services, mobile crisis response, residential treatment, case management, EMS/LE diversion, and community outreach. BCRI’s mission to provide timely and effective community-based services in the least restrictive environment. In the last two years, BCRI has expanded its services and operations immensely, increasing workforce by around 60% and creating new service lines and locations to provide crisis and behavioral health services to more communities than ever before. However, this recent expansion of BCRI’s services to new regions and populations has resulted in a need for administrative capacity to support the resulting increase in scale and impact. The goal of this project is to build capacity and sustainability for BCRI in various administrative areas of focus so that BCRI can maximize its expansion to serve communities of Maryland as effectively as possible. The VISTA Branding & Marketing Coordinator will use marketing strategies and consumer feedback to help BCRI build a compelling brand, create targeted messaging, and identify and pursue opportunities for community outreach. They will also collaborate with BCRI staff and board members, external stakeholders, and other behavioral health providers to promote brand awareness, craft a compelling organizational brand, expand BCRI’s public relations, and build sustainable marketing practices that will support BCRI’s expansion. BCRI is seeking applicants with a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience and a high school diploma. Preferred qualifications are 2-5 years of relevant experience and some college education, preferably a bachelor’s degree or greater. Other desired skills include professionalism, teamwork, writing/editing skills, and a willingness to learn and grow.Further help on this page can be found by  clicking here  .Member Duties : The VISTA Branding & Marketing Coordinator will perform activities to build marketing capacity and sustainability. For example, they will develop and implement a branding and marketing plan that will establish a framework for improving and empowering BCRI’s image, outreach, and community impact. The VISTA Branding & Marketing Coordinator will also create and maintain a public relations media plan for each department at BCRI that outlines which audiences will be targeted, across which channels, at what time, and with which message in order for BCRI to maximize its outreach to the community. One example includes creating “impact messages” that target certain demographics who need BCRI services. Additionally, the VISTA Branding & Marketing Coordinator will create and compile print materials, swag, and organizational messaging using the branding and marketing plan and distribute regularly to external stakeholders, clients, staff, and at recruitment or employer events.Program Benefits : Health Coverage* , Relocation Allowance , Childcare assistance if eligible , Choice of Education Award or End of Service Stipend , Living Allowance , Training . For details about AmeriCorps VISTA healthcare benefits, please visit http://www.vistacampus.gov/healthcare
TermsPermits attendance at school during off hours , Car recommended , Permits working at another job during off hours .Service AreasCommunity Outreach , Health , Entrepreneur/Business .SkillsCommunications , Marketing , Team Work , General Skills , Business/Entrepreneur , Writing/Editing .Refine SearchSummaryProgram Type:AmeriCorps VISTAProgramBCRI Branding & Marketing CoordinatorProgram Start/End Date08/28/2023 - 08/27/2024Work Schedule Full TimeEducation levelHigh school diploma/GEDAge RequirementMinimum: 18 Maximum: NoneProgram Locations MARYLAND Washington/BaltimoreLanguagesEnglishAccepting ApplicationsFrom 07/10/2023 To 10/01/2023Contact Nicholas Richard5124 Greenwich AveBaltimore MD 212292409047382nrichard@bcresponse.orgListing ID  119672

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
One of The Sage Group’s clients is looking for a Marketing Coordinator, with compliance or documentation experience in marketing. The client is a medical device and health care company.The Coordinator is responsible for the workflow of the review and approval system (Zinc) and the accuracy of materials submitted into the system as dictated by the FDA and the Ad & Promo Materials Review and Approval SOP.Duties Proofs all marketing materials initiated in review and approval system for accuracy. Assign reviewers in system and ensures that all content is taken through proper Regulatory, Quality and Legal reviews in compliance with the Ad & Promo Materials Review and Approval Standard Operating Procedure (SOP). Monitor jobs to ensure that reviews are completed as assigned and on time. Collaborates with Marketing Communications to resolve comments and edits documented in system. Archives all jobs in Zinc and ensures certification accuracy. Responsible for updating the list of reviewers by functional area and disease state or product line. Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments. Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors. Performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned. 
 Requirements: An Associates degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Project Management 3 years compliance or documentation 3 years in marketing advertising and promotion or marketing agency experience. Strong proofreading skills. Medical device or pharma experience desired. Experience working with project management tools and software. Experience working in a broader enterprise/cross-division business unit model preferred. Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment. Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment. Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects. Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Ability to travel up to 10%. Multitasks, prioritizes and meets deadlines in timely manner. Strong organizational and follow-up skills, as well as attention to detail. 
 Location: 100% remote USADuration: 6 months to start with potential extensionCompensation: $30-40hr Depending on Experience

Title: Digital Marketing Analyst
JobDescription:
This role will provide data expertise as we improve the growth, retention, engagement, and brand affinity of our products on the health and wellness platform. The Web Analytics Specialist will work closely with cross-functional teams and improve techniques, processes, tracking, analytical insights and technology used by marketing to achieve our goals. The key scope of this position is to help address the complex challenges of design, marketing effectiveness, contact strategy, ROI, consumer behavior and channel effectiveness. Identify revenue opportunities and provide ongoing optimization analysis to the organization to improve sales and customer experience.Provide ongoing review of traffic and conversion trends for all sites and identify areas for improving site conversion.Refine SEO strategy to increase keyword ranking and traffic, leading to other core key performance indicators.Transform raw web analytics data into actionable insight/opportunities to help drive overall sales and improved brand perception.Perform ongoing evaluation of digital environment and competitive landscape to identify unique market opportunities and threats; provide metrics and analysis to key management, on a regular basis.Constantly evaluate new digital e-Commerce opportunities and make recommendations for optimizing performance.Design and automate reports, dashboards, and analyses for website and digital marketing including performance, data, trends, business context and actionable insights to business.Analyze consumer behavior on the site to identify traffic trends and pain points within the online experience and provide strategic insights to support data-driven decision making.Quickly identify causes and solutions to issues or unexpected results as identified in reporting.Ensure data quality by conducting regular audits and testing tracking on site to verify metrics are properly captured and reported correctly. Provide domestic and international markets with ongoing strategic counsel on search best practices and tactics that align with brand objectives/goals and overall business.Manage the paid and organic search campaigns, web analytics and digital marketing, by tracking, reporting, and analyzing all search initiatives and campaigns; responsible for forecasting and budgeting initiatives. Establish clear search marketing performance indicators that complement overall marketing and business objectives.Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution or equivalent experience.2 years experience in a digital marketing role.Solid experience managing and executing paid search campaigns.Fundamental knowledge and experience with web analytics tools and interfaces.Proven digital experience launching and growing search-marketing channels.Skilled in the use of Microsoft office software to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.Strong interpersonal skills, detail oriented and able to coordinate/manage multiple tasks simultaneously.Posses strong and proven data analytics and strategy background.Solid quantitative, analytical, and organizational skills. Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business or related discipline.5 years experience in a search engine marketing role.Proficient in Google Adwords, Google Analytics, Insights and Webmaster Tools.
Established in 2002, Isagenix International has created simple, proven products that optimize what your body is capable of—helping you protect your greatest asset, your health. For more than twenty years, Isagenix has made holistic science an art with transparency and integrity—creating products and systems that address nutrition, stress, fitness, energy, natural beauty, focus and financial wellbeing. The global wellbeing company, based in Gilbert, Arizona, markets their products through a network of independent distributors in 23 key markets the United States, Canada, Puerto Rico, Australia, New Zealand, Mexico, the United Kingdom, Ireland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, Austria, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, and Switzerland. For more information, visit Isagenix.com.Isagenix International, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

Title: Digital Content Marketing Coordinator – Consumer Marketing
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionThis is a unique entry-level opportunity within the Consumer Content team at Ameriprise Financial, working with colleagues across the firm to deliver compelling omnichannel content experiences to clients and prospects.As a Digital Content Marketing Coordinator, you will be responsible for ensuring content compliance across multiple channels and platforms including ameriprise.com, social media, native advertising and others. This includes managing content development, maintenance and updates, as needed. You will work within multiple content management systems as well as partner with the public sites agile team to maintain respective site standards, timelines and operational best practices. You will also optimize digital content, maintain content inventories and assist with reporting and dashboards. This position has a broad reach across the firm, working with multiple business partners, so strong relationship and communication skills are needed.This position reports to the Director, Content Marketing.Responsibilities Serve as primary point of intake and resource for ongoing content updates and maintenance in firm-owned digital assets.Update ameriprise.com web content in content management systems.Track, analyze and report on volume, frequency and trends in ongoing content requests. Contribute to team dashboard reporting and ad hoc reporting requests.Manage relationships with multiple business partners and provide guidance to on digital content requirements, trends and best practices.Work with subject matter experts across the company to make sure that content is representative of the company point of view.Maintain brand consistency across all channels and tactics.Help ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies and procedures.Other responsibilities, as assigned.

Preferred Qualifications High degree of professionalism with ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment as well as desire to support and be an integral part of a team known for its high standards and reputation for creating extraordinary content.Familiarity with content management and project collaboration systems. (e.g., Jira, Smartsheet, Bloom reach etc.).Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business or a related field; or demonstrated experience in financial services industry or similarly regulated industry.Understanding of content success metrics and analysis.Familiarity with agile project management.Familiarity with wealth management and asset management, Ameriprise target audiences including affluent segments, and competitor activities.

If you’re motivated and want to work for a strong, ethical company that cares about you and your community, take the next step with Ameriprise Financial.Ameriprise Financial is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Digital Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
We are seeking a highly motivated and creative Digital Marketing Assistant to join our dynamic marketing team. The Digital Marketing Assistant will play a key role in executing and optimizing various digital marketing campaigns and initiatives. The ideal candidate is passionate about all things digital, has a strong understanding of online marketing channels, and possesses excellent analytical and communication skills. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in the fast-paced world of digital marketing.Responsibilities:  Assist in the planning, development, and implementation of digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including but not limited to search engine optimization (SEO), pay-per-click (PPC) advertising, social media, email marketing, and content marketing. Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for campaign optimization. Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling and engaging content for digital platforms, including website copy, blog posts, social media updates, and email newsletters. Monitor and analyze the performance of digital marketing campaigns using analytics tools, and provide regular reports and recommendations for improvement. Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors, such as designers, developers, and content creators, to ensure timely and effective implementation of marketing initiatives. Provide administrative support, including organizing meetings, managing marketing materials, and coordinating with external partners as necessary.
Qualifications:  Solid understanding of digital marketing concepts, strategies, and best practices. Familiarity with various digital marketing channels, including SEO, PPC, social media, email marketing, and content marketing. Proficient in using digital marketing tools and analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, social media management tools, and email marketing platforms. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven recommendations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to multitask and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
We are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team as a Junior Marketing Specialist. In this role, you will work closely with our marketing team to support various marketing initiatives and campaigns. The ideal candidate is passionate about marketing, possesses strong analytical skills, and is eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities:  Assist in the development and execution of marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, email marketing, and content marketing. Help create and optimize marketing content, such as blog posts, social media posts, and website copy. Support the planning and execution of events, trade shows, and promotional activities. Monitor and analyze marketing campaign performance using analytics tools and provide actionable insights. Assist in managing and growing the company's social media presence. Conduct regular competitor analysis to identify areas of opportunity and improvement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, and design, to ensure marketing efforts align with overall company objectives. Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and marketing best practices.
Requirements:  Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in using social media platforms and digital marketing tools. Familiarity with marketing analytics tools, such as Google Analytics or similar platforms. Basic understanding of SEO principles and content marketing strategies. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively manage multiple projects and deadlines. Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

Title: Marketing/Communications Specialist
JobDescription:
DetailsOpen Date 07/07/2023Requisition Number PRN35617BJob Title Marketing/Communications SpecialistWorking Title Marketing/Communications SpecialistJob Grade EFLSA Code ProfessionalPatient Sensitive Job Code? NoStandard Hours per Week 40Full Time or Part Time? Full TimeShift DayWork Schedule SummaryVP Area U of U Health - AcademicsDepartment 02010 - RMCOEH CenterLocation OtherCity Salt Lake City, UTType of Recruitment External PostingPay Rate Range 39300 to 56000Close DateOpen Until Filled YesJob SummaryThis position includes a variety of activities focused on promoting the Rocky Mountain Center for Occupational and Environmental Health ( RMCOEH ), which is breaking ground as Utah’s first officially designated multi-university program, between the University of Utah and Weber State University.The ideal candidate will have a broad skill set at their disposal to raise the public profile of RMCOEH , one of the leading centers of its kind in the country, and its mission of protecting workers and serving businesses. Experience planning and executing marketing strategies is crucial, as is the ability to collaborate with a diverse team of faculty and staff. A background in public relations, meanwhile, is a plus.This position will be responsible for elevating RMCOEH’s brand — including its programs at both the University of Utah and Weber State University — through a range of channels, with aims that include recruiting local and national students, increasing stakeholders’ awareness about the center’s positive impacts on workers and businesses, and growing engagement with our continuing education offerings for professionals.A typical day may involve collaborating with our multimedia content specialist on a social media advertising campaign in the morning, designing a plan to market our continuing education courses to professionals before lunch, and accompanying faculty on a visit to a construction site in the afternoon for an up-close look at the kinds of problems graduates of our programs are trained to tackle.The person who will be most successful in this position views themselves, on some level, as a storyteller. They are intrigued — and motivated — by the challenge of ensuring the world knows about the remarkable things happening here every day, from students becoming budding experts in their fields to faculty conducting research that shapes how key issues regarding occupational and environmental health and safety are understood.We want people to know what we do at RMCOEH and how it makes workers’ lives better and our communities stronger.We are looking for someone who gets excited at the prospect of digging into what makes our center special and showcasing it in a way that gets people to sit up and pay attention.If that’s you, please apply. We’re excited to hear your story — and to learn how you can help us share ours.Responsibilities Designs, coordinates, and executes a wide range of marketing/communications.Meets with, and develops enduring relationships with, business and labor community contacts.Performs a variety of writing, design, and project management tasks.Demonstrates good judgment and strong interpersonal skills to plan and execute marketing/communications strategies.Utilizes traditional and electronic publishing technologies to produce communications that achieve project objectives.Collaborates with diverse staff, faculty, and students at both the University of Utah and Weber State University to plan and execute marketing/communications strategies.Monitors effectiveness of marketing/communication tactics and adjusts strategies as necessary.Proofreads communications and monitors media.May perform other related technical duties as assigned
