Title: Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
WHO ARE WE?Gold Standard Auctions is a trusted platform that brings together individuals who share a passion for exquisite valuables. We offer a secure and seamless auctioning experience, connecting sellers and buyers in a personalized and reliable manner. Our commitment is to deliver top-notch customer service, ensuring that every consigned item receives the attention it deserves to attract a wide audience of potential buyers. We foster a vibrant and collaborative work environment that encourages growth, learning, and a sense of camaraderie. Our ultimate goal is to set the industry standard for excellence, transparency, and professionalism, continuously adapting to meet the evolving needs of our valued clients.WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?Joining our team as a Marketing Manager means stepping into a pivotal role where you'll be instrumental in driving our brand's prominence, enhancing the customer experience, and achieving our ambitious sales targets. As the creative force behind our company's branding, you'll showcase our illustrious auction house and leverage your expertise to demonstrate how our offerings cater to our clients' every desire. If you're a marketing enthusiast with a flair for exceptional customer service and a passion for thriving in a fast-paced environment, we can't wait to hear from you!RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and Execute Marketing Campaigns: Collaborate with the Chief Development Officer to create and implement comprehensive marketing campaigns. Utilize various promotional strategies, including digital marketing, social media, email marketing, and traditional advertising, to maximize reach and achieve sales targets.Client Relationship Management: Build strong relationships with clients through personalized interactions. Understand each client's account thoroughly and identify opportunities for targeted promotions and personalized offers to enhance customer loyalty.Budget Optimization: Implement targeted marketing and sales strategies while optimizing the allocated budget. Continuously monitor the effectiveness of marketing efforts and adjust strategies as needed to achieve customer outreach and sales goals.Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Regularly monitor CRM and sales statistics to measure the success of marketing initiatives. Prepare detailed reports on campaign performance, providing valuable insights and recommendations to the Executive team.Problem Solving and Creativity: Demonstrate creativity in finding solutions to marketing challenges. Stay updated with industry trends and adapt marketing strategies to keep the company ahead of competitors.Training and Support: Assist Executives in understanding and implementing effective marketing plans. Foster a learning environment, sharing knowledge and best practices to enhance the marketing team's capabilities.
QUALIFICATIONS: Educational Background: A Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or a related field is a plus. However, candidates without a degree will be considered for entry-level positions if they exhibit exceptional customer service skills, sales acumen, and a strong interest in the industry.Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for effectively conveying marketing messages and building strong relationships with clients.Organizational Skills: Demonstrate a well-developed organizational skill set, allowing you to prioritize tasks, set schedules, and complete projects within designated time frames while maintaining high-quality standards.Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail is crucial to ensure error-free and effective marketing materials and campaigns.Presentation Skills: Strong presentation skills are necessary, as you may be involved in public speaking and engaging in social networking settings.Team Player and Leadership: Ability to work effectively within a team and autonomously. Willingness to take on leadership roles when required to drive marketing initiatives.
Join our dynamic team at Gold Standard Auctions, where your creativity, problem-solving skills, and passion for marketing will contribute to our continued success as a trusted platform for exquisite valuables. Embrace the opportunity to excel in a fast-paced environment, drive our brand's prominence, and exceed our ambitious sales targets. Together, let's set the industry standard for excellence, transparency, and professionalism in the world of auctions.

Title: Business Development and Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
Who We AreRestoration 1 of Metro Atlanta services our local community for fire, smoke, and water damage, sewage cleanup and mold remediation activities at residential, commercial and industrial properties. We are a part of the national Restoration 1 network and take pride in providing these services to help our customers get back to what is important – family life and business activities.Restoration 1's reputation for fast responses, unparalleled quality, and uninhibited commitment contributes to our growth as a company. We understand that the need for property restoration services can come at the most unexpected times, which is why we are always ready to help!Restoration 1 of Metro Atlanta is seeking a candidate who can create new prospects and clients, provide exceptional customer service with the ability to show compassion while building new relationships to continue the growth of the company. The Business Development and Marketing Representative will pursue and cultivate strong professional relationships with our referral sources and trade partners by analyzing the market, identifying viable target clients, reaching decision-makers, and intensely focusing on turning leads into accounts and sales. They will estimate and sell water, mold, and fire damage restoration to new and existing customers.They will be visiting and establishing relationships with our targeted trade partners and referral sources, which include, but are not limited to, plumbers, HVAC companies, property managers, insurance agents and public adjusters. We establish these relationships by offering them a professional and certified trade partner to refer to our mutual clients to, returning work back to them from our customers, and having the security that we will always treat our mutual customers with the utmost respect and professionalism.In addition, this individual will develop sales strategies, help develop sales presentation materials, deliver effective sales presentations in person, professionally conduct meetings with clients and prospects, and plan and manage appointment schedules. They will be the point person on projects where project initiation is done to address clients' questions and concerns to ensure a high level of client satisfaction.Responsibilities: Strategically identify, prospect, and grow current and possible account relationships by coordinating meetings, attending events, etc.Filling your weekly calendar with prospecting, networking events, and client visits, Strategic Partner visits, new prospect presentation appointmentsAttending all mandatory sales meetings Accurately recording expenses/mileage and submitting expense reportsHitting outlined sales objectives on a weekly and/or monthly basisParticipating in Company sponsored events, sometimes outside of normal business hours.Initiate restoration projects by making initial customer contact after a water or fire event to sell and secure the project. 
 Requirements: Experience in a construction related industry a plus (ideally familiar with the restoration industry)Able to work in a fast-paced environment with a demonstrated ability to juggle multiple competing tasks and demandsExcellent oral and written communication skills, negotiations skills and presentation skillsProficient with computer software programs including MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)Proven ability in creating new business and client relationships is a mustHighly competitive, positive and results driven sales professionalSelf-motivated, responsible, and accountableCoach-able and trainable with uncompromising integrity
 Compensation: Base salary $25,000 -$35,000 plus commissions, uncapped earning potentialFull electronics package
Benefits: Matching 401KPTO

Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Restoration 1 Corporate.

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription:
At PLAE, our mission has never changed. We exist to create innovative solutions focused on helping people achieve their best selves. Over the years, we’ve worked to redefine athletic flooring and equipment as a foundational component of any advanced training space, and we push the boundaries every day to serve and equip clients who refuse to settle for second best. We harness technology and design. We run our own race, and we’re obsessed with raising the bar because when it comes to the athletes who fuel our passion, good enough is never enough.POSITION OVERVIEW:The Product Marketing Manager is responsible for overseeing all of the marketing programs of new and/or existing athletic flooring products. This role is responsible for planning, guiding and taking accountability for marketing campaigns, strategies and other marketing-related initiatives of products across all market sectors, as well as the internal launch and education for PLAE staff. This role will oversee the complete product makeup, from setting the vision of new and existing products to bringing them to the market.RESPONSIBILITIES:Product Specialist and educator Working with external parties and suppliers to gain an intimate knowledge of all athletic flooring products and establish a clear internal communication strategy with a focus on product details, benefits and USPs.Extensively working with various OEM's for up to date data on various product lines.
Go To Market PlanningThe Product Marketing Manager is responsible for creating and executing a solid GTM plan for a new product. This includes: Showing evidence of market demand, or market gap analysis, for the product Working with 3rd party suppliers to negotiate pricing, exclusivity, and operational / supply guarantees. Specifying the value proposition, positioning, and messaging for each Athletic Flooring product.Working with Sales and Executives to set a clear pricing strategy in line with our brand positioning. Ensuring all products within the PLAE product line and all future products have SDS forms, consistent data, and consistent test results
Research & New Product Opportunity  In collaboration with other stakeholders, this role will try to come up with new opportunities that PLAE can capitalize on. Both NPD for a new feature for an already-existing flooring product, a new market that PLAE could enter, or an entirely new product. 
 Marketing Strategy This role, in conjunction with the broader marketing team, will create and execute a marketing strategy for each athletic flooring product, including but not limited to: Building and managing a new brand identity for the product.Assist the design and digital marketing teams to brief and organize campaign content shoots to ensure that assets meet the sales team's needs.Looking after individual marketing initiatives (content, SEO, paid ads, special events, sales assets, spec sheets, operational documentation, lead generation initiatives, etc.).Aligning with the sales team and providing training and resources to personnel.Specifying and reporting on metrics that align with the sales goals for the product.Creating a distribution strategy and executing it.
Qualifications Bachelor's degree in related field. Relevant certifications or technical diplomas are a plus.Proven experience (5+ years) in Product Marketing Management, preferably with experience in flooring.Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.Extensive knowledge of ASTM's in the USA and Europe for resilient athletic flooring.Understanding of tests performed for specific ASTM's and the classification/result.Current knowledge of VOC's, LEED, etc. for the resilient athletic flooring market and the appropriate certificates such as EPD, HPD, FloorScore, etc
Note: This job description outlines the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Primary Responsibilities: Work with contracted marketing firm, Crux, to execute on marketing campaigns to achieve business objectives. Stay up to date on market trends, current events and competitor strategies through research and collaboration with Crux. Bring new ideas to the table and offer recommendations for innovative marketing programs. Collaborate with cross-functional internal teams to align marketing initiatives with overall business goals. Create and manage content for various marketing channels, including social media, email campaigns, website content and advertising materials. Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, providing regular reports and recommendations for optimization. Assist in the planning and execution of events, trade shows and other promotional activities. Continuously evaluate and improve marketing strategies based on data-driven insights. 
Competencies: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create compelling content. Creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box and develop innovative marketing ideas. Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as collaborate effectively in a team environment. Experience in the tax, assurance, accounting, and technology industries is a plus. Excellent attention to detail. Ability to organize and prioritize tasks. Drive to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite. 
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing or a related field. Proven experience as a Marketing Specialist or similar role, with a minimum of 3-5 years of marketing experience. Solid knowledge of digital marketing channels, including social media, email marketing, content marketing and SEO. Familiarity with the latest marketing trends, techniques, and technologies. 
Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift 10 pounds at times. Oral and auditory capacity enabling interpersonal communication as well as communication through devices such as a telephone.

Title: Entry Level Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
At Acquire, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the front of our business. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do.We are looking for a growth-minded individual with leadership potential. We promote strictly from within, which is why we start each new team member off in our entry-level role focusing on direct marketing and team development. In this position, our next Marketing Associate will handle the in-store marketing campaigns for our clients, focusing on face-to-face marketing, sales, and promotional events. Our unique method of direct marketing and sales has proven to exceed client sales goals weekly as well as grow the brand and customer support daily!Job Responsibilities: Build relationships with new clients, team members, and upper-level managementExecute direct marketing campaigns within partnered retailersGrow our client's brand awareness in local marketsInteract with customers and provide customer service dailyAccurately qualify and inform each potential new customerTrack personal and team sales goals

Title: Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionAbout UsAt Advanced Medical Management, LLC (“AMM”) we provide management services to a host of healthcare companies throughout Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, and Pennsylvania (collectively with AMM, the “Enterprise”) which furnishes high-quality integrated healthcare to people suffering from neuro-musculoskeletal injuries. The healthcare companies we manage, and service offer an extensive slate of office-based diagnostic, surgical and rehabilitation services, provided by compassionate and skilled professionals who medically manage each patient from evaluation through treatment to ensure patients have the best achievable outcomes. Our healthcare companies are leaders in care delivery for personal injury and worker’s compensation patients and have a proven track record of returning patients to their highest level of activity as quickly as possible. We are devoted to furnishing highly competent and timely services in compliance with all applicable legal, regulatory and ethical standards; a commitment to doing things right. We strive to be a good corporate citizen and integrate ESG (environmental, social and governance) considerations within our Enterprise business practices. Our mission is to benefit the healthcare companies we serve, as well as all our collective employees, and communities.Job Duties Actively participate in the robust strategic planning process for each market.Participate in meetings with sales partners and other key stakeholders to review performance of the current marketing plan, discuss business needs, and adjust plans accordingly.Create, maintain, document, and execute all aspects of the integrated strategic marketing plans including collateral, promotional, print, events, and digital tactics.Manage the creation and execution of enterprise marketing campaigns, as well as photo and video production, including developing and maintaining spreadsheets and other documentation.Coordinate, develop, and prioritize the digital asset library.Create or review copy and design elements. Provide feedback and guidance to creative partners to ensure intended marketing strategy is reflected in creative execution.Develop collateral packages that meet sales needs and adhere to the overall brand guidelines.Manage internal and external relationships to ensure all design and assets align to company’s brand guidelines and track against predetermined deadlines.Develop and execute event plans, in conjunction with key stakeholders or community partners, as needed. Based on established plan, provide solutions for event marketing execution.Utilize exceptional communication skills to promote company’s brand via social media.Design strategies to actively track social media post-performance and strategize how to optimize content.Benchmark competitor brand activation strategies and make recommendations on innovative and eye-catching approaches to increase employer brand awareness.Maintain accurate and timely details of spend and provide reports related to tactical budgets.
 Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college/university or equivalent experienceMinimum of 3 years digital content creation, online community management, or marketing experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBasic graphic creation skills are required (using Canva or Adobe suite); Adobe InDesign skills with a keen eye for design preferred. Please include a link to sample workBasic photography and video editing skills preferred
 Additional Skills/Competencies Willingness to think outside of the box and present new ideasMust be extremely organized (prioritization is key) with superior attention to detailEffectively communicate with members of all levels of management in a professional mannerAbility to work in an ambiguous and fast paced environmentA team player who is self-motivated with a sense of urgency to learn and succeedAbility to work well under pressureGoal driven and target oriented with the ability to see big picture
 Physical/Mental RequirementsSitting, standing, walking, reaching above shoulder length, working with body bent over at waist, working in kneeling position, climbing stairs, climbing ladders, working with arms extended at shoulder length, lifting max. of 20 lbs.Diversity StatementAdvanced Medical Management is an equal opportunity employer. We commit to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy or related medical conditions, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic predisposition, marital, civil union or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: COMMUNITY SERVICES COORDINATOR (SELECTIVE CERTIFICATION - MARKETING) AFSCME LOCAL 3109, PAY GRADE 23
JobDescription: IMPORTANT INFORMATIONIn accordance with the Merit System Rules and Regulations, an eligible list, which will be valid for a one-year period and which will be used to fill vacancies during that period, is being established for this classification. Applicants on the eligible list will be certified in accordance with the Merit System and appropriate union contracts. Candidates may submit online employment applications using the NEOGOV online application system available at https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/nccde.EXAMINATION PROCESS: The examination process for this posting may include an evaluation of training and experience, a written examination, a computerized exam, an oral board interview examination, a performance examination or any combination of the above in order to qualify applicants for placement on the eligible list. The eligible list will be used to fill vacancies that occur within the next year. The appropriate number of names on the eligible list as prescribed by Merit System Section 26.03.505 will be certified to the hiring department for consideration to fill the vacant position(s).New employees are generally hired at the starting salary and may be eligible for merit increases each year upon receipt of a satisfactory performance evaluation, up to the maximum salary. New Castle County is an Equal Opportunity EmployerJob DescriptionGENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES: Coordinates the artistic direction, design, production and advertisement of the brand, message, and program calendar of New Castle County Department of Community Services utilizing websites, print, social media, didactics, video, publications and public presentations. Coordinates the overall activities of the Community Services Department by developing, implementing and overseeing programs; staffing facilities; and providing essential services to the community through effective interaction among the various units of the department and other departments within the County; does related work as required.DISTINGUISHING FEATURES OF THE CLASS: An employee in this class assists the Community Services Department Manager in planning, controlling and coordinating marketing activities and staff of the Community Services Department to promote and maintain the highest quality of life for New Castle County residents. This employee assists in developing, providing and maintaining a diverse mix of services available and accessible to all which will contribute to the physical, mental, social, informational and cultural needs of County residents. Responsibilities include connecting diverse audiences to the wide array of Community Services activities of recreation, sports, museum, café, festivals, senior services, farmers markets, art studio, libraries, housing and more. The Marketing Coordinator will highlight these activities through print, social media, e-newsletters, didactics, publications, video, and public presentations. Responsibilities include coordinating the various programs both within and outside the department to include coordinating with the media, other governmental and private service providers and community organizations. This employee may be required to work unusual hours including nights, weekends, and holidays at various work sites. This employee works under general direction. EXAMPLES OF WORK: (Illustrative Only)Artistic direction of all advertising associated with the Department of Community Services.Approach advertising equitably to attract the widest possible breadth of the county's population.Establish and maintain marketing plan and budget based on annual event calendar and targeted demographics.Oversee the content and design of multiple web pages associated the Department of Community Services under the New Castle County web platform, assist in training location staff to monitor their own web content.Organizes multiple e-newsletters, examples include Rockwood Park & Museum, the Arts Studio at the Absalom Jones Community Center, Glasgow Park and Happenings;Oversee content direction and advertising frequency of social media sites associated with the Department of Community Services.Technical and creative writing such as articles, content, and press releases. Oversee design of festival and special program advertisements and signage;Negotiate paid advertisement placement and frequency.Manage annual budget.Seek in-kind marketing support and maintain marketing networks.* Coordinates the delivery of all services provided by the department, including but not limited to recreational, cultural, educational, libraries, programs for seniors, housing assistance and community development;Develops, implements and oversees programs and activities located throughout the county including hiring of part time staff and contractors, and planning for programs, activities and special events.Develops programmatic connections among the various units of the department and other departments within the County;Promotes the sharing of resources and facilitates cooperation among the various program components and activities of the department;Assists in the development of long- and short-term goals for the department;Implements policies and procedures for the department as directed by the department manager;Promotes an ongoing attitude of dedication to excellent public service and ensures that internal and external customers are provided with the highest quality of service;Interacts with outside agencies, the media, other service providers, community organizations and the public concerning related issues;Assigns work and supervises staff; graphic artist as well as recruit and manage volunteers and student interns;Works with department staff to develop methods for dealing with departmental issues and in responding to problems or requests received;Presents information to community groups; Operates a personal computer,design software and other related equipment in the course of the work.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Good knowledgeof current marketing trends; strong decision making; superior organization skills; advocate for equitable representation; ability to inspire staff and co-workers with vision and work ethic; Good knowledge of the services provided in the area of community services; some knowledge of program and budget development; ability to coordinate a variety of diverse community service functions and associated staff; ability to supervise others; ability to communicate courteously and effectively, both verbally and in writing; ability to make effective presentations before groups; ability to establish and develop effective working relationships with associates, government officials, agencies, private organizations and the public and to promote an ongoing attitude of dedication to excellent customer service; ability to analyze complex data, draw valid conclusions and make reliable recommendations.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: At least three years experience in the area of program marketing; planning or coordination of a variety of programs or services and possession of a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in design, marketing, public relations, business administration, public administration or related field; or an equivalent combination of experience and training directly related to the required knowledge, skills and abilities.ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Ability to pass a Class III County physical examination and background check.CONTACT INFORMATIONLaura McDermottOffice of Human ResourcesLaura.McDermott@newcastlede.govPDN-9993e3d9-61ea-4d0b-bbf7-3b372207dd6d
Skills: Communication, Community Outreach, Customer Service, Event Planning, Graphic Arts, Social Services

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Job Description:THE OPPORTUNITYScholastic Inc. is looking for an NYC-based Digital Marketing Specialist to support overall strategic digital marketing for the Scholastic Store, Stored Value programs (e.g., eGift Cards), and Content to Commerce. This role is responsible for creating and implementing marketing plans and digital strategy that drive online sales for Scholastic. The role will also work closely and effectively with other teams throughout Scholastic to provide a unified marketing experience with the customer at the heart of everything we do.This role will require someone with an understanding of how to target and address key segments of our audience, while also having the ability to develop marketing plans that include promotional concepts, digital strategy, social media advertising and messaging, email marketing strategies, and content development and messaging alignment.ResponsibilitiesReporting to the Senior eCommerce Marketing Manager, this Digital Marketing role will help develop, create, and execute marketing plans and materials that are creative, revenue enhancing, and reflective of both our assortment and brand. They will help to partner with the Visual Design team to oversee design and production of marketing materials, partner with channel marketing teams on the successful implementation of marketing plans, and be responsible for the day to day tracking of campaign performance – with an eye to continually improving our efforts. Additional responsibilities include: Maintain a robust and accurate omni-channel marketing calendar. Partner with the Social and Paid Media Teams to help implement eCommerce-focused digital marketing strategies using PPC, SEO, social media, display, and affiliate marketing. Participate in brainstorms with the larger team on creative marketing ideas and recommendations to meet multiple goals. Track marketing KPIs and help analyze performance to inform future marketing efforts. Partner closely with Design, Analytics, Email Marketing and Digital Marketing teams to realize our campaign plans. Contribute to marketing reports and recaps to summarize key campaigns and performance. Write content and marketing messaging, including creative briefs for campaigns. 
Who We AreScholastic Corporation (NASDAQ: SCHL) is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, a leading provider of print and digital instructional materials for pre-K to grade 12, and a producer of educational and entertaining children's media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning programs, classroom magazines and other products that, in combination, offer schools customized solutions to support children's learning both at school and at home. The Company also makes quality, affordable books available to all children through school-based book clubs and book fairs. With a 100+ year history of service to schools and families, Scholastic continues to carry out its commitment to Open a World of Possible" for all children. Learn more at Scholastic.com/AboutScholastic.Thank you for your consideration in choosing Scholastic.QualificationsHOW YOU CAN FIT (Qualifications) 2-3 years of marketing and/or digital marketing experience in book publishing or a related field. Possess an understanding of the publishing landscape

Title: Product Marketing Manager
JobDescription: The FreedomPay Commerce Platform is the technology of choice for many of the largest companies across the globe in retail, hospitality, lodging, gaming, sports and entertainment, foodservice, education, healthcare and financial services. FreedomPay's technology has been purposely built to deliver rock solid performance in the highly complex environment of global commerce. The company maintains a world-class security environment and was first to earn the coveted validation by the PCI Security Standards Council against Point-to-Point Encryption with EMV standard in North America. FreedomPay's robust solutions across payments, security, identity and data analytics are available in-store, online and on-mobile and are supported by rapid API adoption. The award winning FreedomPay Commerce Platform operates on a single, unified technology stack across multiple continents allowing enterprises to deliver a consistent, repeatable experience on a global scale. FreedomPay is a fast paced, high growth company with a great culture with competitive benefits and compensation with a business casual atmosphere.The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for accelerating the adoption of new and enhanced commerce technology products and solutions to drive revenue growth. The ideal candidate for this position will have experience developing strong product content, communicating clearly across multiple stakeholders including internal functions and external such as partners, new and existing clients. The product marketer will use his or her experience, vision, and skills to define problems, identify solutions, manage multiple early adopter programs, and communicate cross-functionally. We are searching for a candidate with experience in a SaaS company- ideally that being in eCommerce and/or FinTech with a passion and tenacity for lead-gen, data driven decisions and storytelling. Primary ResponsibilitiesDevelop positioning and messaging that differentiates the FreedomPay platform and its use cases in the market while managing the adoption of new or enhanced products and solutions. Lead cross-functional go-to-market planning and execution, by gaining a deep understanding of our audience's needs, our core use cases, industry analysts' perception of our niche, our differentiated positioning, and the language that will articulate our message in the most impactful way. Work collaboratively with our Sales/Engineering teams to generate a pipeline of compelling and relevant thought leadership and product content, including whitepapers, webinars, blog articles, demos, and other materials such as e-Commerce marketplacesEducate the FreedomPay teams on our market, value proposition, and product capabilities; you will be a key partner to the Sales team, collaborating closely with them to build a sales tool kit to ensure our sellers are armed with what they need to win Working with the broader Marketing team to support the development of programs that increase market awareness and demand lead generation.Develop methodologies and a repeatable playbook that establish industry best practice in Product Marketing Manage and lead the new Customer Advisory CouncilQualificationsExperience in a SaaS companyBachelor's Degree or higher7-10 years of Product Marketing experience working with technology solutionsProject management experienceSuperior writing and communication skillsProficiency in all aspects of Microsoft OfficeStrong analytical strategic thinking and communication skillsAs the fastest growing commerce company in the industry, we offer the opportunity for tremendous upward mobility within the company as well as development and professional growth opportunities. FreedomPay provides exceptional benefits including medical, prescription, dental and vision coverage, Life Insurance, Retirement Plans with company match, commission sharing plan, flexible hybrid working environment, and great parental and other leave programs. All positions must be able to successfully pass a background check as well as a credit check.PDN-99084e42-cbc6-4abe-bdc0-e033996a9669
Skills: Communication, Competitive Analysis, Cross-functional Team Leadership, Go-to-Market Strategy, Market Planning, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Strategy, Product Launch, Product Marketing, Strategic Thinking

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
About Parascript:Parascript is a software company with a diverse portfolio of automation products that leverage the latest artificial intelligence technologies. Our software is used by thousands of organizations to automate their business processes with the help of AI. Through our global network of software partners, Parascript has automated the postal industry, mortgage, payment processing, and hundreds of other processes.Parascript offers a generous benefits package, a healthy culture, and a diverse team of industry veterans to support your professional development. Numerous training opportunities are available, and employees can pursue their career-related passions with help from management. Parascript’s core values include positivity, work-life balance, and creative thinking.Parascript headquarters are in Niwot, Colorado—a short drive from Longmont and Boulder.About Your Role:The Marketing Coordinator will bring a fresh perspective to the Parascript marketing team through content writing, graphic design, and social media. This role is also responsible for event management and assisting the Sr. Marketing Manager with regular reporting and other marketing projects. As a key member, the Marketing Coordinator contributes directly to the design and messaging of our programs.The primary skill requirement for this role is long-form content writing. The applicant should have experience with writing marketing content such as blogs, eBooks, or case studies, and they should understand content writing best practices and proper grammar. The applicant will be required to submit examples of their writing for consideration, and if no examples are available, a writing prompt will be provided.This is an entry-level position, so extensive marketing experience is not required. Parascript is a great place for a motivated marketing professional to learn about B2B marketing strategies including Account Based Marketing, Demand Generation, and Product Marketing. Plus, the Marketing Coordinator receives ample opportunities to learn and refine new and existing skill sets.Below is an estimate of how the Marketing Coordinator spends their time each week.40% - Content Writing: Blogs, eBooks, Case Studies, Email Newsletters, Sales Cadences, etc.20% - Graphic Design: LinkedIn Ads, Display Ads, Brochures, PowerPoint Presentations, etc.20% - Social Media Management: Develop organic posts for LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.10% - Event Management: Organize and coordinate with sales to exhibit at in-person events. Occasional event attendance required.10% - Reporting & Other: Work with Sr. Marketing Manager on regular reporting and other specialty marketing projects. About You:You are a self-starter with a passion for all things marketing and sales.You are a critical thinker that enjoys being challenged while developing new skills.You are a “grammar nerd” that can write, edit, and compose compelling copy for marketing materials.You enjoy quality design and would like an opportunity to develop your graphic design skills.You have a bias for action, proactive nature, and strong attention to detail.You are interested in software development and artificial intelligence technology.You are career motivated and looking to develop the skills necessary to succeed in the marketing industry.You live in or are willing to relocate to Colorado and can commute to our headquarters in Niwot, CO.
Required: No direct marketing experience required, but applicants with prior roles or freelance activity that involved content writing and graphic design will be preferredOrganizational and project management skills as well as strong attention to detailLong-form content writing experience (examples will be requested)Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communications, or related field
Nice-to-haves: Graphic Design experience (Adobe)Social Media experienceEvent Management experienceSales experienceReporting experience
PRINCIPALS ONLY – NO HEADHUNTERS, CONTRACT, OR SEARCH FIRMS.Applications will be accepted only through our online application system on our website. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, Gender/Minority/Veterans/Disabled

Title: Project Coordinator, Corporate Marketing
JobDescription: Great people make great properties. As a shopping center developer of some of the nation's best real estate in top markets, Macerich offers opportunities to work, grow and develop your unique talents. Apply now to help us shape the future of retail real estate while building a meaningful, rewarding and balanced career. The Position on our Team: Join our dynamic team as a Project Coordinator in our Corporate Marketing Department. As an invaluable member of our in-house advertising agency, you'll immerse yourself in a world of creativity and collaboration, working on a diverse range of projects, events, and marketing materials for stakeholders across our Company. In this position, you'll work through the seamless coordination and trafficking of vital projects that fuel our sales teams, corporate initiatives, and business-to-business (B2B) strategy. From crafting compelling sales materials to orchestrating relationship-building events, your contributions will be instrumental in amplifying our brand and enhancing our market presence. By meticulously managing multiple tasks and deadlines, you'll elevate our corporate marketing B2B team's efforts and make a tangible impact on our overall success. What You'll Do Coordinate and distribute internal assets for project managers and internal company use Support the collection and coordination of asset creation with external agencies, freelancers, and in-house designers Utilize research tools to search for key data points Ensure high quality work, providing quality assurance with thorough proofing for all work product Create PowerPoint presentations and other sales pieces, bringing together research, the sales pitch and stakeholder information to support the overall story Assist with planning for events and conferences Collaborate with project managers, corporate communications, and other marketing team members to execute projects Organize, manage, and maintain files All other duties as assigned Your Key Success Attributes Required: Bachelor's degree 1-2 years of marketing and/or agency experience or equivalent Exceptional attention to detail PowerPoint skills Strong project management skills Proven capabilities in managing many projects at one time Collaborative Highly organized Minimal travel may be required (5%) Working outside of normal office hours may be required (5%) All applicants must be able to perform the essential functions of the position, including corresponding core job requirements, with or without a reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities (and others in accordance with applicable law) to perform the essential functions of the job, consistent with applicable laws and Company policy. Nice to Have: Strong relationship-building skills Basic Photoshop editing skills (resizing and cropping of images) Copywriting/editing skills Design/creative eye Self-starter Our Culture of Belonging At Macerich, we are committed to a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We believe our diversity creates value for our employees, workplaces and town centers, and the communities we serve. We strive to hire great people from diverse backgrounds, and we are stronger for it. We want our employees to thrive, feel valued and respected, and therefore encourage a culture of learning, acknowledging, and celebrating individual uniqueness. We are proud of our practices and the equal opportunity for employment and advancement we foster across the organization. In support of our culture of belonging, Macerich welcomes qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, pregnancy (including childbirth and pregnancy-related medical conditions), sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other characteristic or class protected under federal, state, or local law. Additional information is contained in Macerich's Anti-Harassment, Discrimination and Retaliation Policy, which can be provided to applicants upon request. Macerich also provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the application process or your employment, please contact Human Resources. Join our team of great people!Work Experience1 years: Marketing and/or agency experienceEducationPreferred: BachelorsPDN-9985cea3-1887-414a-bf25-1209c2b6a84e

Title: Interactive Marketing Specialist (Corporate)
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionJob Summary:The Interactive Marketing Specialist I plays a key role in executing and supporting Interactive Marketing campaigns developed by our enterprise and property partners. The Specialist will accomplish this by developing strategic relationships within multiple disciplines of the Marketing organization and property teams. Additionally, the specialist will be responsible for providing training these partners to help ensure flawless execution at the property-level.Remote DetailsOut of State Applicants- this position may be offered remote to applicants outside of Las Vegas, NV with potential for one week in-person training in Las Vegas.Las Vegas Residents - this position is offered as a hybrid role with two days in-person, three days remoteKey Job Functions Setup, consult, and execute real time & Interactive Marketing offer requests and handle inquiries within established timelines.Assist in Salesforce and IoT (Real Time Trigger/Internet of Things)-related projects including, but not limited to: training, adoption, support, establishing standards, identifying efficiencies and creating documentation.Learn and apply knowledge of all functions related to Interactive Marketing channelsCollaborate with external partners to help gather required information for upcoming marketing offersAssist in seed-test and UAT activities and roll-out of new Interactive Marketing productsPerform administration functions including, but not limited to, maintaining team documentation and shared network resourcesPrepare data in an informational format that can be distributed to all levels of management within the organizationPerform product readiness testing in the slot lab or on property as neededOther tasks related to team as assigned or requested by manager
Key Job Requirements Must be detail-oriented and possess strong time-management skillsAbility to communicate effectively to all levels within the organizationAble to use a Windows-based PC and have intermediate proficiency using Microsoft Office productsSupport digital marketing offers during normal business hours and occasionally outside normal business hours as needed.Willingness to learn new technologies and train property operatorsAbility to multi-task and work in fast paced environment
Work Experience At least two years of work experience in marketing, analytics or IT field; direct marketers preferredPassion for Interactive Marketing products and/or digital technology is desiredWorking knowledge in casino industry is preferred.Experience or knowledge in Salesforce products is a plus
Education / Training College degree or equivalent work experience required.
About UsAt Caesars Entertainment, Inc., our Team Members create the extraordinary. We are the largest casino-entertainment company in the U.S. and one of the world's most diversified casino-entertainment providers. Since beginning in Reno, Nevada, in 1937, Caesars Entertainment has grown through the development of new resorts, expansions and acquisitions. Our resorts operate primarily under the Caesars®, Harrah's®, Horseshoe® and Eldorado® brand names. We focus on building loyalty and value with our guests through a combination of impeccable service, operational excellence and technological leadership. The company is committed to its Team Members, suppliers, communities and the environment through its PEOPLE PLANET PLAY framework.Our Caesars family is driven by our Mission, Vision and Values. We take great pride in living these values – Together We Win, All In On Service and Blaze the Trail – every day. Our mission, “Create the Extraordinary”. Our vision, “Create spectacular worlds. That immerse, inspire and connect you. We don’t perform magic; we create it with excellence. #WeAreCaesars”. If you are ready to create some magic, we invite you to explore our dynamic, yet unique, career opportunities.

Title: Development & Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Perkins is more than a school; we are an international NGO dedicated to working in 100 countries for over 100 years to help children with multiple, complex disabilities and visual impairments and their families. We are unlocking opportunities and igniting change. At Perkins, we think courageously, we are collaborative and we take ownership. Join a community of growth!Are you a dynamic and professional assistant who is looking to take your project management skills to the next level? As our Development & Marketing Assistant, you will be a key member of the team at Perkins, which is in growth stages to raise more than $20 million annually by 2026. You will provide executive level support to the Chief Development & Marketing Officer (CDMO) and possess the ability to interact with donors with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality. You will have strong communication skills, planning & organizing expertise, and the ability to provide superior customer service. You will be self-sufficient, resourceful, and an independent thinker, with excellent project management skills. You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, and you thrive in a donor-centric culture that focuses on details, gratitude, integrity, transparency, and diversity.Essential duties and responsibilities include: Act as point of contact for the CDMO for all internal/external matters, prioritizing and determining appropriate course of action, referral or response in a highly professional mannerMaintain CDMO’s portfolio, keeping donor contact and activity records up to date in SalesforceSupport the CDMO in staffing committee meetings; taking minutes; preparing agendas and sharing materials with members in advance; updating online platform BoardableManage the CDMO’s calendar and schedule meetings, anticipating and resolving potential conflictsDraft, edit and proofread outgoing communications and presentations; prepare reports on pipeline activityCreate and conduct correspondence on CDMO’s behalfPlan, schedule and organize various meetings, including agenda preparation, documentation and distribution of meeting minutes, etc., to optimize the CDMO’s productivity and keep projects on trackTakes on special projects and drive them to completion
What we're looking for: Ability to anticipate needs, think critically and offer solutions to problems with a high level of professionalism and confidentialityStrong communication skills - both oral and written, are essentialA customer service focused approach along with the ability to handle multiple tasks and changing priorities - essentialAn entrepreneurial and creative approach developing new, innovative ideas that will stretch the organization and push boundaries where needed.Ability to take initiative and work both as an independent self-starter and strong team playerInteracts with all team members with a high level of professionalismStrong attention to detailStrong project management experience; graphic design experience a plusAbility to anticipate needs and requests without being asked, effective communication, writing and grammar skills
Education and/or Experience  Bachelor's degree preferred
We have benefits that put you first, including an employer contributing retirement plan, tuition reimbursement from day one, professional development for our employees, personal days, paid time off and paid sick leave. Our campus is quaint, charming and historical, a perfect mix of legacy and modern buildings. It is located in the heart of Watertown, adjacent to the Charles River and a 5 minute drive from food & entertainment at Arsenal Yards.

Title: Marketing Administrative Assistant
JobDescription:
Hyatt Residence Club®, a leader in the vacation ownership industry, is seeking a Temporary Marketing Administrative Assistant.Position Summary Perform general office duties to support Sales - Marketing (e.g., filing, sending emails, typing, sending outgoing faxes, delivering incoming faxes, copying, opening or distributing mail).Receive, record, and relay messages accurately, completely, and legibly.Gather materials and assemble information packages and marketing materials (e.g., brochures, promotional materials, maps, price lists, or menus).Verify that individuals meet eligibility requirements for preview package sales/tours prior to scheduling a tour for a property.Record, calculate total, and report numbers of package sales/tours sold to manager/supervisor on a daily basis.Generate letters, invitations, and final participant/attendee lists.Maintain and update databases, spreadsheets, and electronic filing systems related to Sales and Marketing activities (e.g., tours, mailings).Enter, retrieve, reconcile, and verify information (e.g., commissions, leads, third parties) in software involved in the sales process. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager.Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets.Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette.Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals.Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats.Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance.Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors. 
This position is at a location where Hyatt is not the employer. The employer of individuals working at this hotel may be a third-party management company that is responsible for all employment benefits and obligations at this location.

Title: Email Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Job Title: Email Marketing Manager - Ecommerce CompanyJob Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Email Marketing Manager to join our dynamic ecommerce company. As the Email Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing effective email marketing campaigns to drive customer engagement, increase conversion rates, and maximize revenue. You will play a crucial role in enhancing our brand's online presence and growing our customer base.Responsibilities: Develop and implement email marketing strategies and campaigns to achieve company objectives, including customer acquisition, retention, and re-engagement.Create and optimize email marketing campaigns to drive customer engagement, increase open and click-through rates, and improve overall conversion rates.Segment the customer database and personalize email content to deliver targeted and relevant messages to different customer segments.Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as product, design, and content to ensure consistent brand messaging and optimal user experience in email campaigns.Manage the end-to-end email campaign process, including planning, scheduling, testing, deployment, tracking, and analysis.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the success of email campaigns,  and make data-driven recommendations for optimization and improvement.Conduct A/B testing and implement best practices to optimize email performance, including subject lines, content, design, and CTAs.Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in email marketing, and propose innovative ideas to improve campaign effectiveness and customer engagement.Ensure compliance with email marketing regulations and privacy laws, such as CAN-SPAM and GDPR.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field.Proven experience as an Email Marketing Manager or in a similar role, preferably within the ecommerce industry.Proficiency in email marketing platforms (e.g., Klavyio) and marketing automation tools.Strong understanding of email marketing best practices, segmentation strategies, and A/B testing.Solid analytical skills to track and analyze campaign performance metrics, and make data-driven decisions.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a keen eye for detail.Creative mindset with the ability to develop engaging and persuasive email content.Strong project management skills and the ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Knowledge of HTML and CSS for email template design and customization is a plus.Familiarity with CRM systems and customer segmentation techniques.Proficient in graphic design for email templates.
Join our dynamic team and make a significant impact on our company's growth and success. We offer a competitive salary package, a collaborative work environment, and opportunities for professional development. If you are a highly motivated and results-driven individual with a passion for email marketing and ecommerce, we would love to hear from you.Salary: $60,000 to $75,000 annual Benefits:Employee discountHealth insurancePaid time off

Title: Marketing/Sales Assistant
JobDescription:
Job Objective(s)Must have experience in Sales or Leasing. The Marketing Assistant is responsible for providing a successful warm welcoming resident’s move-in and transition to their new home. Summary of responsibilities include but not limited to: Working with the resident and the family in completing and obtaining all required paperwork by communicating with all appropriate parties (resident’s family, physicians, etc.); coordinating appointments and completion of required paperwork and preparing the resident’s Administrative File; conducting the resident’s orientation to their new home. Following the Gentle Touch Health Initiatives quality service standards, ensuring each resident’s move-in and transition to their new home is smooth and successfully following our company values. On occasion, the Marketing Assistant will support the Administrative Assistant with duties pertaining to their particular role,and filling in on an as-need basis.Essential ResponsibilitiesResident Move-in Process  Manages the move-in process as outlined in the Resident Move-in Checklist Meets with the resident and/or family on the day the Community Fee is placed and reviews the Move-in Packet ensuring all Information is explained for understanding Coordinates the Resident Assessment with the RN-Case Manager and Assisted Living Coordinator/ Resident Care Coordinator Ensures all site and state required paperwork and forms are completed on or before the move-in date by the resident and/or family Ensures the completion of the Resident Profile Schedules the Resident Agreement Signing On the Move-in day, the Marketing Assistant: Collects any remaining paperwork Reviews the Welcome Packet with the resident and family member(s) Orientates the resident and family to the community Presents the room to the resident and the family, explains the telephone and emergency procedures systems and other services such as hair care/salon, transportation, activities, etc. Arranges lunch or dinner for the resident and family members on the move-in day
Communication  Maintains an open and ongoing dialogue with the resident and/or family from the time the Community fee is placed through Move-in to ensure a smooth transition for the resident and to identify resident/family needs Initiates communication with the resident’s physician and/or family to ensure completion and delivery of the Physician’s Statement and any state-specific forms Facilitates the Resident Assessment with the RN-Case Manager and Assisted Living Coordinator/ Resident Care Coordinator Assists in the resident and family members in making the emotional connection to the new community through awareness, integration and socialization techniques and engaging activities Reviews, reads, notates and Initializes Daily Log to document and learn about pertinent information Maintains and protects the confidentiality of resident information at all times
Room/ Apartment Readiness  Ensures the room/ apartment is ready for the move-in using the Room Readiness Checklist Communication with the Maintenance Coordinator any necessary room/ apartment readiness needs
Resident Records and Administrative  Prepares the resident’s Administrative File according to Gentle Touch Health Initiatives and state specific regulatory compliance
Risk Management and General Safety  Partners with community team to ensure community is in compliance with OSHA requirements and promotion of Risk Management programs and policies; adherence to safety rules and regulations Practices safety procedures at all times including Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) fire extinguishers, MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheet) and Lockout Tagout procedures
Training, and Contributing to Team Success  Actively participates as a member of a team and committed to working toward team goals Demonstrates in daily interactions with other Committed to serving our residents and guests Contributes in the overall engagement programs and processes (customer and employee engagement) Attends regular meetings; Town Hall, Department Team Meetings, and others as directed by Supervisor/ Department Coordinator
Training/Online Training  Fulfills all required training within the required timeframe, including the completion of all training and study application appropriate for the position Completes all management training within the required timeframe Completes all training required by the state or other regulating authorities including ongoing training per regulations Completion of training may be required and/or certificates available per regulations and laws as applicable
Qualifications  High School diploma/ GED required; Associate and/or College degree preferred One (1) year experience in administrative support role Previous customer service experience demonstration of customer service skill set Ability to handle multiple priorities Possess written and verbal skills for effective communication and the ability to facilitate small group presentations Competent in organizational, time management skills, attention to details and accurate record keeping skills Demonstrates good judgment, problem solving and decision making skills Demonstration of proficiency in computer skills, Microsoft Office (Windows, Outlook, Excel), with the ability to learn new applications As applicable, all employees who drive a DOT transportation vehicle, must complete DOT testing and understand the key essential duties for safety and regulatory compliance
Physical Requirements (based On Essential Responsibilities)Must be able to frequently perform tasks such as, but not limited to, those listed:In an 8 hour workday, employee may stand / walk:Hours at one time: 2-4Total hours / day: 4-6Employee will lift/carry (Max.lbs.): Frequently: 40 lbs. Occasionally: 70 lbs. Height of lift: 3 - 4 feet Distance of carry: 30 yardsIn An 8 Hour Workday, Employee May SitHours at one time: 0 - 4Total hours / day: 4 – 6Employee will use hands for repetitive: Simple grasping, pushing and pulling, manipulationEmployee should be able to Squat: Occasionally Bend: Occasionally Kneel: Occasionally Climb: Frequently Reach: Occasionally, 3 feetGeneral Notes   This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive; additional details will be specified by the supervisor. The employee will also perform other reasonable business duties as assigned by the supervisor. Management reserves the right to change job responsibilities, duties and hours as needs prevail.
Gentle Touch Health Initiatives is an at-will employer. This job description is a guideline and does not constitute a written or implied employment contract. GTHI is an EO Employer/Vets/Disabled.

Title: Assistant Brand Marketing Manager , Haircare
JobDescription:
Job ID: 231564Location Name: CA-FSC SF Off (0174)Address: 525 Market St, 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94105, United States (US)Job Type: Full TimePosition Type: RegularJob Function: MarketingRemote Eligible:Hybrid ScheduleCompany OverviewAt Sephora we inspire our customers, empower our teams, and help them become the best versions of themselves. We create an environment where people are valued, and differences are celebrated. Every day, our teams across the world bring to life our purpose: to expand the way the world sees beauty by empowering the Extra Ordinary in each of us. We are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.The OpportunityYour role at Sephora As an Assistant Brand Marketing Manager - Haircare, you will be responsible for supporting and reporting to the Senior Brand Marketing Manager (SMM) of Haircare. You will support cross functional 360 marketing program execution, helping to manage brand relationships and overall marketing support for 20 – 30 hair brands at Sephora.In Order To Support The SMM In Execution And Follow-through Of All Marketing And Sampling Plans For 20 – 30 Brands, You Will Communicate regularly with brands and merchant partners on business related issues inclusive of key brand and product launches, as well as holistic marketing strategy developmentFollow up with brands on assets, marketing calendar, social media plans, 360 campaign participation, sampling details and any miscellaneous questions/issues as they ariseAssist in sourcing and managing Beauty Insider Loyalty Program sampling plans for each brand including sample sourcing, annual sampling calendar and supporting the Sephora Sampling team in managing sampling timelines with brandsManage social media calendar for the hair Brand Marketing team and be the primary liaison with the Sephora Social, Video and Influencer teams in planning content supporting the hair categoryManage and update monthly brand calendars with marketing exposuresCommunicate effectively with cross-functional teams including Sephora sampling, paid media, campaign & content, dotcom merchandising and category merchandisingDemonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.
We would love to hear from you if you meet the following Four year college degree requiredMinimum of 3 - 4 years of agency or marketing experience in a fast-paced work environment (previous beauty experience preferred, but not a must)Strategic thinker who can quickly adjust approach and priorities based on brands’ nuancesDigital/social media experience preferredStrong interpersonal skills, approachable, positive and flexible. Ability to work collaboratively and proactively with internal and external partiesSelf-starter, high degree of initiative and independence – not afraid to ask questions, take constructive feedback, lead new projects and “roll up your sleeves” for any task at handExceptional organizational skills; detail-oriented. Strong time management skills; ability to juggle prioritiesProficient in: MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Box and Smartsheets preferred
The annual base salary range for this position is $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the applicant’s qualifications for the position; years of relevant experience; specific and unique skills; level of education attained; certifications or other professional licenses held; other legitimate, non-discriminatory business factors specific to the position; and the geographic location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will perform the job. Individuals employed in this position may also be eligible to earn bonuses. Sephora offers a generous benefits package to full-time employees, which includes comprehensive health, dental and vision plans; a superior 401(k) plan, various paid time off programs; employee discount/perks; life insurance; disability insurance; flexible spending accounts; and an employee referral bonus program.While at Sephora, you’ll enjoy…  The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with. The learning. We invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.The culture. As a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000+ stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.
You can unleash your creativity, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can learn and evolve, because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself, because you are what sets us apart. This, is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

Title: Director of Sales and Marketing
JobDescription:

Title: Marketing Associate/Ad Operations Specialist (Hybrid)
JobDescription:
Software Resources has an immediate job opportunity for a Marketing Tech – Ad Operations Specialist with a major corporation in Santa Monica, CA.Duration : 3 month(s) with the potential to be extendedSalary : $30 – $34/hour DOEDescriptionThe Marketing Technology and Operations team is responsible for facilitating the tagging, building audiences, tracking and trafficking of biddable media campaigns.   Basic Qualifications:What To Bring Familiarity with Google platforms (DV360, SA360, DCM, Google Analytics) and/or other major DSP's.Understanding the tag/pixel QA process for pre and post launch.Creating and distributing custom audiences for corresponding campaigns and 3rd party vendors.Familiarity with JIRA or similar ticketing systems.Basic understanding of A/B testing and incrementally measurementAn unyielding desire to learn and proven organizational skillsAbility to prioritize and juggle multiple projects in a dynamic, highly charged environment. Must be very organized and pay special attention to detail.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.Demonstrated ability to set goals, meet deadlines, and successfully manage multiple assignments.
