Title: Marketing Coordinator, Awareness
JobDescription:
About Learning ResourcesWe are Learning Resources® and we are on a mission to bring learning to life. Voted one of the Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces for the last three years, we’re a 150-person strong, family-owned company who make award-winning toys, including top sellers Pretend & Play® Calculator Cash Register, Farmer’s Market Color Sorting Set and Toy of the Year winner Botley® the Coding Robot as well as Educational Insights top sellers Kanoodle®, GeoSafari® Jr., and Circuit Explorer™. From ABCs and 123s to fine motor and STEM skills, our educational toys offer kids the building blocks they need to succeed in school and develop a lifelong love of learning. We pride ourselves on being committed to career and personal development, and having a thriving culture and a diverse, creative atmosphere. Along with our award-winning culture and competitive benefits package, we offer opportunities for training & development by Harvard and UCLA professors as well as in-demand, motivating external speakers.Position DescriptionThe Marketing Coordinator, Awareness will support the execution of advertising programs for brands Learning Resources, Educational insights, Hand2Mind, Hunger for Words & Brightkins – working to drive top funnel growth and increased brand awareness. In this role, you will execute campaign setup and optimizations, coordinate creative assets, and compile reporting.Scope Of ResponsibilitiesUnder the direction of the Marketing Manager, you will execute marketing programs for our portfolio of brands to increase brand awareness, acquire new buyers and increase share of voice. Collaborate with creative and brand teams to support campaigns, grow share of voice, and increase landing page trafficManage day-to-day campaign maintenance for our brands; including timelines, trackers, and optimizations.Contribute to creative briefs and traffic creative assets to external agencies and partners; ensure consistent branding across all campaigns.Maintain tracking of campaigns and programs; ensure that campaigns align with marketing calendar.Maintain communication across marketing and creative teams, and external partners to provide updates on optimizations, progress and results.Respond in a timely manner to errors, questions, alerts and issues and work to resolve with a strong customer focus and sense of urgency.Compile monthly/quarterly performance reports for shareout with sales & marketing teams.
Requirements/Preferences Bachelor’s Degree 1-2 years of business experience; ad agency experience is a plus. Ability to track & manage programs across multiple retailers, and campaign reporting.Understanding and ability to navigate retailer systems and the experience help to resolve retailer issuesAbility to build and maintain effective relationships with management, sales teams, peers and agency partners and manage those relationships to achieve objectivesDetail-oriented with strong organizational skillsProactive and resourceful in solving problems
Ideal Attributes Curiosity to learn and grow and explore how to improve business metricsSelf-starter who thinks and participates effectively, both independently and as part of a teamProactive and resourceful in solving problems, making decisions and executing on goalsVery well organized with the ability to manage multiple initiatives at once and deliver on time Accountable: follows through on commitments, takes responsibility, and produces quality resultsCollaborates: shares information, transfers knowledge and seeks diverse input from others within the team and across the organization
We are a drug-free workplace and an EEO employer.Please note that this role will be filled by our internal recruitment team, so no assistance is needed from any outside staffing agency at this time.

Title: Marketing and Communications Librarian – Part Time
JobDescription:
The Marketing and Communications Librarian plans, coordinates, and implements the marketing of library services and programs to the Garland community with the creation of library press releases, emails, social media posts, informational and promotional documents, publications, and related marketing materials. Responsibilities involve significant public contact, both within the library and through outreach efforts. The incumbent coordinates with other city departments and organizations as directed. The person in this position performs a variety of specialized support work associated with outreach and programming for the library and, depending on qualifications, may provide library and information services, professional reference, reader’s advisory services, and quality programs to library users. The weekly work schedule will include nights and weekends, with some changes to the regular schedule required to participate in programming and outreach services.Target Hiring Range $21.15 to $24.08 Depending on Qualifications Helps develop and promote innovative programs and events and manage promotional materialsUnder the general direction of library administration, generates content and manages communications about library programs, services, and outreach efforts and Friends of the Library activities, to engage and reengage customersEdits written content such as press releases and promotional content to develop a recognizable voice for the libraryCreates an editorial and graphic style that is consistent with the library’s established branding campaign Develops measurable objectives to review and evaluate the success of marketing strategies and communications programs Plans and implements a proactive public relations program for the libraryUses graphic design tools to design, create and facilitate the production of high quality, creative, visually pleasing, and informative, physical and digital media communication resources such as news releases, social media, web content, brochures, signs, displays, and other library publications Writes copy for press releases, e-news, newsletters, fliers and brochuresPlans and implements the distribution of library promotional piecesCarries out special project assignments May provide instructional classes on the Internet and library online resources, and presents educational programs, as assigned May liaise with contracted graphic designers as assigned. Oversees and orders print jobs as neededStays apprised of new resources through continuing education, professional journals, and training 
 Master's Degree in Library Science from an American Library Association accredited college or university or within 6 months of earning an MLS, from an American Library Association accredited college or university Up to 1 year of related experience Or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Other combinations of education and experience may also be considered.Education/ Experience Advanced graduate level coursework in library technology and electronic resources1 or more years of professional-level public library experienceTraining or experience in graphic design, copywriting, or marketingTraining or experience in creating marketing content for social media 
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Knowledge of current practices in public libraries, including reference services, reader's advisory, and library technology, including online resources commonly provided to patrons by public librariesExcellent written and oral communications skills Skill in using a variety of Internet browsers, online productivity tools, and emailSkill operating office equipment, computer equipment, and online productivity applications, especially Microsoft Office 365Skill in creating social media content Ability to work cooperatively and congenially with others, including other city employees and the public Ability to perform multiple tasks and meet deadlinesAbility to handle customer issues and complaints appropriatelyAbility to work closely with others as part of a teamAbility to work a varying 19 hour-per-week scheduleThe ability to speak and read Spanish or Vietnamese is preferred, but not a requirement
 Valid Class C Texas driver's licenseThe incumbent works in a typical office environment, but some physical labor, exposure to dust, and travel to various sites may occur. Work assignments may be at any library facility and may vary, depending on departmental needs; reliable transportation will be needed. Physical tasks will include lifting, reaching, pushing, squatting, bending, stooping, walking, and carrying supplies, as needed, to accomplish the tasks of the activity on a daily basis. Must also be able to use keyboard and peripherals, operate a telephone, and communicate in person and over the telephone.Models Organizational ValuesCustomer FocusCommunicationAdaptability/FlexibilityResults Focus/Project Management

Title: Marketing & Graphic Design Coordinator - $1,000 Sign-on Bonus!
JobDescription:
Mosaic is a different kind of interiors distributor, delivering a unique approach to meet the imaginative needs of a new generation of builders and remodelers. Providing exceptional customer service and a wide array of products, we pride ourselves on our unique selections, creative designs and optimum solutions. Offering custom cabinetry, plumbing, lighting and a variety of tile, stone and flooring, Mosaic partners with leading national and international suppliers to ensure that our customers receive the very best in options to fit all budgets and tastes.Headquartered in Chantilly, VA, Mosaic occupies a broad geographic footprint with nine locations across Virginia, Maryland and North Carolina as well as a Central Servicing Center and Warehouse located in Doswell, VA. Each of our Design Centers house state-of-the-art showrooms, dedicated contractor sales counters and on-site, fully stocked warehouses.The Marketing & Graphic Design Coordinator is responsible for creating all visual tools utilized inside Mosaic’s Design Centers and for Mosaic’s External Clientele. This includes utilizing a standardized format to create display board layouts, literature, catalogs, pamphlets, and brochures. Additionally, the Marketing & Graphic Design Coordinator maintains all database records for where these tools get distributed as well as updating the sales team when product becomes obsolete. This role will maintain all updates for stock status and price changes within all online and printed collateral.Responsibilities Design graphic material for both print and online usageMaintain accuracy in all records/databasesProcess various vendor orders for supplies and materialsResearch new suppliers for optimal cost savingsManage a fluid database of productsWork independently to accomplish tasks within set deadlinesWork collaboratively to further the Mosaic brand imageManage schedule for offsite Sample Department 
QualificationsIdeal candidates will be operationally savvy, exceptionally detail-oriented, extremely organized, flexible and enjoy providing superior levels of internal customer service.  Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  Strong problem-solving and multitasking abilities  The ability to work under deadlines and handle challenging situations  Excellent organizational and written/verbal communication skills  Proficiency with Microsoft & Adobe Suite, specifically expert level InDesign & Photoshop (Illustrator & Acrobat are also used) Friendly, energetic, and highly organized Experience with Tile, Plumbing, Vanities, Luxury Vinyl, and/or Lighting preferred, but not requiredKnowledge of Distribution and/or Construction industry is a plus
Compensation And Benefits Competitive salary, commissions and participation in net profit-sharingMedical, Dental, and Vision InsurancePaid Holidays (including your birthday!)Generous PTO401k Employer Matching Program through John HancockEmployee product discountsFlexible schedules with an understanding of a needed and deserved work-life balance

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionMarketing Coordinator:The Marketing Coordinator reports directly to the Marketing Manager. The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the Marketing Manager in everyday operations of the Promotions Department. This is a full time position, in which the Coordinator will be required to have a flexible schedule, including weekends and holidays, in the event of a party, trade show, promotions, or drawings on or off property.Essential Functions Interfaces with agencies, personnel, and participants in the execution of special events.Assists in the production and dissemination of promotional information and signage needed for special events.Secures and maintains all permits, decorations, equipment, and personnel necessary.Contributes to the creation of new special events presentations and special promotions prior to approval.Assists in executing budgets for individual special events productions, recording expenditures and charting budget variances.Provides necessary information to enable appropriate departments to evaluate the success of special events and promotions on the basis of media coverage generated, Racino drop, or other qualitative and quantitative measures.Acts as a role model and always presents oneself as a credit to the JACK Thistledown and JACK Entertainment brand and encourages others to do the same.Meets the attendance guidelines of the job and adheres to regulatory, departmental and company policies.Licensed and authorized to obtain money from the cage and to distribute promotional prize money on the gaming floor.Assist Marketing Manager in the creation and /or implementation of all promotions and events both on property and off.Review Atrient programs for each event and test prior to each event.Submit IT, Graphics and BEO requestsBe thoroughly knowledgeable of all rules and procedures to all promotions and events taking place both on property and off.Contributes to program development to help the department achieve its goals.Notify ClubJACK/Marketing Manager of any rules and procedures violations to be corrected.Responsible for project management and meeting timelines. Must exhibit attention to detail and follow through.Maintains records and inventory and promotions on a monthly basis.Maintain organization of all promotions folders located in the shared drive.Conduct promotional drawings and contact winner(s), Follow up with all paperwork involved.Assist in the creation of necessary coupons in house and keep ClubJACK, F & B, accounting or any other affected departments informed on all coupons in circulation.Check on a daily basis, all in house signage, all in house brochure racks for outdated or damaged signs, and replace info as needed. Complete work orders/signage request for changes or replacement needed. Inform other departments if their signs are damaged or needs to be replaced.Track all merchandise going to or coming from company warehouse to insure proper inventory information.Inventory promotional merchandise on a daily, weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly basis as requested or required, updating Marketing Manager. Maintain records, charts, and graphs of promotions on a monthly basis.Assists in execution and attend all parties/events being held by ClubJACK/Promotions and/or Player Development.Assist in the arrival and set up of live entertainment.Must be comfortable speaking in front of people and utilizing a microphone to emcee events and promotions.Any other duties as assigned by Marketing Manager.Overseeing the creation of promotional pieces, coupons, certificates for assigned promotional events, and communicating this information to all departments involved, as well as Accounting.Creates and distributes inter- and intra-departmental communication of all promotions and events.
Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or Team Members.Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Education And Experience College Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or equivalent experience in gaming, hospitality, or travel industry.Previous or Current experience as a Promotions Coordinator at a JACK Entertainment property preferred.
Required Certification/License Must be able to obtain an Ohio Lottery Commission license

Title: Content Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
About GoodTimeEvery meeting should move you closer to achieving a clear outcome—whether it's bringing an idea to life, hiring the best candidate, or closing a sale. GoodTime brings the right people together to make it happen. Over 300 leading companies like Spotify, Slack, Pinterest, Okta, HubSpot, and Box have scheduled more than 7 million smart meetings with GoodTime. Learn more at goodtime.io.About The RoleWe are seeking a skilled and versatile Content Marketing Specialist to join GoodTime's Marketing team. Reporting to the Director of Brand and Content, you will be responsible for crafting compelling and engaging content across various platforms to drive brand awareness and support our growth goals. Your exceptional writing skills and ability to create compelling, interesting content will play a vital role in shaping our brand voice and establishing us as a thought leader in the industry. The ideal candidate should be a great storyteller, have a strong understanding of content marketing strategies, and possess a keen eye for detail.What You'll Do Develop creative and engaging content for a range of marketing channels, including blog articles, website copy, social media posts, email campaigns, whitepapers, video scripts, webinars, and more. Conduct thorough research on industry trends, market insights, and customer preferences to inform content development and ensure relevance and resonance. Write clear, concise, and persuasive content that aligns with brand guidelines, tone of voice, and marketing objectives. Create captivating headlines, taglines, and calls-to-action that attract and retain the attention of the target audience and motivate action. Create SEO optimized content to drive measurable traffic growth and conversionsCollaborate with partners on co-marketing efforts and content swapsPlan and maintain our editorial calendar. Effectively distribute content to maximize its impact across multiple channels, including owning our social media strategy. Track and analyze content performance using analytics tools to assess effectiveness and make data-driven recommendations for improvement. 
Who You Are Have 3+ years of experience as a Content Marketer, Copywriter, or similar role for B2B technology brands. You have a portfolio or examples of short and long-form writing samples; please include a link to these or attach to your application. Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a strong command of grammar, punctuation, and style. Strong organizational and time management skills that empower you to meet tight deadlines. Ability to craft compelling narratives and adapt writing style for different target audiences and platforms. Understanding of content marketing principles, strategies, and best practices. Proficiency in SEO and keyword research to optimize content for search engines. Experience using WordPress and Google Analytics. Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative content ideas and storytelling approaches. Exhibit a can-do attitude and an ability to pivot and change course on a dime as needed. 
Nice to have (but not required): Direct experience working with product marketing and/or product teams a plusHubspot experience a plusExperience working in or writing for the HR and Talent Acquisition space a plus
CompensationThe salary range for this role $70,000 - $85,000*GoodTime uses market data to determine the compensation ranges listed on our job posting based on the level of skills and abilities needed. Some candidates may have a level of skills that matches another range based on their experience, skills, credentials and expertise. The majority of candidates will likely fall in the middle of the range depending on experience, skills, credentials and expertise.Our CultureGoodTime is entering uncharted territory in making meetings smarter! To conquer our goals, we've implemented a Culture of Entrepreneurship. Our Culture of Entrepreneurship is built on three pillars; autonomy, accountability, and alignment. As a teammate at GoodTime, you will need to rely on and embody these traits to get the job done successfully. Being in this culture means owning your role, and balancing autonomy with company alignment.The Culture of Entrepreneurship should be a difference maker in helping you and our clients, teammates, and friends create a future where every minute counts.You might be a good fit for GoodTime if you: Like to work with amazing people! Title: Entry Level Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
We are currently expanding and are looking for an Entry Level Marketing Associate to help support the sales and promotions teams. We are focused on developing and enhancing the competitive nature and willingness to lead within every potential candidate. This is a valuable opportunity for those who want experience in team leadership, sales, entrepreneurship, and anybody with a competitive mindset.Entry Level Marketing Associate Responsibilities Strengthen our relationship with clients and company partnershipsPlan and execute campaigns and eventsTrack, analyze, and report the success of those campaigns and eventsEmpower the sales team with marketing content and campaigns that help drive salesGenerate new customer acquisitions through face to face customer relations
Entry Level Marketing Associate Qualifications: 1-3 years of marketing experience A PLUS but not requiredBS/BA in Marketing or a related field of study A PLUSExcellent interpersonal/communication skillsSelf-motivated
Benefits & Our Culture:The management & marketing team offers an environment where our employees ideas are not only heard but implemented. We offer a team-based and structured environment, however, employees are expected to be self-disciplined in managing their own time and work schedule. Fun, team building environmentTravel OpportunitiesLeadership workshops & developmentFinancial management, business management, time managementPhilanthropy events -- a chance to give back to the communityRecognition for top performersAdvancement to management based on performance
Job Requirements:The position at our company is an entry-level position so no direct experience is necessary. We believe that hard work, a student mentality, and exceptional communication skills are all that someone needs to be successful in our firm. Training will be provided in multiple aspects of our company including; leadership, marketing, customer service, and management.

Title: Entry Level Communication and Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
As an authorized AT&T dealer, we strive to find simple, cost-beneficial solutions to fulfill the expectations of our client's customers. We help bridge the gap between client and customer through face-to-face sales, support, and account management in a variety of retail locations.The Entry Level Communication and Marketing Associate will be tasked with maintaining current clients and growing our customer base, meeting regularly with management, training junior client services agents, and recommending different product options to customers.What we are looking for from you: Basic understanding of sales principles and customer service practicesWorking knowledge of customer and market dynamics and requirementsSolid communication and interpersonal skillsA friendly and energetic personality with a customer service focus improved through collaboration.
Entry Level Communication and Marketing Associate Responsibilities: Participate in team-building exercisesNetworking and communication with other team members and marketing leadersAssist customers with questions, concerns, and sales interactionsSpeak face to face with customersStay up to date with client products, services, promotions
What we offer: Entry Level advancement into upper administrative, management, and training positionsTravel and philanthropy opportunitiesPaid TrainingWeekly pay
We encourage anyone with retail, sales, customer service, or any other related experience!
Skills: Account Management, Client Services, Communication, Customer Service, Face-to-Face Sales, Interpersonal Skills, Knowledge Acquisition, Microsoft Dynamics, Sales, Training

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
The Club at Sea Palms is excited to announce the exceptional career opportunity of Marketing Coordinator. Qualified candidates will thrive in a hospitality environment and be highly focused on providing superior service.General Purpose:Under the direction of the Marketing Manager, the Marketing Coordinator is primarily responsible for the implementation of essential marketing-related projects, conceptualizing and preparing digital and print advertising collateral, producing organic social media content, and other promotional efforts in alignment with the revenue objectives of the marketing plan.Essential Duties: MarketingEnsures that sufficient and appropriate marketing activity takes place to reach revenue targets for activity as directed by the Marketing Manager, including, but not limited to, specific promotional campaigns or initiatives, special promotions, and events. Activity will be defined by both property-specific and corporate plans and be related to the current property vision as well as future development plans and initiativesAssists in the production of marketing campaigns by creating innovative and dynamic marketing ideas within agreed budgets and timescales and is responsible for reporting the results. Assists with the development, writing, and communication of marketing plans, promotional recaps, creative briefs, project recommendations, and presentationsTrack marketing campaign results and produce campaign analytics reports as requiredWorks effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary marketing, sales, revenue (and on occasion membership) team to communicate, coordinate, and integrate marketing communications and apply best-in-class practices to all effortsParticipates in regular strategy meetings and develops new programs and initiatives that are designed to further Juniper Preserve’s marketing strategyAssists the Marketing Manager with advertising initiatives and media plansMonitor all processes and implement improvements to enhance marketing productivityEnsures the Company’s brand is applied consistently and appropriately throughout all marketing communicationsMaintains database of key leads and contacts through lead acquisition and segmentation techniquesWork with the Marketing Manager on the preparation of the annual Marketing Plan. 
Communication Write, edit, and/or contribute to promotional literature, newsletters, and direct marketing projects. Prepares and distributes various electronic communications including, but not limited to, resort announcements and electronic newslettersReviews various marketing materials and make recommended editsMaintains all marketing collateral for the Resort and Real EstateMaintains electronic media, including video and photo galleries, in conjunction with Agency partners. 
General Attends staff meetings conducted by the Marketing Manager. Maintain a clean and neat work environmentAble to effectively handle multiple tasks Incorporates safe work practices in job performanceRegular and reliable attendance. Maintains a professional standard at Pronghorn including, but not limited to, appearance, interaction with members, associates, guests of the resort, verbal discussions and written correspondence. Does not discuss work-related issues with members and resort guestsSupports and adheres to the CORE Values (ie. “The T.R.I.P.”) and Guest Service Philosophy as defined by the CompanyParticipate in and support company efforts towards sustainability and environmental initiativesMaintains a positive attitude and the flexibility to take on new and different tasks as assigned by the Marketing Manager. 
Supervisory ResponsibilitiesSupervise the activity of partners or independent contractors as utilized by the department.QUALIFICATIONS RequiredTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Associate’s Degree or higher with an emphasis in Marketing, Communications, Design or equivalent and a minimum of three (3) years demonstrable and progressive experience related to Essential Functions of position. Proficiency and demonstrated experience in developing marketing and promotional campaigns designed to achieve a planned result or outcome and in measuring the success of the marketing activities. Proficiency and demonstrated experience in preparing and developing effective visual design and compelling written copy to support marketing and promotional campaigns. Attention to detail, accuracy, and strong proofreading skills. Ability to work independently and in a self-directed manner. Proficiency in Google Apps and Gmail. Proficiency in Social Media applications including, but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn. Proficiency in videography or photography. A flexible schedule is required to attend, monitor, and manage events. Some nights and weekends will be required. 
Desirable Proficiency in Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator. Proficiency in an email marketing provider such as Revinate. Proficiency in general web page design and updating via a content management system. College Degree preferred2-3 years of marketing and social media creation
SKILLS Required Must be able to read and understand written and oral instructions. Must be able to comprehend topics of a conceptual nature. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret graphs. Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability, predictability, and deductions. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw conclusions.

Title: Client Engagement Specialist
JobDescription: At New Age Marketing, our team of motivated & driven professionals work together in a fast paced environment to create the most successful marketing campaigns our clients have experienced to date. The key to our success has been our top-notch Client Engagement team working on the ground floor of our client’s campaigns. As a result, we have a high demand from our clients to expand rapidly this year.Currently, we are in need of 3-5 Entry Level Client Engagement Specialists to assist us in our expansion efforts and join our Client Engagement team. We are looking for outgoing, energetic entry-level professionals looking to expand their knowledge and skill sets in the Sales, Marketing and Community Management field.Key Responsibilities:· Facilitate all customer activity through strong relationship-building, product knowledge, planning and execution. Generating new leads· Develop learning plans per needs of the customer· Engage with customers to ensure our clients brand name is effectively reaching the local marketExperience:· Previous experience in an Account Management or Customer Relationship capacity · Previous experience interfacing and coordinating with cross-functional teams· Knowledge of basic marketing strategies and techniques· Proven track record of creating long-lasting client relationshipsEducation & Qualifications:· Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2-4 years of customer success or account management experience · Experience working directly with customers· Excellent written and verbal communication skills· High energy, self-motivated, driven and dynamic personality· Confident, with strong interpersonal skills and a true team player

We take the time to develop and train the individual, level by level to handle any task and take initiative on any campaign, which is why we do not require experience in marketing and sales to be a part of our team.We do, however, require highly motivated, proactive individuals that are seeking a career and not just a job. Title: Junior Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
Our management team is looking to fill this position ASAP. Local applicants are encouraged to apply.As our Junior Marketing Representative, you will assist the marketing team in the implementation of all marketing activities, working closely to increase brand awareness, drive sales, and ultimately generate new business leads. This is an entry-level marketing position with exposure to multifaceted areas of our firm in which full training is provided.Responsibilities: Working with the Marketing Manager and key accounts to integrate Promotional campaigns with customer sales promotionsCoordinating in-store service events and maintaining successful field campaign operationBuilding relationships with customers and communicating promotional servicesGenerating new leadsDeveloping and maintaining relationships with suppliers and retail event personnelKeeping accurate and timely record of event traffic, production, and inventoryIdentifying new opportunities and efficiency innovations

Title: Entry Level Promotional Events Representative
JobDescription:
We are looking to hire a full-time, Entry Level Promotional Events Representative to join our star-studded team!As a leader in marketing and customer acquisition, we specialize in expanding our clients customer base through promotional marketing strategies. Using a customer-first approach to brand recognition, we can directly connect leaders in the home improvement market with eager consumers. We can take our clients to new heights through face to face customer service, direct marketing services, sales lead generation, and promotions and special events within local retailers and businesses. In this entry-level role, the entry level Promotional Events Representative will use their personability and communication skills to capture an audience while creating excitement with target demographics. During and throughout promotional events and campaigns, the entry level Promotional Events Representative will work collaboratively with our team to deliver an unforgettable experience. We are looking for an ambitious, resilient, and adaptable individual to grow their career and our team. Responsibilities of an Entry Level Promotional Events Representative: Promote home designer services to create brand awareness and increase customer engagement during each presentation and demonstrationCreate sales leads and connect them with senior home designers for a seamless sales cycle and closing processSet up promotional displays and visual merchandising required at each promotional event to increase customer engagement and understanding of featured client brands as well as products or services while managing supplies and inventory for each eventAnswer consumer questions and inquiries throughout product and service demonstrations and provide in-depth explanationsStay up to date on product & brand knowledge of each featured client’s current promotionMaintain relationships with business partners, retail managers, and clients by upholding high levels of compliance
 Requirements of an Entry Level Promotional Events Representative: College degree in business, marketing, advertising, or similar field preferred and/or:1-2 years of experience in sales and promotional marketing, events, or any related setting, internships includedOutstanding written & verbal communication skillsExcellent organization and planning skillsResults-driven and self-motivatedAbility to work some nights and weekends for events and promotionsTime management skills and ability to adhere to a scheduleEnthusiastic about providing the best customer service for clients and consumersPositive attitude & eagerness to learn
Skills: Communication, Customer Engagement, Customer Service, Marketing, Oral Communication, Organization Skills, Product Demonstration, Relationship Development, Sales, Time Management

Title: Marketing Assistant @ Kent Station - Part-Time/Temp to Start
JobDescription:
DescriptionAre you a creative and detail-oriented individual with a passion for marketing and events? Tarragon Property Services is seeking a talented Marketing Assistant to join our team. As a Marketing Assistant, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Marketing Manager in implementing and maintaining effective marketing strategies for Kent Station, a vibrant mixed-use center located in downtown Kent, Washington. This temporary, part-time position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our dynamic property management company. Join us and make your mark in the thriving Puget Sound region!ResponsibilitiesMarketing Assists the Marketing Manager with the on-going marketing program for the projectsPosts and monitors social media including Facebook and InstagramUpdates and maintains KentStation.com and MySunriseVillage.comMaintains and installs onsite signage throughout the properties and tracks onsite signagePrepares and tracks invoices for sponsorshipsOther marketing and office-related tasks as needed
Events Works closely with Marketing Manager on event preparation including the event itself and wrap up afterwards, including event set up and take downKeeps track of merchant responses to event related memosDelivers event posters throughout the properties and off property as neededPrepares and tracks check requests for summer concerts, holiday vendors and other events as neededDelivers information to crowds at events in an energetic and engaging mannerOther event related tasks as needed

Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook. Ability to use the Adobe Suite is a plusAble to organize work, engage in a variety of tasks simultaneously and consistently meet deadlinesExperience balancing multiple projects and tasks, and ability to be self-directed and use problem-solving skills to complete tasks as neededAbility to effectively communicate and exchange information, including proficiency in delivering well-written reports and business correspondenceMust be able to work during regular office hours according to operational needs. Title: Marketing/Communications Coordinator
JobDescription:
Description BKF Engineers  is seeking an enthusiastic and organized Marketing & Communications Coordinator to join our growing team. We are looking for a candidate who is self-driven, efficient with deadlines, and able to work effectively with diverse teams of engineers, marketers, and design staff to create persuasive and standout deliverables. In this role you will be an integral member of the marketing and business development department providing support and collaboration on all internal and external messaging. Additionally, you will be challenged with developing and executing compelling written and visual content that promotes BKF’s services and brand. The location of this position is based out of our Sacramento office.BKF Engineers is a leading civil engineering, surveying and grant writing firm in California and Oregon that leverages 108+ years of experience to design some of the most iconic projects across the Pacific West Coast. With 16 offices and 500+ staff, BKF has a unique team environment that fosters a diverse project portfolio with innovative design solutions. BKF specializes in the following market sectors: transportation, healthcare, mixed-use, residential, K-12, higher education, commercial, high-tech, civic and public agency projects.Responsibilities may include:  Lead the response to multiple concurrent pursuits by helping coordinate and produce high-quality proposals and presentations, including layout, formatting, proofreading, coordinating graphics, editing/reviewing and production  Provide support to all BKF marketing staff in all offices, relative to specific communication objectives and initiatives  Maintain marketing files in Deltek, Hubspot, InDesign, OpenAsset with project, contact, and prospect information  Create content marketing initiatives in order to push key messages across all digital and print channels.  Actively communicate and collaborate with the internal Marketing & BD Team  A self-starter with strong interpersonal skills, a keen eye for detail, and thrives under deadlines  Respond to multiple concurrent pursuits by helping coordinate and produce high-quality proposals and presentations, including layout, formatting, proofreading, coordinating graphics, editing/reviewing and production  Coordinate with department managers for scope and fees, if needed  Plan and execute various marketing campaigns in support of the firm’s strategic business plan  Coordinate and produce award and recognition submittal packages  Assist with special projects, as needed  Ability to work flexible hours to meet deadlines 
Knowledge and experience required:   Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or English Degree or equivalent demonstrated experience.  3-5 years of experience with the RFP process and proposal production, preferably with an A/E/C firm  Compensation and title commensurate with experience  Exceptional interpersonal, organizational, written and verbal communication skills  Must have the ability to work well with others especially department managers, project managers and anyone involved in business development efforts.  Prefer strong Graphic Design eye, but not required  Experience working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment  Proficient with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)  Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator)  Deltek Vision experience a plus 
 Location & Salary BKF supports a healthy work-life balance and utilizes a hybrid model of home and office work. This position will be based out of any of the following office: SacramentoSalary range for this position is anticipated to be $70,900 to $89,800 annually, and may vary based upon education, experience, qualifications, skills, geographic location, and performance.

Title: Financial Analyst-Marketing Analyst
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionDirect HireTustin, CAHybrid - 2 days onsite, 3 days remoteNOTE: Currently, Corporate Office is located in Commerce, CA but will be relocating to a new location at the end of the summer in Tustin, CA. Candidates will be required to work at the Commerce, CA location 2 days a week before the move. Once moved, position will be in Tustin, CA and will continue the 2 days on site at the Tustin location.What You'll Be DoingProvide financial reporting, analysis, and decision support to both corporate & divisional departments as well as assist the overall FP& A department with consolidation, reporting, forecasting, and analytics. Support the Company's key ongoing strategic and operational initiatives.Looking for a Financial analyst with strong working with strong marketing analyst skillsAny retail industry experience will be a HUGE Plus.Responsibilities Play an active role in the continued development of our budgeting and forecasting processes.Produce financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives and help review critical financial decisions.Generate financial forecasts of revenue, operating expenses, and capital expenditures and perform budget vs. actual analysis.Develop product profitability models by creating key performance measures and key drivers of revenue and expenses.Prepare Actual vs. Budget/Forecast Variance analysis for all functionsPrepare monthly summary Sales, Gross Profit, Financial Statements, and other required month-end financial reports. Assists with the preparation of weekly, monthly, and quarterly financial analysis schedules of actual vs. budget variances.Provides financial analysis support to various areas of the company.Assists in the annual budgeting process, including store and corporate expenses, capital expenses, and balance sheet items.Collaborates proactively with department heads to ensure budgeted goals are met.Assists with short and long-term financial forecasts.Updates forecasts in an accurate and timely manner based on information provided by department heads.Provides insightful revenue and expense reporting and analyses on a recurring and ad-hoc basis and enables senior management to make informed decisions.Develops daily store sales plans based on prior-year trends, recent trends, and communication with merchants and senior management.Performs tracking and analysis of store performance.Performs other job duties as needed.Support the monthly close process in partnership with Accounting and FP&AAbide by the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics Policy.
Minimum Required Experience/ Skills/Knowledge: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related fieldAt least 2 years of experience in a rigorous, fast-paced financial analyst capacity in a large organizationIntermediate to Advanced MS Excel skills preferred (modeling, VLOOKUP, pivot tables)Strong analytical skills, verbal, and written communication skillsAbility to interact and communicate with individuals in various functional areas and various levels of managementDetail orientation and multi-tasking abilities essentialMust be able to think through and analyze problems and summarize results succinctlyHigh level of customer service and relationship management, with excellent interpersonal skills
Preferred Experience/ Skills/Knowledge: MBA and/or CPA preferred but not required.Experience with SAP BusinessObjects a plusExperience in the retail industry is a plusExperience working in retail FP&A and a strong understanding of new store budgeting and planning, store level reporting.
We are an equal opportunity employer and makeTo apply please email your resume to crusso@rothstaffing.com

Title: Social Media Marketing
JobDescription:
We are seeking a talented and experienced Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our dynamic marketing team. As a Social Media Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for developing and executing effective social media strategies to increase brand awareness, drive engagement, and generate leads. Title: Marketing Proposal Coordinator
JobDescription:
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.Job Description SummaryThe Marketing Coordinator is responsible to both lead and assist in Swinerton’s efforts throughout all stages of project pursuits including the development of strong, strategic, professional, and compelling material in support of qualifications packages, proposals, and client interviews/presentations. This position reports to the Marketing Manager and/or Regional Marketing Director, and interfaces with all levels of the organization (Executive Leadership, Project Executives and Project Managers, Field Staff, Preconstruction professionals, internal departments, external consultants, and other Marketing Coordinators) in the performance of your day-to-day responsibilities. This position is extremely deadline driven, requires a proven ability to multitask and manage competing priorities, and necessitates an unwavering commitment to quality control and pride of ownership.Job DescriptionPrimary Responsibilities: Establish strong and collaborative relationships with the local and national Marketing team members, Regional Managers, Division Managers, market leads, and corporate resources; build strong internal relationships across the organization to facilitate strong pursuit efforts.Lead and support new project pursuits including, but not limited to, project/pursuit management, content development, editing and proofreading, formatting, and layout, and production.Work with Pursuit Team members, business developers, or leadership to develop any pre-positioning materials to build awareness and create excitement about Swinerton as a potential partner.Analyze formal RFQ/P requirements and ensure consistency, accuracy, and adherence to all stated requirements.Work with the pursuit team lead to establish and strictly manage the pursuit schedule (i.e., when drafts are expected, color reviews, review time needed, etc.).Develop interview presentation materials in support of client interviews; includes strategy and content development, coaching, scheduling and leading rehearsals, etc.Development of additional marketing collateral including brochures and qualification packages, team resumes, case studies, and project data and stories, etc. that highlight Swinerton’s technical expertise and differentiators.Interface with vendors (i.e., printers, photographers, etc.) as necessary.Provide peer review to other new project pursuits to ensure high quality and compliance with Marketing Standards; accountability to support the regional and national teams.Manage post-proposal activities including content deconstruction, after action reviews, and client debriefs.Accountability for and commitment to all Regional/Divisional Cosential data across all opportunity stages to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the data; working with Regional/Divisional leadership to ensure this occurs consistently.Accountability for and commitment to compliance with all national/corporate initiatives to promote maximum consistency and efficiency and elevate our work product across the organization; support the development and maintenance of best practices for process, content, templates, etc.Supporting national pursuits as e member of Swinerton’s One Proposal Team, as necessary.
Objectives Or Goals To Measure Performance Consistently display the soft skills defined below.Commitment to internal client satisfaction.Viewed as a collaborative partner and problem-solver.Consistent development of high-quality proposals, pursuit collateral, and communications + branding materials.Commitment to continuous improvement and elevation of work product and processes.Commitment to company policies and procedures.Developing leadership attributes as defined by the Career Blueprint. 
Minimum Skills And Experience Requirements Curiosity and commitment to develop a strong level of business literacy about Swinerton’s total operating model, strategic initiatives, differentiators, financial position, and culture.Developing knowledge of best practices in professional services marketing, including business development, marketing research, opportunity evaluation, capture planning, pursuit strategy, and proposal development.Analytical skills to identify trends and challenges; offer new ideas.Professional judgment and discretion.Strong project management and team building capabilities.Exceptional organizational and time management skills; ability to manage multiple competing priorities.Excellent interpersonal communication skills and ability to work with multiple stakeholders.Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.Excellent verbal and written communication skills; content development/storytelling.Developing understanding of construction, architecture and/or engineering industry.Excellent organizational and time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.Ability to develop proficiency with Swinerton’s CRM (Cosential); prior experience with Cosential or equal Customer Relationship Management software is a plus.Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office.Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or related field preferred.Minimum of one (1) year of experience related to marketing, communications, and proposal/pursuit management.Ability and willingness to travel.
Summary Of BenefitsThis role provides the following benefits:  medical; dental; vision; employee assistance program; pre-tax saving and spending accounts; basic term life insurance and AD&D; short and long term disability; 401(k) & savings plan and Company match; Employee Stock Ownership Plan and Profit Sharing Trust; Individual Employee-Ownership; MSA Financial coaching; Care.com; ClassPass fitness membership; pet insurance; legal plan, identity theft protection; DoorDash delivery subscription; paid vacation; paid sick leave; and other voluntary benefit options. * Union Members: health and retirement benefits are provided thru the union; therefore voluntary benefit offerings are available for this role.If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!Compensation RangeHourly Rate: $25.34 - $37.98

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Wright-Pierce has an exciting opportunity for a Marketing Coordinator based in any of our geographic locations. As a marketer at Wright-Pierce, you will be part of a collaborative marketing team that supports efforts in locations throughout New England, New York, South Carolina, and Florida. You will have the opportunity, through proposal development and interview preparation, to directly impact our firm’s growth. If your skills are a match for the position below, we’d love to hear from you.Responsibilities Work hand-in-hand with engineering teams to support development of proposals and presentations. Coordinate trade shows and events. Maintain and update marketing collateral, including case studies, resumes, and boilerplate content. Maintain office marketing material and inventory supply. Maintain quality control of Wright-Pierce brand standards throughout all deliverables. Provide support for our social media program. Cross-train in marketing areas firm-wide and provide backup for others as-needed. Visit project sites to learn and understand what we do firsthand. Other duties related to marketing and business development support. 
Essential Functions Exceptional written communication skills. Self-starter with excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Ability to collaborate in a team environment. Ability to assist with relaying technical information clearly. Belief in the core values of Wright-Pierce and personal qualities of integrity and commitment. Ability to thrive in a challenging, face-paced, environment. 
Experience 0 - 2 years of marketing and proposal experience, A/E/C industry experience is a plus. Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, specifically PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and Outlook. Specific expertise in MS Word layout and formatting is a must. Experience with the Adobe Creative Suite is a plus. Photography skills are a plus. 
Education BA/BS degree in marketing, business administration, or English. 
Office Location(s) Bedford, NHAndover, MAMiddletown, CTProvidence, RIClifton Park, NYPortland, METopsham, MEMaitland, FL
Equal Employment OpportunityWright-Pierce is an EEO Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, transgender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, or marital status.About Wright-PierceAt Wright-Pierce, we’re passionate about serving our clients and making a difference in the world through our commitment to give back and purpose to “engineer a better environment.” We’re proud to be part of an industry that protects our most critical resource: water. Wright-Pierce is an award-winning, multi-discipline engineering firm of more than 300 professionals located in offices throughout the Northeast and Southeast. Since 1947, we have delivered reliable solutions to our clients’ water resource and infrastructure challenges.

Title: Marketing and Communications Librarian – Part Time
JobDescription:
Position SummaryThe Marketing and Communications Librarian plans, coordinates, and implements the marketing of library services and programs to the Garland community with the creation of library press releases, emails, social media posts, informational and promotional documents, publications, and related marketing materials. Responsibilities involve significant public contact, both within the library and through outreach efforts. The incumbent coordinates with other city departments and organizations as directed. The person in this position performs a variety of specialized support work associated with outreach and programming for the library and, depending on qualifications, may provide library and information services, professional reference, reader’s advisory services, and quality programs to library users. The weekly work schedule will include nights and weekends, with some changes to the regular schedule required to participate in programming and outreach services.Target Hiring Range: $21.15 to $24.08 Depending on QualificationsEssential Job Functions  Helps develop and promote innovative programs and events and manage promotional materials  Under the general direction of library administration, generates content and manages communications about library programs, services, and outreach efforts and Friends of the Library activities, to engage and reengage customers  Edits written content such as press releases and promotional content to develop a recognizable voice for the library  Creates an editorial and graphic style that is consistent with the library’s established branding campaign  Develops measurable objectives to review and evaluate the success of marketing strategies and communications programs  Plans and implements a proactive public relations program for the library  Uses graphic design tools to design, create and facilitate the production of high quality, creative, visually pleasing, and informative, physical and digital media communication resources such as news releases, social media, web content, brochures, signs, displays, and other library publications  Writes copy for press releases, e-news, newsletters, fliers and brochures  Plans and implements the distribution of library promotional pieces  Carries out special project assignments  May provide instructional classes on the Internet and library online resources, and presents educational programs, as assigned  May liaise with contracted graphic designers as assigned. Oversees and orders print jobs as needed  Stays apprised of new resources through continuing education, professional journals, and training 
Minimum Education & Work Experience Master's Degree in Library Science from an American Library Association accredited college or university or within 6 months of earning an MLS, from an American Library Association accredited college or university Up to 1 year of related experience Or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Other combinations of education and experience may also be considered.Education/ Experience Preferred Knowledge - Abilities & Skills   Advanced graduate level coursework in library technology and electronic resources  1 or more years of professional-level public library experience  Training or experience in graphic design, copywriting, or marketing  Training or experience in creating marketing content for social media 
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities  Knowledge of current practices in public libraries, including reference services, reader's advisory, and library technology, including online resources commonly provided to patrons by public libraries  Excellent written and oral communications skills  Skill in using a variety of Internet browsers, online productivity tools, and email  Skill operating office equipment, computer equipment, and online productivity applications, especially Microsoft Office 365  Skill in creating social media content  Ability to work cooperatively and congenially with others, including other city employees and the public  Ability to perform multiple tasks and meet deadlines  Ability to handle customer issues and complaints appropriately  Ability to work closely with others as part of a team  Ability to work a varying 19 hour-per-week schedule The ability to speak and read Spanish or Vietnamese is preferred, but not a requirement
 Licenses & Certifications  Valid Class C Texas driver's license Physical Tasks & Working Conditions The incumbent works in a typical office environment, but some physical labor, exposure to dust, and travel to various sites may occur. Work assignments may be at any library facility and may vary, depending on departmental needs; reliable transportation will be needed. Physical tasks will include lifting, reaching, pushing, squatting, bending, stooping, walking, and carrying supplies, as needed, to accomplish the tasks of the activity on a daily basis. Must also be able to use keyboard and peripherals, operate a telephone, and communicate in person and over the telephone. Competencies Models Organizational ValuesCustomer FocusCommunicationAdaptability/FlexibilityResults Focus/Project Management
Skills: Copywriting, Electronic Resources, Graphic Design, Library Reference, Library Science, Library Services, Metadata, Press Releases, Public Libraries, Social Media Content Creation

Manage the admission process by maintaining updated bed availability and community services information at all times. Manage the inquiry process professionally, timely, and with appropriate follow-up. Effectively manage occupancy levels and census/premium mix enhancement. Make calls to outside the community to medical, insurance, legal, and financial professionals, and senior organizations, appropriate special interest groups, hospital discharge planners, and other community contacts. Develop and maintain relationships to advice referral sources of bed availability and new product and services. Maintain current database of existing and potential referral sources. Utilize company’s sales practices and sales tracking tools. Alert appropriate department heads and community staff of projected changes: i.e., admissions, bed changes, and discharges, through daily admission meeting to discuss forthcoming changes. Utilize bed management principles. Maintain a close working relationship with the Director of Nursing Services (DNS) and the Business Office Manager (BOM) to assure appropriate and efficient decisions about prospective admissions. Recommend admission decisions to community management When admission determinations are made, communicate with nursing and housekeeping about appropriate room and bed selection. Ensure appropriate admission paperwork and signatures are obtained from residents or responsible parties prior to admission. Communicate special needs of new admits to staff to ensure a smooth transition. Ensure daily that referral sources and admissions data are entered into the automated referral system. Ensure every admission is educated about and encouraged to sign up for the Alternative Dispute Resolution program. Coordinate the development and implementation of sales and marketing plans, serves as a chairperson for marketing team meetings, monitor budgets and tracks results. Maintain a working knowledge of state and federal regulations and reimbursement guidelines (Medicare and Medicaid). Assist with managed care referral process. May provide assistance with new care team member orientation for the admission process. Maintain a database of medical contacts/community resources along with knowledge of industry trends and legislative/regulatory issues and communicate with information to community staff and community contacts. Keep all patient information confidential. Develop and implement special events and presentations targeted at community education, establishing, and maintaining status for the community as the expert on skilled nursing, specialty programs, and rehabilitation care in the community. Monitors and evaluates customer satisfaction; audiences might include new admissions, post-discharges, current residents and families, community sources, and others as appropriate to develop action plans, as needed. Daily follow up on all active and pending inquiries. Perform other tasks as assigned and within the scope of practice. Must demonstrate empathy, courteous, kind and professional workplace behavior and customer services to all residents, Care Team Members, vendors, visitors and family members at all times. Attends all mandatory in-services; and completes timely all necessary Relias trainings scheduled to perform. Keeps abreast and/or discusses with supervisor or manager all necessary policies, procedures and business practices within the scope of the position held to effectively perform all duties assigned.
Requirements:  Associate and/or Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Communications field preferred. Two years equivalent experience in a sales/marketing position or Admissions Coordinator position in lieu of degree. Previous healthcare community relations’ experience preferred.
Majestic Care provides a competitive compensation and full benefits package. For more information please apply. Come join our team!

Title: Marketing Communications Assistant
JobDescription: We are a consistently growing company providing marketing, advertising, and consulting services to industry leaders. We excel in developing unique marketing that places our clients' brands in front of consumers when and where it matters most. Our success derives not only from our ability to increase our clients' revenue, but also out time tested strategies for promoting brand awareness and creating a repeat customer base in targeted markets.We have recently expanded and added new clients to our portfolio. As a result, we are currently looking to fill several entry level positions immediately and willing to train representatives from the group up. These new additions to our marketing teams will be crucial to the development of each new campaign and will be cross trained in all facets of marketing, sales, and brand management.In our Entry Level Representative role, we use a hands on approach that will challenge candidates to advance their skills in marketing, advertising, sales, public relations, and brand management. We provide a setting that will broaden an entry level candidate's professional experiences while promoting self-confidence, accomplishment, and career development. In a short amount of time, entry level candidates will have the opportunity to work with several different clients as well as work closely in tandem with our management team.We consider candidates from all backgrounds, but the following majors will be considered first:MarketingManagementPublic RelationsSports ManagementAdvertisingCommunicationsPsychologySociologyAPPLY TODAY!

Title: Graphic Designer  - Marketing
Company: Cincinnati and Hamilton County Public Library
JobDescription:
Graphic Designer  - Marketing DepartmentDate Posted: 7/11/2023POSITION SUMMARY: Responsible for developing consistent branch imagery promoting Library programs, services and materials including but not limited to: posters, branch signage, bookmarks, fliers, websites, logos, banners, exhibit materials, digital signage, newsletters and e-newsletters. The successful candidate will enjoy collaborating with multiple teams across the organization while providing excellent internal customer service.Duties Designs still and animated artwork and layouts for a wide variety of purposes including print, digital and CHPL.org to promote Library programs, services and materials. Items include but are not limited to: print and online publications, brochures, bookmarks, posters, forms, signage, illustration, photography, exhibit labels, t-shirts, banners, ads. Designs artwork in alignment with the Library’s brand standards. Manages simultaneous projects by prioritizing, estimating deadlines, and sharing project updates with direct supervisor. Designs for target audiences: teens, children, adults while prioritizing inclusion and representation of our diverse communities. Operates in-house production printer and cutter. Mounts posters, exhibit labels, cut, frame and matte materials for display. Contributes to the Marketing team through positive, solutions-oriented collaboration in meetings and brainstorming sessions. Works with third-party printing shops to obtain maximum quality of outsourced materials. Performs simple maintenance and restocking of graphics equipment. 
Qualifications Maintains current knowledge of graphic media, design trends, materials, best practices, techniques and technology; exhibits a willingness to learn other applications as needed. Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite; including Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign. Ability to work independently, conceptualize projects and manage multiple priorities. Analytical skills to identify and interpret needs and Library’s brand. Solution-oriented with the ability to meet deadlines, often with a quick turnaround time, and with accuracy.Demonstrates a devotion to diversity, equity and inclusion efforts of all colleagues and customers regardless of age, cultural background, ability, ethnicity, family status, gender identity, immigration status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status and veteran status. Keeps current on trends in the library field and builds awareness of contemporary library spaces and services to inform design work. Demonstrates the Library’s Welcoming Spaces strategic priority by delivering excellent customer service to internal and external customers. Interacts with members of diverse ethnic and socio-economic communities, children, staff and management in a respectful and professional manner that reflects the Library’s Healthy Culture strategic priority. Demonstrates professionalism in all settings, including being a team player with a solutions-oriented mindset; arriving to work reliably, regularly, and on time; and exhibiting behavior that is consistent with building a strong organizational culture, while performing work duties.
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design or Art.Minimum of 2 years of professional design experience.Graphic design skills that are demonstrable through a strong design portfolio.Valid driver’s license and driving record that is acceptable to the Library’s insurance carrier.Must be able to drive own vehicle or library vehicle.
Preferred Qualifications Experience with animation software is preferred. Familiarity with working within project management systems is preferred. Bilingual skills are a plus. 
Job LocationCincinnati, OH, United StatesPosition TypeFull TimeHOURS 40 hours per weekSalaryGrade 8: $51,792.00 - $75,088.00 annualDEADLINEFriday, 7/21/23 at 5pmEqual Employment Opportunity Employer

Title: Brand Ambassador
JobDescription:
Do you love making a difference? Are you passionate about raising awareness and giving people their voices back?In order to keep up with client demand, we’re looking to add an additional entry level Account Manager to our Tampa-based Marketing team this month. This is a very hands-on marketing role where you’ll be working closely with our community. We’re willing to provide training to the right person, so marketing degrees and experience are welcome, but not essential.You will end up being a delegate for a noble cause having an effect in our country! Our clients are awesome at what they do, and we work well for them by constantly giving procedures and promoting arrangements. You will help make and carry out convincing efforts, and address our clients through different marketing campaigns, eventually drawing in new crowds and expanding monetary help. All while loving what you do and creating success in your career simultaneously!What We Require of You – Your Role: Work diligently to build a positive brand image for clients.Research and book venues for upcoming eventsPlan, prepare for and manage live marketing eventsKeep up to speed on marketing trends and effective techniquesBuild a strong customer base with an emphasis on customer retentionBuild strong relationships with clients, customers, and sponsorsBuild strong relationships with team members and venue representativesDemonstrate clients’ products and explain services at live eventsBe the face of clients to the public – sometimes the only face they’ll seeAnswering general questions and overcoming minor objectionsClosing and consolidating sales when appropriateEngage with registered voters in meaningful, one-on-one conversationsGather petition signaturesWork in a team environment to set and accomplish campaign goals
Qualifications Commitment to progressive politics and policiesGreat communication skillsInvigorated communicatorsAlluring energy; fun and cordial characterEnergetic and committed to having an effectNatural leader qualitiesAdaptable and able to make changes when essentialWant to grow personally and professionally
Here’s what we need from you: Sales, retail, customer service, or hospitality experience is a plus since you’ll be working with customers in a fast-paced environmentYou should be able to communicate effectively with a wide range of people from different backgrounds. Speaking more than one language is a bonus!Due to the nature of the role, all applicants need to be 18 years or older and legally authorized to work in the USA without sponsorship.You’ll have to be able to work with large groups as a team player while also ensuring you’re meeting your individual targetsHaving a positive attitude, optimistic nature and a winning mindset is importantWe’re looking for someone that can complete tasks on time and meet deadlinesIt is imperative that you be ethical, honest, and straightforward in all business dealingsBe able to redirect a conversation if it starts going south or gets off trackHave the ability to adapt easily to market and industry changes and advancesThis is NOT a remote position, so you’ll also need to be able to commute to our Tampa based office on a daily basis.ACCOUNT MANAGERS NEEDED ASAP FOR THE LEGALIZING MARIJUANA CAMPAIGN!!**** We are looking for people with an outgoing personality to work with a petition form!

For Consideration:Please apply using the online application process. We’re always looking to upgrade and expand our team, so don’t be surprised if our recruiter reaches out to you soon after receiving your application. In order to ensure she can contact you, please make sure your resume has your current contact details and that you’re keeping an eye on your phone and email inbox (including spam folder as we are a marketing company and sometimes get flagged!)Thanks for considering our opportunity! We look forward to hearing from you!
