JobDescription:
MMG Executives is seeking an energetic, innovative leader for our partner marketing team. Our Marketing Associate works side-by-side with our Campaign Manager and will work closely with our sales teams globally. Our Marketing Associate strives to develop and execute local marketing plans that drive the pipeline for net new target demographics as well as customer acquisition opportunities. You will create a marketing mix consisting of regional events, partner marketing, and strategic sales support with visibility and insights into local markets. We are headquartered in Cincinnati, OH with offices in San Francisco, Dallas, and Charleston.Are you looking to expand your horizons in a rewarding career? We offer comprehensive on-the-job training and advancement opportunities for all of our team members.Sports Marketing Associate Duties Work with our sales and marketing team to develop effective marketing strategiesUtilize marketing techniques and strategies to increase customer acquisitionsIncrease retention via successful marketing presentationsCoach, train, and encourage junior team membersDrive salesMaintain a positive and competitive workplace atmosphereInteract with clients on a one-to-one basis
Sports Marketing Associate Requirements Background in Marketing, Public Relations, Sales, or CommunicationsA creative mindset is a plus!Works well in a fast-paced team environmentMust be goal-orientedExcellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills are requiredMinimum Associates Degree or three years of relevant experienceCandidates may be subject to background screening
If you are interested in advancing your career in marketing, apply today!

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Job SummaryWoods Hole Oceanographic Institution is seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist  to join the Communications team. This position is responsible for developing and implementing Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution’s digital marketing initiatives and efforts including paid advertising, promotions, emails, landing pages, lead generation, campaigns, marketing research, and reports. This position is responsible for helping to strengthen WHOI’s brand, increase awareness of and engagement with the Institution, drive lead generation, and maximize revenue from online fundraising and merchandise sales. This position also coordinates and supports marketing needs of researchers and administration as appropriate. Remote work option available for this position. This is a full-time, exempt position and is eligible for benefits.Essential Functions  Develop strong digital marketing plans and campaign briefs to guide marketing efforts.  Design and implement paid advertising and promotions on platforms like Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and Google Ads.  Create compelling copywriting and edit content for various digital marketing efforts.  Lead email marketing campaigns, including promotions, email series, drip campaigns, A/B testing, and reporting.  Develop and implement landing pages and websites.  Execute lead generation campaigns and manage and nurture email lists.  Optimize call-to-action (CTA) and conversion points across WHOI channels.  Collaborate closely with the Digital Content Producer to optimize and grow social media KPIs, including fans/followers, reach, and engagement.  Grow and nurture influencer marketing efforts.  Conduct keyword research and implement SEO best practices to improve website traffic and search engine rankings.  Serve as a liaison with outside marketing agencies, vendors, and contractors as necessary.  Be a power user of and improve WHOI’s marketing automation tools  Perform market research, reporting, and analysis of digital marketing efforts to evaluate effectiveness and provide actionable insights.  Collaborate with various teams within the organization to meet marketing objectives and ensure consistent messaging and branding.  Stay updated with the latest market research, trends, and tools in digital marketing and make proactive recommendations for improvement.  Support out-of-home advertising and underwriting efforts as needed. 
Non-Essential FunctionsPerform other duties as necessary.Education & ExperienceBachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field; equivalent professional experience in digital marketing will be considered.2+ years of demonstrated experience in digital marketing.Strong copywriting skills and attention to detail.Experience with paid advertising platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, etc.Knowledge of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics and SEMrush.Experience with email marketing and marketing automation platforms such as Mailchimp, HubSpot, etc.Strong analytical skills and the ability to analyze and interpret data to make informed decisions.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Self-starter with the ability to take ownership of projects and work independently.Experience with image editing software (e.g. Adobe Photoshop) and experience with web content management systems a plus.Proven ability to successfully handle multiple projects and meet critical deadlines.Results-oriented and a passion for creativity.Experience working with a non-profit organization a plus.Physical RequirementsPhysical duties for this position include but are not limited to: occasional standing and/or walking along with being mostly and continuously sedentary. Other occupational requirements include talking, traveling, working around others, and with others. Physical duties are subject to change. All are welcome to apply.

Title: Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
FCS International, Inc dba FirstCarbon Solutions is focused on improving the world we live in. It's our goal to improve the lives of all the people we work with, whether they are clients, partners, or colleagues. Come join our team of amazing professionals dedicated to making the world a better place!FCS International is excited to open up a new opportunity within our Marketing team! This position has the option to work remotely or from one of our physical California office locations (abiding by the FCS Workplace Policy). This is a multifaceted role in a busy environmental services & sustainability consulting firm. We are looking for someone to join our team who is passionate about helping our internal and external clients, sharing a cohesive message, and improving the world around us!The Marketing Associate (CG05) will be responsible for managing corporate communications and processes; maintaining promotional materials inventory and company websites; planning meetings and webinars; maintaining databases; preparing reports and managing project scheduling, among other duties. This individual must be able to proactively drive projects and work collaboratively with others in an enthusiastic and detail- and process-oriented manner.Duties And Responsibilities Maintain and update company websites using MODX to make real-time edits, and work with offshore marketing team to manage website contentManage corporate and internal communications and collateral to ensure a sense of brand consistency, brand ownership, brand culture, and brand values within the organizationManage events, webinars, and podcasts to ensure deadlines are met; identify appropriate media outlets to promote and implementSupport lead generation and ensure all marketing generated leads are accurately entered into necessary systems; use reports and dashboards to manage data quality of leads; manage leads who no longer wish to receive marketing communicationsMaintain company marketing drive to ensure version controlTraffic marketing materials and promotional items from design through proof review and finalization, including electronic files, printing, and shippingManage marketing newsletters and lead gen emails, including content, to improve open, click-through and conversion ratesCommunicate with and leverage both internal and external vendors and teams to drive project deliverables while achieving utilization goalsSuccessfully deliver marketing communications from concept to execution as specified by the approved MarCom calendarsSupport external clients and partners within budget and deadline parameters for maximum engagement opportunitiesMaintain guardianship of the ADEC Professional Services brands, and their associated products, both internally and externallySupport internal sales teams in achieving company goalsContinually gather knowledge of company practices and product lines to facilitate marketing leadership and expertise, as well as personal career developmentSeek to advance processes to improve marketing programs
Skills Impeccable organizational skills to manage continually changing priorities across multiple practices, services, external partners, and internal teamsPrecise communication skills that facilitate project goals, while maintaining a positive and constructive rapport with cross-functional teamsKnowledge of best practices in digital marketing techniques (email, website, SEO, social media, etc.)Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Salesforce CRM, Pardot, Smartsheet, Anchor.fm, Google Analytics, Hootsuite, and MODX or similar CMSAbility to monitor regular analytics to translate into actionable results and provide recommendationsExtremely detail-oriented; works well under pressure; effectively manages deadlines, ad hoc requests, and changing priorities; takes initiative and drives projects to completionWorks well in a team environment, as well as able to take the lead on projects from beginning to endAbility to work with cross-functional teams at various levels of seniority and within different cultures and geographic regionsAbility to review copy for content and accuracy, as well as brainstorm outlines and draft content
Education And Experience Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications or other relevant field or equivalent experience3-5 years in marketing with experience in digital communications and special emphasis on business-to-business in the United States and EuropeExperience in environmental services and/or corporate sustainability a plus
Work EnvironmentThe position currently operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to have hand/finger dexterity; be in front of a computer for long periods of time and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.Diversity and respect are fundamental. Fundamental to our teams. Fundamental to our clients. Fundamental to the communities we serve and live in. Fundamental to the landscapes we work within. We need you and your unique talents, history, and background to become the Company we aspire to be. We insist upon a culture of common respect, expect transparency, and celebrate all individuals' fundamental values and dignity. Our mutual equality as humans is the path to diverse and innovative collaboration. We cultivate integrity, driving us to growth, and allowing us to achieve more together than we could ever hope to as individuals.PI224845434

Title: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
Are you ready for a career where you can make a real impact?We are looking for proactive, motivated, and coachable individuals who are interested in the sales industry. As an Entry Level Marketing and Sales Representative, you will be the first point of contact with potential clients through prospecting and creating sales opportunitiesIn order to be successful in this position, you will need to be a go-getter who is driven to exceed goals and must be driven for future success in all areas of life. We have found that the right company culture fit will result in an amazing long term working relationship. Our goal is for this to be the best job opportunity you’ve ever had!We recently expanded with a new client and are looking for an entry-level marketing sales assistant to help support the sales and management teams.What’s in it for you: Competitive pay and performance-based incentives.Flexible work hours.Career advancement opportunities.Free sales training, extensive support, and mentorship program.
Job Requirements  Competitive individuals with a winning/student mentalityTeam captains ready to lead and trainCandidates who are serious about a long-term career with a growing industrySales experience is a plus, but not required

JobDescription:

JobDescription:

Position will work with Marketers, Product and Technical Team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions that are aligned with business and IT strategies while complying with the organization's architectural standards.Duties ADT's Salesforce Marketing Cloud technology expert responsible for design and technical implementationTranslate business and marketing challenges into well-designed solutions.Collaborate with internal Agile development team to determine best path for Salesforce platform implementation. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Raleigh, NC McAdams is hiring a full-time marketing coordinator to work closely with our chief administrative officer, director of marketing and team. This role spans both strategic and production work and requires a thoughtful, proactive approach. Strong time management, creative problem-solving, and client relationship skills are important keys to success in this role.You will create qualifications, proposals, presentations, and other deliverables daily, both print and electronic, across multiple platforms. We look for a high level of skill with InDesign, a natural graphic eye, a love of the industry, and an outstanding ability to collaborate with our teaming partners, both internal and external.To be eligible for this role, you will have 0-3 years of experience in marketing, preferably in the A/E/C industry.Responsibilities Coordinate and work with department leaders, project managers and other technical staff to prepare proposals, statements of qualifications, brochures, presentations and other materials in alignment with brand standards and strategic messagingCreate and edit marketing proposal documents as well as develop and coordinate graphics and layoutsGain comprehensive understanding of McAdams’ portfolio of work, project types and firm-wide capabilitiesPerform multiple marketing efforts against rapid and frequent deadlinesConsistently maintain pursuit and project information in our customer relationship management (CRM) database, including managing capital improvement program information, incoming leads, follow-up and tracking of opportunity statusConsistently maintain resumes, project descriptions, image library and websiteCoordinate and develop new materials to support marketing activitiesMaintain trade organization conference schedules, attendance, sponsorships and other eventsCheck marketing RFQ websitesAssist in ideation of our social media postsBe an integrated marketing team member
Requirements Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field as well as 0-3 years of professional experience in the A/E/C industryKnowledge of the proposal process (RFQ/P) and experience researching, designing, editing and producing proposals, presentations and other marketing collateralSuperior editing skills, including ability to craft a story in a compelling mannerAdvanced InDesign skillsAwareness of good information design and layoutAbility to manage and organize multiple marketing efforts simultaneously, with constant attention to detailAbility to work both independently and collaboratively to meet a deadlineStrong communication, organization, team-building and relationship management skillsStrong client service skillsCompetency in Microsoft applications including OneNote, Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel and Powerpoint knowledge of Wordpress, SEO and Deltek Vantagepoint is a plus

Title: Executive Marketing Assistant (Onsite Roswell, GA - Immediate Hire)
JobDescription:
EXECUTIVE MARKETING ASSISTANT (ONSITE ROSWELL, GA - IMMEDIATE HIRE)Job DescriptionPosition Objective: Complete critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach that includes drafting/composing letters and emails, creating PowerPoint presentations, Excel spreadsheets and various tasks that facilitate the CEO’s ability to effectively manage new business.Primary Duties Provide high level marketing support, including tracking business leads in Salesforce and keeping the Company CEO well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, as they relate to potential business opportunities. Serve as the Company’s Salesforce administrator. Work in conjunction with Company’s outside marketing consultants to develop and implement marketing strategies and initiatives. Create and distribute Company weekly newsletter in HubSpot Research RFP opportunities and develop proposals in response to various bid solicitations and other requests for information. 
Responsibilities Complete projects and special assignments in a timely manner by establishing objectives, determining priorities, managing time, gaining cooperation of others, problem solving and adjusting plans. Support new business development by creating PowerPoint sales presentations. Write or assist in writing and distributing sales letters and/or emails for new business opportunities. Perform Salesforce administration to include: 1) managing user access 2) maintaining and updating leads 3) monitoring opportunities 4) creating and updating CEO’s ongoing opportunities and contacts. In conjunction with Company’s outside marketing consultant group, provide marketing coordination that includes, but is not limited to, conducting industry research; website administration; writing and distributing company weekly newsletter; blogs and e‐blasts; maintaining promotional materials inventory, administration of client contact lists; and managing social media outlets (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn) including daily activity and content. Regularly monitor Google AdWords’ PPC campaigns. Coordinate networking events and tradeshow registrations with Operations. Manage industry award entries. Maintain supplier diversity registrations. Work with outside PR/marketing firm writing many of the above marketing efforts; however manage the processes internally, set timelines, and collaborate with internal team to help company improve upon existing marketing and PR efforts. Other duties as may be required. Strong organizational and time management skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail Strong interpersonal skills and a background in marketing and customer relations (internal and external) Solid oral and written communication skills, demonstrating a command of English grammar and composition, along with proofreading skills Ability to create, communicate, and execute a strategic approach/ project plan Highly resourceful, collaborative team player, with the ability to be extremely effective independently Forward-looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions Self‐starter with a high level of initiative, proven proactive thinker Calm individual who can operate under pressure, with demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet aggressive deadlines Punctual and dependable Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in marketing required. Prior experience working with executive level management desired. High level of proficiency in MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook required. Proficiency in Salesforce.com required. Working knowledge of HubSpot desired. 
Skills, Knowledge, And Abilities Required  Strong organizational and time management skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detailStrong interpersonal skills and a background in marketing and customer relations (internal and external) Solid oral and written communication skills, demonstrating a command of English grammar and composition, along with proofreading skillsAbility to create, communicate, and execute a strategic approach/ project plan Highly resourceful, collaborative team player, with the ability to be extremely effective independently Forward-looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions Self‐starter with a high level of initiative, proven proactive thinker Calm individual who can operate under pressure, with demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet aggressive deadlines Punctual and dependable
Experience Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in marketing required. Prior experience working with executive level management desired. High level of proficiency in MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook required. Proficiency in Salesforce.com required. Working knowledge of HubSpot desired.
Only those with the experience and qualifications outlined above will be considered. This is not an executive assistant or sales position. Candidates MUST have advanced experience in Salesforce in order to be the administrator for the program. We will not train.Work Schedule8:30 am to 5:30 pm with one-hour for lunch. Overtime is expected if necessary to meet crucial deadlines.Salary Range: $60K to $65KIncentives:  After six (6) months of continuous employment, an Incentive bonus plan will be created for mined RFPs that are successful in new business development.

Title: Marketing And Public Relations Assistant
JobDescription:
Have you been waiting for an opportunity to grow in a business where you can travel and build a real career?Do you consider yourself a creative, hard-working individual?We believe that three things draw the best from our people: Competition, Travel, and Creativity. By focusing on a team-oriented environment, our employees are given all of the tools they need to grow, succeed, and thrive both professionally and personally.We care about all of our employees and believe that without them, we would not be the world-renowned consulting firm that we are.About Our New Openings:As a Communications and Marketing Associate, we are looking to hire people that are interested in facilitating positive communication skills. Whether that is between clients, customers, or even individuals in our office setting. This position allows for public speaking and market research study opportunities as well. In addition, this position also gives our employees opportunities to progress into various management positions to those that work hard.Responsibilities: Perform tasks to ensure the functionality and coordination of the department’s activitiesAid marketing executives with organizing projectsAssist with organizing promotional events and campaigns and attend them to ensure their successPrepare and deliver promotional presentationsCommunicate directly with clients and build trusting relationships
Qualifications Prior experience as a marketing assistant or experience in a related fieldHigh School Diploma; degree in Marketing, Business or related field is a plusExcellent communicator with a strong attention to detailStrong organizational skillsPositive and professional demeanor
Don’t wait any longer to feed your wanderlust, Apply TODAY! For Consideration: Send in your resume, LinkedIn profile, or cover letter as soon as possible in order to be contacted immediately upon review. Candidates must be over the age of 18 in order to qualify.

Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
About us:Strike realizes that even with the influx of modern technological advancements, there will always be a need to humanize a brand and have the option for customers to talk to a person (not a computer) about any queries or issues they may have. Only time will tell what will be possible in the future. All we know is that Strike will be part of the evolution.Job Description:Are you a dynamic and ambitious individual with a passion for marketing? We are currently seeking a Marketing Assistant to join our team!As a Marketing Assistant, you will play a crucial role in supporting our marketing efforts and helping us achieve our business objectives. You will work closely with our marketing team to execute various marketing campaigns, conduct market research, analyze data, and assist with the creation of marketing materials.Key Responsibilities: Conduct market research to identify industry trends, customer preferences, and competitor strategies.Analyze marketing data and provide insights to optimize campaign performance and improve marketing strategies.Assist in the creation of marketing materials such as brochures, presentations, and promotional content.Matthew GoodchildSupport the planning and coordination of marketing events, including trade shows, conferences, and product launches.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, or a related field.Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Knowledge of market research techniques and data analysis.
If you are a motivated self-starter with a passion for marketing, we would love to hear from you! Join our team as a Marketing Assistant and take your marketing career to the next level. Apply now with your resume and cover letter.

Title: Junior Marketing Associate
JobDescription:
Here at Foursight AdvanEdge, we believe in investing in our employees and providing opportunities for growth. As a Junior Marketing Associate, you will receive comprehensive training in sales and marketing techniques, as well as ongoing coaching and support from our experienced team members.In addition, we offer a clear career path for our employees, with opportunities to progress into more senior marketing and management roles based on performance and potential. We believe in promoting from within and providing our employees with the tools and resources they need to succeed.Please note: We are looking for candidates in the St. Louis area and are willing to commute to our Clayton location daily!Responsibilities: Collaborating with team members to achieve goals and increase brand awarenessDeveloping and maintaining face-to-face customer relationshipsCollecting and analyzing customer feedback to improve our marketing strategies and tacticsAssist on sales teams

Title: Marketing Associate - Content & Communications

Focus on plan documentation, publication and remarketing of proprietary content.Support the development, compliance review and distribution of complex marketing materials including corporate brochures, product profiles, newsletters, publications, slide presentations, product launches, etc.Support digital marketing efforts by maintaining corporate and investor relations websites, social media and other digital properties. Support automation efforts to streamline and measure marketing effectiveness.Other duties as assigned.

Who You Are Exceptional time management abilities with strong analytical, problem-solving skills and a collaborative approach.Team player with the ability to develop strong working relationships and partnerships across different departments and internal and/or external clients, vendors and partners.A strong business sense with the ability to create product strategy from understanding market problems and opportunities.Proven technical aptitude and strong management skills.A strong customer orientation with a “How can I help?” approach.Strong verbal and written communication skills. Proven ability to apply judgment, creativity and writing skills in planning, developing and editing customized content, campaigns and product materials.Ability to work on multiple assignments and complete high-quality work against strict and competing deadlines dictated by clients, prospects and consultants.Detail orientation and interest in reporting, analytics and automation (technology integration)Wordpress and Marketing Automation/Communication tools (Hubspot and ActOn preferred)

Most travel is within the local area and may be outside of normal work hours.This job description may be subject to change at any time.What To Expect NextWe look forward to receiving your application. Title: Event Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Wunderman ThompsonDepartment: MarketingLocation: Wunderman Thompson Studios - North America,Last Updated: ${ new Date('2023-07-12T11:26:56-04:00').toLocaleDateString() }Who we are:At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience.We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology.Event Marketing CoordinatorWunderman Thompson Studios, North AmericaLocation: North America (Any primary office in the USA)Who we are:At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience. We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology.Company Background:Wunderman Thompson was created in 2019 through the WPP merger of creative agency, J. Walter Thompson, and data-driven marketing shop, Wunderman, as part of an effort to maximize the group’s ability to create genuinely integrate solutions for clients that drive growth and stand out in a complex world of rising consumer expectations and disruptive technology. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, the agency is made up of experts across a wide range of disciplines—including CX, data and insights, CRM, brand consulting, creative development and production, technology, XP, and commerce—that all work together to deliver truly groundbreaking and revolutionary work, driving the mission of Inspiring Growth for Ambitious Brands.Globally, the group is 20,000 strong in 90 markets. As a team, they bring together creative storytelling diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities in service of making a meaningful impact on clients’ businesses. In the United States and Canada, the agency is made up of more 3,500 experts spread out across the continent, from Boston to Atlanta, New York to Seattle, Chicago to Dallas. They mix creative, data and technology to help clients—including Best Buy, T-Mobile. Con Ed, Amazon, Volkswagen & Audi, Samsung, Unilever, Nestle and Microsoft (to name just a few) to navigate the ever-changing digital and physical world. Wunderman Thompson was recently named Integrated Agency of the Year by Campaign in UK . In 2021, they won Innovation Grand Prix at Cannes for its work with Degree deodorant. The agency is led by Mel Edwards, Global CEO, and in the US, by Audrey Melofchik, CEO US.https://www.wundermanthompson.com/Wunderman Thompson Studios (a Wunderman Thompson Division) is a digital and content production capability that runs and optimizes marketing ecosystems for clients through a borderless network of global studios. We localize, adapt, and extend content by harnessing the power of our clients' Martech platforms, bringing together content management and brand personalization at a global scale. We design bespoke service models by utilizing industry-leading production and operation models to automate and optimize client businesses. By linking clients, partners, workflow, global assets, and compliance, we deliver rapid adoption and ease of use all in one. Our centers of excellence include experts in DCO, transcreation, RPA, AI, and machine learning, and accessibility.We’re the heartbeat behind brand operations, pulsing 24/7https://www.wundermanthompson.com/expertise/studiosThe Role:Are you experienced with coordinating events? Can you collaborate with a range of teams, stakeholders and clients? Do you have a strong sense of initiative, an eye for detail and a passion for perfectly executed events? Would you like to help drive impactful activities as part of Wunderman Thompson’s work for a leading, global technology company? Then you might be just the Marketing Event Coordinator we’re looking for!What will your day look like? In the role as Marketing Event Coordinator, you will be the point of contact when it comes to the execution of all virtual and in-person marketing events, and you will be the subject matter expert in modern marketing tools and services in the brand space. You will be responsible for bringing together different elements in order to execute event briefs in a joint approach, which addresses client objectives and business challenges. More specifically, your tasks will include:Responsibilities: Project coordination, execution and management of in-person and virtual events. This includes attending on-site events, ensure control, pace and execution on time as well as creation and management of all related collateral and materials (e.g. decks, videos, traditional media, etc.) Will act as the subject matter expert on event platforms in conjunction with internal and external corporate supportTrain marketer on the utility of event platforms and educate local stakeholders on event services, tools and capabilities Will own the overall planning of the event lifecycle, including preparation of all related materials and collateral, coordinating dry runs for each event, identifying and solving potential issues before events, reporting on and escalating issues to obtain needed support, etc. Reporting to provide specific reviews and information to stakeholders, including budgeting, spending, etc. Obtaining insights and analyzing marketing activities to find patterns, best practices, and building and improving efficiencies Ensure a strong client-agency relationship; ongoing efforts to improve client satisfaction and assist with the growth of the client accountDevelop a deep understanding of the clients’ business and marketing objectives is crucial, specifically when it comes to the projects you will own 
Requirements:The ideal candidate must have an appreciation and interest in marketing automation and related technology for digital as well as in-person events. They will be a team player who can collaborate with various groups and disciplines on both a regional and global level. They must be detail-oriented, with the ability to think through the right workflows, while simultaneously managing a large volume of operational tasks to support the event focus within the company. In addition, they must have: A bachelor’s degree combined with an event and/or marketing background 1-3+ years of experience with project and/or marketing event coordination Excellent client-management, client-facing and event focused project management skills with the ability to coordinate with multiple teams and stakeholders Possess a strong sense of personal initiative, proactivity and the ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlinesA demonstrated interest in working in a global, fast-paced environment Excellent adaptation skills and the ability to re-focus and reprioritize whenever needed Ability to become a leader in personalized customer/consumer and brand experiences 
Our division is a world-leading Center of Excellence that helps Fortune 500 businesses humanize the relationship between their brands and their target customer through hyper Personalization at scale, Marketing Automation and CRM.With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer centric.Our Behaviors: We believe we are what we do, not just what we say. Our behaviors show how to bring the Wunderman Thompson culture to life through the actions we take every day. Listening – We see conversation as a chance to discover and understand, not get a point across.In It Together – We’re at our best when we work together: with our clients, with our colleagues and with our partners.Creative Bravery – We challenge convention in every aspect of our work. Creative describes how we act, not the department we sit in.Positivity – We seek solutions to problems and always find a way forward. We bring passion and energy to every situation we encounter.
Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency. For more information, please visit our website and follow Wunderman Thompson on our social channels: Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram.Wunderman Thompson is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to attracting and retaining the most qualified employees regardless of race, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, age or disability. As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve.Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency.  For more information, please visit our website and follow Wunderman Thompson on our social channels via Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Position Summary: This position supports the work of YMCA of the Rockies, which operates a mission-based family and group conference and retreat center and overnight summer camp for youth, serving more than 225,000 guests and over 2,200 campers annually. The Marketing Coordinator will work with the Marketing & Communications Manager and the Marketing team to create and maintain all owned media for YMCA of the Rockies, including website, blog, newsletters / emails, all written guest communication, printed materials and signage. Essential Functions: Craft guest communications with an end goal of booking a stay Assist with gathering content, writing, and producing newsletters Compose social copy in collaboration with Social Media Strategist Make website updates as needed / assigned Update and maintain lodging listings on YMCA website, property management system and OTA sites Develop user generated content process in collaboration with Marketing Team Update KPI reports regularly with owned media metrics Create and order YMCA branded swag for giveaways, etc. Monitor and oversee YMCA branded products for adherence to brand guidelines Audience research / identify new markets Blog production Assist marketing team with other duties as needed 
Essential Requirements:  Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations or other relevant field; or two years of experience in a professional marketing / communications role Ability to craft compelling marketing copy Creative ability to establish marketing / communications strategies to reach a broad audience with a variety of technical abilities and access Self-motivated and able to thrive in a fast-moving, complicated, challenging environment Ability to handle multiple tasks at the same time and meet deadlines Ability to develop positive, supportive and effective working relationships with internal and external colleagues Motivation and commitment to work independently and be self-directed Complete projects in a timely and efficient manner Must comply with Association service principles and service standards Possess a valid, USA state issued driver’s license, an acceptable driving record, and comply with YMCA driving rules to be approved to operate YMCA vehicles Ability to work cooperatively with others in a diverse environment Support the Association safety program Promote safe work practices and a safe environment for guests, members and staff 
Compensation Package & Employee Perks: Health, dental, and life insuranceGenerous PTO/VacationParticipation in YMCA Retirement Fund (an additional 12% contribution by YMCA after 2 years employment)Employer owned rental housing may be available nearby - Contact Human Resources for more informationYMCA of the Rockies membershipDiscounted childcare, summer day camp, and summer overnight campDiscounted nights at YMCA of the Rockies lodges for friends & familySki passes to nearby resortsFree or discounted gear rentals for outdoor adventures

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription: Digital Marketing SpecialistAre you passionate about marketing and have a love for bread? Breadsmith is seeking a talented Digital Marketing Specialist to join our dynamic team. About Breadsmith Franchising:Breadsmith Franchising (BFI) is more than just a franchise bakery company - we are a small, tight-knit team of passionate individuals who share a love for the highest quality artisan breads and sweets made without additives or preservatives. We’re dedicated to upholding the highest quality standards while providing support to our franchisees, helping them achieve success in their businesses. We focus on teamwork, professionalism, and extraordinary customer service. We’re invested in our community, and at the end of each day, Breadsmith donates its unsold baked goods to local food pantries. Honest and genuine communication is a cornerstone of our company culture. Join us and learn more about exceptional handcrafted baked goods made using time-honored techniques and quality ingredients.Position Responsibilities:As the Digital Marketing Specialist for BFI, you’ll provide support for our franchise system and our corporate stores as outlined below.·       Collaborate closely with the Franchisee and Retail Marketing Specialist to enhance marketing efforts, leveraging their expertise to develop store-specific marketing campaigns, advertising strategies, loyalty programs, and online ordering support.·       Utilize your in-depth knowledge of digital media, online ordering, email marketing, and the loyalty program to drive growth and success for the Breadsmith system.·       Occasional travel requirements - approximately 2-3 trips per year - for conducting market visits to gain valuable insights into different markets. ·       Provide comprehensive support for new store openings, including training for the Breadsmith Rewards loyalty program.·       Serve as the primary contact for requests between stores and the loyalty vendor to ensure smooth operations of the Breadsmith Rewards program.·       Offer technical support to stores for the Breadsmith Rewards program, addressing customer-related issues, in-store operations, and promotions.·       Evaluate and determine overall loyalty program updates to enhance the effectiveness of our loyalty initiatives. Identify opportunities for improvement and implement strategic changes to optimize the Breadsmith Rewards program.·       Leverage Breadsmith Rewards program data and customer engagement insights to develop new automated campaigns for stores, utilizing automation tools to optimize customer communication and drive sales.·       Develop a comprehensive strategy for digital gift card sales and SMS campaigns for Breadsmith Rewards, leveraging customer insights to maximize effectiveness.·       Leverage social media platforms, (primarily Facebook) to maximize engagement on a corporate level, and for the Milwaukee Market stores. This involves creating and curating engaging content, managing social media accounts, analyzing metrics to optimize performance, and staying up to date with the latest social media trends. A working understanding of social media management platforms such as Hootsuite is a bonus.·       Create and execute an effective communication strategy for emailing Breadsmith Rewards program members in the Milwaukee Market, aimed at driving customer retention and incremental sales. This includes developing compelling email content, segmenting the customer base, analyzing email performance metrics, and continuously optimizing the email marketing strategy.·       Handle Breadsmith Rewards billing and invoicing to ensure accuracy, while monitoring the overall cost of the program.·       Enhance the online ordering platform by implementing win back campaigns to re-engage inactive customers and increase sales.·       Provide in-store assistance during peak seasons such as Thanksgiving and Christmas, ensuring smooth operations and exceptional customer experience.·       Collaborate closely with the Marketing, Operations, and Graphics Department to ensure the effective execution of marketing strategies, maintaining brand consistency and alignment.·       Create and write compelling copy for various purposes such as internal guidance, product descriptions, staff training, system updates, promotions, advertisements, and website content. ·       Collaborate closely with other departments to ensure the corporate and guest-facing websites are up to date. Having a working knowledge of Google Analytics and SEO is a bonus, as it will help maximize the impact of the content.·       Assist with franchise development by contributing to the overall marketing strategy for attracting and targeting new franchisees. This includes identifying target markets, developing targeted messaging, and implementing effective marketing campaigns to attract potential franchisees.  The Ideal Candidate Will Have: ·       Bachelor’s degree in marketing or a related field.·       Minimum 2 years of experience in marketing.·       Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects efficiently in a fast-paced environment.·       Excellent communication skills to effectively advocate for ideas, plans, and priorities.·       Proficiency in digital marketing.·       Effective time management skills with adaptability and flexibility.·       Attention to detail.·       Decisiveness.·       Creativity.·       Resourcefulness (as our stores do not have big marketing budgets).·       Enthusiasm and dedication, as this role may require long hours and travel.·       Ability to cultivate and maintain relationships as a team player within the corporate office and franchisees.Top Benefits of Working for Breadsmith:·       Enjoy complimentary delicious Breadsmith products.·       Embrace a hybrid work environment.·       Celebrate your birthday with a well-deserved day off.·       Roth IRA with company match·       Seven paid holidays·       Phone allowance·       Incredible culture and coworkersLocation: This role is based out of our corporate office, located on Silver Spring Drive, in Whitefish Bay, WI.

Title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Social Media Marketing Specialist (Entry Level)Position Description:We are seeking a highly motivated and creative Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our dynamic marketing team at Minitab. In this role, you will assist in the design and execution of social media campaigns, create engaging content for various platforms, and support our overall marketing efforts. You will also leverage our social channels to build and support a new Minitab online community. You will be evaluated based on creativity, productivity, collaboration and ability to drive followers, community members and engagement across all of our social channels. The ideal candidate is passionate about digital and content marketing, possesses excellent communication skills, and has a keen eye for detail.Responsibilities:  Assist with the design and execution of social media campaigns to drive brand awareness and engagement. Create weekly and monthly editorial calendars to promote company brands on various social media websites. Create a weekly and monthly community calendar to promote company community events, live events, content and Minitab updates.Post (at least) daily social posts across multiple channels, track daily, weekly, monthly and annual social media engagement metrics to identify high-performing ideas and campaigns for scalability. Provide support to the marketing team during live and online events. Perform research on social media marketing trends and best practices. Assist in developing influencer campaign strategies and collaborate with influencers for brand promotion. Monitor and respond to comments and direct messages on social media platforms to engage with the audience. Brainstorm and research ideas for original content that aligns with the company's target audience and marketing objectives. Create visually appealing graphics to share across social media channels. Write compelling social media captions that effectively communicate the brand's message. Collaborate with the team to create and edit short-form videos for social media platforms. Develop new strategies and initiatives to increase audience engagement and reach. Ensure brand message and tone of voice are consistent across all social media platforms and marketing materials. 
Attributes: Strong written and verbal communication skills. Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative ideas. Detail-oriented and able to maintain consistency in brand messaging. Proficient in social media platforms and knowledgeable about current trends. Ability to work collaboratively within a team and adapt to changing priorities. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Enthusiastic and self-motivated with a passion for digital marketing. 
Experience:  1-2 years of experience in social media marketing or content creation (internships or relevant coursework will be considered). Familiarity with social media management tools and analytics platforms. Familiarity with community building tools and platforms.Basic knowledge of graphic design software and video editing tools. Experience in conducting market research and analyzing data. Understanding of SEO and content optimization strategies. 
Education:  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field (equivalent experience will be considered). Join our team at Minitab and contribute to our mission of delivering impactful content to our audience through innovative social media marketing strategies. 
NOTE: Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination is required for all positions that require person-to-person contact with customers, partners, and vendors.

Title: Director Marketing Product Management
JobDescription:
We're hiring a Director, Marketing Product Management!About This PositionThe Director of Product Management will lead a team to implement the vision and strategy for new product development and product lifecycle management of existing products. They will incorporate customer insights, research, and concept development with market analysis, industry intelligence, and the voice of the customers to create product category roadmaps and innovate new products and enhancements. The Director of Product Management will partner with internal stakeholders, including marketing, sales, operations, finance, and regulations, to ensure the new and existing products meet development targets and support the organizational financial goals. At the same time, partner with the field and marketing focus groups. They will be accountable for managing and performing the assigned product category profit and loss throughout the entire product lifecycle. This position is not limited to innovation/renovation and will be expected to contribute to strategic projects, including brand positioning, customer retention, and customer engagement.Who will love this job? A people person, you are a customer-focused individual who can understand others. A talent steward, you drive and optimize team performance, engagement, and productivity by empowering and developing each individual within your team. As a project manager, you have the discipline and creativity to turn ideas into a project plan based on business goals and execute it on time. 
What You'll Do You develop and drive a product roadmap to support the organization's vision and strategy for its assigned product category. You're accountable for leading the development of new concepts which deliver on the critical customer, ambassador, and internal needs and align with the brand strategy. You provide management with analysis and consistent reports of product category performance, including sales volume/revenue compared to baseline/budget. You develop budgets and forecasts for existing and new products on the roadmap to support the annual budgeting process. You're accountable for adherence to the assigned product category P&L goals. Partner with operations and finance to determine and drive opportunities to meet or exceed annual product and category budget numbers. You partner with Product Marketing, Sales, and R&D to develop highly effective positioning that differentiates Plexus products from a competitive marketplace and develop a go-to-market strategy and support plan for each launch. You will collaborate with operations, finance, and sales teams to manage the assigned products and product categories in a fiscally responsible manner (e.g., reducing excess inventory, SKU optimization/rationalization, and forecasting). You assist in identifying and driving product promotion strategies for responsible categories to achieve incremental sales (e.g., gifts with purchase, holiday offers, cross-promotions, etc.)You assist in building internal capabilities that allow for stronger management. You're a resource and mentor for the rest of the product management team. You track the marketplace to learn of and implement best practices. 
You should have You have a bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. You have 7+ years of product marketing and/or product management, three years as a manager, and 8+ years leading people. You have 9+ years in product marketing, specifically with a nutritional, weight loss, or skin care company preferred. You have a passion for creating an extraordinary business opportunity, cares about people, and wants to be a part of something bigger. You have strong analytical skills to evaluate marketing, sales, and financial opportunities. You demonstrate strong strategic and creative skills, as well as communication skills, as they will champion the project assigned. You can work in a fast-paced role that requires individuals to manage multiple projects simultaneously while working across company functions with many different people and teams. You collaborate with others and thrive in a team environment while meeting individual goals and expectations. You anticipate obstacles, communicate effectively and plan accordingly. Adept at providing solutions and working in cross-functional areas to facilitate the successful completion of projects. You can contribute to the professional development of a team and provide innovative leadership. You bring high energy, remain positive in a dynamic organization, and lead high-performing teams. You value relationships and can influence others to develop relationships reflected in continuously positive experiences. 
About PlexusPlexus Worldwide is a leading direct-sales company founded in Scottsdale, Arizona, where it remains a top employer and economic driver. For the past 14 years, Plexus has been focused on igniting hope, health, and happiness, through their science-backed nutritional products and skincare, as well as an exciting home-based entrepreneurial opportunity.As a 6-time Best Places to Work winner, the company enjoys a strong organizational culture and has a deep commitment to giving back to communities in need.Our Core ValuesWe contribute to the overall growth and success of Plexus by embracing the Plexus core values: We are One Plexus. We are accountable. We get the job done right. We empower others.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Our goal is to be the best retailer in USA in the eyes of our customers, associates, and business partners.  We would love to have you join the Scheels team! OverviewThe Marketing Leader will elevate the SCHEELS brand through strategic community engagement, manage local marketing initiatives and create programs that will increase store traffic, engage the consumer and enhance the consumer’s experience. The associate will work directly with the Store Leader to determine strategies that align with store goals.What It Takes To Be a Scheels Expert Customer Service   Genuinely and consistently treat co-workers, customers and business partners like they are the most important person including eye contact, a smile and a genuine “Thank you” 
 Culture   Approach daily tasks, projects and follow-up communication with energy and sense of urgency  Cultivate a deep desire to become a knowledge expert in their role with the ability to apply their knowledge and experience with great impact  Show respect and appreciation for others and Scheels  Arrive to work and meetings 10 minutes early 
 Team Mentality   Genuine interest and action in helping others before yourself, regardless of recognition or reward 
 Teach-ability   Consistent eagerness to listen, learn, apply knowledge and accept critical feedback  Ability to adapt to a changing work environment  Ability to apply concepts of basic math, grammar, punctuation and spelling 
 Dress Code   Meets Scheels dress and grooming expectations in support of professional, clean and welcoming environment for customers, co-workers and business partners 
 Efficiency   Demonstrate pride and ownership of their work while meeting expected deadlines 
The Essentials  Identify and direct local community outreach opportunities  Serve as the scheduling manager to ensure that SCHEELS’ associates are present at relevant community events  Serve as a representative for SCHEELS at community events by upholding the highest standards in conduct and appearance  Mange donor requests  Identify local media opportunities via print, TV and radio  Evaluate effectiveness of marketing initiatives  Have a clear understanding of the SCHEELS brand and culture  Manage and enhance pre-print promotions within the store  Determine and direct programs including budget, advertising and staff needs  Identify opportunities to share the SCHEELS story  Evaluate all Marketing endeavors  Create annual strategy of events that promote and align with the store’s goals and creates customer and store iteration  Execute events to drive sales, traffic and community good-will  Serve as the store liaison with Corporate Marketing Office to maximize and align marketing strategies  Experience in marketing; and ability to think strategically and creatively  Exercise sound judgment and tact as it relates to interactions with consumers, SCHEELS associates and the community  Strong oral/ written communication and presentation skills to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization and with external audiences  Leadership and/or management experience preferred  Professional in appearance and attitude  Ability to work assigned schedule which may include varied hours, evening, weekends and holidays; some travel, including overnight stays  Must possess a valid driver’s license 
Expert ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field; two – five years of related experience: or equivalent combination of degree and experience.ActivityMust be able to sit, stand, bend at the waist, climb, stoop, kneel, crouch, reach, walk, push/pull, lift, talk, and hear with or without reasonable accommodation Medium work –  Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objectsScheels cares about the health and safety of our Associates. Associates are expected to follow all safety procedures and perform their job duties in a fashion that minimizes the risk of injuryScheduleMust be flexible to work assigned schedule between 9a.m. and 9p.m., Monday through Saturday, 10a.m. and 6p.m., Sunday. Schedule may include varied hours, evenings, weekends, and holidays, must be available minimum of three weekends a month. Average hours per week is  40  hours.BenefitsScheels offers a complete benefits package to include:  Employee Stock Ownership Program  Associate Discount  Health & Dental Insurance  Short Term & Long Term Disability Insurance  All State Accident Insurance  Employee Assistance Program  Paid Time Off  Holiday Pay  401(K)/Roth(K)  Maternity Leave  Bereavement  Vision

Title: Event Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
TALLADEGA SUPERSPEEDWAYTalladega Superspeedway was created as a palace of speed in 1969 by NASCAR founder Bill France, Sr., who coined it “the Greatest Race Track in the World.” At a mammoth 2.66-miles with 33 degrees of banking in the turns, it is NASCAR’s Most Competitive venue. The “Fun” track prides itself on being family friendly, especially with the introduction of the Talladega Garage Experience in 2019 where guests are immersed into motorsports like never before. The host of two major NASCAR weekends a year, the iconic ribbon of asphalt is easy accessible off I-20, located between Birmingham, AL, and Atlanta, GA.NASCAR is seeking an Event Marketing Assistant who will assist in all facets of marketing events at Talladega Superspeedway. Based in Talladega, AL, at Talladega Superspeedway, this key role on our team is responsible for a variety of functions in support of the famous 2.66-mile venue, plus assisting the other NASCAR Southeast Region tracks (Daytona International Speedway and Homestead-Miami Speedway). This position will report to Talladega’s Event Marketing and Business Operations departments. The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented with a strong willingness to learn, desire to work in a fast-paced environment, and ability to work long hours. Some travel is also required.This position will be responsible for the following: Learning the intricacies of the Talladega Superspeedway brand and Event Marketing Department while strengthening his or her own professional attributesResearching and developing new marketing ideas to expand current brand initiativesManaging grassroots events, including seeking out opportunities, programming, and leading activations leading up to TSS Fall and Spring race weekendsAssisting the Event Marketing Manager with media promotions and activations, including managing the relationships with radio and TV outletsAssisting in all facets of TSS NASCAR weekends, including fan events and activations, as well as Kid’s VIP programming, etc. Analyzing fan experiences throughout the sports industry to enhance weekend event programming at Talladega and across the Southeast RegionCultivating ideas to improve fan engagement using digital outlets & social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.)Strategizing with the Marketing team on ways to better engage with the millennial audience and draw in new and diverse fansAssisting in developing content and messaging ideas for social media leading up to and during promotional events and race weekendsAssisting in developing content and messaging ideas for emails directed to fansOther duties as assigned
Events to include: YellaWood 500 Event Weekend (September 30-Oct 1, 2023) – Talladega SuperspeedwayGEICO 500 Event Weekend (April TBD, 2024) – Talladega Superspeedway
To participate in this role, individuals should be enrolled in college courses or have graduated within the last 12 months. Flexible start/end dates, 24 plus hours per week, with some evenings and weekends required. Race week and event weekend hours will vary. Availability is required August 1st through October 15th, 2023, and February 27th through May 3rd, 2024. Must have excellent driving record for operating company vehicles.Part Time | Housing not providedTravel to other Southeast Region events outside of Talladega, if required, will be paid for by the Company.Qualifications: Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing or Sports ManagementStrong organizational and communication skills A strong worth ethic and willingness to learn and understand NASCAR brand requirements and protocols, as well as sales systems, databases, and partnership management/activation A team player who is committed to the success of the eventsStrong attention to detail and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environmentProficiency in multiple computer programs (Adobe, Microsoft Word, Power Point, Excel, etc.)Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays Willingness to learn and maintain a positive attitudeDesire to engage with fans and oversee data cultivation at offsite eventsAbility to lift over 50 lbs. 
Previous event or sports experience and basic knowledge of motorsports and NASCAR a plusApply Now!Learn more about this role and our team by applying at www.careers.nascar.com for consideration.We are a company unlike any other. We want you to bring your experience, skills and passion to our close-knit, high-energy environment in which our employees thrive and where you can prosper. We know the key to our success is our employees and we offer highly competitive salaries, a solid benefits package focused on wellness, and opportunities for you to grow and develop both personally and professionally. It won’t take you long to find out that you are on the right track here at NASCAR!NASCAR is committed to fostering a diverse work environment where all employees feel valued and empowered. NASCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). We seek to attract and retain the best qualified people available. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any basis that is protected by applicable law except where a bona fide occupational qualification exists.Follow us on Twitter @NASCARJobs to stay current on all of our openings.

Title: Product Marketing Manager, Compressor Technique - Rock Hill, SC
JobDescription: Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations. Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow. Your Role Mission Promote the development and growth of the product line through the development and successful implementation of business development and marketing communications plans and excellent customer support and service. Roles and Responsibilities Product responsibilities: Oil free rotary screw and tooth air compressors. Business Development (40%) In consultation with the Business Line Manager/Vice President and Business Development Managers to create and implement business development and marketing communications plans. Present plans to Regional Vice Presidents and Sales Managers and coordinate/motivate sales efforts to achieve established growth and sales goals. Provide monthly reports to management regarding the effectiveness of business plan implementation in achieving sales goals. These reports should include information about the development of the prospect and sales platform, as well as orders achieved. Additional focus on gaining market share through these efforts is of great importance. Marketing Communications (40%)Develop and distribute product price lists and relevant technical data to regional sales. Develop and implement informational session and training programs as required to achieve business development goals. The training will be geared towards educating the sales managers on the product and selling techniques. Create quotation standards and systems to ensure excellent, prompt response to customer inquiries. Review competitor positions and create competitor comparison reports. Based on these reports, provide recommendation to management regarding products that could/should be developed. Additionally monitor competitor pricing to make sure we are competitive in our pricing model. Customer Service (20%)Review and respond promptly to customer and sales staff inquiries relevant to the product line. Develop an understanding and collect information, as appropriate, to clarify the needs of the customer or the sales group to better facilitate addressing those needs and expectations. Develop rapport with the sales team through effective communication, interpersonal skills, and professionalism, and strengthen the relationship between sales team and marketing team through ensuring a high standard of customer response. Professional Development (5%)Through training and development, remain current in the product knowledge and sales/marketing skills necessary to be effective in the position. Contribute to positive Company branding by projecting a knowledgeable, professional, and customer-oriented image to customers. Perform all duties in accordance with Atlas Copco standards, while always striving to understand the needs and expectations of the customer. Take whatever action is appropriate and required to get the job done and to establish and maintain communications with all people/employees considered necessary to get the job done. Perform other duties as assigned. To succeed, you will need Qualifications Supervisory Responsibility None Experience 5 years of relevant experience in sales and marketing of technical, industrial equipment (preferably compressed air equipment). Proven ability to successfully achieve sales goals and implement business development planning. Education 4-year Engineering, Business, or Marketing degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Skills Must be a self-directed team player, who has a positive attitude, can motivate those around them, and is service oriented. Must also have excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel and Power Point, experience in SAP applications would be an advantage. Some travel to support field sales activities will be required. Travel Up to 25% overnight travel. In return, we offer you Required. Drive your Career, Explore Opportunities, Realize your Passion . . . Choose your career with us Attractive benefits Include: Excellent compensation package, including a flexible benefits plan, and generous 401 (k) retirement plan Health insurance/ Dental insurance/ Vision insurance Competitive paid time off Commission elegible Monthly Car Allowance Annual Bonus $75,000 - $85,000 base salary. Salary based on knowledge, skills, and experience and has been geographically adjusted. Drive your Career, Explore Opportunities, Realize your Passion . . . Choose your career with us Attractive benefits Include: Excellent compensation package, including a flexible benefits plan, and generous 401 (k) retirement plan Health insurance/ Dental insurance/ Vision insurance Competitive paid time off Commission elegible Monthly Car Allowance Annual Bonus $85,000 - $95,000 base salary. Title: Marketing & Administrative Brokerage Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job TitleMarketing & Administrative Brokerage CoordinatorJob Description SummaryThe Brokerage Coordinator will report to the Office Manager and will serve as the support for the fee-earner and/or team. This position is responsible for support and management of client service activities such as pitch and proposals, transaction support, and fee-earner administrative support. The Brokerage Coordinator will interact with various departments within the organization on behalf of the fee-earner to ensure they are able to meet the needs of their clients.ResponsibilitiesJob Description Work with the Centers of Excellence (COE’s) to create and edit the content of marketing materials and presentations to include flyers, corporate leasing proposals, case studies, property touring presentations, property surveys, email blasts, invitations, and website content using Adobe InDesignEdit content of brochures, flyers, and floor plans for exclusive building listings and manage the printing and binding of books for the teamPartner with the COE’s to create and coordinate initial listing presentations and broker opinion of valuePartner with the COE’s to design, animate, and produce client presentations by utilizing multiple forms of graphics including uploading and color adjustment of photosPartner with the COE’s to draw site plans/floorplans if needed with the aid of Adobe InDesignPartner with the COE’s to manipulate and annotate aerial and map data in PowerPointSupport content creation process with regards to timeline and production cycleAssist in draft, review and analysis of lease/sale documents, maintaining edits and updating SalesforceCoordinate with other departments and utilize various resources based on the needs of the fee-earnerProvide marketing, transaction, and administrative supportPrepare deal documents and submit for deal processingPrepare and submit expense reports on behalf of fee earnersManage client event preparation as neededAssist with all other administrative tasks required by the fee earnersExercise discretion and independent judgment in the performance of job duties listed above.

Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Olson Kundig is a design practice founded on the ideas that buildings can serve as a bridge between nature, culture and people, and that inspiring surroundings have a positive effect on people’s lives. The firm’s work can be found across the globe, with projects as wide-ranging as huts to high rises, homes—often for art collectors—to academic, cultural and civic projects, museums and exhibition design, places of worship, creative production, urban design, and interior design.Currently we are seeking a Marketing Assistant for our Seattle office to support the marketing team and firm’s overall marketing efforts.Primary Responsibilities include: Maintain and update marketing information databases.Support quarterly and annual marketing reporting. Schedule, prepare for and follow-up on marketing team meetings, as well as external marketing meetings. Assist awards efforts, including tracking, gathering materials and submissions. Coordinate in-house and external events, lectures, and juries for team members. Assist with special projects such as books, installations, exhibitions.Support the marketing team in a variety of tasks, such as production coordination, event planning, photoshoot support needs, business development initiatives, travel logistics, scanning, filing, inventory, etc. Support data tracking and reporting for new project leads, current pursuits, and industry-related news.Support market and other research as needed.
Required Qualifications: 1+ years of experience working in a professional work environment.Excellent written and verbal skills required (grammar, technical writing, and information gathering).Organized, flexible, and responsible self-starter who enjoys a dynamic, team atmosphere and is able to work with and take direction from multiple levels of professional staff with differing professional styles.Strong attention to detail and the ability to organize complex content.Ability to multi-task in a deadline-driven atmosphere without a loss in quality.Proficient with Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, English, Marketing, Communications, or other business-related specialty preferred.Familiarity with Adobe InDesign and Smartsheets a plus, but not required.Knowledge of architecture, engineering, or construction field helpful, but not required.
In addition to a dynamic and creative culture, Olson Kundig provides a generous benefits package that includes 16 days of paid time off, paid holidays, health plan, 401k match, bonuses, profit-sharing plans for qualified positions, a monthly travel subsidy for public transportation, and more.As a firm, we are committed to pay practices that are fair, competitive, and reflect internal pay equity. At the time of posting this job, the hiring range for this position in Seattle is between $60,000 and $70,000 annually. Final salary decisions are made based upon the extent and relatedness of the candidate’s education and experience and considering internal equity and external market factors.COVID-19 considerations: Full COVID-19 vaccination required or an approved medical or religious exemption.All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship and must already possess long-term work authorization.
