Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Why Work with Us? For many people, it's the opportunity to work for an inclusive, local, values driven business that provides healthy, delicious, and sustainable foods to their community; it's also about people - the ability to work with a great team to create amazing customer experiences. Whatever your reason for joining us, know this, working with us makes a difference!Position SummaryThe Marketing Specialist serves a critical role in the success of the coop. The position supports the Marketing Director to ensure effective and visually appealing press releases, advertising, and social media efforts. They will develop creative marketing plans and strategies based on research, consumer behavior, and industry standards to increase brand awareness, attract, and retain customers, member owners, and team members. Specific areas of accountability include customer service, communications, marketing content and creation, design, social media management, analytics, marketing department maintenance and sustaining a welcoming and inclusive environment for all. This role requires strong communication, strategic thinking, collaboration, problem solving, superior attention to detail, organization, intercultural competence, and multi-tasking /prioritization skills as well as customer service, adaptability, initiative, self-awareness, resiliency, judgment, and integrity. Reports to: Marketing DirectorLocation: Partially Remote; 622 Selby Ave, Saint Paul, MN 55104Schedule: Monday - Friday. Occasional weekend or evening hours required.Qualifications Education: Degree, coursework or certificate in marketing, communications, or relevant field Industry Experience: Experience working in a marketing or communications field including campaign management, content strategy and creation, social media management, analytics, and design Writing: Strong copywriting, business writing, and proofreading skills Project Management: Ability to successfully manage projects with cross-functional teams, collaborating and building strong effective relationships Marketing Content & Creation: Experience in creating engaging content for social media, email newsletters, signage, and website content management utilizing creativity and customer insights Communication: Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication skills, including public speaking and presentations Customer Service: Ability to provide excellent customer service including positive interactions, responsiveness, and follow-through Initiative: Ability to assess situations, identify problems and opportunities, and take action Culturally Competent: Cultural competency and the commitment to work with diverse populations and other stakeholders Computer Skills: Ability to utilize internet quickly and accurately, email, word processing, graphics and multimedia, spreadsheets with formulas and databases; create slideshows in PowerPoint, formulas in Excel, Mail Merge in Microsoft Office 
Preferred Qualifications:  Design: General understanding of layout, color, photo editing including use of tools such as Canva, Adobe (Photoshop, Illustrator) Multilingual

Title: Marketing Coordinator - Graphic Design/Website Management
JobDescription:
Baird Holm is seeking a Marketing Coordinator with 3-5 years of experience in marketing with an emphasis on graphic design and website management to join our Marketing team. The Marketing Coordinator works closely with the Marketing Director and other department members to identify, develop and implement marketing and communications strategies that support the firm's strategic initiatives and growth objectives. Because we are a small team, you will get the opportunity to contribute to a wide variety of marketing initiatives, including design, social media, website management, events and more. The Marketing department is responsible for communications that promote brand awareness and the reputation of the firm to clients and the community; this position also supports internal firm communication needs.This Graphic Design/Website Management Marketing Coordinator position directly contributes to the firm's communications, public relations, branding, advertising, website management, designing and maintaining firm collateral, and RFP support.Essential Duties/ResponsibilitiesPublic Relations/Advertising: Evaluates and develops editorial and public relations opportunities for the firm; prepares and distributes firm publicity and announcements; coordinates media requests for interviews.Works with attorneys to develop content for publications; promote published articles.Coordinates response to external surveys (Best Lawyers, Chambers, Benchmark Litigation, Vault) and directory listings.Develops and manages annual print advertising plan and editorial calendar.Designs firm advertising templates (ads, html emails, flyers, invitations) using InDesign and Photoshop; acts as the in-house Graphic Artist with ongoing training.Manages relationships with advertising and other related agencies.
Business Development/Marketing Collateral Acts as the lead for marketing content management; ensures content is consistently edited in all tactics and mediums (including bios, practice section descriptions, general firm verbiage, etc.).Manages the creation and maintenance of attorney and paralegal biographies and headshots.Manages the creation and maintenance of practice section descriptions.Coordinates the release of approximately five monthly practice online newsletters
Date:
gaining approvals and posting articles online.Coordinates, reviews, edits and designs responses to RFPs, including print and presentations.Works with attorneys to design, write and produce other marketing materials, as needed.
Marketing Technology Oversees the daily management of the firm website for branding, content, user experience, accuracy and freshness using WordPress. Fixes errors, adds new content, and ensures proper functionality.Produces quarterly reports tracking website usage.Assists with the coordination, production, editing, and promotion of the firm's internal and external podcasts.Provides support for the firm's social media presence according to State Bar Association guidelines; monitors social media sites and responds as appropriate.
Other Coordinates all internal and external requests for marketing materials, logos.Maintains department's filing and catalogue systems; updates marketing database.Ensures appropriate content is posted to the firm's portal for internal communications.Assists with firm-sponsored events- including planning, design needs, and onsite assistance.Provides assistance for other marketing efforts and supports needs of the department as requested.
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Desired Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in a marketing position; bachelor's degree in marketing, communications or related field is preferred.Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to write press releases, web copy and other communications.Strong project management skills with a meticulous attention to details; ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks at once.Strong computer skills with intermediate knowledge of MS Office applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.Experience in desktop publishing, including InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Adobe Creative Suite 6 is preferred; experience with WordPress website content management system.Experience with podcast production and editing programs. Interpersonal skills necessary in order to maintain effective relationships with attorneys, team members, staff and clients.Possess a professional image and the ability to represent the firm in a positive, business-like manner both internally and externally in the business community.Proactive, enthusiastic, adaptable and action-oriented.
Benefits Include Health InsuranceHealth Savings AccountDental InsuranceVision InsurancePaid Time OffHoliday PayFree Covered Parking401(k)Profit Sharing PlanMental Wellness BenefitsLife InsuranceDisability InsuranceParental LeaveEmployee Referral Program
Salary: Collateral, Graphic Arts, Headshot Photography, Internal Communications, Marketing Materials, Newsletters, Podcasting, Press Releases, Public Relations, Website Administration

Title: Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
WHY DIAMOND GAME?When you work at Diamond Game you are part of a diverse, forward thinking, technology focused gaming organization. Diamond Game employees work alongside one another as part of an engaged team, making contributions at all levels to ensure the highest quality and standards.As a Diamond Game employee, you are afforded growth opportunities, career mentoring and valuable work experience. Diamond Game appreciates and encourages growth within the organization, knowing it's our talent that keeps us moving forward.Career development, remote and hybrid work schedules, a robust benefit package, work-life balance and an inclusive culture are all part of a complete and rewarding employee experience at Diamond Game.Diamond Game designs, produces, and services electronic pull-tab games, gaming systems, and tickets for charitable gaming and lottery markets. Established in 1994, Diamond Game is proud to be a subsidiary of Pollard Banknote Limited and a sister company of Pollard Games, Inc DBA American Games and International Gamco.Our mission is to develop and provide innovative gaming solutions to charitable gaming and lottery markets while providing players with thrilling gaming experiences. We always put customers first by providing consistent service and unique products that outperform our competitors. We foster a work environment for employees that encourages teamwork, imagination and continuous improvement. We are proud that our products positively impact many charitable communities across North America.Our Core Values are: Be a Team Player; Have a Game Plan; Be Reliable; Be a Game Changer; Play Fair; Be a Pro; and Have Fun!Position SummaryThe Marketing Assistant's key responsibilities will be supporting the Marketing Manager and Graphic Designer. This person will help coordinate various details for multiple marketing, promotions, and sales projects and accurately track deadlines for promotion projects, tradeshow preparation, and related tasks. This person will have intermediate experience in graphic design applications, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.The Marketing Associate will assist the Marketing Manager in planning for various industry tradeshows, will assist in design direction, print orders, and coordination of shipping marketing collateral including tent cards, posters, play center inserts, flyers, and retailer instructional guides.This person will also help write content, edit, and publish articles for various collateral, press releases, and the company newslettersEssential Duties And Responsibilities Promotions: Research promotional items and source best pricing options.Coordinate and place print orders.Assist in coordinating logistics of promotions.
Competitive/Industry Market Research: Research competitor trends in advertising, social media, and tradeshows.Read industry publications/magazines as received and provided summarized reports of content.
Graphic Design: Assist Graphic Designer in creating designs, concepts, illustrations, and sample layouts based on knowledge of layout principles and esthetic design concepts for corporate identity, advertising, flyers and brochures, etc.
Misc.: Complete various administrative and clerical support duties including the preparation of printed promotional materials such as paper cutting, sorting items, stuffing envelopes, affixing promotional stickers, etc.Actively facilitate the preparation/production of all in and out of house sales support materials.Assist with shipping materials to events.
Perform other tasks and duties as needed and/or requested by management.
Education Requirements Bachelor's degree in marketing, business or related field.1 - 2 years' experience in marketing or a related position required.1+ years' project management experience preferred.Familiarity with social media platforms and their usage for marketing purposes helpful.
Knowledge And Abilities Requirements Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Intermediate ability in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Basic understanding of different marketing techniques.Strong desire to learn along with professional drive.Possess strong attention to detail including writing, editing, and proofreading skills.Ability to multi-task and take initiative.Ability to take direction and absorb information quickly.Passion for the marketing industry and its best practicesCreative mindset and ability to think outside the box.
Benefits Medical, Dental, Vision401k with company matchProfit SharingPaid VacationEmployee Referral ProgramTuition ReimbursementEmployee Assistance ProgramGrowth & Development OpportunitiesWork-Life Balance
We thank all that apply; however only the most qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory response from a Background Screening (Criminal History Search and Drug Test).Diamond Game provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.To ALL Recruitment Agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Business Development Representative
JobDescription:
The CompanyMarketing.com brings together people from diverse personal and professional backgrounds to create a technology-centered, people-powered culture that is constantly evolving and redefining how marketing is done. Our team members bring to work a combined history of dedication, service and being the best at what they do—everyday. With over 30 production facilities in the US and Canada (and growing!), we provide comprehensive digital marketing services, commercial printing, warehousing & fulfillment, direct mail marketing, sign manufacturing & fabrication, and promotional products.We are expanding at warp speed and are adding to our team – from our sales office and shop floor locations to our remote online team members. We are a diverse, creative, and passionate crew who is always looking to discover and implement fresh, innovative ideas and make some pretty amazing things.Job DescriptionThe position requires heavy outbound calling responsibilities as well as handling inbound calls. The customer interfacing will result in the incumbent or applicant is responsible for resolving issues such as requests for quotations, lead times, order placement, expediting, changes in quotes, writing orders, and communicating pertinent information to all necessary parties.Primary Duties And Responsibilities Create and manage marketing campaigns targeting newly discovered leads.Market research to identify growth opportunities in our existing accounts. Identify decision-makers amongst the targeted leads to initiate and close the sale.Proactively contacting decision-makers to introduce and promote TopForms Medial offeringGrow sales profitably targeting new business/prospecting activity as well as cold calling/prospectingMaintaining and expanding the database of prospects in CRM tool (Salesforce.com)Develop working relationships with customers through regular contact and communication.Providing product function/benefitsProviding customers with product samples and/or conduct mailings as neededParticipating fully in product training sessions, meetings, skills training, and professional development classes. Solve actual and potential problems and address account complaints.Complete normal business reports as required. Other duties as assigned. 
Job Requirements Bachelor's degree in business management, finance, marketing, or equivalent is preferred1-3 years of relevant work or internship experience in customer service, retail, sales is preferred but not required.Comfortable/effective making sales cold callsAbility to cultivate relationships, establish rapport and develop credibility with customers and co-workersAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environmentExceptional verbal and written communication skillsMust have highly proficient level computer skills including: MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and OutlookExperience using CRM tool is a plus but not required (Salesforce.com)Must be able to report to the TopForms Medical facility office dailyLimited travel required, must be able to travel to client reviews and healthcare summits (when needed).

Title: Digital Marketing Associate - CRM & Customer Lifecycle
JobDescription:
Who We AreFor over 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the forefront of sonic innovation. Guided by our mission to inspire and enable creators to express themselves, we develop integrated audio hardware and software solutions for musicians, producers, engineers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience.Marketing is at the heart of Native Instruments’ business. We act as the conduit between the company and its audiences. Together, we are aiming to empower music creators worldwide, through inspiring content and unique community activations. Our Digital Marketing team takes care of the acquisition, activation and engagement. We work in cross-functional teams, each consisting of experts from the areas of data analytics, messaging, lifecycle management, performance marketing, SEO, engineering and content production.What You'll Do Using your lifecycle management and CRM expertise you will support the team to plan, build and manage high performing messaging campaigns across multiple channels (email, push, in-app), including audience selection, trigger qualification, segmentation, setup, send out and campaign analysis;Together with the team you will identify opportunities to drive product adoption, engagement, retention as well as cross- and up-sell behavior in LCM channels;You will coordinate campaign creation process with relevant departments and be the point of contact for campaign stakeholders;You will carefully monitor individual campaign performance, adjusting and adapting as needed and collecting insights to optimize future campaign activity;Using your segmentation tactics knowledge, you will support the team to develop target groups and communication concepts for marketing automation;Together with relevant stakeholders you will compile, consolidate and systematically maintain customer data.
What You'll Need Initial working experience and a track record of success in CRM, preferably as a CRM specialist;Meticulous organizational skills. You are a planner, a collaborator and an excellent project manager;Google Drive is your second home;Knowledge of Braze, Metabase, Google Analytics and experience with SQL is a plus;Passion for music and understanding the current music production market;English language fluency with excellent written and verbal communication skills;Demonstrated ability to work cross functionally;Proven ability to collect, analyze and derive insights from customer and business data. 
About UsNative Instruments embraces diversity and a respect for all people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Native Instruments we value teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

Title: Field Marketing Specialist
JobDescription: Field Marketing SpecialistF.W. Webb is seeking a Field Marketing Specialist to support strategy, development and execution of field marketing programs and events to drive awareness, demand and revenue growth for the company’s $2B+ wholesale distribution business and retail showrooms in the Northeast. In this role, you will partner with General Managers, Store Managers, Showroom Managers, Sales and Marketing to promote the company’s products, services and solutions across designated states to support achievement of regional revenue and growth targets.  If you’re passionate, energetic and thrive on making a difference, this is an ideal opportunity for you to join a highly collaborative marketing team in a role that’s pivotal to the company’s success. This position requires an understanding of demand generation and field marketing best practices and experience in event planning, execution and field enablement. This is an in-office position at the company’s headquarters in Bedford, MA. Key Responsibilities·       Plan, develop, coordinate and evaluate field marketing programs, activities and events in assigned states and regions in the Northeast.·       Develop and maintain knowledge of target audiences, customers, competition and market trends in assigned states and regions and tailor programs, activities and events accordingly.·       Support planning and execution for in-region events and provide onsite support for select events.·       Support execution of field-driven promotions, trainings and hospitality events.·       Provide programmatic support for F.W. Webb and Frank Webb Home new store openings, relocations, grand reopenings and in-region acquisitions.·       Coordinate creation and delivery of sales and promotional collateral, branded apparel and giveaways, advertisements, signage and other materials.·       Forecast, measure, analyze and report on program and event ROI, with a focus on driving continuous improvement and maximizing customer engagement and satisfaction.·       Research and identify new tactics and approaches to reach target audiences.·       Other related duties as assigned. Qualifications·       BA/BS degree in Marketing, Business, Communications or a related field.·       3-5 years of experience in field marketing, demand generation, marketing programs or a related discipline.·       Demonstrated ability to prioritize, develop and execute programs, activities and events to support the achievement of business goals. ·       Excellent project management, budget management, time management, interpersonal and organizational skills.·       Exceptional attention to detail and ability to smoothly manage multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills. ·       High-energy, low-ego and an exceptional team player.·       Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills.  About F.W. WebbAn industry pioneer since 1866, F.W. Webb is the largest wholesale distributor of plumbing, heating, HVAC, LP gas, refrigeration and pipe, valves and fittings in the Northeast. The company has grown from a single location to more than 100 across nine states and proudly offers customers an extensive inventory of products and dedicated services that reach from underground to the rooftop. Covering 16 areas of expertise, specialty markets include process controls, water works, environmental services and more. F.W. Webb also operates 48 Frank Webb Home bath, kitchen and lighting retail showrooms.

Title: Account Coordinator
JobDescription:
Job Description:The Account Coordinator position is responsible for supporting the account team in the acquisition, growth and retention of clients and revenue. A Phase 3 Marketing & Communications Account Coordinator achieves this by building trusted relationships, identifying needs and providing solutions to marketing communication challenges. The successful candidate is responsible for generating new sales, identifying, and qualifying business opportunities and presenting Phase 3 products to prospects, as well as preparing quotes and leading pitches to help close the sale. Position reports to the regional head of sales.Job Responsibilities:  New Business Pitches Outbound Email Outreach and Appointment Setting Prospecting Capabilities Presentations Growth, retention and maintenance of clients Develop strong account relationships and grow existing accounts Develop expert knowledge of all Phase 3 Marketing & Communications products and services Achieve revenue targets and quota for new business growth Order Entry Forecasting Quoting Reporting Project Management
Job Requirements:  Preferred, 0-3 years of agency or print account management experience Ability to close and manage accounts Work well in a very fast paced, deadline-oriented environment Communicate effectively and work well with others in a team environment Tremendous relationship building skills Strong organizational skills Strong problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail Requires both phone and in-person sales skills Flexible working hours Working knowledge of a PC and Microsoft Office software
Company Wide Benefits: Medical + Dental + VisionCompany Paid Life Insurance and AD&DHealth Savings AccountEmployee Assistance Program401k and Roth IRAActive & FitGenerous PTO schedule$500 Employee Referral Bonus
About Phase 3 Marketing & Communications:Founded in 2001, Phase 3 is an integrated marketing services firm, simplifying the way brands connect with their customers. A commitment to ideation to execution means Phase 3 offers everything from creative, digital, marketing and public relations to small- and large-format digital, and offset printing. We manage the big picture of projects – start-to-finish, arm-in-arm – like no other partner. With locations across the eastern United States, including Atlanta, Charlotte, Dallas Nashville and Fairfield, New Jersey, our reach and efficiencies enable our team to creatively and effectively solve clients’ biggest marketing challenges, together.Phase 3 is recognized annually as a top 10 marketing services firm by the Atlanta Business Chronicle and as a top 15 marketing services firm by the Charlotte Business Journal and Nashville Business Journal. The company has been ranked among the flagship Printing Impressions 400 annually since 2011, and additional accolades include Atlanta Business Chronicle’s 2015 Pacesetter Award, placement on the 2017 Inc. 5000 List for Fasted Growing Private Companies, and recognition as one of Charlotte’s Best Places to Work.
Skills: Account Management, Attention to Detail, Communication, Deadline Oriented, Marketing, Organization Skills, Presentations, Problem Solving, Relationship Building, Sales Presentations

Title: Sales And Marketing Representative
JobDescription:
Accentus Insurance Group is a general insurance agency with offices in Baton Rouge, LA and Irmo, SC. We are seeking a South Carolina Marketing Representative to join our growing team! This person will be responsible for contracting with independent producer agencies to market our products, monitoring producer agency production against performance goals, educating producer agencies about underwriting guidelines and eligibility, and developing new growth opportunities  throughout South Carolina. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to the following.  Build and deepen relationships with producer agency partners through regular in-person office visits and provide follow up communication, to reinforce key messages.Contract new producer agencies to expand existing distribution channels.Deliver value-added  training on insurance products, processing systems, underwriting criteria, and marketing strategies.Analyze market trends and competitor data and recommend strategies to maximize profitable growth.Attend trade shows and industry events.Possess highly-effective organizational skills to facilitate efficient appointment scheduling, trip routing, and timely follow up.
 BENEFITS Base pay plus Commission & Bonus OpportunitiesHealthcare benefits including Medical, Dental, VisionShort-term disability, Life, Cancer, Accident and Critical Illness Insurances401K 
 EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university; or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: The ideal candidate has experience in P&C insurance (i.e. Agency experience; Marketing; Underwriting; or Claims).  The candidate has their South Carolina Property and Casualty producer license or is willing to obtain their license within the first 90 days.
  The ideal candidate must also be able to work independently (typically from home) and be willing to travel frequently throughout the state. He/she should have excellent organization skills and be comfortable working with Windows Office and other basic computer programs. A Bachelor’s degree is preferred.
Skills: Marketing, Property and Casualty Insurance, Relationship Building, Training, Travel

Title: Marketing Social Media Coordinator
JobDescription:
We are currently seeking Marketing Coordinator with a focus on social media. You will play a crucial role in supporting the marketing team's efforts to promote the brand on various media platforms.Responsibilities:  Manage and maintain social media accounts across platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube Create and curate compelling, on-brand content for social media posts, including images, videos, infographics, and copy Monitor and analyze social media metrics, such as reach, engagement, follower growth, and conversion rates Collaborate with the marketing team to develop engaging social media content calendars Create original content, such as graphics, videos, and written posts, to share on social media platforms Ensure all content maintains brand consistency, messaging, and visual identity Utilize social media analytics tools to track and measure the effectiveness of campaigns and content strategies

Compensation: $25-35/hrSalary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications.

Title: Associate, Fund Marketing
JobDescription:
Who We Are:With offices in Los Angeles, Newport Beach, Boston and Sarasota, Aristotle is a family of employee‐owned investment management firms that collectively manage equity and fixed income strategies. Aristotle attracts and retains talented investment professionals through a culture focused on research, investment management and client success.Aristotle’s experienced corporate leadership team oversees a centralized support infrastructure to ensure that our distinct teams of investment professionals can focus on what they do best—adding value to client portfolios. The company’s support infrastructure includes shared services such as finance, compliance, trading, operations, client communication, marketing, and distribution.We are currently seeking an Associate, Fund Marketing to support the Aristotle Funds marketing strategy and objectives. This role will focus on the completion of quarterly updates, shepherding projects through our defined process and ad hoc marketing requests.This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Fund Marketing.What You Will Do:  Support the Aristotle Funds marketing strategy and objectives.Prepare quarterly marketing materials, including factsheets and presentations.Assist in the creation of marketing collateral such as insights, investment ideas, and ad-hoc requests.Coordinate with graphic design team to ensure data integrity of marketing collateral.Recognize and promote the strategic positioning of Aristotle Funds.Develop and maintain professional relationships with internal stakeholders including asset managers and internal departments.Complete ad hoc projects as necessary.
What You Will Need:  Knowledge of financial industries.Exceptional level of professionalism, accuracy, and attention to detail.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Self-motivated and thrive in a fast-paced environment.Proficient computer skills (Microsoft Office Suite, with emphasis on Excel, Word, and PowerPoint applications).Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a major in business, economics, marketing, or communications.1-3 years of experience in financial services.
What We Have to Offer: Robust Health, Dental, and Vision insurance for you and your dependents401(K) Retirement Plan with Employer MatchingA culture that values inclusivityFlexible Paid time off, including annual Employee Volunteer DayLife, Critical Illness, Disability, and Accidental Injury InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramVarious Company events throughout the yearEmployee Discount Program
Is Aristotle Right for You? At Aristotle, we stand by our core values.We place our clients’ interests first.We act with integrity.We achieve excellence through accountability and collaboration.We empower our employees.We are respectful.We value community.
Compensation Range: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00, plus discretionary bonus.This is a hybrid role, preference is to be located within commuting distance of our Newport Beach, CA office.We are looking for exceptional individuals who are intelligent, enthusiastic, and curious, someone who will contribute to our expanding business. An ideal candidate would not limit their contribution to the provided job description but would help us surpass our goals by continually finding ways to improve themselves and the firm. If you would like the stability of a successful, established company and the growth opportunities of a dynamic environment, we look forward to hearing from you.Note: The above description identifies the essential job functions and skills needed by the person or persons assigned to this position. These job functions and skills are not intended to be a complete and exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. The information contained herein is subject to change at the company's discretion. No phone calls. No agencies or recruiters.Aristotle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Aristotle will consider for employment, qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.Aristotle Capital Management, LLC, Aristotle Credit Partners, LLC, Aristotle Capital Boston, LLC, and Aristotle Atlantic Partners, LLC are affiliated organizations. Each is an independent investment adviser separately registered under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, as amended. Registration does not imply a certain level of skill or training. More information about each adviser including the investment strategies, fees and objectives can be found in their ADV Part 2, which is available upon request.We have updated our Privacy Policy on October 7, 2020 (“New Privacy Policy”). Please read the policy carefully. By using this website you are agreeing to the terms of our New Privacy Policy.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Who We Are:With offices in Los Angeles, Newport Beach, Boston and Sarasota, Aristotle is a family of employee‐owned investment management firms that collectively manage equity and fixed income strategies. Aristotle attracts and retains talented investment professionals through a culture focused on research, investment management and client success.Aristotle’s experienced corporate leadership team oversees a centralized support infrastructure to ensure that our distinct teams of investment professionals can focus on what they do best—adding value to client portfolios. The company’s support infrastructure includes shared services such as finance, compliance, trading, operations, client communication, marketing, and distribution.We are currently seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team.The Digital Marketing Specialist is a highly motivated self-starter who has previously demonstrated the ability to successfully execute digital marketing campaigns with a focus on email. This role will create and collaborate on all digital marketing projects, including e-newsletters, webinars, podcasts, video and social. The Digital Marketing Specialist will use their deep working knowledge of email best practices to execute and own email automation programs and build out targeted nurture and social campaigns that align with the goals set forth by marketing leadership. This role will use HTML knowledge to enhance email design, build out any web pages part of digital marketing campaigns. This individual will also report on success, key findings and recommendations across email, web and social on a monthly and quarterly basis.What You Will Do: Primary owner of email marketing creating programmatic and trigger-based email marketing programs based on known client behaviors and content preferences.Work with members of the marketing team to help design and implement client journeys, experiences, and automations with a focus on email and web to achieve goals set by marketing leadership.Build out all web pages needed for all digital marketing campaigns.Strategize and execute social media campaigns paired with email campaigns.Measure and analyze key performance indicators ensuring digital campaigns are impactful, delivered on-time, accurately tracked, and continually improved upon.Keep apprised of industry trends impacting digital marketing and share best practices with internal teams.Work with marketing strategy team and other parties to integrate email marketing campaign results with CRM data to generate sales leads.Attend webinars and conferences for continual learning and to ensure the firm stays within alignment of digital marketing best-practices in the financial services industry.
What You Will Need: 3-5 years of work experience in digital marketing (financial services industry of similar preferred).Must have experience working with Marketo (preferred), HubSpot or Pardot – having deep, practical/tactical expertise in email marketing.Strong technical skills and demonstrated ability to successfully build and execute digital campaigns to achieve target goals.Basic knowledge of HTML, WordPress, Salesforce, and Google Analytics (GA4), Sprout Social or similar.Strong capability with Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Creative Cloud tools.Detail oriented, strong organizational skills, a team player, and have the intellectual curiosity and aptitude to learn new technology and build digital campaigns.Advanced problem-solving skills and ability to think outside the box and look for new innovative solutions.Desire to learn and develop financial services industry knowledge ultimately becoming an expert in digital marketing for this industry.Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or equivalent experience.Marketo Certification required or the ability to obtain a Marketo Certification upon hire.Strong expertise working with email automation systems.Experience working with a CRM platform in a marketing capacity, Salesforce preferred.

Title: Product Marketing Specialist (ENTRY-LEVEL)
JobDescription:
We are a local Promotional Marketing & Sales firm in East Brunswick, NJ. We are looking to hire for our Product Marketing Specialist position. As our Entry Level Product Marketing Specialist, you will assist the marketing team in implementing all marketing activities, working closely to increase brand awareness, drive sales, and ultimately generate new business leads.This is an entry-level position with exposure to multifaceted areas of our firm in which full training is provided. Our team of motivated & driven professionals works together in a fast-paced environment to create the most successful marketing campaigns our clients have experienced to date.Product Marketing Specialist Responsibilities: Working with the Marketing Manager and key accounts to integrate promotional campaigns with customer sales promotionsBuilding relationships with customers and communicating promotional servicesGenerate new customer acquisitions through face-to-face customer relationsAttend and learn all product knowledge for clients and apply it in actual consumer interactions and marketing initiativesIdentifying new opportunities and efficiency innovations
We are Looking For: 1-2 years of experience in sales, marketing, customer service, event, or retail-related settings are an asset. Internship experience and previous entry-level experience will be consideredSelf-motivated and results-drivenExcellent time management skills and ability to adhere to a schedule
Qualities We Feel Team Members Exemplify: Outstanding COMMUNICATION skills both verbal & writtenAbility to PRIORITIZE and work INDEPENDENTLY with minimal supervisionAbility to work effectively in a TEAM environmentLEADER & GO GETTER mentalityAdaptable, dependable, and responsible
Apply for immediate consideration with an updated copy of your resume!

Title: People and Culture Generalist (On-Site)
JobDescription:
Receive up to3 weeks of paid time offin your first year!At Wilson, we are here to empower every human to live like an athlete. Passion. Creativity. Integrity. Teamwork. Ambition. Innovation. These are the qualities that have made Wilson Sporting Goods Co. the number one sports equipment brand in the world. We come together to win, grow, and celebrate. We all play for Team Wilson. We all have a role to play within our organization and are working towards the same goal. One team, one dream.We believe that being an athlete isn’t something you do, it’s who you are. It’s a universal code of conduct, a way of seeing the world and how you show up every day. We seek out diverse voices and welcome all perspectives. Our team is composed of individuals with unique backgrounds, points of view and experiences. These perspectives create a rich and diverse culture in which we learn from one another through empathy and inclusion.Evolving the sports world and being the best partner for players, athletes, and our community is no small task. We are continually looking to add enthusiastic, ambitious, team-first individuals who desire to make a difference —and who love to help others win. Together, we will create a better world through sport. Join us.What You'll DoWe are currently seeking a People & Culture Generalist, who will provide leadership for all People & Culture functions and work with the DC management team to support the site business strategies for Wilson’s two distribution facilities in Nashville, TN. This individual will also support other companywide People & Culture initiatives for Wilson Sporting Goods.This role is based at our Nashville location.Specific Duties May Include  Coach and develop the distribution center leadership team on employee relations, talent development, and performance management.  Serves as the link between team members, operations, payroll, and corporate People & Culture team by answering questions and interpreting and administering company policies.  Partner with Talent Acquisition to manage staffing requirements including the recruitment, selection, and promotion process for all hourly and salaried openings; acts as a point of contact for temporary staffing agencies; assists Talent Acquisition in building relationships with local colleges, chamber of commerce, or other resources in the area to attract talent.  In conjunction with the People Resource Hub, manage leaves of absence (FMLA/short-term disability), conduct new hire orientations, and assist employees with all aspects of benefit administration, including open enrollment.  Handles employee relations issues (work complaints, harassment allegations, other employee concerns, etc.) in accordance with company standards and applicable laws.  Administer the local compensation program in accordance with company practices.  Administer the workers’ compensation program, including investigating injuries, first aid, and near misses; assist in organizing and running the annual safety training.  Assist with companywide People & Culture initiatives like compensation, Coaching for Success (annual performance management process), employee engagement, and learning and development.  Assists in specific learning and development needs for the distribution centers; aids in developing a plan and implementing learning programs that align with best practices, business strategies/needs, and company values in collaboration with the Senior Manager of People and Culture.  In conjunction with Payroll, assist in ensuring accurate information for payroll and timekeeping so all team members are paid accurately. Assists in providing training to managers and supervisors to utilize HRIS (including Kronos and Workday)  Assist the DC Leadership team and Sr. Manager of People and Culture in the site-specific Engagement Strategy.  Other duties as assigned. 
What We're Looking ForThis role requires a minimum of 3 years of experience strong experience in Human Resources in a manufacturing or distribution setting. A Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related area is preferred.  Fluency in Spanish is strongly preferred.  Ability to act with limited guidance and solve practical problems; exercises good judgment and solid decision-making skills.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to express ideas, problems, and solutions with clarity.  Knowledge of HRIS and timekeeping systems (Workday, Kronos, etc.)  Ability to build trust with employees; builds relationships throughout the organization at all levels.  Objectively coach leaders and team members through complex, difficult, and sensitive issues.  Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and make recommendations that effectively resolve problems by using judgment that is consistent with policies, standards, and state/federal regulations.  Effective project management skills with the ability to adapt to changing priorities with ease and composure while continuing to meet deadlines.  Articulates the appropriate responses to employee questions and issues using empathy and credibility; Ability to maintain confidentiality and deal appropriately with sensitive issues.  Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.  Ability to travel by automobile between locations as needed. 
 PERKS We Offer a Fast Paced, Collaborative, Team-work Environment With Best In Class Amenities And Perks, IncludingClosely located to the “IT City” of Nashville, the vibrant and sports-centric, Wilson Sporting Goods Co. with its global presence and the feel of a small town community.  Discounts on Wilson and Amer Sports products  Very competitive benefit package with all the works  Generous vacation package  Paid holidays  Casual and comfortable dress code (we are a sporting goods company J )  Employee events 
Amer Sports is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Title: Product Manager, Ad Tech Platform (Remote)
JobDescription:
Position PurposeThe Product Manager (PM) position is responsible for delivering business value to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfaction through the production of quality products. Within their designated enterprise product line, PMs focus on delivering incremental value by driving product changes and working closely with a team of developers, designers, and business partners. They support in-depth business reviews, communicate and present across all levels of the organization, and support cross-functional product teams.Key Responsibilities40% Strategy & Planning: Gains a thorough understanding of customer and associate needs, both existing and potential, and uses that knowledge to help deliver enterprise products that provide Home Depot customers and associates with an unparalleled shopping experienceTranslates business goals and end user needs into product strategy; communicates direction and product priorities to the development team, other matrixed teams, and third-party partnersIdentifies goals, metrics, and analytics to determine product value; continually making recommendations and refinements to the product backlog based on learningsConduct end user research to help identify user stories and help determine Minimum Viable Product (MVP)Partners with Finance to understand financial needs and assists in the creation of business plans for new opportunitiesMonitors research as well as the competitive landscape to recommend the best solutions and ensure that products remain or become best in classEvaluates research and market analysis on industry innovations and technology platforms to recommend the best possible solution
30% Delivery & Execution: Ensure product is aligned with company, stakeholder and end-user priorities to drive sales, improve efficiency, and improve customer satisfactionDocuments, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are metFormulates, tests and refines assumptions and hypotheses through user research and testingCreates, prioritizes and accepts user stories; incorporate them into release planningMakes product decisions that drive value on a daily basisIdentifies pros, cons, issues, obstacles, dependencies and value associated with features and enhancementsParticipates in standups, iteration planning sessions, product demos and retrospectivesCondenses complex technical concepts into non-technical language for stakeholders
30% People: Fosters collaboration with team members (Engineering, User Experience Designers, etc.) to drive value and collectively identify and resolve impedimentsActs as a proponent of modern software development practicesAdvocates for the end user and stakeholder by empathizing with and understanding user needs and becoming the domain expertRegularly works with the product team to continuously assess progress, disseminate lessons learned, and understand next stepsManages cross functional team and stakeholder expectations to execute on product strategy; provides education to requestors to determine prioritization based on tangible benefits and/or user experienceExhibit active listening, facilitate sessions, and clearly communicate at all levels (Executive Leadership Team, store associates, etc.) and in all formats the product's long term strategy which is used to prioritize short-term action
Direct Manager/Direct Reports Typically reports to the Product Management Manager or Sr. Manager.
Travel Requirements Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Physical Requirements Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.
Working Conditions Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Minimum Qualifications Must be eighteen years of age or older.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.Must be legally permitted to work in the United States
Preferred Qualifications 1-3 years of relevant work experienceExperience working as a Product Manager in a modern software development based enterprise environmentDemonstrated experience with modern software development product management practices and agile methodologies, specifically the extreme programming (XP) principles of paired programming, test driven development, and continuous deploymentExperience working in a fast paced, fluid environment where priorities shift on a regular basisExperience communicating with and influencing functional and technical team members at all levels in the organizationExperience working as part of a collaborative, cross-functional, modern software design and development teamExperience creating, prioritizing and accepting user storiesExperience conducting user research and testing to understand needsExperience identifying goals, metrics and analytics to measure product valueExperience conducting competitive research and analysis
Minimum Education The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a high school diploma and/or GED.
Preferred Education No additional education
Minimum Years Of Work Experience 1
Competencies Business Insight: Applying knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goalsCollaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectivesCommunicates Effectively: Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiencesCultivates Innovation: Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successfulCustomer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutionsDrives Results: Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstancesInterpersonal Savvy: Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of peopleManages Ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain or the way forward is not clearNimble Learning: Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodderOrganizational Savvy: Maneuvering comfortably through complex policy, process and people-related organizational dynamicsSituational Adaptability: Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situationsEmpathy: Understands the needs of multiple stakeholders and is responsive in meeting their needs with the most optimal resolutionPlans and Aligns: Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Skills: End User Research, Extreme Programming, Pair Programming, Product Management, Product Strategy, Software Deployment, Test-Driven Development, User Stories, Windows XP, Workload Prioritization

Title: Digital Marketing Email Associate - Contractor
JobDescription:
iCapital is powering the world’s alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $159 billion in global client assets invested in 1,288 funds, as of May 2023.iCapital has been named to the Forbes Fintech 50 for six consecutive years (2018 – 2023); a back-to-back selection by Forbes to its list of Best Startup Employers; and a two-time winner of MMI/Barron’s Solutions Provider award (See link below).About The RoleiCapital is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Digital Marketing/Email Marketing Specialist to join our dynamic Marketing team. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in planning, executing, and optimizing our email marketing campaigns to drive engagement and conversions for iCapital’s Structured Investment products. This role will work closely with various teams, including Channel Marketing, Business Solutions/CRM, Sales, Content, and Design, to develop and implement effective email strategies. This individual should have a passion for digital marketing, a track record of successful email campaigns, and a desire to contribute to a dynamic team.Responsibilities Develop, execute, and manage end-to-end email marketing campaigns that align with our marketing objectives and target audience. Create engaging email content, including compelling subject lines, body copy, and calls to action, to drive customer engagement and conversion rates. Utilize HubSpot, our marketing automation tool to build and deploy email campaigns, ensuring accuracy and proper segmentation. Monitor email deliverability, open rates, click-through rates, and other relevant email metrics to assess campaign performance and optimize future campaigns. Conduct A/B testing to continuously improve email performance, including testing different subject lines, content variations, and email layouts. Collaborate with the design team to create visually appealing email templates and graphics that align with our brand guidelines. Ensure compliance with email marketing best practices, industry regulations (e.g., CAN-SPAM Act, GDPR), and data privacy policies. Implement dynamic email campaigns, leveraging customer segmentation, and personalization techniques to enhance engagement and increase conversion rates. Work closely with the CRM team to integrate email campaigns with customer data, ensuring seamless data flow and accurate targeting. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging email marketing technologies, tools, and strategies, and make recommendations for improvement. Provide regular reports on campaign performance, including key metrics, insights, and recommendations for optimization. 
Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Marketing, business, or a related field Proven work experience as an email marketing campaign specialist or similar role, preferably in Wealth Management, Fintech, or Financial Services industry Proficient in email marketing software and marketing automation tools (e.g., Marketo, HubSpot, Pardot) and CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce) In-depth knowledge of email marketing best practices, including list management, segmentation, deliverability, and compliance Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and experience in optimizing email campaigns based on data-driven insights Familiar with HTML and CSS for email template customization is a plus Excellent written communication skills with a keen eye for detail and a passion for crafting compelling copy Analytical mindset and able to interpret data and draw actionable insights to enhance campaign performance Able to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and work cross-functionally with different teams Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 products 
BenefitsThe pay range for this role is $35/hour to $50/hour.  iCapital offers a compensation package which includes salary, equity for all full-time employees, and an annual performance bonus. Employees also receive a comprehensive benefits package that includes an employer matched retirement plan, generously subsidized healthcare with 100% employer paid dental, vision, telemedicine, and virtual mental health counseling, parental leave, and unlimited paid time off (PTO).We believe the best ideas and innovation happen when we are together. We offer most employees the flexibility to work in the office three or four days.  Every department has different needs, and some positions will be designated in-office jobs, based on their function. For additional information on iCapital, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc | Awards Disclaimer: https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us/recognition/iCapital is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Skills: A/B Testing, Business Insights, Campaigns, Customer Engagement, Digital Marketing, Email Marketing, Key Metrics, Market Segmentation, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Campaigns

Title: Marketing & Communications Associate
JobDescription:
Are you ready to rise to the challenge of climate change with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is a U.S. technology and manufacturing company that is developing and commercializing pioneering energy storage technologies to enable the electric grid to run on 100% renewable energy, every day of the year.Supported by leading investors such as Breakthrough Energy Ventures, ArcelorMittal, TPG Rise, MIT’s The Engine, and others, we share a common belief that low-cost, multi-day energy storage is the key to enable tomorrow’s zero carbon electric grid. Driven by our core values of humanity, excellence, and creativity, we are deeply motivated and inspired to create a better world. We need talented, hardworking individuals who share our goal of tackling the challenge of climate change. Do you want to work with us today to build a better tomorrow?Role DescriptionForm Energy is hiring a Marketing & Communications Associate to support the company’s internal communications and external marketing and public relations efforts. As part of our Communications team, you will contribute to strengthening Form Energy’s brand externally, while helping foster a strong culture internally. While this role reports to our Communications Manager, you will work in close collaboration with teams across the organization - including our Policy, Commercial, People Operations, Recruiting, Engineering, and Analytics teams. If you are hungry to make a dent on climate change - while learning new marketing and communications skills to enable you to rapidly grow in your career - then this is the right role for you!This role can either be performed remotely in the US or hybrid from our Somerville, MA, Berkeley, CA, Eighty Four, PA, or Weirton, WV locations. What You'll Do Execute on Form Energy’s digital marketing strategy - including managing the company’s social media accounts (posting, monitoring, reporting) and paid advertising buysSupport the coordination of press interviews and press visits, as well as building of media listsSupport Form Energy’s talent marketing and employer branding efforts Review and edit communications collateral, as neededMonitor, track, and report out press coverageMeasure and analyze the impact of Form Energy’s external communications channels (social media channels, website, earned media, etc.) 
What You'll Bring 3-4 years of experience in marketing or public relations, agency experience is a plusDemonstrated experience in social media management and building a brand’s digital presenceStrong writing skills - can write effective, snappy social copy and bring fresh edit ideas to other written collateral An eye for design - has good creative judgment and can work with designers and/or whip up a graphic or video yourself if needed (e.g. in Canva)Excellent organizational skills - can manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environmentFresh creative ideas and perspective on new ways Form Energy can continue to strengthen its brand and reach key audiences
The salary range for this role is $63,035 - $87,060. The range listed is what we reasonably expect to pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and may be modified in the future. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.Besides joining a community of people working to make the world better, Form Energy commits to you equitable compensation, stock options, and offers a generous benefits package to make sure you have the support you need to thrive.We cover 100% of employee premiums and 80% of dependent premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for full time employees. We offer a flexible Paid Time Off program and every employee, regardless of gender identity or expression, is eligible for 12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. A full listing of our benefits is available on our careers page .At Form Energy, we are working toward a 100% renewable energy future for everyone in the world. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees and are seeking to build a team that reflects the diversity of the people we hope to serve with our revolutionary products. Form Energy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Skills: Collateral, Digital Marketing, Media Management, Organization Skills, Press Coverage, Public Relations, Social Media, Social Media Management, Strategic Communications, Writing

Title: Administrative Assistant
JobDescription:
Help Help Requirements  Conditions of Employment You must possess U.S. Citizenship or be a U.S. National.You must complete a favorable Background Investigation (BI).Selective Service registration is required.
If you fail to meet the conditions of employment or any other pre-employment requirements, such as missing any of the scheduled appointments, the hiring agency may rescind their tentative offer of employment.Applying to this announcement certifies that you give permission for TSA to share your application with others in DHS for similar positions.Any offers of employment made pursuant to this announcement will be consistent with all applicable authorities, including Presidential Memoranda, Executive Orders, interpretive U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) guidance, and Office of Management and Budget plans and policies concerning hiring. These authorities are subject to change.QualificationsTo qualify for the SV-E Pay Band (equivalent to GS-7/8), you must have one year of specialized experience at the SV-D or GS-6 in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private sector. Specialized experience is defined as experience that has equipped you with the knowledge, skills and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. Such experience includes providing payroll support, AND applying knowledge of at least two (2) of the following: Identifying payroll issues related to time and attendance, pay, and leave;Interacting with staff to exchange information;Preparing, reviewing and modifying documents, letters, memos or reports using word processing software;Compiling, tracking and analyzing data;Developing charts and tables for reports and briefings; ORCoordinating travel and preparing travel orders and vouchers
 Credit for experience is given based on a 40-hour workweek. Part-time experience is credited on a part-time ratio, i.e., working 20 hours per week for two months equals one month of experience. No additional credit is given for overtime.National Service Experience (i.e., volunteer experience): Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, Non-career SES or Presidential Appointee employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the Human Resources Office.Resumes Must Include The Following Narrative description of duties with start and end dates (including the month and year) for work experience.State the number of hours worked in a position (i.e. full-time or part-time). If part-time, state the total number of hours worked per week.Performance level (i.e. band or grade)
 You must meet the qualification requirements for this position no later than the closing date of the vacancy announcement.EducationThis job does not have an education qualification requirement.Additional InformationEligibility to apply for other Federal positions: TSA is an Excepted Service agency exempt from most of Title 5 United States Code, including regulations which apply to displaced Federal employees (CTAP/ICTAP) of other agencies, and employment with TSA does not confer Competitive Status" that generally results from selection and service in Competitive Service agencies.
