Title: Graphic Designer & Web Developer
JobDescription:
Are you ready to rise to the challenge of climate change with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is a U.S. technology and manufacturing company that is developing and commercializing pioneering energy storage technologies to enable the electric grid to run on 100% renewable energy, every day of the year.Supported by leading investors such as Breakthrough Energy Ventures, ArcelorMittal, TPG Rise, MIT’s The Engine, and others, we share a common belief that low-cost, multi-day energy storage is the key to enable tomorrow’s zero carbon electric grid. Driven by our core values of humanity, excellence, and creativity, we are deeply motivated and inspired to create a better world. We need talented, hardworking individuals who share our goal of tackling the challenge of climate change. Do you want to work with us today to build a better tomorrow?Role DescriptionForm Energy is hiring a Graphic Designer with strong web development experience to build upon and strengthen the company’s brand. As part of our Communications team, you will combine your graphic design, web development, and other creative production skills to elevate Form Energy’s brand identity both internally and externally. While this role will report into our VP of Communications, you will work in close collaboration with teams across the company - including our Policy, Commercial, People Operations, Recruiting, Engineering, and Analytics teams. You will be the first graphic designer to work in-house at Form Energy! If you are hungry to make a dent on climate change - and passionate about using your creativity and design skills to make an impact - then this is the right role for you!This role can either be performed remotely in the US or hybrid from our Somerville, MA, Berkeley, CA, Eighty Four, PA, or Weirton, WV locations. What You'll Do Be the steward of Form Energy's brand - designing based on Form Energy’s brand standards - and continuing to evolve the brand to keep it fresh, creative, and engaging for our audiencesDesign internal and external communications collateral (web pages, social media graphics, slides, newsletters, handouts, etc.) and ensure each graphic element meets appropriate design specifications (color, resolution, web optimization, etc.)Bring creative collateral to life on Form Energy’s website and maintain the website on a regular basisTake photos at Form Energy’s facilities across the U.S., as neededSupport editing videos, as neededOrganize and manage all graphic assets
What You'll Bring 3-5 years of professional graphic design and web development experience Deep working knowledge of Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop (working knowledge of using collaborative tools like Figma and Canva is a plus)Strong experience in WordPress required, experience with Elementor or similar page builders is a major plus. Basic proficiency in HTML and CSS required. You will be the only web developer on our team. Knowledge of SEO and understanding of how to ensure that websites meet important page speed standards Experience in photography and in editing videos (with Adobe Premiere, and Aftereffects, and/or FinalCut pro) is a plus Ability to produce a first-rate work product under tight deadlines and while juggling multiple projects
The salary range for this role is $124,000-$176,000. The range listed is what we reasonably expect to pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and may be modified in the future. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.Besides joining a community of people working to make the world better, Form Energy commits to you equitable compensation, stock options, and offers a generous benefits package to make sure you have the support you need to thrive.We cover 100% of employee premiums and 80% of dependent premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for full time employees. We offer a flexible Paid Time Off program and every employee, regardless of gender identity or expression, is eligible for 12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. A full listing of our benefits is available on our careers page .At Form Energy, we are working toward a 100% renewable energy future for everyone in the world. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees and are seeking to build a team that reflects the diversity of the people we hope to serve with our revolutionary products. Form Energy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Warehouse Worker
JobDescription:
Amare is looking for a Warehouse Worker to participate in our warehouse operations and activities. Warehouse Worker responsibilities include storing materials, picking, packing and scanning orders. The goal is to increase efficiency, profitability, and customer satisfaction.Key Job Responsibilities  Prepare and complete orders for delivery or pickup according to schedule (load, pack, wrap, label, ship) Receive and process warehouse stock products (pick, unload, label, store) Perform inventory controls and keep quality standards high for audits Keep a clean and safe working environment and optimize space utilization Complete diary logs into inventory Report any discrepancies Communicate and cooperate with supervisors and coworkers Operate and maintain preventively warehouse vehicles and equipment Follow quality service standards and comply with procedures, rules and regulations
Requirements  Familiarity with modern warehousing practices and methods Good organizational and time management skills High school Diploma / GED preferred
Physical DemandsThis job may require some or all of the following: standing, walking, sitting, lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, stooping, reaching, and handling.Benefits Medical, Dental and VisionFlexible Spending Account / Health Savings Account401(k) with employer matchIncome Protection Insurance Voluntary Plans3 weeks paid time off in your first year

Title: Sales Development Representative (Fully Remote)
JobDescription:
Who We Are & What We Do: Branching Minds’ mission is to empower all educators to effectively, efficiently, and equitably support the holistic needs of their students; and to create a path to academic and personal success for every learner. Already supporting over 1,000,000 students across 100+ districts from 30 states, our vision is to be the most impactful national K12 school district solution for achieving high-fidelity RTI/MTSS; consistently demonstrating our ability to save teachers' planning/documenting time, improve outcomes of our students, and eliminate achievement gaps.As a startup, we don’t have to play by the rules of traditional organizations. We get to be innovative in the solutions we develop for our partners and the way we conduct our business for ourselves. Branching Minds is also a Benefit corporation. We get to prioritize our mission > profit, and the means of getting there is just as important as the ends. We err towards self-management, transparency, collaboration, initiative, and giving a damn.If using innovation to reimagine education in service of equity energizes you -- join our team!The Calling:As a Sales Development Representative, you will be integral in forming partnerships with school districts of all sizes to help all kids succeed by improving their RTI / MTSS practice. You will be able to create successful outbound sequences utilizing company tools (CRM) and protocols for pipeline development.As part of the Sales team, this role reports into the National Sales Manager and VP, Sales.What You Will Achieve: Schedule meetings with districts in your territory for the field sales team Sell Branching Minds platform and related Professional ServicesBuild partnerships with district leaders and help them achieve student success for all learnersLeverage our existing partners to drive new opportunities, as well as to work with them to grow these existing partnershipsOwning the entire sales cycle from prospecting to close on smaller districts Showing off your outbound cold calling hustle and presentation skills via webinarFlexing your strong organization and reporting abilitiesCommunicating and working with the team on overall sales and marketing strategiesManage transitions to the customer support team to ensure customer success
RequirementsWhy We Want You:  Solid experience working in K12 education or related business development role in Ed tech, education or related industriesAble to cultivate personal relationships with potential clients to become a trusted ‘advisor’ and friendExcited by our mission and ready to seize on the momentum we have built as a leader in RTI/MTSSComfortable with the dynamic, self-motivated, collaborative, fast-paced culture of a startup, and able to work well both independently and as part of a teamYour voice, your commitment and your passion can guide our collective efforts to drive enthusiasm and increased adoption of our platform, and ultimately in pursuing our end goal of helping all K12 students achieve success!
Lucky Us If You:(No biggie if you don’t) Sold school district-level software working closely with educators & administrators (preferably, sold assessment/intervention/RTI/MTSS tools in the educational technology market);Worked in K12 schools as an educator and thoroughly knowledgeable of best practices within RTI / MTSS;Showcased strong written and verbal communication, and presentation skills;Demonstrated success in meeting and exceeding sales goals;Demonstrated experience with territory and call cycle management, as well as strong customer service and listening skills;Achieved proficiency with business process technology including CRM software, G-Suite (Gmail, Docs, Drive Calendar), and Microsoft Office; and,Operated effectively within a distributed team, utilizing tools such as Slack and Zoom
Interview Process:If we are a match you can expect a total of 3 steps in the interview process after the initial application 30-minute Video/Phone Interview with hiring manager45-minute Deep Dive with hiring manager + VP, Sales60-minute Panel Interview
BenefitsWhat We Offer You: Check out our Benefits & Perks (https://secure.justworks.com/benefits/company_benefits_overviews/d50b8a3e-f599-4319-b600-a65d344d1c9c/show )Fully remote! An awesome, cross-disciplinary, mission-driven team solving meaningful problems that improves the lives of educators and studentsBase annual compensation for this role is $50,000 - $65,000 based on experience and expertise + bonus and commissions
In Our Own Words, We Are...Independent, Relaxed, Ownership, Flexibility, Always Learning, Casual, Adaptable, “Best Idea Wins,” Passionate, Dedicated, Very Capable/Competent, Efficient, Communicative, Welcoming, Caring, Scrappy, Friendly, Co-operative, Agile, Supportive, Principle-Driven, Respectful, Practical, Attentive, Funny, Self-Motivated, Silly Parrots.Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & InclusionAt Branching Minds, a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where everyone, regardless of their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation or identity, education, professional and life experiences, disabilities, and abilities; feels valued and respected. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is committed to continuing to create a diverse, inclusive and equitable environment.Our Commitment To People With DisabilitiesBranching Minds is committed to disability inclusion, and to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at info@branchingminds.com

Title: eCommerce & Digital Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
If you love how technology helps connect people and brands, moving projects from concept to completion, and how to make things stand out from the clutter, we may be looking for you.Your ability to hear project needs, gather the resources to complete it and manage the project cheerfully and attentively has a powerful opportunity to help grow one of Nashville’s social enterprises.The ideal candidate will demonstrate fine-tuned attention to detail, with excellent time management and effective project management skills. The person in this role will work alongside the Digital Marketing Manager to convey the quality of Thistle Farms products, along with their impact to our overall mission by creating a streamlined user journey through our collection of intentionally curated touchpoints. General knowledge of UX/UI best practices, and an eye for basic design and aesthetic consistency is a plus.Shopify Management  Manage the organization’s Shopify websites. Create product listings for Thistle Farms and Shared Trade products - approximately 300 products per year. Update product statuses in Shopify on a weekly and/or basis in accordance with changing inventory and stock levels. Launch new products online and in The Shop, creating a multi-channel shopping experience. Digitally merchandise to increase conversion using best-in-class techniques such as collection management, product recommendations, cross-sells, etc. Manage listings throughout the product life cycle, including A/B testing. Investigate new Shopify releases and features to assist in identifying areas of opportunity to increase our revenue and improve our customer shopping experience. Understand our existing KPIs for overall eCommerce/product performance, as well as how to interpret and analyze them. Work with inventory management and product management team members to ensure accurate product statuses in accordance with changing stock levels. 
Maximize Other eCommerce Channels Including Meta, Google Merchant, Amazon, and Faire  Manage product listings and product sets for use in catalogs and dynamic advertising. Assist in account and product optimizations. Flag, Troubleshoot, and correct discrepancies and errors when necessary. 
Website Content Management Pull and report on KPIs and work with Digital Marketing Manager to implement ongoing optimizations. Support the content management of the organization’s websites accurately and efficiently.Create landing pages and collections for campaigns.Content manage the product and missional areas of the site, making updates upon request.Support SEO & SEM via landing page enhancements at the direction of the Digital Marketing Manager.
Requirements Bachelor’s degree in a relevant fieldStrong attention to detail1-2 years experience with an eCommerce platform (Shopify preferred)General knowledge of UX/UI best practices is preferredStrong problem solving skills: able to research, diagnose, and resolve issuesAnalytical - able to interpret data and provide actionable insightsAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with a high attention to detailA self-starter, capable of navigating unfamiliar situationsExcellent computer skills- experience in agile principles of project management a plus
 Physical Requirements Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
Skills: A/B Testing, Digital Marketing, E-Commerce, Marketing, Shopify, User Experience (UX)

Title: Mortgage Loan Assistant
JobDescription:
We are currently seeking an experienced and detail-oriented mortgage loan partner for our dynamic lending team. The ideal candidate will have years of mortgage experience, a can-do attitude, and a proven track record of providing solutions in the mortgage lending industry. If you are looking for an excellent position that will help you reach your financial goals, start your application today!

Desired Skills and Experience
Qualifications
Loan Origination or Sales experience preferredSuperb analytical skills, time management skills, and attention to detailAccounting, finance, or business Associate’s degree preferred - High school diploma or GED requiredExcellent written and verbal communication skills are a requirementFHA, FHLB, FNMA, or VA loan product knowledge and mortgage lending experience required
Responsibilities
Secure property and loan documentation to process mortgage loan files such as appraisals, inspections, title searches, site surveys, contracts, and property tax recordsInput detailed loan process documentation in our system - from origination to close Assure that loan files meet banking and regulatory guidelines and policiesDetermine the best loan option for the borrower through interviewing and discussionDecide the creditworthiness and complete the mortgage loan application by working with the borrower to obtain necessary and verified financial documentation, such as credit reports

Title: MARKETING SPECIALIST IV - 64029929
JobDescription:
Requisition No: 807034Agency: Department of HealthWorking Title: MARKETING SPECIALIST IV - 64029929Position Number: 64029929Salary: $49,999-$54,999Posting Closing Date: 07/19/2023 Internal Agency Opportunity Applicants accepted only from Department of Health employees, (includes OPS, Career Service, SES or SMS employees).Applicants will not be accepted from outside of the department.Your Specific ResponsibilitiesThis position utilizes professional expertise and experience to create, design and produce marketing products for the Florida Department of health in Duval County. Through the use of technology and knowledge of marketing techniques and graphic design, the position assists the Program Managers of the Department in developing marketing and messaging materials for internal and external target audiences. Public Health Competency Domain 1:  Production of Graphic Design Assets and Communications Materials   Designs illustrations, artwork, advertising, graphics, and branded imagery to communicate the agency's key messaging.  Develops and disseminates publications, posters, reports, brochures, newsletters (Inside DOH) and other print (or digital) assets.  Plans communication/graphic pieces by gathering & referring to information provided by the individuals requesting materials.  Designs drafts of art and copy with respect to branding, color, fonts, space, and other aesthetic concepts.  Obtains approval for publishing and/or printing of materials.  Processes requests for internal and/or external customers.  Maintains a record of requests, including job scope, job status, dates, etc. 
 Public Health Competency Domain 2: INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS   Produces communications for employees in the forms of weekly newsletters, all-users emails, signage, memos, and flyers.  Writes reports and weekly updates for external partners and community leaders.  Produces other communications and reports as needed. 
 Public Health Competency Domain 3: MAINTENANCE AND DEVELOPMENT OF WEBSITE   Audits and updates the agency's website for accuracy, grammar, punctuation, branding, and consistency.  Collaborates with managers on the production of time-sensitive and mission-critical website content.  Reviews content and makes recommendations for improvement based on original findings.  Works with Information Technology, locally and at the state level, on all matters related to website maintenance and any other web-based tools or programs that affect the overall performance of the Communications department. 
 Public Health Competency Domain 5: UTILIZATION OF TECHNOLOGY, EQUIPMENT, AND PROGRAMS   Uses and stays up to date on design-specific programs such as the Adobe Creative Suite.  Operates PCs, printers, ink cartridges, copiers, laminators, paper cutters, and any other printing tools and equipment.  Ensures that all equipment operates safely and effectively. Follows machine manufacturer's instructions for use.  Performs preventative maintenance/repairs (or calls outside vendor for assistance with maintenance/repairs)  Troubleshoots machine errors when applicable.  Keeps an inventory of print supplies such as paper, ink cartridges, binders, folders, presentation materials, office items, etc.  Orders items in a timely manner.  Writes the weekly internal newsletter  Creates content for the DOH-Duval Twitter account  Answers questions that come in through the website email address Orders supplies for our department through MFMP  Writes weekly/monthly update reports  Supports PIO as back-up by responding to media requests when needed  Ensures DOH-Duval has the opportunity to shape and influence relevant discussions, planning and policies relating to public and community health.  Assists with the development and dissemination of public and community health messaging toolkits and campaigns.  Acts as a spokesperson for DOH-Duval (or arranges representation of DOH-Duval) in media interviews, relevant events, Policy forums and planning meetings.  Assists with ensuring DOH-Duval promotes a consistent message across all its representatives and communication platforms and channels.  In collaboration with the DOH-Duval Director and key team members, develops stakeholder engagement and media strategies to position DOH-Duval as the thought leader of public and community health.  Prepares, coordinates and presents briefings and policy statements and appropriate DOH-Duval updates to key stakeholders.  Raises the profile, credibility and influence of DOH-Duval with key individuals and audiences across the public, private, voluntary, government, and media sectors.  Develops and sustains beneficial relationships with a variety of key stakeholders.  Constructively engages with DOH-Duval team members to inform and build consensus for DOH-Duval's priorities and plans for engagements with stakeholders.  Provides conceptual, strategic and practical leadership and support of DOH-Duval's priorities and programs.  Ensures consistency with DOH-Duval's mission, strategies, policies and ethics during all aspects of advocacy, communications, and public affairs.  Perform other related duties as assigned. 
Knowledge Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:   Knowledge and understanding of policy development and legislation within local, slate and federal government.  Customer and personal service - knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessments, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.  Computer-knowledge of computer software including applications.  English language - knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. 
Skills  Ability to conduct executive level presentations and facilitate group discussions.  Proven negotiation and persuasion skills.  Exemplary influential skills at all levels.  Skills to analyze and provide advice on complex issues.  Excellent time management and attention to detail.  Outstanding written and oral communication skills, including experience of communicating effectively with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders.  Active listening - Gives full attention to what other people are saying, taking lime to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.  Reading comprehension - Understands written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.  Social perceptiveness - Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.  Service orientation - Actively looks for ways to help people.  Critical thinking - Uses logic and reasoning lo identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. 
Abilities  Ability to communicate appropriate, concise and accurate information in written and verbal formats.  Ability to understand the needs and priorities of customers (inside and outside the organization) and the desire to meet their expectations.  Ability to understand and interpret other people's behavior, concerns and motives.  Willingness and ability to lead, guide and motivate others toward a common goal.  Ability to build and maintain networks of business contacts in and beyond the agency.  Ability to assist team members in reaching full potential through feedback, coaching, development and training.  Ability to tackle issues in a logical, step-by-step way.  Ability to ensure accuracy and quality in work delivered.  Ability to make swift decisions and judgements even in the face of ambiguity or criticism.  Ability to pre-empt problems and seize opportunities without waiting to be told.  Ability to develop clear, efficient and logical approaches to work.  Ability to make effective and appropriate use of technical skills and knowledge.  Ability to accept change and ability to maintain effectiveness in a changing environment.  Ability to maintain control and performance during stressful situations. 
Minimum Qualifications:   Must have a minimum of five years of experience in a marketing position. 
Preference will be given to those who meet the following :  Bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, marketing or relevant field from an accredited college or university. 
Mission Florida Department of Health Mission, Vision, and Values: To protect, promote & improve the health of all people in Florida through integrated state, county & community efforts.VisionTo be the Healthiest State in the Nation.Values I  nnovation: We search for creative solutions and manage resources wisely. C  ollaboration: We use teamwork to achieve common goals & solve problems. A  ccountability: We perform with integrity & respect. R  esponsiveness: We achieve our mission by serving our customers & engaging our partners. E  xcellence: We promote quality outcomes through learning & continuous performance improvement.Where You Will Work921 N Davis StreetJacksonville, FL 32209The Benefits Of Working For The State Of FloridaWorking for the State of Florida is more than a paycheck. The State’s total compensation package for employees features a highly competitive set of employee benefits including:  Annual and Sick Leave benefits;  Nine paid holidays and one Personal Holiday each year;  State Group Insurance coverage options, including health, life, dental, vision, and other supplemental insurance options;  Retirement plan options, including employer contributions 
(For more information, please click www.myfrs.com );  Flexible Spending Accounts;  Tuition waivers;  And more! 
For a more complete list of benefits, including monthly costs, visit www.mybenefits.myflorida.com .Please Be AdvisedYour responses to qualifying questions for this position must be verifiable by documentation provided through the electronic application process.This position requires a security background check and/or drug screening and participation in direct deposit. Any misrepresentations or omissions will disqualify you from employment consideration. Note: You will be required to provide your Social Security Number (SSN) in order to conduct this background check Successful completion of a drug test is a condition of employment for safety-sensitive positions.Male applicants born on or after October 1, 1962, will not be eligible for hire or promotion unless they are registered with the Selective Services System (SSS) before their 26th birthday, or have a Letter of Registration Exemption from the SSS. For more information, please visit the SSS website: http://www.sss.govIf you are a retiree of the Florida Retirement System (FRS), please check with the FRS on how your current benefits will be affected if you are re-employed with the State of Florida. Your current retirement benefits may be canceled, suspended or deemed ineligible depending upon the date of your retirement.The successful candidate will be required to complete the Form I-9 and that information will be verified using the E-Verify system. E-Verify is operated by the Department of Homeland Security in partnership with the Social Security Administration to verify employment eligibility.Incumbents may be required to perform emergency duty before, during, and/or beyond normal work hours or days.The State of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer and does not tolerate discrimination or violence in the workplace.Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act, must notify the agency hiring authority and/or People First Service Center (1-877-562-7287). Notification to the hiring authority must be made in advance to allow sufficient time to provide the accommodation.The State of Florida supports a Drug-Free workplace. All employees are subject to reasonable suspicion drug testing in accordance with Section 112.0455, F.S., Drug-Free Workplace Act.Florida has the third largest population of veterans in the nation with more than 1.5 million service men and women. The Florida Department of Health (department) is committed to serving members of the United States Armed Forces, veterans and their families by encouraging them to apply for vacancies that fit their area of knowledge and/or expertise. Through the Department's VALOR program, which expedites licensing for military veterans, the Department also waives initial licensing and application fees for military veterans who apply for a health care professional license within 60 months of an honorable discharge. These initiatives help ensure that the transition from military service into the workforce is as smooth as possible and reflects our appreciation for the dedication devoted to protecting our country.The State of Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action Employer, and does not tolerate discrimination or violence in the workplace.Candidates requiring a reasonable accommodation, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act, must notify the agency hiring authority and/or People First Service Center (1-866-663-4735). Notification to the hiring authority must be made in advance to allow sufficient time to provide the accommodation.The State of Florida supports a Drug-Free workplace. All employees are subject to reasonable suspicion drug testing in accordance with Section 112.0455, F.S., Drug-Free Workplace Act.VETERANS’ PREFERENCE. Pursuant to Chapter 295, Florida Statutes, candidates eligible for Veterans’ Preference will receive preference in employment for Career Service vacancies and are encouraged to apply. Certain service members may be eligible to receive waivers for postsecondary educational requirements. Candidates claiming Veterans’ Preference must attach supporting documentation with each submission that includes character of service (for example, DD Form 214 Member Copy #4) along with any other documentation as required by Rule 55A-7, Florida Administrative Code. Veterans’ Preference documentation requirements are available by clicking here . All documentation is due by the close of the vacancy announcement.

Title: Publishing Assistant, Artisan Books
JobDescription:
SUMMARY:Artisan, a division of Workman within Hachette Book Group, is seeking a Publishing Assistant to support the department. This is an entry-level role that gives a 360-degree view of the publishing process as the position interacts with all departments within Artisan. Artisan publishes illustrated books to inspire and instruct, produced with great intention and quality. We specialize in cooking, design, crafts and hobbies, and expanding the boundaries of general nonfiction.Please note: this role will be based in our New York Office on a hybrid model.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Perform administrative duties, including mailings, processing book orders, scheduling, directing/responding to inquiries, and maintaining book archives. Enter, maintain, and track metadata and other key title information in our central management system. Process and track payment requests and invoices. File expense reports and reimbursements. Work with department members to create sales presentations for recurring meetings and solicit various assets used for seasonal sell-in. Interact professionally with authors and their literary agents, as well as internal departments, including design, publicity, marketing, production, and sales. Register books with the copyright office and file CIP data. Help setup digital galleys and update website information. Spearhead miscellaneous research projects, such as researching media, influencer, and brand opportunities, as well as trends and competition (including sales research on comparative book titles). 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: Detail-oriented, organized, eager to learn, and capable of multi-taskingEnjoys playing an active and collaborative role on a small teamExcellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skillsSelf-directed and able to work independently. Familiar with Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Adobe Suite, including Photoshop and InDesign, and other similar tools. 
How to apply:In order to be considered, please submit both a resume AND cover letter.As a leading book publisher, we believe that including and representing diverse voices in all aspects of our business is fundamental to what we do. Our publishing programs must reflect the broad range of backgrounds, experiences, political views and ideas that shape our society and publish books for all readers.Hachette Book Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.The compensation for this position is $47,500. Salary can vary based on a number of factors including skills, experience, and location — talk with your recruiter to learn more. There may be times that you will be required (or requested) to work overtime due to the nature of your role or exceptional workload issues or special projects.The following benefits are offered by the company: medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life, short-term and long-term disability, accidental death and dismemberment, critical illness, hospital indemnity, long-term care, health and dependent care FSA, commuter benefit plan, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, travel assistance, 401(k), discretionary bonus program, PTO (15 vacation days, 2 personal days, 10 holidays and generous sick leave) and group discounts on auto and home insurance and legal services. Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification, hours worked and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms.

Title: Merchandising Representative
JobDescription:
Job DescriptionWe are searching for a Merchandising Representative to ensures adequate inventory and accuracy of materials and products in accordance with inventory cycles and organizational philosophy for our client, a luxury jewelry company.This is a onsite, contract role with potential to become a full time position.Position Responsibilities Processing and reconciling inventory counts and annual inventoriesAccurately checking event lines returning to headquarters.Assists with the coordination and management of the silver sample inventory process.Ensure that all transactions involving the materials distribution and inventory of precious metal and gemstones are accurately accounted for.Assist with the process of pulling merchandising items including e-commerce ready for purchase. Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
About KB HomeKB Home is one of the largest and most recognized homebuilders in the United States and has built over 650,000 quality homes in our more than 60-year history. Today, KB Home operates in 45 markets from coast to coast. What sets KB Home apart is the exceptional personalization we offer our homebuyers from those buying their first home to experienced buyers allowing them to make their home uniquely their own, at a price that fits their budget. As the leader in energy-efficient homebuilding, KB Home was the first builder to make every home it builds ENERGY STAR® certified, a standard of energy performance achieved by fewer than 10% of new homes in America, and has built more ENERGY STAR certified homes than any other builder. An energy-efficient KB home helps lower the cost of ownership and is designed to be healthier, more comfortable and better for the environment than new homes without certification. We build strong, personal relationships with our customers so they have a real partner in the homebuying process. As a result, we have the distinction of being the #1 customer-ranked national homebuilder in third-party buyer satisfaction surveys. Build your career with KB Home. Learn more .JOB SUMMARY: The marketing coordinator is responsible for assisting in the coordination and administrative support of the division’s marketing strategy and plan. Working with the marketing and sales teams, this position will be responsible for assisting with the execution of community specific marketing initiatives.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesEvent Planning: Assist Marketing Leadership with coordinating community grand openings and other special events. Place food and beverage ordersOrganize communication efforts – flyers, emailsContact vendors to place orders and monitor vendor commitmentsProcess vendor check requests and vendor set-ups in the systemOrganize logistics involved with broker visits or special sales eventsAttend weekly Sales Meetings to communicate and plan for marketing events
Signage & Model Home Review Drive division communities to report on signage needs and correct any visible problemsUpdate monthly rental agreements for off-site signageConduct model home inspections and ensure all items on “check-list” are completed for public viewingCoordinate the install and move out of sales offices (signage, furniture, etc)
Administrative Update MLS system & provide weekly inventory updates for RealtorsCreate and maintain traffic reportsProvide administrative support for weekly KB Agency IO submissionsPurchase promotional items & maintain inventory of Marketing items. Keep Marketing closet organized Assist with organizing and/or retrieving inventory at warehouseOrganize and distribute mail, schedule couriers 
Marketing Calendar & Website Prepare and update marketing calendar and marketing board for Sales team (daily, weekly, monthly)Website: assist with directly updating or working with Corporate Marketing to upload needed pictures, new community information, inventory and price updates, floorplans, interactive virtual tours
Accounts Payable Prepare and Code all sales and marketing invoices Maintain monthly sales/marketing expenses via tracker
Education/Experience/Minimum RequirementsEducation:  Associates Degree in advertising, marketing, business, or communications requiredBachelor’s degree in advertising, marketing or communications preferred.
Experience Must have at least 1 year of administrative experience in a professional environment. Prior advertising experience (at least 2 years) preferred. Prior homebuilding or residential real estate experience preferred.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Strong verbal and written communication skillsMulti-task orientedStrong organizational skillsMust be proficient in Microsoft Office (at least intermediate level)Ability to work occasional weekend events/functionsSense of urgency and bias for action is essentialAbility to work well under pressure and consistently meet deadlines
Find out why KB Home is attracting and retaining the best employees! If you are interested and qualified, please apply now. KB Home provides above average compensation packages and earnings potential, full benefits, an outstanding 401K matching program, bonus plans and amazing promotional opportunities. KB Home is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse work team. Diversity is important to KB Home!

Title: Stylist
JobDescription:
JOB TITLE: Stylist‬DEPARTMENT: CreativeREPORTS TO: Executive Creative DirectorLOCATION: Splashlight Studios, 75 Varick Street, New York, NY 10013ROLE & SALARY RANGE: Full Time, Salary Range $65,000 - $80,000Job Summary‬The ideal candidate will work in partnership with teams of Photographers, Art Directors, Merchandise and Producters to ensure that the highest quality images are produced; the images created are on-brand and that they reflect the elevated standards expected of a studio team member. Part of the Stylist’s responsibilities will be to help standardize continual process improvements and styling efficiencies and work, in tandem with the Art Directors and Merchandise team, to ensure all production guidelines are followed, and timelines are met, for our high-volume retail clients. This position requires excellent attention to detail and solid on-set editorial/e-commerce shoot experience.Primary Functions Oversee daily shoots while maintaining positive energy in studio that reflects Studio values and expectationsWork closely with Photographers, Art Directors and Assistant Stylist to ensure that all products are represented accurately, creatively and are in line with brand guidelinesWork to ensure freelance stylists follow style guides and produce on-brand images Troubleshoot styling challenges on-setAnalyze studio productivity to help develop and implement process improvements Partner with Creative team to identify new ways to improve on-set efficiencyFollow studio style guide to ensure images produced are stylistically elevated but maintain brand rules and guidelinesWork with Art Directors to update style guides Strive for continual elevation of imagery utilizing Studio’s GuidesDrive expectations to support quality and productivity with FreelancersSuggest best practices and innovations in styling techniques and aestheticsHelp maintain and organize supply and prop closets
Skills And Requirements BA degree or equivalent in fashion merchandising or related field requiredMinimum 5 years of experience on-set styling in a fast paced commercial photography studio environmentA strong portfolio that demonstrates broad knowledge of styling and demonstrates expertise in applied styling techniquesUnderstanding of market trends, visual composition, and the art of aesthetic presentation Execute visually compelling styles that support brand aesthetic An awareness of contemporary trends in photography A meticulous eye for detailKnowledge of commercial studio workflowExcellent time management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously under tight deadlinesProven to be a quick problem solver Easily able to communicate creative ideas and collaborate in a team environment Also have the ability to work independently; self-motivation, with a demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment, a mustSome experience of Adobe CS and Capture One Pro is advantageous
PERKS & CULTURESplashlight offers a competitive salary and benefits package including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Parental Leave, Long and Short term Disability, Life Insurance 401K with matchingCommuter and Flex Spending Generous Vacation Policy & 10 paid holidaysPet friendly environment60,000 square feet of upbeat, stylish studio space
Our culture is founded in partnership, collaboration, and respect internally & externally.We work as a team, win as a team and help one another.Our team’s mantra - When you are strong, we are strong. Because you are Splashlight.Supplemental Application: https://forms.gle/SdxqnVY5EjSMBZMC6EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENTSplashlight is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Splashlight is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Splashlight are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Splashlight will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.About UsFounded in 2002, Splashlight (www.splashlight.com) is an innovative and industry-leading visual content partner providing strategy, creative direction, and production of photography and digital video services to the largest players in the fashion and retail industry. Splashlight has helped to perfect the e-commerce, catalog, and marketing content of many of the most successful brands in America. Current innovations include new enhancements that help clients improve the quality and performance of their visual content by using advanced measurement analytics. Splashlight has built a reputation for the finest fashion photography & video. Join us at the helm of eCommerce’s high velocity & max volume world. Splashlight is headquartered in New York City.The salary range represents the expected salary range for this role. Ultimately, compensation is determined by level of experience, location, and other job-related factors.New York, NY

Title: Cavs Crew (Entertainment Team)
JobDescription:
Cavaliers Holdings LLC is committed to delivering unparalleled sports and entertainment experiences fueled by a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. We strive to find talent that defines being the DIFF through a “Care – Lead – Engage” (CLE) philosophy across all aspects of our business. If this sounds like a culture you can thrive in, and you enjoy working in fast-pace and high energy setting, then we want to talk to YOU!Job SummaryThe Cleveland Cavaliers are searching for Cavs Crew team members to be a part of the 2023-24 season! The Cavs Crew is the official co-ed interactive entertainment team that represents the Cleveland Cavaliers organization at all Cavaliers home games and helps put on the ultimate game-night experience at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse. This team is an ideal fit for those individuals with a high-energy level who excel in a fast-paced work environment and are looking to gain experience in the sports and entertainment industry. This is a part-time position with a compensation rate of $13.50 per hour.Responsibilities Assist the Game Operations department with the preparation, planning, and execution of pre/post-game events, in-game elements, and halftime act performances among other elements.Help bring excitement and enthusiasm to the Cavaliers game-day experience by engaging with fans and creating extraordinary experiences for all guests.Assist the Game Operations department with non-game-day logistical tasks such as storage clean-up, event preparation, etc.Serve as a public-facing representative of the Cleveland Cavaliers organization and uphold the company’s core values and “ISMs” at all times.Other duties as assigned 
Qualifications A self-starter who can execute multiple tasks throughout the course of a game while also engaging with and exciting fans. A team-player who is eager to be a part of a larger working group and proactively assist fellow team members as needed.Must possess a strong focus on positive fan engagement and being friendly and helpful to all guests.  Must enjoy working with people, possess the ability to perform in front of large crowds, and have a high-energy personality.Must have the ability to carefully follow instructions and make decisions on the spot.Prior experience in live entertainment (sports, cheer, dance, theater, etc.) is preferred but not mandatory. General knowledge and enthusiasm for the Cleveland Cavaliers and/or the NBA is preferred.Willing to work nights, weekends, holidays, offseason offsite outreach/community events and other ancillary events as assigned. Must be 18 years or older by September 15th, 2023.Must be able to work at least 75% of all Cleveland Cavaliers pre-season, regular season, and post-season home games. Must be able to report to the Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse building two (2) hours before scheduled tip-off.Must have reliable transportation to and from Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse.Must be able to lift 50 lbs.
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Title: Health Communications Officer
Company: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
JobDescription: DutiesSummaryAs a global leader in public health & health promotion, CDC is the agency Americans trust with their lives. In addition to our everyday work, each CDC employee has a role in supporting public health emergency management, whether through temporary assignments to emergency responses or sustaining other CDC programs and activities while colleagues respond. Join our team to use your talent, training, & passion to help CDC continue as the world's premier public health organization. Visit www.cdc.govRequirementsQualificationsRequirements Continued: CDC Financial Disclosure -OGE form 450 Holding ourselves to a higher standard; the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention inspires public confidence in its trust responsibilities and mission by maintaining high ethical principles. This position is subject to the confidential financial disclosure requirements of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (P.L. 95-521). Therefore, if selected, you will be required to complete a Confidential Financial Disclosure Report (OGE Form 450) to determine if a conflict or an appearance of a conflict exists between your financial interest and your prospective position with the agency. This Information will be required annually. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. Public Trust/Moderate Background Investigation (5) is required. In accordance with Executive Order 12564 of September 14, 1986, The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) is A Drug-Free Federal Workplace. The Federal government, as the largest employer in the Nation, can and should show the way towards achieving drug-free workplaces through programs designed to offer drug users a helping hand, and at the same time demonstrating to drug users and potential drug users that drugs will not be tolerated in the Federal workplace. The use of illegal drugs, on or off duty, by Federal employees is inconsistent not only with the law-abiding behavior expected of all citizens, but also with the special trust placed in such employees as servants of the public. Applicants tentatively selected for this position may be required to submit to urinalysis to screen for illegal drug use prior to appointment and be subject to reasonable suspicion and post-accident drug testing upon hiring. If required to submit to urinalysis, the appointment to the position will be contingent upon a negative applicant drug test result. In order to demonstrate commitment to the HHS goal of a drug-free workplace and to set an example for other Federal employees, employees not in a testing designated position may volunteer for unannounced random testing by notifying their Drug-free Federal Workplace Program Point of Contact upon hiring. Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-14 grade level of in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience providing leadership in the development and implementation of health communication and marketing programs and/or campaigns in an effort to translate epidemiological and medical information into health messages. Documenting Experience: In accordance with Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not normally be part of the employee's position is creditable, however, when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignment. The documentation must indicate whether the duties were performed full time or, if part time, the percentage of times the other duties were performed. It is expected that this documentation is included in the employee's official personnel record. In order to receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate documentation of such experience as indicated above. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), a major operating component of the Department of Health and Human Services, is the nation's leading science-based, data-driven, service organization that protects the public's health. For more than 75 years, we have put science into action to help children stay healthy so they can grow and learn; to help families, businesses, and communities fight disease and stay strong; and to protect the public's health. In addition, CDC also has a critical preparedness and response mission: we protect the American people from health threats, research emerging diseases, and mobilize public health programs with domestic and international partners. CDC's 24/7 Emergency Operations Center (EOC) unites highly trained experts, well established processes, and state-of-the-art technology to coordinate resources and information as CDC responds to emergencies worldwide. Every CDC employee has a role in supporting public health emergency management, whether through temporary assignments to emergency responses or sustaining other CDC programs and activities while colleagues respond. CDC offers exciting and dynamic opportunities in Public Health with global impact. Examine how you can use your talent, training, and passion to help CDC continue as the world's premier public health organization. Please visit www.cdc.gov for more information.

Title: Social Media Manager
JobDescription:
ThriveMore Brands is seeking to hire a creative and strategic Social Media Marketing Manager to determine unique ways to spread awareness about our two franchise concepts, RockBox Fitness and beem™ Light Sauna, and drive potential new members to our studios.This team member will be an innovator who is responsible for developing and managing content that drives engagement, audience growth, and brand awareness. Keeping a pulse on trends, developing engaging content, and curating a “stop the scroll” feed for each of our fitness and wellness franchises will all be key roles that this person will fill. This role offers many opportunities for upward mobility at ThriveMore Brands. You’ll be expected to continually develop new skills and stay up to date with trends to enhance social media strategies. This job comes with a competitive salary and in addition to a benefits package comprising health insurance, 401K, parental leave, and more.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Curate content strategies for organic social media platforms on Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tik Tok, and LinkedIn Work with an in-house creative manager to develop engaging photo and video content.Manage social listening strategy, monitoring messages and comments on various social media platforms.Increase lead generation for studios and execute campaigns effectively, on schedule, and within budget.Track and analyze social KPIs and provide weekly/monthly insights that tailor a future strategy.Stay up to date with emerging trends, market insights, and offerings to optimize marketing tactics on organic channels.
Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelor’s in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, or related field - preferredDemonstrated measurable experience in social media marketing and content management.Proven track record in managing multiple digital resources in a complex, ever-changing environment.General understanding of high-level social media analytics.Ability and willingness to think strategically and act/implement tactically.  This is a hands-on position. Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines. 
Skills:  Very strong communication and written skillsExcellent project management skillsCampaign ManagementCopywritingExperience with prominent social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Tik Tok, and LinkedIn, Collaborative worker with a strong, collaborative initiative and worth ethic
Why Join the ThriveMore team?:ThriveMore Brands is a Health and Wellness Platform in the franchising space, comprising three brands: RockBox Fitness, beem™ Light Sauna, and Leverage Nutrition.We offer a competitive salary along with exceptional benefits & perks such as:  Unlimited PTOHybrid work environment401KPaid HolidaysHealthcare Benefits: Medical, Dental, and VisionBasic Term Life InsuranceParental Leave Free workouts Fitness casual dress codePassionate, collaborative work environmentParticipation in team building and professional development events 
Learn more about us here.

Title: Brand Specialist, Wyoming Whiskey - Jackson
JobDescription:
About EdringtonEdrington’s vision is to give more by crafting exceptional ultra-premium spirit brands. Highland Park is our central focus, supported by Highland Park and The Glenrothes in the fast-growing single malt category and Naked Malt in the blended malt category. Our portfolio is completed with The Famous Grouse Blended Scotch Whisky, Brugal premium rum from the Dominican Republic and Noble Oak American Whiskey. Edrington also has strategic partnerships for No.3 London Dry Gin, and Wyoming Whiskey.Edrington is headquartered in Scotland with global presence in its wholly owned and joint venture companies. We own our route to market in 15 countries and distribute our brands to more than 100 countries around the world through joint ventures and third-party agreements.Edrington’s principal shareholder is The Robertson Trust, which has donated £301 million to charitable causes in Scotland since 1961. Our business is underpinned by the Edrington values of giving, respect, integrity and excellencePosition SummaryThe Brand Specialist is responsible for driving Wyoming Whiskey brand knowledge and confidence within the on and off trade in Jackson.They have the mission to segment the market and identify where Wyoming Whiskey is present and activated and identify opportunities to drive brand engagement.Job Description Deliver bespoke education for Wyoming Whiskey and build elevated brand confidence within priority trade accounts and local wholesalers, inspiring brand advocacy and ensuring front of mind presence.Introduce new Wyoming Whiskey releases to all accounts where applicable.Work collaboratively to identify opportunities of brand presence in the area and recommend change as required.Regular updates to local marketing and commercial teams on Wyoming Whiskey performance in the On and Off trades. Build relationships and the trust of key decision makers (e.g., beverage directors, buyers, and leading bar staff).Create and demonstrate Wyoming Whiskey serves and rituals to priority On Trade accounts.Work with Wyoming Whiskey marketing team to implement a range of marketing activations and communications that are in line with brand DNA and objectives.Collaborate with Wyoming Whiskey Regional Education Manager and actively contribute as part of the global education, marketeer, and commercial network.Identify key brand building initiatives for Wyoming Whiskey in collaboration with local commercial teams.The management and most efficient use of their annual T&E and activation budgets.Report on Trade Activity through Salesforce and Share of Recommendation.
Skills And Experience Previous experience of commercial, trade or brand ambassador roles, ideally with prestige brands.Understanding of the luxury market in the context of distribution and route to market strategies.Exceptional communication skills, with tact and diplomacy to deal with external parties.Self-driven with good organizational and prioritizing skills.Suitably presented/polished to represent a luxury brand.Strong commercial awareness.Experience of working in an international organization would be advantageous.
Benefits And Perks 25 days of paid time-off, 8 paid holidays, end of the year break and office closes every Friday at 1PM100% employer paid health benefits for employee and dependentsCompetitive 401K company matchEmployer paid Short & Long Term Disability and basic Life InsurancePre-tax benefitsMentoringGlobal Wellbeing program
Equal opportunitiesEdrington provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to general legal requirements, Edrington complies with applicable federal, state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
