Title: Virtual Data Entry Specialist - Entry Level (Remote)
JobDescription:
Title: Join Our Remote Team as a Data Entry Specialist!Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to kickstart your career in data entry? Look no further! We are seeking talented individuals to join our remote team as Data Entry Specialists. This entry-level position will provide you with the perfect platform to gain valuable experience and grow within our organization. If you are detail-oriented, organized, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this role is perfect for you!Responsibilities: Accurately input and update data into our systems, databases, and spreadsheets.Verify the accuracy of entered data and perform regular quality checks to ensure data integrity.Maintain confidentiality and adhere to company policies while handling sensitive information.Organize and categorize data to facilitate easy retrieval and analysis.Collaborate with team members and provide support in data-related tasks as needed.Identify and report any data inconsistencies or errors promptly.Follow established guidelines and protocols for data entry procedures.
Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent qualification; further education or certification in data entry or related field is a plus.Strong attention to detail and exceptional accuracy in data entry.Proficient in using spreadsheet software such as Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize tasks effectively.Solid written and verbal communication skills.Strong computer literacy and familiarity with data entry software or tools.Ability to maintain focus and productivity in a remote work environment.Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
Benefits: Remote work opportunity: Enjoy the flexibility and convenience of working from the comfort of your own home.Growth and development: Gain hands-on experience and build a strong foundation in data entry.Career advancement: Show your skills and dedication, and unlock opportunities for professional growth within our organization.Supportive work environment: Join a team of friendly and talented professionals who value collaboration and open communication.Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary package commensurate with your skills and experience.Work-life balance: Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with flexible working hours.Learning resources: Access a variety of learning materials and training programs to enhance your skills and knowledge.
If you are passionate about data entry and ready to embark on a fulfilling career journey, we want to hear from you! Apply now and become a valued member of our remote data entry team. Let's work together to make a positive impact in the world of data!
Skills: Attention to Detail, Communication, Confidentiality, Data Entry, Databases, Google Sheets, Online Data Entry, Oral Communication, Sensitive Information, Spreadsheets

Title: Jr Data Entry Assistant - Part Time (Remote)
JobDescription:
Job Title: Remote Data Entry AssistantAre you a detail-oriented individual with excellent organizational skills? Do you thrive in a remote work environment? We have an exciting opportunity for an entry-level Remote Data Entry Assistant to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Data Entry Assistant, you will play a crucial role in maintaining accurate and up-to-date information in our systems. This is a remote position that allows you to work from the comfort of your own home, providing you with flexibility and work-life balance.Responsibilities: Inputting and updating data accurately and efficiently into our database systems.Verifying and reviewing data for completeness and accuracy, making necessary corrections when needed.Conducting research and gathering information from various sources to ensure data integrity.Sorting, organizing, and maintaining physical and electronic files for easy access.Assisting in the creation and modification of spreadsheets, documents, and presentations.Collaborating with team members to ensure timely completion of projects.Following data entry protocols and best practices to maintain data security and confidentiality.Communicating any discrepancies or issues with data to the appropriate personnel.Adhering to strict deadlines and managing multiple tasks effectively.
Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent (additional certifications or coursework in data entry is a plus).Proven experience in data entry or related administrative roles is desirable but not required.Proficient computer skills, including familiarity with spreadsheet software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets) and word processing software (e.g., Microsoft Word, Google Docs).Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and information management.Excellent organizational and time management skills to prioritize tasks effectively.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team.Reliable internet connection and a suitable home office setup.Strong commitment to maintaining data privacy and confidentiality.
Benefits: Remote work opportunity: Enjoy the flexibility and convenience of working from home.Work-life balance: Set your own schedule and manage your workload efficiently.Professional growth: Gain valuable experience in data entry and develop your skills in a supportive and collaborative environment.Entry-level position: Perfect for those seeking to kickstart their career in data entry or administration.Competitive compensation: Receive a competitive salary based on your skills and qualifications.Opportunity for advancement: Demonstrate your abilities and take on more challenging responsibilities within the company.Training and mentorship: Receive guidance and support from experienced professionals in the field.Join a dynamic team: Be part of a vibrant and diverse team that values innovation, teamwork, and continuous improvement.
If you are ready to embark on a rewarding career as a Remote Data Entry Assistant and have a passion for accuracy and efficiency, we would love to hear from you! Apply today with your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the role. Join us in our mission to maintain high-quality data and contribute to the success of our organization.
Skills: Attention to Detail, Communication, Confidentiality, Data Entry, Data Privacy, Database Systems, Databases, Organization Skills, Spreadsheets, Virtual Assistance

Title: Product Developer
JobDescription: About UsPeak Design makes radical, meticulously-engineered gear for detail-obsessed people. Our backpacks, travel bags, camera gear, and phone accessories are used dang-near everywhere. If you’ve visited Machu Picchu, Tokyo, or an REI store in the last 10 years, you’ve been within ogling distance of a Peak Design product.Alongside our award-winning gear is a brand that truly reflects who we are as people—passionate about design, deeply caring about our environmental and social impact, unafraid to speak up, radically transparent, and generally down to clown. Whether we’re explaining a product , running a sale , launching a nonprofit , sponsoring a film , or razzing the biggest company on Earth , we do it with our trademark honesty, warmth, and wit. Through our products and our brand, we aim to create delight, and leave this world better than how we found it.About The JobWe are seeking a talented Soft Goods Product Developer to join our team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our Product Designers, Project Managers, external manufacturers, and suppliers to ensure the successful mass production of our new soft goods product designs. Additionally, you will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and improving our existing product lines throughout their lifespan.We require someone who is driven to bring challenging and unconventional designs to production within tight timelines. Functionality, beauty, and cost are equally important considerations to us, as we aim to create the most functional and aesthetically pleasing carry solutions in the world. We are looking for someone who is passionate about building top-of-the-line gear.We currently have three new product lines under development that incorporate soft goods, along with an existing bag business valued at over $42 million that requires ongoing maintenance. Two of the product lines in development combine soft goods with hardware.As a member of our small and flexible team, you will have a voice in shaping the design and story" of our new products. However
Date: your main focus will be on the development and execution of each product design. If you are up for the challenge
Skills: we invite you to join us in redefining the world of soft goods.What You’ll Do:  Play a critical role in the product creation process by building and maintaining Bills of Materials (BOM’s) and Technical Specifications throughout the prototyping process from concept to mass production. Support the product creation process by facilitating communication between a wide range of talented human beings
Salary: from visionary designers to efficiency-driven suppliers. Ensure projects run on time by collaborating on development calendars and communicating schedules to internal teams and external vendors. Apply your technical knowledge of soft goods product construction and materials to drive improvements to quality and efficiency while identifying opportunities for sustainability improvements. Set the bar high for quality by establishing comprehensive quality control documents and inspection plans with our trusted suppliers. Create and execute product testing plans to ensure ambitious performance and quality goals are met and our customers are delighted with their gear. Discover cost-down and functional improvement opportunities
column12: materials
column14: bringing their creative visions to life by delivering support documents to technical drawing packages that wow our manufacturing partners. Organize and maintain critical documentation and communications related to product manufacturing
column15: playing a vital role in our success.

JobId: About YouThe following list represents a range of traits and experience that would help make you highly effective and impactful in this role:  Have at least 5 years of experience working with soft goods vendors to bring products to mass production for consumers. Have experience throughout all phases of the product creation process and an established track record in bringing products to market. Are a natural collaborator that thrives when bringing together teams with a wide range of skill sets ranging all the way from visionary designers to efficiency-driven factory managers. Have a strong proficiency in building soft goods drawing packages
Title: also known as "Tech Packs
Company:
using the power of Adobe Illustrator. The quicker and more accurate, the better! Take pride in your ability to work within structured product development systems, ensuring every crucial step is followed on the path to final mass production. Phase gate systems and PLM (product lifecycle management) will be your allies. Have a broad range of software-related skills sets and are proficient with spreadsheets and knowledgeable with Adobe Illustrator and CAD software used for technical artwork.. Are comfortable in a shop environment and happy to get your hands dirty improving a prototype or creating an in-house test. Have expertise in setting up quality control expectations and documentation, ensuring the highest level of product quality at our manufacturing partners. Employ a solid understanding of softgoods-related construction methods and can leverage it toward building detail-oriented quality control-related documentation for overseas vendors. Able to travel to Asia, including countries like China, Vietnam, and potentially others in the future,3 to 6 times per year. Trips generally last around 7 to 14 days each, and will be dedicated to development and production. Local to the San Francisco Bay Area (or willing to relocate for this role) and willing to work from our office/workshop in the Dogpatch neighborhood a minimum of 2-3 days per week (i.e. this is not a remote role, though we do maintain flexibility).
Note that while these skills are valuable, they are not absolute requirements. If you possess the necessary drive and determination, we're open to being convinced of your capabilities.NOT REQUIRED, BUT ALWAYS VALUED:  You use and care a lot about gear (photography, outdoor, or other passion areas). You have strong opinions about the products that you use in your life and enjoy debating what makes these products great. You’re a systems thinker and love optimizing workflow and efficiency - you are capable of navigating surprise roadblocks with rational thinking and problem solving. You have prior experience with enterprise-level product lifecycle management software.
$120,000 - $160,000 a yearCompensationWhen we find the right candidate, we strive to extend an offer that’s exciting and competitive. We consider the skills and experience you bring, market data for your role, level, and location - and equitability across these areas as defined by our compensation philosophy.The base salary for this role is targeted between $120,000-$160,000 USD. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary from the amounts listed above.INTERVIEW PROCESSHere’s what you can expect:  Written application - online. Initial screen + take home assignment - phone - 30 min. Team member interviews - Zoom - 60 min. Final round interviews - Zoom or in person - 120+ min.
What We Offer  100% covered employee premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options Life/AD&D, long-term disability, and short-term disability coverage Generous mental health and fertility health reimbursement options 401(k) plan with employer matching Unlimited PTO policy, 12 paid company holidays, and flexible work schedules 100% paid parental leave Peak Design product and exclusive industry discounts Monthly cell phone reimbursement Pre-tax commuter benefits Annual career development stipend Charitable donation program with employer matching Quarterly onsite or offsite collaboration weeks with the whole Peak Design team
WHY US?Thanks to the folks at Outside Magazine, we can tell you that Peak Design is an objectively great place to work. Why? We provide opportunities to go deep in your craft, work both autonomously and collaboratively, drive your professional growth, and recharge with flexible Fridays and unlimited paid time off -- the saucy list of perks and benefits goes on. So, how do we maintain this exquisite way of working while also pulling off an exceptionally thoughtful brand and product line? A close-knit culture that values transparency, community, trust, and questioning the status quo.Many employees find the way we run our business to be radically different from what they’ve experienced elsewhere. You might call it the opposite of micromanagement: employees are often expected to set their own priorities and roadmaps for their areas of the business. Who thrives here? Self-starters. Question-askers. People who make their own to-do lists. Folks who can do a little bit of everything. People who aren’t afraid to get their hands dirty with nitty-gritty details in order to see a vision through.If you prefer to work in a more traditional corporate environment, Peak Design might not be the place for you. But if you’re pickin’ up what we’re putting down, we look forward to hearing from you!DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION & BELONGINGAt Peak Design we believe a diverse team is an innovative team and something worth celebrating. A range of perspectives and backgrounds creates a stronger and more creative work environment (not to mention more fun). We’re committed to equality and inclusivity across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience.Some candidates may see a long list of job requirements and feel discouraged because they don’t match every single bullet point – we strongly encourage you to apply anyway! If what we do resonates with you, and you feel excited and able to contribute, we’re equally stoked for the opportunity to engage with you.ACCOMODATIONSPeak Design provides reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in the job application and interview process (including if you have any difficulty using our online system). If you need such an accommodation, please complete the application form below.

Title: & Other Stories Retail Sales Ambassador
JobDescription: Company Description& Other Stories is a fashion brand offering women a wide range of shoes, bags, accessories, jewelery, lingerie, beauty products, stationary and ready-to-wear to create their personal style, or story. Our creative ateliers in Paris, Los Angeles and Stockholm design diversified fashion collections with great attention to detail and quality at an affordable price.& Other Stories is an inclusive and welcoming workplace where great challenges and opportunities are offered to you to grow and where we win together. You encourage and contribute to the shared responsibility of creating and protecting an inclusive and welcoming workplace where everyone can self-identify.We offer a work environment where culture and values play a big part in everything we do. We have a flexible attitude and value an entrepreneurial spirit. We want every employee to take ownership of the brand’s success and believe that a fun working place generates great results.Additional InformationYou are guided by our values in all that you do, and together with your colleagues you are responsible for keeping the values alive and as a guide in your everyday work.Compensation:Sales Associates Start at $17.00 per hour**Benefits: & Other Stories believes in rewarding our employees for their many contributions to our shared success. That’s why we offer a full range of inclusive benefits that enable wellness, both in and outside of work. We pride ourselves on being a do-good company and we have a comprehensive benefit package that matches that ambition. Plus, additional Voluntary Benefits.Our career site will have more details, check out: https://careers.smartrecruiters.com/HMGroup/other-stories This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. This range may be modified in the future.

Title: Copywriter - eCommerce Marketing Agency
JobDescription:
The main purpose of the Copywriter is to work on copy-related tasks for your assigned clients and stores as part of the Service Department, with the responsibility to create quality, effective, well-written, error-free, and impactful email marketing campaigns that convert and drive sales for our clients.As our Copywriter, this will include writing the copy for a variety of clients’ marketing campaigns in a way that reflects their message, brand, and tone of voice, while also coming up with innovative and catchy copy ideas for clients’ marketing campaigns, and ensuring that your copywriting work is of the highest standard and delivered on time. This includes working on copy tasks such as email banners, SMS/MMS graphics, and a variety of marketing flows and campaigns.Mission statement:The primary mission of our Copywriter is to maintain the high copy standards of our company by playing an active role in the copy creation and editing process across our range of clients and for our internal marketing material.About UsHustler Marketing is a world-class email marketing agency. We customize plans of attack for each of our clients to help them double or even triple their email revenue.HM is made up of 100+ people from around the world. We work remotely, yet we’re most proud of our ability to crush it as a cohesive team. We’re team-minded, and strive to create a culture where each person is encouraged to do their best.As for clients, our list is incredibly diverse, with stores ranging from 300K-20M/year in revenue in nearly every niche you can think of.We know that becoming the best agency begins with having the best team members—which is why we might just be looking for you!Responsibilities Creating high-quality, on-brand copy for your assigned clients’ email campaigns and flows, as well as SMS/MMS campaigns and flows using various professional writing tools (including the Google Workspace Suite, Grammarly, and other writing tools), when and as directed by Account ManagersCreating and developing marketing-oriented and effective copy decks that are focused on conversionsAssisting with various copywriting tasks as part of the Copy TeamUnderstanding the written brand identity of various clients and being able to advise your Account Managers on potential copy ideas, improvements, and optimizationsUnderstanding and communicating copy ideas (in writing and verbally) to other team members and (potentially) clients, when required to do soReceiving and implementing feedback and copy changes to projects you’ve worked onBeing part of a team of both expert and less experienced copywriters and being able to work as a group if needed, and being able to stick to deadlines and deliver high-quality finished copy decks on timeBeing open to learning how to effectively and productively use new tools, while maintaining a great ability to effectively use all aspects of Google Docs, Asana, Hubstaff and using copywriting tools to improve your own copyWriting the copy for our company’s marketing efforts, when needed (including SMSs, MMSs, emails, flows, blog posts, social media content, and email marketing assets)Constantly educating yourself and developing your writing and editing skills to enhance your expertiseWorking on various tasks, initiatives, and projects as delegated by our Head of CopyContinuously working to improve the results from email marketing for your assigned clients using your copy skillsWorking with the Service Department to maintain high copy standards and ensuring that the set targets for your assigned clients are met in terms of their copy requirementsParticipating in the training and skill-building sessions for the Copy Team within the Service Department to improve their skills, performance, and overall expertiseParticipating in the Copy Team's group callsContinuously working to discover industry-wide best practices and standards and present your findings to the Copy Lead, the Head of Copy, and the Service DirectorBeing available to assist with all internal copy-related needs from other departmentsDirectly reporting to the Head of Copy and the Service Director (in that structural order)
Requirements At least 12 months of experience working as a Copywriter in a professional role or similar experience in a copywriting role at another agency (Preference will be given to candidates who have worked with remote teams and team members from different countries or have agency experience)Experience using Klaviyo or having any agency experience is considered a plusHaving an established copywriting portfolio showcasing elevated, effective, and on-brand copy written for a variety of clients, stores, and nichesMust possess the ability to create copy for a variety of clients, regardless of their brand and nicheStrong writing and communication skills to be able to create and deliver quality marketing contentHave the ability to take action and work fast to implement changes and solve copy-related problemsMust possess strong communication, presentation, organizational, time management, and interpersonal skills to effectively deliver work of high quality promptlyShould be able to perform both repetitive and miscellaneous tasks while maintaining a high level of accuracy in your workMust be highly accountable, responsive, and have an excellent ability to meet deadlinesGreat aptitude for working with people, problem-solving, and thinking critically / analyticallyPossesses a growth and results-driven mindset, and can handle and implement constructive criticismAny remote work experience is a major advantageExcellent interpersonal skills to clearly and effectively communicate with clients as well as marketing professionals in our Service DepartmentFamiliarity with working autonomously and managing your time (remote work experience is a plus)Must be available and responsive during office hours (Mondays to Fridays between 3-6 PM BCN time)Must consistently work 25-30 hours per week (i.e, 120 hours per month)Must have a stable internet connection and a laptop or PC, as well as be able to attend virtual video conferencesExcellent verbal and written communication skills in English (you must be fluent in English, although English doesn't have to be your native language)Being open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism and improving on it, as well as giving feedback of similar nature productively to your team

Title: Project Coordinator
JobDescription:
FASTSIGNS International, Inc. is the largest sign and visual communications franchisor in North America. We provide comprehensive visual marketing solutions and help companies of all sizes and across all industries attract more attention, communicate their message, sell more products, help visitors find their way and extend their branding across all of their customer touch points including décor, events, wearables and marketing materials.We are hiring a Project Coordinator to work closely with our National Account customers. From receiving new inquiries, managing and relaying order information internally, to providing an excellent customer experience, you will play an integral role in our operation.The ideal candidate will be highly organized with a knack for paying attention to the details. This position is ideal to learn the ropes of project management and has a direct growth path into a Project Manager position.This is a full-time, hourly position with a Monday through Friday schedule, working between hours of 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.Key Responsibilities:  Receive and review new inquiries and orders Communicate with customers about sign programs and answer any questions Enter new jobs into the project management software and create a scope of work based on the type of jobResearch and select franchisee or subcontractors to complete the work Contact landlords for sign criteria, insurance requirements, and property use-/ subcontractor regulations as needed Maintain accurate data and statutes within project management software Assist team and complete other related tasks as needed 
Qualifications: High School Diploma/GED required Some project management and/or sign experience preferredHighly organized and detail-orientedExcellent Written and Verbal Communication Skills 
Benefits & Perks:  Amazing work environment, lots of fun, company-sponsored events throughout the yearHealth benefitsCompany 401(k) Paid Time Off 
EEO Statement EEO Statement FASTSIGNS International, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, FASTSIGNS International, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.FASTSIGNS International, Inc. expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of FASTSIGNS International Inc.’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be added at any time with or without notice.

Title: Visual Merchandising Keyholder
JobDescription:
Company DescriptionWE ARE MORE THAN JUST A CLOTHING BRAND; WE ARE ON A MISSION TO TRANSFORM THE FUTURE OF FASHIONAre you looking for a company that pushes the boundaries and creates a community inclusive of everyone? A shared vision beyond only us?If you answered yes, why not join us? This could be your first step towards a new and exciting career at COS!About COS: Offering innovative design, elevated essentials and wardrobe icons, COS is a fashion brand rooted in contemporary culture. From the beginning, our design ethos has always put lasting style, quality and sustainability first. Today 92% of the materials in our collection are more sustainably sourced.COS, alongside Arket, Monki, Weekday, Afound, & Other Stories and H&M, is one of several unique brands that make up the H&M group. The H&M Group employs over 170,000 people in 74 markets across the globe, and we are the 2nd largest fashion company in the world. Since launching COS in 2007, we have opened more than 200 stores worldwide.What we value most: Alignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviours that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are open-minded and curious, we dare to be different, we believe in constant improvement and we empower and trust you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.At COS we love welcoming new people and work hard to provide an environment where everyone feels appreciated and valued. We celebrate individual differences and recognise the contribution that all our colleagues make, regardless of their background.Job DescriptionToday we are looking for a Visual Key holder to join our talented team in Atlanta. This role will be full time for 32h-40hr per week and includes shifts at weekends and evenings.Although no two days are ever the same, there are some things that you can expect to be involved in as a Visual Merchandiser include Offering customers a high level of service, through styling advice, product knowledge and store experience Analyse selling information and take responsibility for the visual direction of the store Installing window displays Creating inspiring outfits and styling mannequins Merchandising stock on the shop floor Support the sales staff with store operations Set the visual merchandising standard for the store and train other managers and staff Being a COS brand ambassador and providing the best experience for our customers. 
QualificationsTo work as a Visual Key holder, you should have some previous visual merchandising experience plus the qualities below. Approximately 1 year experience as a visual merchandiser or visual assistant Good communication skills Customer focused & Good commercial abilities Self-motivated, adaptable & positive A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Excellent planning and organisational skills Creative mindset & interest in keeping updated with the latest trends, competitors 
Ability to work a flexible schedule including early mornings, weekends and evenings when requiredAdditional InformationWhy You’ll Love Working for COS Dynamic, team-driven work environment with a group of unique, diverse, and kind individuals. Endless growth & development opportunities Dress your personality. We encourage you to dress your personality all day, every day. Did we mention our discount at H&M, &Other Stories, and COS? 
Compensation:Hiring range: $18.00 - $18.37HourlyBenefits:COS believes in rewarding our employees for their many contributions to our shared success. That’s why we offer a full range of inclusive benefits that enable wellness, both in and outside of work.  We pride ourselves on being a do-good company and we have a comprehensive benefit package that matches that ambition.  Please note, benefits may have eligibility requirements based on employment status.We offer: 25% Staff Discount - Medical, Pharmacy Vision and Dental Coverage – Employee Assistance Program - Vacation, Wellness, Holiday and Parental Pay – 401K – Commuter Benefits, Health and Dependent Care FSA. Plus, additional Voluntary Benefits.Ready to apply? Click on the I’M INTERESTED link where you can upload your CV securely. Once we have received your application, we will keep you updated regularly about the status of your application. The two stages of a successful recruitment process will include a short telephone interview followed by an interview/group interview in the store. Should you require any adjustment to this process, please let the recruiter know who will be happy to discuss this
Skills: Customer-Focused Service, Inspiration, Merchandising, Product Knowledge, Styling, Visual Direction, Visual Merchandising, Wardrobe, Window, Window Displays

Title: Spa Regional Director
Company: Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa - Weston, FL
JobDescription:
Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa is a national franchise with over 550 locations in Florida. The Southern Florida region is seeking an experienced and dedicated Regional Spa Director to join our growing team!The Leadership Team at Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa is dedicated to providing outstanding customer service in a team-oriented fashion. This is a full-time position with opportunities to earn competitive performance-based bonuses. The ideal candidate for this job will possess strong communication and organizational skills, with the ability to motivate and support employees to peak performance in a fast-paced environment.The primary duties for the Regional Spa Director are: Develop growth strategy and action plans for overall sales in each department Create and aid in implementation of sales goals for Management teamPerform ongoing hiring and training of Management team Oversee implementation of Spa protocols and procedures Maintain brand standards for protocols, policies, spa décor, dress code, and moreWork with Marketing and Advertising department on generating leads Build standard operating procedures for ordering and inventory Oversee all social media platforms and daily content Public Relations and Human Resources Recruiting Strategies and maintenance for all departments Vendor negotiations and agreementsOversee bi-weekly payrollMonthly assessment of employee files Maintain communication with team members to ensure the smooth day to day operations of the SpaOther duties and projects as assigned by Owners
Experience and skill requirements: 5+ years of high-level Regional Sales experience Availability to travel to multiple locations in Southern FloridaAvailability to work some weekends and evenings A dynamic leader who can guide team members to operate at peak efficiencyPossess excellent communication and organizational skillsA self-starter who enjoys working with the public in a fast-paced environmentAble to multi-task and work with minimal supervisionShows proficiency in Microsoft office suite and other basic computer and mathematic skills
Benefits: Competitive monthly and annual bonuses 401k with 4% company contributionHealth Insurance allowance*Paid time offFree servicesDiscounted productsCompany advancement 
 Salary: Base salary range is between $70,000 and $85,000 depending on experienceTotal compensation package opportunity $125,000+
If you meet the above requirements and feel you would make a great addition to the team, please send a current resume, cover letter, and 3 professional references.I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with an independently owned and operated Hand and Stone franchisee, a separate company and employer from Hand and Stone Franchise Corp. and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Hand and Stone Franchise Corp. does not accept, review or store my application. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand and Stone franchisee.

Title: Real Estate Agent Executive Assistant
JobDescription:
As an Executive Assistant, you will provide comprehensive administrative support to a senior executive, ensuring smooth and efficient operations. Your role will be pivotal in coordinating internal operations, liaising with clients, organizing meetings, and facilitating communication.Responsibilities Manage the executive's daily calendar, including scheduling appointments and coordinating logistics for meetings.Act as the initial point of contact, responding professionally to both internal and external inquiries.Prepare and manage various reports related to real estate transactions.Assist in planning and organizing events, and manage special projects as required.Facilitate internal communication procedures, meetings, and conferences.Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.Coordinate travel arrangements when necessary.
Qualifications Proven experience as an Executive Assistant.Knowledge of the real estate industry is highly desirable.Outstanding organizational and time management skills.Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong problem-solving ability with a proactive approach to tasks.

Title: Event Coordinator for Real Estate Team
JobDescription:
We are the #1 residential real estate team in Utah and our fast-growing team is seeking an experienced, energetic, and detail-oriented Event Coordinator to manage and execute various internal and external events. This is an exciting opportunity for an individual passionate about creating memorable experiences, fostering team cohesion, and ensuring client satisfaction.Responsibilities Plan, coordinate, and execute multiple team event per year. Team events will involve only our team members and will aim to foster team unity and camaraderie.Organize and facilitate multiple client events per year, which may involve coordinating with external entities such as sports event organizers. These events will aim to engage and entertain our clients, helping to build and maintain strong relationships.Arrange lunch-and-learn events, involving logistics for catering, securing speakers, and promoting employee participation. These sessions should be educational and engaging, providing our team members with valuable insights and knowledge relevant to their roles.Handle all event logistics, including venue selection, negotiating with vendors, arranging food and beverages, managing guest lists, and coordinating event promotions.Handle any issues or emergencies that arise during the planning process or event itself promptly and professionally.
Requirements Proven experience as an event coordinator.Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends as needed for event preparation and execution.Work well under pressure.
Why You'll Love Working With UsWe are a vibrant and young team of 80 real estate agents committed to not only providing exceptional service to our clients but also to fostering a supportive and enjoyable work environment for our team, clients, and community. We believe in work-life balance, continuous learning, and fun in the workplace.

Title: Account Manager
JobDescription:
We are growth-minded industry disruptors who happen to do staffing. Our success isn’t just about the bottom line as we work to innovate the way staffing is done, but it is also about remaining agile in this increasingly automated technical, digital landscape.We are technologists with the nuanced expertise to do tech, digital marketing, & creative staffing differently. Every day, we’re providing critical solutions for some of the world’s most innovative and demanding companies, delivering expectation-exceeding resultsWe thrive on our entrepreneurial spirit and encourage you to take your career path into your hands. Our core values, Mindset, Accountability, and Process (MAP) guide our personal and professional growth and success.With a significant track record of promoting from within, growth opportunities, uncapped earning potential and on-demand skills development, become part of our team to level up your career.ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES The Account Manager position is a full-cycle sales role in which you’ll be responsible for business development, account management, and client retention. Day to day responsibilities consist of driving net new business using a multi-pronged approach of cold calling, LinkedIn research, and outreach to drive automation and reach predetermined targets.
 Developing new clients while maintaining and expanding relationships with existing clients and following up with key decision makers.
 Keeping a finger on the pulse of the industry: identifying opportunities, issues, and trends to help our business stay on the forefront of innovation and talent demand.
 Working well within a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a sense of urgency.
 Attending daily meetings designed to foster collaboration and communication between teams.
 We are a metrics-driven environment. You will be responsible for driving activity and achieving attainable KPIs on a daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly basis.
 Your ramp-up period will be business development-focused as you build your book of business through cold calling, networking, prospecting, and sourcing.
EXPERIENCE REQUIRED TO JOIN MONDO Passionate individual who embraces learning
 Desire to succeed in a performance driven culture
 Motivated by uncapped commission
 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
 Growth mindset
 Hands-on, roll-up-your-sleeves, jump-in, and get-it-done type of person
WHY OUR STAFF LOVES WORKING FOR MONDO Career development opportunities: YOU are a pioneer. This position is starting on the ground floor. Down the line, you will have the opportunity to grow within the company and expand your horizons.
 Fast-Track your success: With our proven Career Mapping we encourage personal and professional growth that will allow you to build the future of your career in as little time as possible.
 Mentorships: Learn from the best during hands-on, weekly one-on-one coaching sessions with Mondo’s biggest heavy hitters.
 Perks: Phone Expense, Gym Discounts, Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits, 401k Plan, Paid Vacation, Access to Mental Health Support, Free Headspace Membership and more!
 Flex Fridays: Based upon your cumulative results, you’ll have the opportunity to “flex” on Friday to get some down time after a week of hustle.
 Uncapped Earning Potential: Base salary plus uncapped commission means no draw and no minimum. You make money on every deal you close, meaning the sky’s the limit.
 Team-building: Enjoy team challenges, team swag, bonus incentives, and more...
 Training Programs: Learn from our experienced training team who have walked the walk in a hands-on environment to give you a road map to success starting day one.
 Continued Education: Training continues far beyond onboarding. Learn from industry experts with role and technology-specific content.
Are you ready to conquer the market with Mondo?Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision Benefits, 401k Plan, Paid Vacation, Access to Mental Health Support and more!

Title: Litigation Associate
JobDescription: Martin, Magnuson, McCarthy & Kenney is seeking a litigation attorney to work defending medical providers and institutions in medical malpractice claims. The firm is widely recognized as one of the leading civil trial firms in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Since 1957, our attorneys have established a distinguished record of success at trial and on appeal. This is a unique opportunity to engage in a dynamic area of the law with regular exposure to some of the premier medical professionals in the field. You will be called upon to represent clients in all phases of litigation. Your responsibilities will include direct interaction with medical providers, preparing and answering discovery, conducting depositions, court appearances, interviewing and retaining expert witnesses, and preparing for and participating in trials. You will work directly with a senior partner, and you will have an opportunity to grow your own practice.This is a full-time position with a competitive salary and benefits package. At least one full year of experience in handling professional liability or insurance-based claims or in the health care industry is required. The candidate also must possess excellent oral advocacy and writing skills and be self-motivated with a desire to achieve great outcomes for our clients. Massachusetts bar license required. Qualified applicants please submit a cover letter, resume and writing sample to soshea@mmmk.com. No telephone calls please.

You will be a vital part of a firm that specializes in the design, production, and fulfillment of Point of Purchase Displays and Retail Packaging. You will be responsible for the design and production of cost-effective displays that support and build our customer's brands.Responsibilities: Plan, implement, and maintain complex projects with multiple stakeholders, including vendors & customers.Operate within our APEX procedures and framework to ensure consistency, transparency, and repeatability.Manage deadlines and proactively ensure that cost targets are met.Maintain all required project documentation - costing, artwork, client requirement, etc.Serve as the critical link and liaison between internal, vendor-facing, and client-facing aspects of projects.

We complement this with our vast manufacturing capabilities. We also execute the assembly, pack out, warehousing, and shipping required from our own QAI Organic Certified facility.

Title: Hospitality Coordinator starting at $16.00 hourly (FT 9 am - 5:30 pm)
JobDescription:
Company DescriptionDo you have HEART? We are looking for individuals who can embrace our mission to purposely brighten and enrich the lives of those we serve with HEART; Hospitality, Excellence, Appreciation, Respect & Teamwork. In this role you will be responsible for promoting and creating a culture of hospitality. Reporting to the community's Executive Director, you will manage the community's first impressions and signature services, lead the development and training of staff to enhance the hospitality culture, assist in welcoming new residents and staff to the community, assist with resident programming, events, and special resident requests.Job Description Assist the community’s team members in the achievement of the community’s First Impression goals and help the community’s staff understand how their roles relate to the successful execution of the First Impression.Assist the community’s staff in understanding the most hospitable way to interact with anyone who enters the community, by developing the tools necessary for hospitable customer interaction.Adhere to one standard, every area be it the front of the house or back of the house should be held to the same level of scrutiny. Maintain an excellent level of hospitality/cleanliness in the Tour Path, by making sure the proper items, events, and interactions (i.e. flowers, photographs, cooking demonstrations, recognition of guest by name by staff) are in place at all times and all events (resident activities/major or minor building repairs) are coordinated appropriately.Deliver the Senior Lifestyle Corporation’s Signature Services and understand that it is a key component to the community’s image. These Signature Services help differentiate the community from its competitors by enhancing the community’s image and level of service. Play an integral role in the Employee On-Boarding process, by acting as a liaison between the Human Resources Department and the new hire, as well as helping reinforce the expectations/standards that are set for the on-boarding process. Work with the Dining Staff to support a polished hospitality approach to dining room service.Assist in the coordination and oversight during special community events. Let the Community’s residents, residents’ families, or out-side entity know that you are there to help fulfill any special request related to their dining experience.Ensure that every department is notified of all new move-ins to help coordinate new resident involvement in appropriate activities and meals. Support the Hospitality Training the community’s staff. Take a role in the development and operation of the Ambassador program at the community. 
QualificationsLevel of Formal Education: Bachelor’s Degree and three plus years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experienceArea of Study: Hospitality or related fieldYears of Experience: 3+ yearsType of Experience: Hospitality relatedSkills And Abilities Ability to work as part of a team and handle multiple tasks safely and effectively. Excellent organization skills.
Information Systems:  Microsoft officePersonal Attributes:  Exceptional verbal and written communication skillsAdditional InformationSenior Lifestyle offers a comprehensive benefits plan to eligible team members including health, dental, vision, retirement benefits, short-term disability, long-term disability, and paid time off. All Senior Lifestyle positions are eligible to use DailyPay, an application that allows you to access your earned but unpaid wages before your next payday. Senior Lifestyle requires that all employees provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination unless exempt due to medical, religious, or personal beliefs. Government requirements or exclusions may apply.

Title: Coordinator of Broadcast Media/GCPS TV
JobDescription:
License and Certification Qualifications: None required.Education Qualifications: Bachelor's degree required.Experience Qualifications: Five or more years of industry experience in television, film, or media, and management experience in a related field required. Two years or more of writing broadcast scripts preferred.Skills Qualifications: Ability to meet deadlines while supporting the delivery and creation of media; proven storytelling skills and ability to create strong messaging of concepts; ability to create vision for a project and give clear direction to team in how to produce it; excellent written and verbal communication skills to work with a variety of stakeholders across the district; ability to work independently and as a lead member of a video production team; excellent organizational capabilities to oversee multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to problem solve and work well under pressure to come up with creative and relevant solutions for meeting deadlines. Deep understanding of the skill sets, technical requirements and project workflows needed for video production. Willingness to learn. Ability to shift seamlessly from one project to another.?Proactive mindset, a can-do attitude, strong attention to detail, and patience to adapt to changes when needed. Collaborative leadership. Ability to analyze existing processes and identify areas for improvement. Experience using cameras, microphones, and post production software preferred.Primary Responsibilities: Help develop the creative vision for video and event productions. Collaborate with team members and stakeholders to determine the needs of video projects and develop a plan to accomplish the goal. Be a lead member in the production of video requests and district live events. Identify inspiring stories to become videos highlighting the success of the district.  Assist the Director Broadcast and AV Media in managing video project requests. Evaluate and prioritize video project proposals. Determine scope of video needs through discussions with stakeholders. Create project management plans for accepted video projects. Maintain positive working relationships with team members and stakeholders. Create an actionable, realistic plan from a variety of ideas presented for a project. Coordinate the production for Assigned video projects. Coordinate the determination of appropriate content for video projects. Manage the production of assigned videos to meet project requirements. Oversee the production of assigned videos and hold production meetings with editors. Assist in coordinating the ongoing production schedule for assigned projects. Write and edit scripts and lead in the development of scripts written by others. Participate as an assigned team member of a production crew. Ensure accuracy of information presented and ensure grammatical integrity. Collaborate with stakeholders in the production of videos and live event planning and project management in support of annual district events. Work one-on-one with appropriate leaders in schools, divisions, or departments to plan and produce videos for these events that adhere to the content and brand standards established by the district. Assist in supporting and coaching talent to provide them a trusting and empathetic environment to be successful. Participate as a team member in planning and developing themes for district live events. Help craft and edit scripts for presenters and speakers. Assist the Director Broadcast and AV Media in developing communication plans for the department. Communicate departmental program goals and develop vision for the department's support of the district's mission, vision, and goals. Develop brand messaging, plan collateral materials, and generate GCPS TV reports. Manage the programming of the GCPS TV channel. Guide the Research and selection of educational programming to air on channel. Conduct quality control over GCPS TV programs. Oversee the production and distribution of weekly program schedules and updates. Expand the GCPS TV reach by developing and strengthening contacts within the community and developing and implementing outreach strategies. Meet with various community groups and organizations to share information about GCPS TV. Represent GCPS TV at various functions/meetings and community wide events. Perform other duties as assigned.
Physical Demands:Employee occasionally is to work events in the evenings or on the weekends outside of district business hours. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand, walk, negotiate stairs, climb ladders, reach with hands and arms, talk, and hear, manipulate tools and small items with hands, and lift and transport up to 50 pounds over short distances. The employee is required to operate a motor vehicle in performance of duties. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and color vision. The employee may be subjected to a wide range of ambient temperature and humidity conditions while working on equipment under varying conditions including overhead work and work in confined spaces. Potential hazards of this position include working with electricity, working with heat and noise producing machinery and equipment, working on elevated equipment using ladders or other lifting devices, and use of chemicals and solvents. Reasonable accommodations will be made for individuals with specific disabilities.

Title: Jr. Marketing Specialist, US East & Central
JobDescription:
Job description: Job Description The Opportunity Denodo is looking for a smart, motivated and dedicated individual to join the marketing team. Reporting to the regional Senior Marketing Manager. The selected candidate will be primarily responsible for executing field marketing events and digital programs, to drive pipeline generation and acceleration - supporting sales and marketing goals and targets within the region. The successful candidate will have the ability to work cross-functionally with the demand generation, field marketing, product marketing and partner teams, working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple projects simultaneously, while consistently meeting deadlines. Denodo is the leader in data virtualization, providing agile, high-performance data integration and data abstraction, and real-time data services at half the cost of traditional approaches. Denodo’s high-profile customers across every major industry have achieved significant business agility and ROI. Job Responsibilities & Duties Job Responsibilities & Duties  Regional demand generation campaign support: support for running all offline and online demand generation campaigns for the assigned region.Marketing lead processing:  qualification, upload and tracking on Salesforce.com (SFDC) of all leads across events, digital campaigns, and other marketing initiatives. List build, targeting & segmentation: enrich and cleanse imported lists, database, and audit and segment for successful campaign execution.Set up, develop, and report on effectiveness of demand generation programs and campaigns using our Marketo and Salesforce tools.Social Media campaign management - content creation, execution, and smooth running of all social media marketing campaigns, (both organic and paid).Planning, organising and running effective Nurture Campaigns through Marketo for existing and new leads. Maintain availability of marketing and sales materials, ordering new supplies as needed.Events logistics and on-site set-up and support (this will include travelling around the region).Management/coordination of marketing vendors (printers, branding agencies, couriers, etc.).Marketing administrative tasks (raising purchase orders, invoice management, etc.)Support for Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and Public Relations (PR) activities in the region.
 Desired Skills & Experience Desired Skills & Experience  We are looking for a person who is agile, willing to learn, committed and very collaborative.Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, communication, or related fields.Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in field marketing and demand generation preferably in the IT/technology space. Experience of planning, executing, and managing campaigns independently.Strong project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities and marketing projects at the same time with excellent attention to details.Ability to perform in a fast-paced and high energy environment with attention to detail and quality.Experience in creative writing Experience in the B2B sector will be a plus. Experience in database marketing, segmentation, and analytics. ABM experience would be a bonus.Knowledge and use of CRM and Marketing Automation (ideally Salesforce.com and Marketo) tools.Proficient in Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Fluency in English language (written & verbal); any other European languages will be a plus.Team player, hands-on attitude, keen learner, passion for work and eagerness to generate results.Experience in Paid Media Marketing campaigns, including LinkedIn.Ability to use Excel to create analytical reports.Up to 20% travels required
Skills: Campaigns, Creative Writing, Digital Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Marketing Automation, Marketing Campaign Management, Marketing Campaigns, Media Marketing, Paid Media Advertising, Social Media Marketing

Title: Lifestyle Coordinator - Overture Barrett
JobDescription:
The Lifestyle Coordinator plays an integral role in the support of the day-to-day management of the community to achieve community goals surrounding resident retention. This role works closely with the Community Manager and Sales Consultants to assist in the move-in process, the creation and coordination of programs and resident events, and with all aspects of sales and marketing for the community.Job Description  Greets prospects and residents as they enter the office/leasing area and ensures the comforts of prospects and visitors while they wait to speak with a team member. Assists with tours as needed Answers phone calls, routes all calls to the appropriate team member for assistance, and assists with completed service request call backs as necessary.  Maintains the guest suite schedule to ensure proper payment and cleanliness upon guest arrival and manages and monitors the loading dock and/or elevator schedule for move-ins and move-outs.  Manages all package deliveries by documenting arrival information and notifying residents of all package deliveries within 24 hours.  Ensures all amenities are in tour condition and prepared for resident use.  Utilizes amenity space to develop and execute innovative, creative, and dynamic events, services, and programs. Works to develop outcomes as well as assessment metrics to determine success of programs.  Keeps detailed information on local area restaurants, shops, delivery places, and other pertinent information that may be of interest to residents and maintains positive relationships and contacts with concierge vendors and local businesses, Offers recommendations to residents on a variety of services or needs and keeps up to date on events within the community.  Monitors and responds to Lifestyle E-mail Account and works with Lifestyle Team to ensure messages are responded to in a timely fashion and to create marketing and awareness of events, programs, services, and initiatives.  Creates and produces the monthly calendar, newsletter, and flyers with activities and events. Monitors and submits items for Resident Portal postings.  Participates in ensuring Greystar sales and marketing program standards and benchmarks are being met.  Provides input into the development of budgets within the property portfolio as it relates to planned activities and resident retention. Manage expenses to budget. 
The base compensation rate will vary based on education, experience, skills, and geographic location, as applicable. Greystar seeks to attract, recruit, advance and retain top talent. Greystar’s compensation strategy is tailored to appropriately reward the skillset and experience that a team member will bring to the organization.Depending on the position offered, regular full-time and part-time team members may be eligible to participate in a bonus program in addition to their salary. Team members may also participate in the 401k plan, once eligible. Regular, full-time team members are offered a range of medical, financial, and other benefits from which to choose.For Union and Prevailing Wage roles compensation and benefits may vary from the listed information above due to Collective Bargaining Agreements and/or local governing authority.Greystar will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Administrative Assistant - Cultural Arts
JobDescription:
Job DetailsDescriptionJOB TITLE: Administrative AssistantDEPARTMENT: Cultural ArtsSUPERVISOR TITLE: Supervisory/Management StaffSALARY RANGE: $18.21 - $29.23This is a non-exempt/hourly position.Purpose Of This PositionThe purpose of this customer service-oriented position is to meet the needs and requests of internal and external customers through the accurate and timely processing of information to ensure high quality department outcomes. The position performs a variety of highly responsible administrative, clerical, and financial duties in support of an assigned Village department; assists in planning, organizing, and coordinating support activities, operations, and functions related to the assigned office; and provides general information and assistance to staff and the general public.As a municipal organization, Greenwood Village is a provider of emergency services. Some emergency situations, including weather related emergencies, may necessitate Greenwood Village employees to assist in areas of work which may not be directly related to the employees specific job function, but which will be within the physical capabilities, training, and skills of the employee.ESSENTIAL FUNCTION STATEMENTS: The following statements are illustrative of the essential functions of the job and do not include other nonessential or peripheral duties that may be required. The Village retains the right to modify or change the duties or essential and additional functions of the job at any time without notice.Essential Functions  Administrative/Clerical Duties Provides assistance and information and responds to questions and inquiries from the general public; answers incoming telephone calls; serves as first point of contact for department at the Curtis Center for the Arts. Assists with program registration, provides information about activities or exhibits. Processes all recreation reimbursement requests; data inputs information; verifies receipts provided; responds to customer questions; ensures compliance with program guidelines. Processes program registration forms and shelter/pavilion permits; provides information regarding availability and applicable fees; schedules facility reservations. Receives registration and permit monies; issues receipts; balances and reconciles cash drawer. Provides administrative and clerical support on the electronic program registration system for recreation and cultural arts; updates information; provides assistance to other departmental users. Provides clerical support in a variety of meetings; prepares agendas and compiles materials. Creates flyers, invitations, and applications for art exhibits, grand opening and other community events. Assists with financial record keeping; processes invoice payments; tracks expenditures. Provides support to the Parks, Trails and Recreation Commission and/or Arts and Humanities Council; coordinates posting meeting agendas; assists with packet preparation; may attend night meetings once per month; takes and transcribes meeting minutes. Supports evening exhibit openings, lectures, or other departmental activities; assists in shopping for supplies in advance of meetings and functions; sets up and cleans up after events. Updates mailing/email lists, manages mailings and email blasts. Miscellaneous Duties Provides back-up support to other administrative staff. Performs related duties and responsibilities as required.
Position RequirementsKnowledge and Ability Requirements:Knowledge Of Modern office procedures, methods, and equipment, including a computer and basic software.Methods and procedures of data entry. Basic accounting principles.Basic business letter writing and basic report preparation.Basic principles and procedures of filing and record keeping.English usage, spelling, grammar and punctuation.
Ability To Learn and adhere to applicable departmental, local, State, and Federal rules, regulations, and laws.Perform mathematical calculations.Meet schedules and timelines. Maintain records and prepare computer-generated reports.Operate and use modern office equipment including a computer.Type at a speed necessary for successful job performance. Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.Maintain effective audio/visual discrimination and perception to the degree necessary for the successful performance of assigned duties.Meet the physical requirements of the position including frequently sitting at computer for several hours; walking or standing for brief periods of time; talking to and hearing customers on telephone and in person; using hands to finger through files and control objects; reaching with hands and arms; and stooping, bending and kneeling.
Experience and Training Guidelines: Any combination of experience and training that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be:Experience: Four years of responsible administrative or clerical experience.Training: Equivalent to the completion of the twelfth grade. Supplemental college level course work in business, accounting, bookkeeping, or a related field is desirable.Equipment Utilized: Standard office equipment, including computers with a variety of software programs.Contact with Others: Primary internal contact is with the professional, clerical and management staff. Primary external contact is with vendors, artists, instructors, other public agencies, and the general public.Supervisory Requirements: Receives general supervision from the assigned department director or other management or supervisory staff.The City of Greenwood Village is dedicated to the principles of the Equal Employment Opportunity Act and prohibits unlawful discrimination against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age over 40, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation or gender identity.

Title: Real Estate Administrative Assistant
JobDescription:
We’re looking for a driven and dedicated Real Estate Administrative Assistant to join our growing team. Your job will be to complete and file the appropriate paperwork for transactions, oversee important deadlines and communicate with clients frequently throughout the process, and coordinate schedules for final walkthroughs and other appointments. You’ll also work with the team to facilitate local events to foster connections with people in the community. Our ideal candidate has superb organizational skills, a knack for customer service, and a strong understanding of the real estate transaction process. Does this position interest you? Apply today!!Compensation $37,500+ yearly DOE

Desired Skills and Experience
Qualifications
Additional qualifications include:High school diploma or GED is required, preferably some college experience.Knowledge of Google Suite and customer relationship management software.Highly detail-oriented.Completion of the DISC profile is required for consideration (be sure to take the next step in the application process).Full-time, Monday - Friday.Compensation depends on experience.Prior experience in the real estate industry or as an office manager Great written and verbal skills 
Responsibilities
Additionally:Coordinate agent schedules to ensure the highest and best use of time.Handle difficult situations in a tactful manner.Consistently show the ability to recognize and deal with priorities.Attendance at all meetings and scheduled Coaching calls for Ops Team staff.Deliver concierge-level customer service to sellers, buyers, and lenders, to improve customer satisfaction ratingsComplete paperwork for all real estate transactions in a timely manner to ensure a deal is closed as quickly as possibleTrack important dates and time limits for transactions and notify relevant stakeholders as needed Schedule necessary appointments with all parties, including open houses and the final walkthroughTake part in employee development programs to strengthen existing skill sets in real estate administration

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Software Resources has an immediate job opportunity for a Marketing Coordinator with a major corporation in Glendale, CA or San Francisco, CA. Mon-Thurs onsite, Fri – remote.Duration : 12 month(s)This assignment can be in Glendale, CA., (Salary $25-$28.60 hr DOE) or San Francisco, CA., (Pay Not to Exceed $29-$32 hr DOE). Must HavesVERY DETAILED, Excellent Communication skills, Ability to track and document action items with the ability to follow up post stake holder mtgs., take detailed notes, Juggle priorities – dependent on business needs, Leverage the cross functional teams to deliver action items within a set timeframe and Adapt and solve business needs independently.DescriptionThe Games Marketing team partners with licensees to deliver world-class campaigns, helping each licensee successfully create/execute go-to-market plans that build brand awareness, engage consumers, and drive conversions through thoughtful brand storytelling, data-driven insights, and creative innovation – all grounded in a consumer-centric integrated marketing approach.Working with the Sr. Manager, Marketing, you will work on assigned titles within the Games business. The Marketing Coordinator plays a critical role in coordinating schedules, details, and deliverables across all assigned titles and is collaborative, organized, and creative.  Support the Sr. Manager, Marketing in providing insightful guidance/feedback and routing/managing approvals for go-to-market plans, assets, and activations with licensees Oversee the routing/approvals of assets and plans with licensees and internal teams Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Production, PR, Franchise, and Legal) to secure alignment/feedback/approvals on all major marketing deliverables Create and maintain asset management tools/directories to track/coordinate deliverables Coordinate all asset deliveries and ensure on-time deliverables for assigned titles Draft and distribute guidance, updates, and protocols pertaining to assigned titles Coordinate with regional teams on incoming/outgoing requests/approvals Develop knowledge of KPIs, common marketing strategies/tactics, and Synergy programs Learn appropriate benchmarks and goals across greater marketing channels/campaigns Become a strong brand steward for our brands to deliver on-brand marketing and creative Foster relationships with both licensee and internal teams throughout our company
Basic Qualifications  1–2 years of Marketing experience (preferably within the gaming industry) Experience in brand management, product marketing, user acquisition, or social/community Experience analyzing data and extrapolating insights Demonstrated project management skills and familiarity with project management tools
Preferred QualificationsPrevious experience in or passion for the gaming industryMS-Office, Google Suite, Box, Favro, Air table and/or Jira ExpDon't delay. Join the Software Resources team today! Software Resources specializes in connecting talented IT professionals with challenging job opportunities that transform jobs into careers.To meet our clients hiring needs, we continuously source talented IT Professionals with all levels of expertise and in all disciplines. We offer world class major medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) with match, short term disability, Life Insurance and AD&D. You, our future employees, can make a tremendous difference to our company and our clients. Please apply to this job and experience the Software Resources difference. You can view all of our jobs at https://www.softwareresources.com/careers/

Title: Marketing Specialist
JobDescription:
Atmosfy is looking for a dedicated and organized team member to support and grow within the Marketing team. You will be a great teammate who is willing to take direction but also shows initiative and can work independently on projects. You are a fast learner and are willing to take on projects and direction as assigned. You show a strong work ethic and strive to continually learn and grow your digital marketing skills. The role will support the team's efforts on acquisition campaigns, with special focus on affiliate and mobile acquisition marketing campaigns.Compensation $70,000 - $95,000 yearly

Desired Skills and Experience
Qualifications
