Title: Community Specialist | 86th & 3rd
JobDescription:
Description & RequirementsWho We Arelululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.Job SummaryThe Community Specialist is responsible for executing the store’s community strategy, which includes engaging with the community through relationship building, events, and other activities including supporting lululemon product seeding and attending local studios. They develop and sustain local key relationships with lululemon Ambassadors and other relevant and influential community partners providing synergistic value. The Community Specialist also delivers a world-class guest (i.e., customer) experience when working on the floor in the store, bringing their community perspective into the guest connection.Core Responsibilities Of The Job Collaborate with store leadership to bring Community strategy, through the pillars of community foundations, and guest experience to life. Establish and manage local key relationships (e.g., Ambassadors, Sweat Collective, studio owners, lululemon Studio partner studios) to increase new guest acquisition and guest retention. Engage with the local community to identify future Ambassador or partner opportunities and to increase the store’s standing as a community hub. Connect with guests on the floor to assess their unique needs, provide technical product education, and incorporate omnichannel programs into a seamless end-to-end guest experience. Attend, support, and/or host local and regional Community events. Execute the product seeding strategy through community partners and Ambassadors. Review community relevant business data and metrics to identify and share insights and recommendations with store leadership regarding Community events, projects, or initiatives. Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive, productive, and fun experience for all team members. 
Job RequirementsEligibility  Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with reliable transportation methods 
Schedule/Availability  The work schedule can vary based on store needs Shifts are typically scheduled: mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays In addition, during peak timeframes, special events, or other circumstances, the schedule may include early mornings or late nights/overnights for some employees
Experience 1 year of cumulative experience in customer service or engagement, grassroots marketing, brand engagement or community building 
Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required) Education: High school diploma/GED/equivalent, or above Experience (not necessarily the focus of a role): building or maintaining relationships with clients, groups, or partners; motivating team members to accomplish goals or activities 
What We Look For Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences Integrity: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner Connection and Partnership: Is able to build professional relationships with team members and guests; develops partnerships within and across the company and community Planning and Organizing: Plans and organizes work in a clear and efficient manner to ensure completion in alignment with priorities Collaboration and Teamwork: Works productively with and supports others to achieve common goals; seeks connections, partnerships, and diverse perspectives Learner Mindset: Is curious, open to feedback, and pursues learning and progressing new skills to continually grow and develop Self-Leadership: Takes personal responsibility for own actions; inspires others to buy-in and actively support goals and initiatives Interactive Communication: Conveys information effectively and understands information shared while interacting with others 
Work Context (e.g., environment, interactions, physical) Work can occur in various locations and environments, including moving through the store with bright lights and loud music, and at locations throughout the community Work involves building relationships with new people, strengthening community partnerships, and participating in events related to fitness or movement Work is accomplished as part of a team, sometimes independently, and sometimes using a computer or other technical devices 
Compensation & Benefits PackageOur community specialist base pay ranges from $20.50 - $23.58/hour with a target bonus of an additional $3 per hour, bringing our total target compensation range between $23.50 - $26.58/hour, depending on location and level of experience. Our pay-for-performance bonus philosophy supports our employees by recognizing exceptional individual and team performance.At lululemon, our care and investment in our employees does not stop at compensation. Investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. With extended health and mental health plans, paid time off, savings plans, generous employee discounts, fitness & yoga classes, parenthood top up and more, our benefits support our values and recognize our teams for their performance and dedication. Additionally, our personal and professional development programs include people networks, parenthood support programs, mentorships, and leadership series programming to help employees grow their career.Note: Availability of the benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.
Skills: Brand Activation, Client Relations, Communication, Community Building, Customer Service, Grassroots Marketing, Grassroots Organizing, Organization Skills, Personal Responsibility, Seeding

Title: Account Manager
JobDescription:
Albiware is growing our team! We are hiring a Customer Success Manager to partner with clients to drive adoption, manage business processes, and grow our business. This role is a balance of individual work within a highly collaborative team. You will be working directly with clients to maintain and grow existing relationships and will identify expansion opportunities to achieve negative net churn.We’re a company that helps home service contractors grow and scale their businesses through our SaaS platform. We’re a team united by our shared values of integrity, curiosity, growth, social responsibility, and innovation.Albiware is a venture-backed startup that has been growing at 30% month over month for the past 2 years.If you’re a person who is driven by delivering results for customers and thrive in a fast pace environment this is a perfect position for you. Be sure to read on!You’re good at: Strong and Clear Written and verbal communication Strong empathy for customers and their success.Desire for committing over delivering and following up with customers to make sure they’re successfulProblem solving and analyzing data to gain clear insights to improve customer success.Managing your work and collaboration in a highly organized and proactive fashion.Communicating brand/products effectively and clearly to the market and internal customers
Extra awesome You love inspiring others with enthusiasmYou love connecting with people You have experience working at a tech company
What you’ll doAccount Manager, you’ll be responsible for: Providing customer onboarding support for the first 100 days of their journey.Producing and conducting Executive Business Reviews; building engaged relationships with clients to ensure Albiware is supporting every client in their business goals.Focusing on monitoring customers at risk of churning. Drive true value for customers and report on it.Acting as a liaison between internal teams to ensure customer needs are being met. Keeping consistent and organized documentation on our customer relationshipBeing a trusted advisor, thought leader, and subject matter expert to customers in relation to Albiware’s product.
What you’ll needThe following experience is relevant to us: 3+ years of experience in environments with preference for customer success, account management, sales development, or consulting background. Experienced with online tools (ie: Google docs, sheets, Trello, Zoom, GoToWebinar) History of meeting and exceeding customer expectationsExcellent communication, organizational, and analytical skillsExtremely comfortable engaging with customers to ensure their successExperience working with a team across multiple disciplines
Why join usWorking at Albiware can accelerate your career and allow you to work with world-class talent. We’re a team that loves what we do, and we all thrive on our ability to make an impact. There are many benefits that come with working with us such as: 401K , Health Vision and Dental, PTO, and much more!Apply today by clicking Apply Now!

Additionally, our personal and professional development programs include people networks, parenthood support programs, mentorships, and leadership series programming to help employees grow their career.Note: Availability of the benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.
Skills: Brand Activation, Client Relations, Communication, Community Building, Grassroots Marketing, Grassroots Organizing, Organization Skills, Personal Responsibility, Seeding, Team Motivation

Title: Marketing Communications Coordinator
JobDescription:
ABOUT US Congregation Rodeph Sholom (CRS) is a large dynamic Reform synagogue at the heart of Manhattan’s Upper West Side and has a strong 180-year history. We are a community for all who enter our doors and our members represent the vibrant diversity of New York’s Jewish landscape. Multi-generational families, millennials, interfaith families, lifelong New Yorkers, those new to the city, folks pursuing conversion and those exploring Judaism for the first time have all found a home at CRS.  ABOUT YOU Congregation Rodeph Sholom seeks a creative, tech-savvy, and self-motivated Marketing and Communications Coordinator to promote the synagogue across all channels. The ideal candidate possesses very strong writing, editing, and organizational skills; has experience with email marketing and social media platforms; and is excited to tell the Rodeph Sholom story. Knowledge of Jewish culture and religious traditions and institutions is a plus. WORK SCHEDULE Our team works on a hybrid schedule. All our team members must be flexible and able to adapt to short- and long-term shifts in their job duties. Working hours are generally 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM (4:00 PM on Fridays); additional hours may be required evenings and weekends, generally with advance notice and flexibility to adjust work schedule. WHAT YOU WILL DO Partner with Marketing and Communications Manager to develop and implement editorial calendar; adhere to goals and timelines; contribute to the overall marketing and communications strategy.Coordinate the writing, editing, and sending of e-mail communications; manage distribution lists with Program Assistant; create and distribute regular email performance reports.Execute a results-driven social media strategy by developing and curating engaging content for social media platforms; create a social media calendar and develop an optimal posting schedule.Maintain website calendar and ensure all public-facing programs are listed correctly; make additional website content updates as needed.Manage the vetting, uploading, tagging, and sharing of photos/videos in SharePoint; take photos and short videos at programs and events as needed.Collaborate with Program Assistant on program registration.Additional duties as assigned.
 QUALIFICATIONS 2 years of professional work experience in the field of communications.Direct email marketing experience, including strategy, implementation, analytics, and reporting; previous experience using Constant Contact a plus.Deep familiarity with all social platforms.Demonstrated WordPress skills.Content creation skills, i.e.: photography, video editing, copywriting.Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) in a PC environment; Google Docs, and SharePoint/One Drive. Comfortable learning new programs is essential. Training support provided for Zoom, Constant Contact, IMIS, SimpleTix, Concur, Airtable and other new technologies as they become available.Experience tracking, analyzing, and reporting on key metrics.Basic understanding of HTML and CSS.Proficiency in graphic design programs such as Canva or Adobe Creative Suite.
COMPETENCIES Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Exceptional writing using consistent voice, organization, fluency, and tailoring content to the target audience.Efficiency in a dynamic, high-volume environment.Ability to successfully manage and collaborate on multiple, simultaneous projects.Dedication to meeting deadlines and submitting high-quality work.A keen eye for detail in regard to design layouts, copy, and accessibility.Motivated self-starter capable of taking initiative and working independently as well as within a team environment.Ability to maintain positive working relationships with Rodeph Sholom community of employees, volunteers, lay leaders, and with other organizations and industry contacts.
 SALARY & BENEFITS  Salary range: $55,000-$60,000; commensurate with experience. Generous paid time off (e.g., vacation, holidays, sick and personal days, and parental leave).Comprehensive medical, dental, vision insurance, and HSA options.403(b) retirement plan with up to a 7% matching contribution. Flexible Spending Accounts for commuter, dependent care, and medical expenses. Short-term disability, long-term disability, and life insurance.AFLAC plans. Company provided Mac laptop with Adobe Creative Cloud.Gym membership subsidy. Professional development.
Salaries are based on a number of factors including qualifications and experience and are non-negotiable due to pay equity practices. VACCINATION POLICY  All staff must be fully vaccinated, including booster shot. Proof of vaccination required at start of employment. 
 APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS  Cover Letter: Please include a cover letter with your resume that demonstrates your relevant skills and experience, plus interest in this positionWork Design Portfolio/Reel: A minimum of 3-5 examples of work including samples of email and social media
 Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Congregation Rodeph Sholom does not unlawfully discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of one’s actual or perceived race; color; religion; sex/gender (including gender identity); creed; sexual orientation; marital status; pregnancy; ethnicity; national origin; ancestry; age; disability; alienage/citizenship status; arrest or conviction record (consistent with the provisions of New York State’s Corrections Law); partnership status; familial status; military service; status as a victim of domestic violence, stalking or sex offenses; veteran status; genetic pre-disposition or carrier status; or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Employment decisions at CRS are made in a non-discriminatory manner and are based on qualifications, abilities, and merit. As may be permitted by law, certain Rodeph Sholom positions will be filled by persons of the Jewish faith as a bona fide occupational qualification. CRS also prohibits, and will not tolerate, any form of retaliation or reprisal against any employee who reasonably and in good faith complains of discrimination or harassment or provides information in connection with any such complaint.

Title: Communications/ Community Engagement
JobDescription:
PTS Advance has two contract positions open in San Ramon, CA. for a Communications/ Community Engagement person.Daily Hours: 8AM - 5PM. Candidate must be local and willing to adhere to Hybrid work schedule - Remote Mon/Wed/Fri, In-office Tue/Thu.Responsibilities Enable the cultivation and creation of concepts that effectively represent our brands, achieving campaign goals.Develop content and creativity in support of Company's Fuels initiatives and strategies.Build content framework for Retail Fuels business across brands and Programs (Company App, Loyalty, Consumer Card) with input from key stakeholders (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, third-party partners, etc.)Collaborate with the Fuels and Programs managers to understand goals and objectives, initiative prioritization, and target segments for growth.Translate these strategies into creative briefs which are provided to our agencies to develop the relevant content.Work directly with creative agencies and managers to ensure content meets desired needs and objectives.Manage outside agencies and resources, including setting and managing content budgets, managing agency performance, costs, deliverables, deadlines and provides editing direction to deliver final content.Ensure alignment with Marketing priorities and compliance with Brand requirements.Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders including web specialist, email specialist, media specialist, brand specialists, and legal team to understand content needs; develops content and digital campaigns that are leveraged across all our marketing channels; and ensure compliance and timely publication.Content for development may include elements such as POP elements, web page items, infographics, social media items, videos, push notifications, campaign emails, brochures, presentations, and FAQ's.Manage marketing and content projects, results, and budgets using project management tools.
Required Skills/Experience  Bachelor's degree 8+ years of experience in print and digital marketing content and campaign development Experience collaborating with creative agencies
Preferred Qualifications  Experience in marketing retail fuels, convenience retailing, mobile apps, loyalty programs, and/or partnerships Experience using creative development application Experience with Salesforce and MPM Deadline oriented, ability to work under tight deadlines, many moving parts Excellent communication, teamwork, and project management skills Adaptable and flexible, comfortable in a dynamic environment and change management
Additional Considerations  Concept, execution, production, delivery to measurement of content Digital, Mobile App, email, social, web and print production experience Adobe creative cloud CX, UX and brand experience Project management and familiar with Project management systems/tools
Interview Process  In-person interviews 2 rounds of interviews likely

Title: Brand Marketing Operations Specialist
JobDescription: Brand Marketing Operations Specialist FLSA: E Pay Target: E2 Supervisory Responsibility: No Summary Job DescriptionThe brand marketing operations specialist participates in the implementation of brand, communications, and marketing initiatives. This role requires attention to detail, organizational skills, and a commitment to teamwork to help ensure the success of the entire team. The position is responsible for vendor onboarding and billing, project management and production coordination, and reviewing materials for brand compliance.This position is a hybrid of remote and in-person work, reporting in person weekly at a minimum on Thursdays.We're looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is passionate about working in an organization that values and promotes diversity, equity, inclusion, and anti-racism.Duke Health Marketing and Communications is committed to creating an accessible, supportive environment that recognizes diversity and cultural competence as integral components of excellence. Candidates who can contribute to that goal are encouraged to apply and to identify their strengths in this area. Key Duties and Responsibilities Assist in the coordination of creative design and production of various marketing and communications collateral. (50%)Gather background information and content for projects, edit copy, and organize all details to kick off the creative process.Facilitate the logistics and processing of print and broadcast advertising placements and printing and installation of collateral. Communicate with stakeholders, keeping them aware of the project status and navigating any changes to scope.Participate in the implementation of department-wide projects, including tracking budgets and overseeing contracts and vendor relationships. (40%)Coordinate with procurement to establish all new vendors and related contracts and purchase orders.Prepare department budget reconciliation reports and appropriate recommendations for on-time invoice processing and any variance from approved budget. Coordinate a variety of accounting tasks involved in maintaining financial records and processing related data such as invoices. Performs other related brand and marketing project duties as assigned, including but not limited to creative production logistics and scheduling. (10%)Successful candidates will have:Commitment to demonstrate and support a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusionProven ability to work in a rapidly changing, high-growth environment Excellent time management and prioritization with the ability to manage multiple and competing work priorities, demands, and changesSAP integrated suite experience preferredClear communicator with the ability to provide direct and applicable feedbackDedication to champion cross-functional teams in an open, positive, and inclusive environmentProject management software experience a plusAbility to serve as an advocate for individuals of all ethnicities, genders, ages, and backgroundsBilingual proficiency preferredKnowledge or experience in healthcare desiredRequired Minimum Qualifications Education Bachelor's degree in Business, Communications, Marketing, or related field is required.Experience One year of directly related experience is required.Degrees, Licensure, and/or Certification N/ADistinguishing Characteristics of this LevelN/AJob Code: 00005287 MARKETING, COMMUNICATIONS & PUB REL SPECJob Level: E2Duke is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individual's age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or veteran status.Duke aspires to create a community built on collaboration, innovation, creativity, and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas-an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences flourishes. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values.Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essential job functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.PDN-994589a4-9361-44a3-a259-b9e4046e54bb

This role will play a key part in driving strategic alignment and execution across product delivery and sales enablement. This role will report directly to the U.S. Bank Channel Support Leader in the U.S. Bank Payment Solutions organization.This position will require an understanding of U. S. Bank business units and Elavon Healthcare products and can lead and manage multiple high priority sales engagements simultaneously. A strong ability to partner and nurture relationships within Elavon and U. S. Bank to support strategic Healthcare business initiatives will be vital to the role.Key Responsibilities Both digital and in person engagements with prospects and clients for the purpose of identifying and recommending U.S. Bank Healthcare solutionsEnable revenue with Healthcare solutions to small and mid-sized physician and dental practice providers with annual revenues up to $25MMProvide training, guidance and support to sales representatives and bank partners in the Healthcare verticalAssist with the delivery of customized client proposals, demonstrations, and presentationsEstablishes and maintains a network of key people in the industry and communityServes as Healthcare product liaison, maintaining consistent engagement with product to stay in front of new developments and enhancements that will impact sales teamProvide additional sales enablement activity as required

Demonstrated management and leadership skillsStrong communication, organizational and analytical skillsAbility to identify and resolve exceptions and to analyze dataAbility to manage multiple prioritiesExcellent record in delivering resultsProven success in building relationships and working collaborativelyAbility to prioritize competing demands

Title: Community Specialist | Walden Galleria Mall
JobDescription:
Description & RequirementsWho We Arelululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.Job SummaryThe Community Specialist is responsible for executing the store’s community strategy, which includes engaging with the community through relationship building, events, and other activities including supporting lululemon product seeding and attending local studios. They develop and sustain local key relationships with lululemon Ambassadors and other relevant and influential community partners providing synergistic value. The Community Specialist also delivers a world-class guest (i.e., customer) experience when working on the floor in the store, bringing their community perspective into the guest connection.Core Responsibilities Of The Job Collaborate with store leadership to bring Community strategy, through the pillars of community foundations, and guest experience to life. Establish and manage local key relationships (e.g., Ambassadors, Sweat Collective, studio owners, lululemon Studio partner studios) to increase new guest acquisition and guest retention. Engage with the local community to identify future Ambassador or partner opportunities and to increase the store’s standing as a community hub. Connect with guests on the floor to assess their unique needs, provide technical product education, and incorporate omnichannel programs into a seamless end-to-end guest experience. Attend, support, and/or host local and regional Community events. Execute the product seeding strategy through community partners and Ambassadors. Review community relevant business data and metrics to identify and share insights and recommendations with store leadership regarding Community events, projects, or initiatives. Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive, productive, and fun experience for all team members. 
Job RequirementsEligibility  Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with reliable transportation methods 
Schedule/Availability  The work schedule can vary based on store needs Shifts are typically scheduled: mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays In addition, during peak timeframes, special events, or other circumstances, the schedule may include early mornings or late nights/overnights for some employees
Experience 1 year of cumulative experience in customer service or engagement, grassroots marketing, brand engagement or community building 
Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required) Education: High school diploma/GED/equivalent, or above Experience (not necessarily the focus of a role): building or maintaining relationships with clients, groups, or partners; motivating team members to accomplish goals or activities 
What We Look For Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences Integrity: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner Connection and Partnership: Is able to build professional relationships with team members and guests; develops partnerships within and across the company and community Planning and Organizing: Plans and organizes work in a clear and efficient manner to ensure completion in alignment with priorities Collaboration and Teamwork: Works productively with and supports others to achieve common goals; seeks connections, partnerships, and diverse perspectives Learner Mindset: Is curious, open to feedback, and pursues learning and progressing new skills to continually grow and develop Self-Leadership: Takes personal responsibility for own actions; inspires others to buy-in and actively support goals and initiatives Interactive Communication: Conveys information effectively and understands information shared while interacting with others 
Work Context (e.g., environment, interactions, physical) Work can occur in various locations and environments, including moving through the store with bright lights and loud music, and at locations throughout the community Work involves building relationships with new people, strengthening community partnerships, and participating in events related to fitness or movement Work is accomplished as part of a team, sometimes independently, and sometimes using a computer or other technical devices 
Compensation & Benefits PackageOur community specialist base pay ranges from $18.00 - $20.70/hour with a target bonus of an additional $3 per hour, bringing our total target compensation range between $21.00 - $23.70/hour, depending on location and level of experience. Our pay-for-performance bonus philosophy supports our employees by recognizing exceptional individual and team performance.At lululemon, our care and investment in our employees does not stop at compensation. Investing in our people is a top priority. We believe that when life works, work works. With extended health and mental health plans, paid time off, savings plans, generous employee discounts, fitness & yoga classes, parenthood top up and more, our benefits support our values and recognize our teams for their performance and dedication. Additionally, our personal and professional development programs include people networks, parenthood support programs, mentorships, and leadership series programming to help employees grow their career.Note: Availability of the benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

Title: Sourcing Associate
JobDescription:
We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is over 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding.We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a Sourcing Associate.This position is responsible for developing, monitoring, and pursuing tactical and strategic initiatives/projects in a specialized area (e.g., commodities, vendor/contract relationships, or supplier management). The Sourcing Associate prepares analytical reports and forecasts in order to track product costs and recommends appropriate course of action to senior purchasing/sourcing leaders. Lastly, this position partners closely with Design to ensure successful product development.This is a hybrid position based out of our Northbrook, IL offices and requires 3 days/week in the office. A day in the life as a Sourcing Associate…   Supports associate managers and senior managers in seasonal sourcing activities and ongoing vendor performance management  Monitor pre-production tasks (sample development and costing)  Calendar milestone tracking  Sku data gathering and management to ensure all item related information is accurate and complete prior to sku set-up exercise  Reporting:   IMU tracking and analysis  Monitor internal on-time performance reporting  Capacity reporting 

What You’ll Bring To The Table…  Excellent written and oral skills  Poses multi-cultural awareness and respect  Strong financial reporting and quantitative analysis skills, retail math skills  Customer focus (internal and external)  Effective email communication with overseas vendors and agents  Negotiating skills  Excellent interpersonal skills  Adaptable to meet rapidly changing priorities  Basic understanding of manufacturing processes for assigned categories 
 We’d love to hear from you if you have…   A minimum of 2 years in an associate-level role within sourcing, product development, production, or Merchandising  College degree preferred  Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications and G Suite
Skills: Financial Reporting, Google Workspace, Interpersonal Skills, Manufacturing Processes, Merchandising, Performance Reporting, Pre-production, Quantitative Analytics, Retail Math, Sample Development

Title: Analyst-Accommodation Remote
JobDescription:
Job Summary:The primary purpose of this role is to participate in the establishment and implementation of the accommodation request process for the company. Such processes include those related to requests from both active employees and those returning from an approved medical leave of absence. This includes responsibility for facilitating the interactive process between the vendor, the employee, the location manager and field human resource manager to identify appropriate work accommodation options and monitor the implementation of same.Key Responsibilities:  Engages in interactive process with employees requesting additional leave, modifications to assist the employees to perform their essential job duties, or requesting reassignment Reviews and evaluates accommodation requests and recommends appropriate accommodation options Engages with hiring managers, HR partners or talent acquisition applicants regarding accommodation requests Develops standardized methods for reviewing and handling frequent end-of-leave/return to work accommodation requests and requests for additional leave Consults with leaders on how to document accommodation responses and leave decisions, including terminations and posting/backfilling roles Partners with functional stakeholders on Workday coding, status and short-term / sick pay questions Supports associates that have questions about leaves and accommodations or need help understanding how to navigate the process Partners with vendor to monitor for leave extension, accommodation request and interactive process responses / progression Engages with vendor and leaders on escalated cases, which includes working to resolve cases within designated service level agreement Monitors case management system, email and Teams to ensure that cases and inquires are being handled timely and accurately Monitors implementation of accommodation response to employees who return from leave Supports and implements any reporting obligations in coordination with the Legal Department Supports business partners and legal on any case reviews for leaves or accommodations Ensures training obligations on leave and accommodations processes are completed Creates reporting availability for interactive process requests and end-of-leave processes, as needed
Required Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business or related field OR 4 years related experience 3 years case management experience in the ADA/disability/worker’s compensation/FMLA/counseling arena Subject matter expertise in ADA and FMLA with working knowledge of workers' compensation
Preferred Qualifications:  5 years experience managing disability accommodation cases that include return to work programs
About Lowe'sLowe's Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 17 million customer transactions a week in the U.S. With total fiscal year 2022 sales of over $97 billion, approximately $92 billion of sales were generated in the U.S., where Lowe's operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.EEO StatementLowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.Pay Range for CA, CO, NJ, NY, WA: $56,400.00 - $94,000.00 annuallyStarting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits. Pay Range for CA, CO, NJ, NY, WA: $56,400.00 - $94,000.00 annually Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.
Skills: Analytical Skills, Arena Simulation Software, Communication, Compensation, Counseling, Microsoft SQL Server, Return to Work Programs, Service Levels, Service-Level Agreements (SLA), Teamwork

Title: Junior Event Account Manager
JobDescription:
Junior Event Account Manager | - $600 - $1200 per weekWork Location: Addison, TXExpected start date: Immediate StartTHE COMPANYAn innovative production agency who creates and build impressive, high-quality events from design and concept through to build and execution, ensuring all elements are bespoke to their client’s vision. With a focus on high-end quality, creativity and innovation, this company has an outstanding industry reputation.This business has established relationships with an array of renowned venues, as well as widely recognised end clients. Their extensive offering of in-house facilities is supported by an exclusive network of trusted partners and leaders in their field.You will work within a close-knit and friendly team where hard work is rewarded.THE ROLE:This company are now looking for a Junior Event Account Manager to join their team where you will be responsible for growing business with corporate and private clients and accredited venues through effective account management and delivery of high specification events.This is a broad role with responsibilities that will include: Building and maintaining long term and strong personal relationships with designated venues and clientsWorking with Commercial Director to develop and implement individual account strategiesUnderstanding client brands to build robust relationships and add commercial valueDeveloping and implementing strategies to build strong relationships with potential new clientsGrowing business with existing clients through effect Account ManagementDeveloping and present professional and effective pitches to secure jobsPresenting pitches directly to clients securing sales and winning jobsKeeping abreast of competitor activity and maintain competitive edge in the service offeringFollowing and upholding the existing budgeting and quoting processes.Completing time sheeting as required to allow reconciliation against each job
What's in it for you?We think Brand X is a great place to work and we work hard to maintain that: We value work-life balance; we understand the importance of a healthy work-life balance and ensure we protect it.We grow careers; as our business grows we look to develop skills and grow responsibilities internally as opportunities arise.Our people are our greatest asset; we recognize that we succeed together and reward the hard work of our people.
If you are looking for an exciting opportunity where you can learn and develop yourself, we would love to hear from you. Ideally, we would love to fill this position asap!This position is based in Addison, Texas so please be sure you can commute daily. Applicants living outside the city may not be contacted.Actively considering candidates from varying backgrounds, including retail, administration/receptionist, warehouse, cleaning, HGV drivers and many more. Hiring Immediately.

Title: Marketing Coordinator
JobDescription:
Must be local to Lincolnshire, IL. Responsibilities -Analyze data to make business decisions. -Engage regularly with assigned partners to maintain an open channel of communication at all times to ensure that partner stakeholders are kept up to date on any and all issues, initiatives, meetings, and conferences related to a partner’s investment. -Identify challenges or risk in the business and escalate to leadership for review.

Title: Project Manager Assistant
JobDescription:
HEI Civil, Inc. is a full-service civil construction company. We offer a full range of construction services, including heavy civil highway construction, commercial, residential, oil fields, site development, dams and reservoirs, parks, and golf courses.We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Project Manager Assistant to join our team in our Castle Rock, CO office. The Project Manager Assistant will work under the direction of the Senior Project Manager Assistant and Senior Project Manager.Key Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  Work closely with the Project Manager and other project team members daily Assist Estimators with cost estimates Submit invoices for payments Support Project Managers with schedules and budgets Set Up New Jobs and import them into Spectrum and Heavy Job Assist in coordination of construction activities Create Purchase Orders and Subcontracts from the Bids (making sure subcontractors meet insurance requirements) Create Job Books for PM & Superintendents Participate in Precon/Prebids meetings (In-House and External) Pre-Job video of the Job site Attend weekly onsite meetings (when necessary) Interface with permit plans and renewals of permits Take-Off’s (small ones) Keep Heavy Jobs software updated Track all extra work tickets Printing Plans Maintain Office Folders, Job List and Plans/Contracts electronic files Submittals Any other requests from the PM’s
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:  Self-motivated with a strong work ethic and a passion to learn Good organization skills and follow through Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Education and Experience  Minimum two years’ experience in the Heavy Civil construction industry Experience with Heavy Bid and Heavy Job preferred
Physical Requirements:  Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds at times. Able to use hands for typing, writing, reach, etc.
Work Environment:  Office-based work with varying temperatures. Occasional visits to the field with variant weather conditions.
Job Type: Full-time, ExemptSalary: From $55,000 a year, based on experienceBenefits:  Health Insurance Paid Time Off 401k Six paid holidays $10,000 Employer paid life insurance Voluntary dental, vision, life, and Colonial supplemental insurance

Title: Patient Success Representative - Call Center (Remote)
JobDescription:
You could say Brightree by ResMed is a technology company. And that’s true. But Brightree is, at its heart, about people. We develop innovative, end-to-end technology solutions and services for people facing everyday challenges in the post-acute care industry. Brightree helps streamline processes, improve efficiency, and increase profitability. For over fifteen years, organizations big and small have put their trust in us—for our wide-ranging solutions, our leadership, and our unmatched customer service. Going to work each day and creating new ways to positively impact our customers’ businesses and the lives of patients is just what we do. Because Brightree is, after all, about people.To learn more about Brightree technology and solutions watch this short video by our CEO: https://www.brightree.com/whychoosebrightreeWorking in a call center now? Tired of coming to an office? Brightree by ResMed is hiring motivated callers ready for a change and eager to work for a growing, innovative company with great pay and benefits. Our fully remote positions offer competitive pay, and medical, dental, 401K and employee stock purchase plan. Equipment is also provided. Pay is $17 hourly.Let's talk about the team and you:We are currently looking for full-time remote (U.S.) Customer Service Specialists in the Resupply space. The Customer Service Specialist will make and receive follow-up calls to and from medical equipment patients. Calls are patient follow ups for solicitation of resupply of existing products. Candidates must have experience providing customer service via phone, strong attention to detail and the ability to utilize multiple computer applications while providing best in class customer service. A successful candidate must be able to convey information to patients in a clear and concise manner and be able to navigate simple software programs.Key accountabilities and decision ownership:  Initiates and receives calls to/from patients requiring resupply of sleep therapy products and collects information needed to complete an orderUnderstands the unique requirements of patients and provides appropriate directioninto a daily work list and documents results of callsFlexibility to work with multiple clients and any given time.Provides patient education to provide patients the ability to make an education decision on ordering new supplies.Completes and documents sales orders with accuracy and speed.De-escalates patients through best practices.Navigates through multiples systems and programs.Works directly with other departments and clients to resolve patient issues.
Skills, experience, technical/professional qualifications:Must have:  High school education required1 year of customer service experienceMust be a self-starter who can troubleshoot challenges on the flyStrong communication skills on the telephoneExcellent written communication skillsAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentAbility to work independentlyAbility to make twenty to twenty-five calls per hourMust have high speed Internet
Preferred:  Associates Degree and/or college coursework preferredCall center experience preferredSales experience highly preferred. Bilingual Spanish speaking is a plus 
We are shaping the future at ResMed, and we recognize the need to build on and broaden our existing skills and continue to attract and retain the world’s best talent. We work hard to offer holistic benefits packages, provide flexible work arrangements, cultivate a workforce culture that allows employees to grow personally and professionally, and deliver competitive salaries to our team members. Employees scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible for benefits. This position qualifies for the following benefits package: comprehensive medical, vision, dental, and life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance, sleep care management, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), commuter benefits, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and tuition assistance. Employees accrue fifteen days Paid Time Off (PTO) in their first year of employment, receive 11 paid holidays plus 3 floating days and are eligible for 14 weeks of primary caregiver or two weeks of secondary caregiver leave when welcoming new family members.Individual pay decisions are based on a variety of factors, such as the candidate’s geographic work location, relevant qualifications, work experience, and skills.At ResMed, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current base range for this position is: 16.30 - 20.37 - 24.44 USD HourlyFor remote positions located outside of the US, pay will be determined based the candidate’s geographic work location, relevant qualifications, work experience, and skills.Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

Title: Content Creator
JobDescription:
AboutThis is a Remote Contract Position (1 year) from anywhere in the US. NEOGOV is a proud SaaS leader in the Public Sector for HR, Recruiting, employee development, and management. Through the NEOGOV HR Suite, our passion is to bring efficient and more innovative solutions to public sector organizations. We are in business to serve the people who serve the people.We are seeking a skilled and creative Content Creator to join our team on a contract basis. As a Content Creator, you will play a crucial role in developing customer-facing quick help articles and videos for our SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing our customer’s experience by providing them with valuable and easily accessible resources .What You Will do  Create high-quality quick help articles and videos that effectively communicate complex concepts and instructions in a concise and engaging manner.  Collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and support teams to gather information and understand the features, functionality, and updates of our SaaS products.  Translate technical information into user-friendly content that caters to our diverse customer base, ensuring that the content is clear, accurate, and accessible.  Write step-by-step guides, tutorials, FAQs, and troubleshooting tips to help users understand and resolve common issues independently.  Produce videos using Camtasia or similar tools, including screen recordings, demonstrations, and interactive visuals, to visually demonstrate product usage and features.  Continuously update and maintain existing content to reflect product updates, changes, and improvements.  Research and stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and customer feedback to improve content quality and user experience.  Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize content for SEO and create content that aligns with brand guidelines and style. 
Who You Are  An individual with strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects with varying deadlines.  Committed to delivering high-quality content and have high attention to detail.  Self-motivated and are able to work independently while collaborating effectively within a remote team environment. 
What You Have  1+ Proven experience as a Content Creator, Technical Writer, or similar role, preferably in the software or SaaS industry.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to explain complex concepts in a simple and concise manner.  Proficiency in using tools like Camtasia or similar screen recording/editing software.  Experience in creating content optimized for search engines (SEO) is a plus.  Familiarity with HTML, CSS, or other web technologies is a plus.  A portfolio of previous content creation work, including quick help articles and videos, demonstrating your ability to simplify complex concepts. 
What NEOGOV OffersNEOGOV does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factors.
Skills: Audio Recording, Camtasia, Communication, Content Creation, Editing, Editing Software, Organization Skills, Product Demonstration, Tutorials, Video Production

Title: Jr. Account Manager - B2B & Retail
Company: Unilever Water & Air Wellness - North America
JobDescription:
Blueair and Pureit, as part of Unilever Water and Air Wellness, are rapidly growing global brands with rocketlike potential. At Blueair we believe that the freedom to breathe clean air is a basic right, and we fight for that right around the world. Pureit is a world leader in sustainable water purification providing healthy and safe drinking water for millions of people worldwide. Together, we have built a team of thinkers, dreamers, and doers who are passionate about our impactful products. At Unilever Water and Air Wellness, we strive to gain and support the next generation of innovators in the market. We are seeking to add to our entrepreneurial culture at Blueair with a Junior Account Manager - B2B & Retail.Position Description:This role will focus on driving excellent account management for new and existing customers within our B2B and Retail channels. The key objective is to help grow our B2B channel and maintain a strong presence with our retail partners. This candidate will be primarily responsible for overseeing the day to day execution for these two channels ensuring customer satisfactionThe Jr. Account Manager reports directly to the Business Development Manager B2B and will collaborate closely with Operations, Finance, and Marketing teams.This role is hybrid and requires applicants to live in the following states: IL, IN, WI, NY, NJ and report to a Blueair office two days per week. Responsibilities and Functions: Evaluating and Closing Deals: Identify, qualify, and close sales opportunities with new and existing customers, utilizing your expert knowledge of our air purification products to address customers’ unique needs.Coordinating item set up for retail accounts: Gather product information, specifications, pricing, images, and descriptions.Cross Functional Teamwork: Collaborate with finance, marketing, and operations to ensure product offerings are competitive and profitable.Order Management: Coordinate with the operations team to ensure the timely and accurate placement of customer orders, while maintaining a strong focus on customer satisfaction.Inventory Manager: Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless inventory management for customers, proactively addressing any stock availability issues and preventing out-of-stock situations.Customer Follow-Up: Establish and maintain strong relationships with customers through regular communication and providing exceptional support.Accounts Receivables: Conduct regular accounts receivable follow-ups with customers, monitoring payment schedules, and resolving any outstanding payment issues or disputes.Reporting and Analysis: Monitor sales performance and making recommendations for continuous improvement and growth opportunities.
Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or a related fieldProficiency in Microsoft ExcelSales or account management experience is a plusProven ability to solve problems creativelyExcellent organizational and analytical skillsStrong interpersonal skills and resourcefulnessBias for action, Curious learner, Passionate Proven ability to complete and reach development goals within timeline
About the Company:We are looking to add to our entrepreneurial culture and team. Here, employees are challenged to perform at a high level while helping the company grow and are given the opportunity to excel and grow themselves. Unilever Water and Air Wellness is constantly in pursuit of opportunities that strengthen our cause to support and enhance the education and betterment of air and water pollution for people around the world.Our Take on Leadership:Growth Mindset: This is competitive leadership. Taking the lead in the marketplace versus following. It's a positive attitude about the company's future — glass half-full —but it's realistic. It's passion for winning. Winning defined as gaining market share. It's placing a fresh emphasis on innovation — challenging the status quo.Consumer and Customer Focus: This is purpose-driven leadership. It's externally focused — on consumers, on customers. First take care of consumers and customers; financial performance will follow. It's a heightened passion for the consumer: “I firmly believe in improving the lives of consumers.” It's bringing the voice of the consumer and the customer into everything we do. It's seeing our brands through their eyes.Bias for action: This is action-driven leadership: This is what I will do." It's speed and sense of urgency in making decisions. Title: Junior Marketing Assistant
JobDescription:
Junior Marketing Assistant |  Weekly Pay $900 - $1200Location: Dallas TexasAvailability: Full Time, Immediate start.Candidates must have full legal rights to work in the USA.In the highly competitive marketing industry, Bottomless Promotion has identified a gap in the market for a more direct and personalised marketing approach in offering brands interactive, personalised, and tailor-made experiential sales and marketing strategies that deliver ‘the personal touch. We have an exciting immediate opening for a Confident, Charismatic & Self-Motivated Junior Marketing Assistant who can represent our clients with complete confidence, professionalism, and enthusiasm.Junior Marketing Assistant opening:As a Junior Marketing Assistant, you will assist in the daily operations of our sales and marketing campaigns, day to day responsibilities will include: Assisting the sales and Marketing teamAssisting with customer acquisition and retentionCreating brand exposureIncreasing market share and developing strong leadership skills.We are seeking someone that is outgoing, personable, and competitive, and ideally looking for both personal and professional development.

Title: Promotions Assistant (Branded Marketing Events)
JobDescription:
Promotions Assistant (Branded Marketing Events) | Weekly Pay $600 - $1200Entry Level: No Promotional Experience Needed; Marketing & Promotional Training & Support Provided!Kickstart your new career with us by joining our Dallas-based team this month. In your new Promotions Assistant role you’ll be: Learning basic promotional sales, customer service, and consumer relations skillsWorking with customers face-to-face at different retail establishmentsSetting up retail-based kiosks and pop-up events with branded promotional materialsEngaging with local people about our client's products/services/reputationResponsible for representing our clients with integrity and enthusiasmAnswering common questions and overcoming minor objectionsClosing, consolidating, and processing sales using a digital deviceTracking sales conversations and providing useful feedback to clients
If you’re a fast learner with the ability to inspire and influence others, you’ll be able to advance into a Junior Management role relatively quickly. We promote people based on their results and capabilities, not based on seniority or office politics. From day one, you’ll be given an outline of what you’d need to do in order to advance.Our Ideal Candidates:We are looking for goal-oriented salespeople that share our values and want to take control of their sales career by working in a fast-paced environment where salespeople earn and progress based on their results and their ability to lead others over time.We love meeting former athletes, former military, college/university graduates, and other self-motivated individuals who aspire to win and are looking to grow and develop both personally and professionally.What You Can Expect:We have an annual budget dedicated to travel and securing access to industry experts and industry events specifically designed to help our people grow professionally and personally. We are always ready to support and communicate productively with those beginning their marketing career and are proud to have a 90% retention rate on our staff!We are proud to offer monthly competitions with exclusive prizes for top performers. We also host regular team nights and team days because it allows our management team and leadership core to get to know the people they’re mentoring and coaching on a deeper level. All we expect back in return is a commitment to yourself that you’ll absorb information, expand your comfort zones and do what it takes to reach your individual career goals!Candidate Requirements:We are passionate about fulfilling opportunities for growing professionals from all backgrounds and disciplines. We welcome individuals from all levels of experience as we are excited to mentor and advance these motivated people into ambitious industry experts.This is NOT a remote position, so you’ll also need to be able to commute to our Dallas office on a daily basis.Thanks for considering our opportunity! We look forward to hearing from you.Please send us an online application with your resume. Note: All applicants must be able to commute to Dallas, TX for this on-site role!Actively considering candidates from varying backgrounds, including retail, cashiers, servers, administration/receptionist, warehouse, cleaning, HGV drivers and many more.Hiring Immediately.
Skills: Business-to-Business (B2B), Client Relations, Communication, Customer Engagement, Customer Satisfaction, Marketing, Product Demonstration, Relationship Building, Sales, Sales Promotion

Title: Project Coordinator
Company: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
JobDescription: Posting InformationPosting InformationDepartment Lineberger Compr Cancer Center - 426801Career Area  Research ProfessionalsPosting Open Date 07/17/2023Application Deadline 07/24/2023Position Type Temporary Staff (SHRA)Position Title  Project CoordinatorPosition Number 20024804Vacancy ID S021838Full-time/Part-time Full-Time TemporaryHours per week 40Work ScheduleMonday-Friday 8a-5p. May necessarily fluctuate to meet the research needs of the position.Position Location North Carolina, USHiring Range Dependent on Education/ExperienceProposed Start Date 07/31/2023Estimated Duration of Appointment 6 months not to exceed 11 monthsPosition InformationPrimary Purpose Of Organizational UnitThe UNC School of Medicine has a rich tradition of excellence and care. Our mission is to improve the health and wellbeing of North Carolinians, and others whom we serve. We accomplish this by providing leadership and excellence in the interrelated areas of patient care, education, and research. We strive to promote faculty, staff, and learner development in a diverse, respectful environment where our colleagues demonstrate professionalism, enhance learning, and create personal and professional sustainability. We optimize our partnership with the UNC Health System through close collaboration and commitment to service.OUR VISIONOur vision is to be the nation’s leading public school of medicine. We are ranked 2nd in primary care education among all US schools of medicine and 5th among public peers in NIH research funding. Our Allied Health Department is home to five top-ranked divisions, and we are home to 18 top-ranked clinical and basic science departments in NIH research funding.OUR MISSIONOur mission is to improve the health and well-being of North Carolinians and others whom we serve. We accomplish this by providing leadership and excellence in the interrelated areas of patient care, education, and research.Patient Care: We will promote health and provide superb clinical care while maintaining our strong tradition of reaching underserved populations and reducing health disparities across North Carolina and beyond.Education: We will prepare tomorrow’s health care professionals and biomedical researchers by facilitating learning within innovative curricula and team-oriented interprofessional education. We will cultivate outstanding teaching and research faculty, and we will recruit outstanding students and trainees from highly diverse backgrounds to create a socially responsible, highly skilled workforce.Research: We will develop and support a rich array of outstanding health sciences research programs, centers, and resources. We will provide infrastructure and opportunities for collaboration among disciplines throughout and beyond our University to support outstanding research. We will foster programs in the areas of basic, translational, mechanistic, and population research.Position SummaryThe UNC Lineberger Comprehensive Cancer Center ( LCCC ), founded in 1975, is a National Cancer Institute ( NCI )-designated comprehensive cancer center. The Center’s mission is to reduce cancer occurrence and death in North Carolina and the nation through research, treatment, training, and outreach.UNC CASCADE Network Research Base is hiring a full-time Project Coordinator based at UNC Gillings School of Global Public Health in Chapel Hill, NC. The study is a 5-year NIH -funded trial to develop, test, and implement effective, scalable, and cost-effective screening and treatment strategies to improve the screening for and management of cervical cancer among women living with HIV . The Project Coordinator will be in charge of all aspects of study implementation as part of a friendly and productive team that includes UNC faculty, staff, and students. They will directly manage day-to-day study activities and serve as the main point of contact for project partners.Minimum Education And Experience RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a discipline related to the field assigned and one year of related training or experience; or equivalent combination of training and experience. All degrees must be received from appropriately accredited institutions.Required Qualifications, Competencies, And Experiencen/aPreferred Qualifications, Competencies, And Experiencen/aSpecial Physical/Mental RequirementsCampus Security Authority ResponsibilitiesNot Applicable.Special Instructions Quick Link https://unc.peopleadmin.com/postings/261747Temporary Employment PoliciesTemporary Employment PoliciesPosting Contact InformationOffice of Human Resources Contact InformationIf you experience any problems accessing the system or have questions about the application process, please contact the Office of Human Resources at (919) 843-2300 or send an email to employment@unc.eduPlease note: The Office of Human Resources will not be able to provide specific updates regarding position or application status.Equal Opportunity Employer StatementThe University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Marketing Communications Specialist
JobDescription:
Requires work to be performed at an onsite physical location on a regular basis (generally 3 days per week) as determined by applicable business unit unless business demands, geography or other factors require adjustments to this requirement  .Responsibilities Marketing Specialist I Assists with implementing elements of strategic marketing and communication plans for assigned marketing segments. Develops and revises general or standardized marketing materials and supports more senior level staff with more complex materials.  Writes and edits content for general or standardized marketing materials maintaining a clear message and consistent brand identity. Develops general communications to internal business units and brokers and assists more senior staff with complex communication programs. Provides clear direction to design and production staff. Coordinates with Marketing Decision Support to ensure programs are tracked and measured. Assists other Marketing staff with projects on an ad-hoc basis. Helps draft necessary communications to address HIPAA compliance and notification under the direction of the legal department. Performs other duties as assigned.
 Marketing Specialist II Develops elements of marketing and communication plans for assigned marketing segment. Integrates strategy with execution to generate varied and moderately complex marketing materials.  Writes and edits content for varied and moderately complex marketing materials maintaining a clear message and consistent brand identity. Oversees design and production efforts for assigned projects. Coordinates with Marketing Decision Support to identify areas of campaigns to be measured and tracked to supply reliable, actionable data. Assists other Marketing staff with projects on an ad-hoc basis. Helps determine best response related to HIPAA compliance and notification under direction of the legal department. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications Marketing Specialist I   Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Journalism or related field. 1 year experience in marketing or related field which includes online communications venues, preferably in the health insurance or financial services industries. Knowledge of marketing/communications concepts and best practices. Strong writing skills with a demonstrated command of grammar, spelling and sentence structure. Intermediate Microsoft Office skills. Knowledge of print and multimedia production.
 Marketing Specialist II   Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Journalism or related field. 3 years’ experience as a Marketing Specialist or equivalent experience in marketing or related field, preferably in the health insurance or financial services industries. Knowledge of and ability to apply marketing/communications concepts and best practices. Strong writing skills with a demonstrated command of grammar, spelling, and sentence structure. Advanced Microsoft Office skills. Knowledge of print and multimedia production.
